446   <h3>
1   Preface<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="index.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="02-Introduction.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
3088   a
428   command
1129   shell
2223   and
297   utilities
220   package
1113   for
841   Windows
10   similar
3144   to
1061   that
28   found
883   on
32   Unix
1041   or
2   Linux
4   systems.
983   The
1   zillions
2059   of
6   popular
297   utilities
11   &ndash;
2   <tt>grep</tt>,
2   <tt>fgrep</tt>,
3   <tt>head</tt>,
2   <tt>tail</tt>,
2   <tt>diff</tt>,
2   <tt>sed</tt>,
2   <tt>cron</tt>,
3   <tt>tar</tt>,
2   <tt>mv</tt>,
2   <tt>cp</tt>,
2   <tt>rm</tt>,
2   <tt>su</tt>,
38   etc.
11   &ndash;
17   provide
6605   the
2   vocabulary.
983   The
1129   shell
17   itself
2   ties
879   it
13   together
920   with
3088   a
5   powerful
12   interactive
1   scripting
35   language
2223   and
590   an
2   elegant
55   user
1   interface.
983   The
35   language
6   grammar
11   includes
3088   a
24   complete
436   set
2059   of
41   control
3   structures,
1   <tt>if</tt>,
4   <tt>switch</tt>,
3   <tt>for</tt>,
4   <tt>foreach</tt>,
1   <tt>repeat</tt>,
5   <tt>while</tt>
2223   and
2   <tt>proc</tt>,
1   block-structured
94   local
22   variables,
30   floating
4   point,
51   wildcarding
2223   and
8   more.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2   began
4   life
1307   in
1   September,
1   1987
268   when
22   I
4   quit
13   my
18   job
2223   and
436   set
157   up
1   shop
1307   in
13   my
1   living
1   room,
4   soon
61   after
6605   the
2   birth
2059   of
13   my
281   first
14   child.
2   I&rsquo;d
1   loved
56   both
11   operating
4   systems
2223   and
35   language
2   processors
10   (and
320   this
3   combined
1   both!),
4   PC&rsquo;s
132   were
47   about
3144   to
51   get
6605   the
1   big-OS
2   capabilities
22   I
1   liked
13   working
1   with,
2   I&rsquo;d
80   always
11   wanted
3144   to
924   be
590   an
1   entrepreneur
2223   and
22   I
11   wanted
3144   to
924   be
40   home
920   with
13   my
1   kids.
1   Fifteen
1   months
2223   and
2   35,000
111   lines
2059   of
66   code
10   later,
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
3   became
6605   the
281   first
2   multi-threaded
27   application
3144   to
3   ship
1113   for
5   OS/2.
106   In
7   July
1   1992,
879   it
3   became
6605   the
44   very
281   first
2   third
2   party
27   application
3144   to
3   ship
883   on
23   NT.
30   These
7   days,
102   it&rsquo;s
47   about
1   240,000
15   lines.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
181   This
15   latest
37   release
289   has
382   been
231   completely
1   refreshed
1113   for
841   Windows
28   7
2223   and
410   now
11   includes
3088   a
31   full
21   64-bit
5   build.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
22   I
1   hope
675   you
1   enjoy
13   my
43   work.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
2   Nicole
1   Hamilton<br/>
4   Redmond,
1   Washington<br/>
5   September
1   15,
2   2014
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   <i>First
63   written
277   at
1   Wayland,
1   Massachusetts,
5   December
1   9,
1   1988.</i>
1679   </p>

57   <h4>Topics</h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
1   href="#Features">Features</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#Improvements">Over
6605   the
253   original
32   Unix
1930   C
5   shell</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#TypicalUsers">Typical
1   users</a><br/>
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="Features"></a>Features
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
3088   a
35   language
1113   for
6   interactively
191   using
12   Windows.
1   Compared
3144   to
6605   the
37   standard
39   Command
1   Prompt,
879   it
15   provides
3088   a
6   vocabulary
2223   and
6   grammar
1061   that
42   allows
30   much
207   more
16   complex
13   activities
3144   to
924   be
1   described.
14   Here
650   are
101   some
2059   of
6605   the
5   major
1   features.
1679   </p>
440   <ul>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
39   Command
372   line
57   editing
2059   of
4   enormous
73   statements
920   with
7   arrow
7   keys,
320   filename
46   completion
2223   and
428   command
10   completion.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   User-definable
29   function
8   keys.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
3   Fully
9   recursive
2   grammar.
3   Statements
511   can
924   be
11   arbitrarily
13   nested
1041   or
4   piped
63   without
1   concern
1113   for
94   statement
38   length
1041   or
176   other
19   arbitrary
2   restrictions.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
8   Procedures
2223   and
6   aliases.
983   The
6   vocabulary
2059   of
6605   the
35   language
1837   is
7   meant
3144   to
924   be
1   extensible
588   by
6605   the
8   user.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   Variables,
4   arrays
2223   and
13   expressions.
1   Integer
2223   and
30   floating
39   point
3   arithmetic,
46   pattern
26   matching
4   facilities
2223   and
25   various
383   file
110   system
14   tests
2223   and
57   editing
44   operators
17   provide
590   an
1   expressive
2   grammar.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
5   Threads
2223   and
11   processes.
1   Child
33   threads
2223   and
30   processes
511   can
924   be
8   spawned
3144   to
146   run
62   commands
2   asynchronously
1041   or
1307   in
6605   the
8   background.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
39   Command
14   substitution.
983   The
64   output
2059   of
271   one
428   command
511   can
924   be
3   stuffed
51   back
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
857   as
74   arguments
3144   to
6   another.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   History.
1   Past
62   commands
511   can
924   be
3   recalled
2223   and
1   edited.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
4   Advanced
320   filename
8   wildcarding.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
21   An
1   extensive
6   vocabulary
2059   of
5   powerful
20   little
2   utilities:
1   &ldquo;All
6605   the
12   usual
1   suspects&rdquo;
33   including
2   <tt>grep</tt>,
2   <tt>fgrep</tt>,
3   <tt>head</tt>,
2   <tt>tail</tt>,
2   <tt>diff</tt>,
2   <tt>sed</tt>,
2   <tt>cron</tt>,
3   <tt>tar</tt>,
2   <tt>su</tt>,
3   <tt>ls</tt>,
2   <tt>mv</tt>,
2   <tt>cp</tt>,
2   <tt>rm</tt>,
38   etc.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
448   </ul>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="Improvements"></a>Improvements
53   over
6605   the
253   original
32   Unix
1930   C
1129   shell
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
181   This
1930   C
1129   shell
1   borrows
122   its
11   basic
35   language
1   concepts
640   from
6605   the
253   original
2223   and
1   wildly
6   popular
1930   C
1129   shell
63   written
588   by
1   Bill
1   Joy
1307   in
6605   the
1   late
1   1970s
277   at
6605   the
1   University
2059   of
1   California,
3   Berkeley,
857   as
33   part
2059   of
9   BSD
283   UNIX
1   project.
58   But
640   from
2   there,
102   it&rsquo;s
382   been
1   adapted
2223   and
1   extended
1307   in
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
90   way
920   with
4   modern
14   compiler
5   technology
1113   for
1   Windows:
1679   </p>
440   <ul>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
261   A
4   modern
1   top-down
6   parser
1837   is
281   used
1113   for
25   better
35   language
2   recognition
2223   and
4   performance.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
12   It&rsquo;s
6   easier
3144   to
5   use.
983   The
25   syntax
2223   and
6   grammar
299   have
382   been
56   made
2   flexible
2223   and
207   more
9   consistent
920   with
176   other
4   modern
14   high
22   level
35   language
5   conventions.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
159   It
33   knows
47   about
231   Windows,
1   HPFS,
1   NTFS,
53   long
5   filenames,
90   environmental
22   variables,
1   networks,
4   international
172   character
1   sets,
2223   and
47   about
364   all
6605   the
25   various
3   kinds
2059   of
16   applications
1061   that
841   Windows
1   supports.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
150   You
511   can
7   customize
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
45   give
675   you
857   as
20   little
1041   or
857   as
30   much
841   Windows
14   versus
1   UNIX/Linux
8   behavior
857   as
675   you
2   choose.
111   For
101   example,
93   either
6   <tt>\</tt>
1041   or
10   <tt>/</tt>
511   can
924   be
281   used
1307   in
3088   a
3   filename.
11   Either
8   <tt>-</tt>
1041   or
10   <tt>/</tt>
511   can
924   be
281   used
857   as
590   an
192   option
18   switch
172   character
1113   for
6605   the
22   utilities.
150   You
511   can
7   decide
57   whether
19   typing
10   <tt>cd</tt>
920   with
227   no
20   destination
319   directory
99   means
38   report
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
1   Windows-style)
1041   or
16   take
675   you
3144   to
6605   the
40   home
32   directory,
2223   and
113   so
18   on.
53   (The
11   chapter
883   on
3314   <a
1   href="48-CustomizingTheShell.htm">customizing
6605   the
1930   C
1   shell</a>
1837   is
1   devoted
3144   to
320   this
1   topic.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
5   Threads
650   are
281   used
1   extensively
3144   to
2   achieve
15   performance
2223   and
1   functionality
471   not
44   possible
1307   in
2   UNIX.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   Feedback
3144   to
6605   the
8   user,
7   especially
268   when
25   reporting
18   errors
289   has
382   been
13   improved.
468   If
675   you
8   encounter
590   an
106   error
97   inside
3088   a
16   complex
24   script,
22   you&rsquo;ll
115   even
51   get
3088   a
24   complete
9   dump
2059   of
6605   the
25   call
24   stack
18   showing
91   how
675   you
9   got
6   there.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
448   </ul>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="TypicalUsers"></a>Typical
17   users
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
11   Most
17   users
2059   of
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
650   are
6   relatively
2   technically
2   oriented
3   computer
9   users.
3   Often,
21   they&rsquo;re
442   software
1   developers.
20   They
299   have
3088   a
5   business
44   need
1113   for
841   Windows
6   system.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   Peering
53   over
32   their
1   shoulders,
104   they
6   typically
299   have
8   lots
2059   of
20   windows
42   open
883   on
6605   the
14   screen.
10   Many
2059   of
6605   the
20   windows
650   are
92   running
30   copies
2059   of
320   this
55   shell.
16   Some
30   copies
650   are
1   transient,
33   created
3144   to
26   display
920   with
20   little
1   snippets
2059   of
34   information
18   needed
883   on
6605   the
1   spur
2059   of
6605   the
1   moment.
11   Other
30   copies
2059   of
6605   the
1129   shell
161   would
924   be
281   used
1113   for
207   more
1   long-running
1   projects:
1113   for
101   example,
9   getting
3088   a
53   make
13   working
1113   for
3088   a
5   major
13   application.
261   A
1129   shell
66   window
1837   is
90   like
439   any
176   other
27   application
66   window
241   but
920   with
3088   a
58   different
1   paradigm.
4   Instead
2059   of
5   data,
6   rows
2223   and
3   columns
2059   of
21   numbers
1041   or
111   lines
2059   of
3   text,
6605   the
8   object
78   being
1   manipulated
1837   is
6605   the
22   machine
18   itself.
261   A
19   good
1129   shell
1   tackles
3088   a
58   different
33   problem
171   than
1   icons
2223   and
4   windows.
4   Instead
2059   of
6605   the
1   point-and-shoot
1   immediacy
2059   of
1   &ldquo;do
320   this
110   single
4   thing
1   now,&rdquo;
3088   a
1129   shell
223   offers
35   language
2223   and
6605   the
5   ability
3144   to
5   describe
207   more
2   customized
1041   or
1   repetitive
1   actions,
95   e.g.,
8   identify
3088   a
10   suitable
436   set
2059   of
39   files,
11   perform
101   some
5   action
27   against
72   them
2223   and
11   filter
6605   the
27   results
1307   in
101   some
3   interesting
4   way.
1679   </p>

446   <h3>
1   Installation<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="02-Introduction.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="04-Tutorial.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
1604   <p>
181   This
9   section
2   outlines
91   how
3144   to
21   install
2223   and
3   uninstall
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
55   shell.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
468   If
675   you
8   encounter
1   problems,
1   consult
6605   the
9   section
883   on
3314   <a
1   href="56-CommonProblems.htm">common
3   problems</a>
1041   or
7   contact
5   us
1113   for
3314   <a
1   href="61-Support.htm">support</a>.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
22   System
1   requirements
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
380   will
21   install
2223   and
146   run
883   on
439   any
26   32-bit
1041   or
21   64-bit
65   version
2059   of
841   Windows
1041   or
841   Windows
1   Server,
33   including
8   Vista
2223   and
841   Windows
28   7
1041   or
4   8.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   Roughly
1   32M
2059   of
83   disk
67   space
1837   is
5   required.
11   Most
2059   of
1061   that
1837   is
1113   for
6605   the
55   user
6   guide.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
5   Installation
72   procedure
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
2   Simply
1   double-click
3144   to
42   open
6605   the
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
4   installer
3   <tt>.msi</tt>
96   file.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
55   uses
6605   the
37   standard
243   Microsoft
4   installer
3144   to
17   ensure
590   an
1   easy,
2   automated
21   install
2223   and
3088   a
24   complete
2   uninstall.
29   There
650   are
227   no
2   manual
2   steps
3144   to
60   copy
294   files
1041   or
38   create
1   shortcuts.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
135   does
471   not
270   use
439   any
6   registry
17   keys
42   except
234   just
6605   the
4   ones
6605   the
4   installer
13   creates
113   so
1061   that
6605   the
12   Control
3   Panel&rsquo;s
9   Add
1041   or
8   Remove
5   Programs
4   applet
511   can
176   do
3088   a
4   clean
2   uninstall.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
150   You
380   will
924   be
1   prompted
3144   to
25   accept
6605   the
1   End-User
3   License
2   Agreement,
3144   to
1   confirm
6605   the
319   directory
105   where
6605   the
18   program
294   files
131   should
924   be
2   installed,
2223   and
21   choose
57   whether
320   this
18   installation
1837   is
1113   for
234   just
1113   for
675   you
1041   or
1113   for
364   all
9   users.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
1   Uninstallation
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
103   To
231   completely
14   remove
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
640   from
252   your
9   machine,
270   use
6605   the
12   Control
1   Panel's
9   Add
1041   or
8   Remove
5   Programs
5   applet.
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
44   very
1   well-behaved:
2   Anything
33   created
13   during
6605   the
18   installation
1   (registry
7   keys,
2   shortcuts,
9   etc.)
380   will
924   be
2   totally
6   removed.
1679   </p>

436   <small><a

1129   shell

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="TheCshellCommandPrompt"></a>The
1930   C
1129   shell
428   command
52   prompt
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
4   Starting
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
857   as
63   simple
857   as
234   just
1   double-clicking
6605   the
3   icon.
11   After
6605   the
20   initial
1   greeting,
22   you&rsquo;ll
43   see
6605   the
281   first
9   prompt.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">Hamilton
1930   C
8   shell(tm)
7   x64
13   Release
1   5.1.d
64   Copyright
65   (c)
1   1988-2014
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
214   1
64   C%
28   <span
7   class="yellow">_</span>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
983   The
2   <tt>1
1   C%&nbsp;</tt>
52   prompt
21   tells
675   you
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
380   will
17   remember
81   what
675   you
84   type
857   as
428   command
165   number
214   1
2223   and
1061   that
252   your
213   current
112   drive
1837   is
4   <tt>C:</tt>
42   (or
34   whatever
879   it
1837   is
883   on
252   your
1   machine.)
983   The
10   <tt>%</tt>
1837   is
2   traditional;
46   rather
90   like
8   <tt>&gt;</tt>
1113   for
6605   the
841   Windows
428   command
9   prompt.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
106   When
879   it
2   starts,
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
1837   is
252   your
40   home
32   directory,
6   typically
1   <tt>c:\Users\<var>your-user-id</var></tt>.
983   The
1930   C
13   shell&rsquo;s
10   <tt>cd</tt>
428   command
49   works
90   like
6605   the
37   regular
841   Windows
10   <tt>cd</tt>
588   by
9   default:
468   If
675   you
30   don&rsquo;t
45   give
879   it
439   any
8   argument,
879   it
17   reports
6605   the
213   current
92   directory.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">1
64   C%
52   cd
1   c:\Users\Hamilton
102   2
64   C%
28   <span
7   class="yellow">_</span>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
2   Naturally,
675   you
511   can
78   change
252   your
52   prompt
3144   to
924   be
41   anything
675   you
10   like.
111   For
101   example,
3144   to
51   get
3088   a
52   prompt
1061   that
20   looks
90   like
271   one
675   you
55   might
51   get
640   from
1   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">3
64   C%
436   set
5   prompt1
527   =
1   '$cwd&gt;
12   '
1   c:\Users\Hamilton&gt;
28   <span
7   class="yellow">_</span>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
181   This
49   works
588   by
1   taking
6605   the
105   value
2059   of
6605   the
2   <tt>cwd</tt>
3   (current
13   working
5   directory)
243   variable
2223   and
9   pasting
1   <tt>&gt;&nbsp;</tt>
50   onto
6605   the
9   end.
983   The
105   value
1837   is
2   recalculated
197   each
96   time
3088   a
52   prompt
1837   is
34   given,
113   so
879   it
80   always
6   displays
590   an
4   up-to-date
21   value.
1   (Lists
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
19   builtin
111   variables
2223   and
25   procedures
650   are
91   given
1307   in
11   later
1   sections.)
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
103   To
436   set
879   it
1   back:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">c:\Users\Hamilton&gt;
9   unset
5   prompt1
35   4
64   C%
28   <span
7   class="yellow">_</span>

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="BasicStatements"></a>Basic
73   statements
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
2   Generally
2   speaking,
34   whatever
62   commands
675   you
55   might
299   have
49   typed
178   into
16   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>
42   (or
1   <tt>command.com</tt>)
380   will
66   still
102   work
1   here.
8   Even
590   an
30   internal
16   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>
29   function
90   like
6   <tt>dir</tt>
2   works:
1679   </p>

1307   in

1604   <p>
468   If
6605   the
428   command
675   you
84   type
7   refers
3144   to
3088   a
6   <tt>.cmd</tt>
2   batch
383   file
1041   or
3088   a
16   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>
30   internal
3   function,
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2   passes
879   it
3144   to
3088   a
107   child
70   process
92   running
16   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>
1113   for
4   evaluation.
4   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>&rsquo;s
19   builtin
22   functions
650   are
1   intercepted
920   with
31   aliases
43   defined
1307   in
1307   in
2   <tt>startup.csh</tt>.
6   Everything
56   else
1837   is
21   evaluated
11   directly
588   by
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
55   shell.
111   For
101   example,
790   if
675   you
84   type
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
590   an
7   <tt>.exe</tt>
39   file,
6605   the
11   appropriate
8   CreateProcess
25   call
3144   to
6605   the
841   Windows
16   kernel
3144   to
87   start
1061   that
18   program
380   will
924   be
58   done
11   directly
588   by
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
55   shell.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
261   A
1   bit-mapped
13   hash
27   mechanism
1837   is
281   used
113   so
1061   that
268   when
675   you
84   type
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
3088   a
29   command,
6605   the
1129   shell
2   zeroes
37   right
1307   in
883   on
383   file
675   you
2   mean.
159   It
37   doesn&rsquo;t
299   have
3144   to
12   check
23   every
89   path
319   directory
1113   for
23   every
44   possible
7   extension.
2   Naturally,
790   if
675   you
84   type
3088   a
428   command
1061   that
37   doesn&rsquo;t
10   exist,
6605   the
1129   shell
1   complains:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">6
64   C%
37   zork
20   csh:
13   Couldn't
38   find
590   an
40   executable
383   file
10   named
1   'zork'.
28   7
64   C%
28   <span
7   class="yellow">_</span>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
32   By
78   being
207   more
171   than
4   merely
3088   a
2   wrapper
45   around
590   an
31   existing
428   command
2   processor,
35   several
2   advantages
650   are
1   created:
3   (1)
15   performance
1837   is
1   understandably
10   (and
1   visibly!)
30   much
6   higher
2223   and
2   (2)
4   limitations
883   on
428   command
372   line
1   lengths,
22   etc.,
4   become
6605   the
6   relatively
1   generous
2   limits
2059   of
231   Windows,
46   rather
171   than
6605   the
1   restrictive
2   limits
2059   of
10   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="CustomizingTheScreenColors"></a>Customizing
6605   the
204   screen
197   colors
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
983   The
1930   C
13   shell&rsquo;s
20   inherits
122   its
117   default
204   screen
197   colors
640   from
6605   the
43   console
66   window
268   when
879   it
29   starts
71   up.
468   If
18   you&rsquo;ve
150   started
879   it
6605   the
117   default
3   shortcut,
26   that&rsquo;s
68   white
197   characters
883   on
3088   a
19   blue
65   background
42   unless
18   you&rsquo;ve
21   changed
61   it.
1   Highlighting
2223   and
46   color
650   are
281   used
3144   to
53   make
101   some
11   things
1   (special
39   files,
9   etc.)
2   stand
5   out.
113   All
6605   the
270   use
2059   of
46   color
1041   or
18   highlighting
1837   is
231   completely
1   customizable.
150   You
511   can
21   choose
41   anything
675   you
90   like
2223   and
53   make
45   changes
588   by
35   setting
6605   the
3314   <a
1   href="40-EnvironmentVariables.htm#COLORS"><tt>COLORS</tt></a>
2223   and
176   other
76   environment
12   variables.
111   For
101   example,
3144   to
436   set
7   black
197   characters

3088   a

68   white
1   background:

1655   <div
2   class="codesample">7
64   C%

41   bright
68   white

1307   in
6605   the
1   background..
1679   </p>
115   </li>
14   </ol>

446   <h3>
39   Command
372   line
2   editing<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="04-Tutorial.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="04.2-FilenameCompletion.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
57   <h4>Topics</h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
1   href="#CommandLineEditing">Command
372   line
20   editing</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#CommandCompletion">Command
19   completion</a><br/>
3314   <a
55   href="#SeeAlso">See
55   also</a><br/>
1679   </p>
446   <h3>
3314   <a
1   name="CommandLineEditing"></a>Command
372   line
57   editing
446   </h3>
1604   <p>
11   With
428   command
372   line
224   editing,
22   you&rsquo;ll
8   notice
34   immediately
91   how
30   much
6   easier
879   it
1837   is
176   do
11   things
11   quickly
63   without
3088   a
11   lot
2059   of
1   retyping.
23   As
675   you
47   try
6605   the
2   examples,
8   notice
91   how
6605   the
12   <script
18   type="text/javascript">
5   Arrows.UpArrow(
22   );
1   </script>,
1   <kbd>Insert</kbd>,
1   <kbd>Delete</kbd>,
1   <kbd>Home</kbd>,
2   <kbd>End</kbd>
2223   and
176   other
17   keys
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
7   recall
32   previous
62   commands
1041   or
53   make
45   changes
19   anywhere
883   on
6605   the
75   line.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
39   Command
372   line
57   editing
1837   is
90   like
25   having
3088   a
2   full-screen
4   editor
9   pasted
50   onto
6605   the
7   front
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
55   shell.
2   Key
3   bindings
650   are
1   intuitive
2223   and
13   follow
3   accepted
5   conventions.
150   You
511   can
38   create
4   enormous
62   commands
1061   that
4   stretch
53   over
204   screen
61   after
204   screen
2223   and
16   move
45   around
920   with
6605   the
7   arrow
7   keys,
4   inserting
1041   or
5   deleting
2   anywhere.
261   A
2   scrap
45   buffer
15   provides
3088   a
11   basic
1   cut-and-paste
2   facility.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
983   The
11   basic
38   key
3   assignments
3   are:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
2   <kbd>Insert</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
3   Toggle
64   between
7   insert
2223   and
3   overstrike
1   modes.
53   (The
17   cursor
1837   is
1   thicker
268   when
23   you&rsquo;re
1   inserting.)
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
1   <kbd>Home</kbd>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<kbd>End</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
7   Beginning
23   /
412   end
2059   of
428   command
75   line.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
12   <script
18   type="text/javascript">
4   Arrows.LeftArrow(
22   );
2   document.write(
2   '&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;'
22   );
6   Arrows.RightArrow(
22   );
12   </script>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
15   One
172   character
20   left
23   /
9   right.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
12   <script
18   type="text/javascript">
5   Arrows.UpArrow(
22   );
2   document.write(
2   '&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;'
22   );
4   Arrows.DownArrow(
22   );
12   </script>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   Up/down
271   one
428   command
1307   in
6605   the
112   history
39   list.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
5   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<script
18   type="text/javascript">
6   Arrows.RightArrow(
22   );
12   </script>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
5   Move
271   one
97   word
277   at
3088   a
16   time.
8   Similarly,
920   with
6605   the
176   other
7   arrow
8   keys.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
5   <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<script
18   type="text/javascript">
6   Arrows.RightArrow(
22   );
12   </script>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
16   Delete
271   one
97   word
277   at
3088   a
16   time.
8   Similarly,
920   with
6605   the
176   other
7   arrow
8   keys.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
2   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Insert</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
6   Paste
271   one
97   word
277   at
3088   a
16   time.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
5   id="keystrokes"
5   class="last">
78   <p
47   class="left">
2   <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>Insert</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
6   Paste
6605   the
33   entire
40   contents
2059   of
6605   the
2   scrap
13   buffer.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
468   If
675   you
30   don&rsquo;t
299   have
590   an
2   <kbd>Alt</kbd>
10   key,
270   use
2   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Shift</kbd>
10   instead.
1679   </p>
2   <h4
3   style="margin-top:
1   20px">
3314   <a
1   name="CommandCompletion"></a>Command
46   completion
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
106   In
7   addition
3144   to
2   backing
157   up
109   through
252   your
32   previous
62   commands
271   one
277   at
3088   a
96   time
920   with
4   Up
2223   and
1   Down,
675   you
511   can
190   also
10   ask
6605   the
1129   shell
3144   to
76   search
51   back
109   through
439   any
32   previous
62   commands
18   you&rsquo;ve
49   typed
1113   for
6605   the
77   last
428   command
1061   that
93   either
150   started
920   with
1041   or
24   contained
6605   the
197   characters
1307   in
6605   the
32   previous
25   word.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
2   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Enter</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
12   Find
6605   the
32   previous
428   command
1061   that
150   started
920   with
6605   the
197   characters
2059   of
6605   the
32   preceding
25   word.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
3   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Shift</kbd>-<kbd>Enter</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
12   Find
6605   the
32   previous
428   command
1061   that
24   contained
6605   the
197   characters
2059   of
6605   the
32   preceding
97   word
19   anywhere
883   on
6605   the
75   line.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
3   Repeatedly
5   pressing
94   these
17   keys
2   cycles
157   up
109   through
364   all
6605   the
26   matching
62   commands
18   you&rsquo;ve
14   previously
13   typed.
39   Command
46   completion
55   uses
32   something
26   called
6605   the
112   history
27   mechanism
3144   to
7   recall
62   commands
18   you&rsquo;ve
14   previously
13   typed.
1   Later,
8   we&rsquo;ll
1   devote
3088   a
50   whole
11   chapter
3144   to
101   some
2059   of
6605   the
207   more
1   advanced
55   uses
2059   of
5   history.
1679   </p>

446   <h3>
22   Filename
3   completion<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="04.1-CommandLineEditing.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="05-TheUtilities.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
57   <h4>Topics</h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
1   href="#FilenameCompletion">Filename
19   completion</a><br/>
3314   <a
55   href="#SeeAlso">See
55   also</a><br/>
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="FilenameCompletion"></a>Filename
46   completion
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
22   Filename
46   completion
1837   is
55   another
1   &ldquo;creature
1   comfort:&rdquo;
675   you
84   type
234   just
3088   a
1   fragment
2059   of
3088   a
320   filename
2223   and
20   let
6605   the
1129   shell
10   fill
1307   in
6605   the
4   rest.
29   There
650   are
16   three
2   variations:
191   using
6605   the
9   <kbd>Tab</kbd>
38   key
3144   to
5   walk
3   one-by-one
109   through
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
7   matches,
4   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>F</kbd>
3144   to
7   expand
199   only
857   as
30   much
857   as
1837   is
19   common
3144   to
364   all
6605   the
33   matches
2223   and
4   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>D</kbd>
3144   to
26   paste
1307   in
364   all
6605   the
33   matches
364   all
277   at
5   once.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
9   <kbd>Tab</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
4   Next
19   match.
21   Show
6605   the
257   new
65   match
1307   in
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
52   filenames
1061   that
65   match
6605   the
5   wildcard,
4   replacing
6605   the
32   previous
19   match.
11   After
6605   the
77   last
3   match,
20   put
6605   the
253   original
129   string
51   back
6   up,
18   highlighting
879   it
1307   in
41   bright
11   red,
189   then
23   continue
3   cycling
109   through
6605   the
190   list
6   again.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
2   <kbd>Shift</kbd>-<kbd>Tab</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
2   Previous
19   match.
38   Same
857   as
6605   the
9   <kbd>Tab</kbd>
10   key,
241   but
2   rotate
10   backward
109   through
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
20   matches.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
4   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>F</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
22   Filename
10   completion.
6   Look
1113   for
3088   a
320   filename
1061   that
29   starts
920   with
32   preceding
55   characters.
468   If
879   it
33   matches
3088   a
110   single
39   file,
10   fill
1307   in
6605   the
16   rest
2059   of
6605   the
32   name.
468   If
207   more
171   than
271   one
383   file
1   matched,
32   show
6605   the
33   part
1061   that
363   was
6605   the
122   same
1113   for
6   all,
8   highlighted
1307   in
5   green.
1   (Bright
19   red
99   means
87   there
132   were
227   no
33   matches
277   at
1   all.)
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1655   <div
42   id="keystrokes">
78   <p
47   class="left">
4   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>D</kbd>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   Duplicate
1   completions.
6   Paste
364   all
6605   the
26   matching
52   filenames
50   onto
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
271   one
61   after
6605   the
176   other
920   with
42   spaces
2   between.
1679   </p>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
12   Since
9   <kbd>Tab</kbd>
1837   is
56   normally
5   bound
3144   to
6605   the
320   filename
46   completion
3   function,
6605   the
37   regular
28   tab
172   character
1837   is
49   typed
46   instead
857   as
2   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Tab</kbd>.
468   If
13   you&rsquo;d
3   prefer
3144   to
299   have
6605   the
9   <kbd>Tab</kbd>
38   key
924   be
6605   the
37   regular
28   tab
172   character
2223   and
2   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Tab</kbd>
924   be
320   filename
224   completion,
14   invoke
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
920   with
6605   the
1   <tt>-T</tt>
43   option.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
22   Filename
46   completion
1837   is
58   done
920   with
9   wildcarding,
9   pasting
590   an
16   <tt>*</tt>
50   onto
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
32   previous
97   word
2223   and
189   then
25   looking
1113   for
439   any
20   matches.
1   Unlike
5   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>,
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
135   does
439   any
51   wildcarding
98   before
7   executing
6605   the
428   command
675   you
4   type.
159   It
55   uses
3088   a
5   powerful
9   recursive
46   pattern
65   match
8   algorithm
1061   that
1   guarantees
9   sensible
33   matches
115   even
790   if
675   you
84   type
3088   a
44   very
16   complex
19   pattern.
15   Wildcarding
1837   is
6605   the
1   subject
2059   of
3088   a
50   whole
11   chapter
157   up
2   ahead.
1679   </p>

39   cp
2223   and
1   rm</a><br/>

1   href="#touch">touch</a><br/>

2223   and

7   pushd,

1   rotd</a><br/>

1   grep</a><br/>

2223   and

1043   Hamilton

2059   of

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="ls"></a>ls:
190   list
294   files
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
10   href="Utilities/ls.htm"><tt>ls</tt></a>
1837   is
3088   a
7   somewhat
1   nicer
90   way
3144   to
190   list
3088   a
8   directory:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">6
483   D%
91   ls
3   <b>memos</b>
14   hello.c
8   hello.exe
28   <span
5   class="green">sysstuff</span>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
1   Subdirectories
650   are
8   highlighted
1   (shown
20   here
1307   in
1   bold.)
468   If
3088   a
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
289   has
6605   the
110   system
49   bit
67   set,
102   it&rsquo;s
66   still
1   listed,
10   displayed
1307   in
5   green.
10   Normally,
9   <tt>ls</tt>
28   lists
26   everything
1307   in
32   lower
97   case
1113   for
25   better
6   readability.
106   In
53   long
8   format:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">7
483   D%
91   ls
27   -l
1   D----
16   Feb
15   23
1   13:46
91   -
3   <b>memos</b>
7   ---A-
16   Feb
15   23
3   12:56
6   72
14   hello.c
7   ---A-
16   Feb
15   23
3   12:57
3   7731
8   hello.exe
1   -S-A-
16   Feb
15   23
1   13:22
4   15
28   <span
5   class="green">sysstuff</span>
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
1   Conventionally,
9   <tt>ls</tt>
28   lists
11   things
1   alphabetically,
920   with
103   directories
10   ahead
2059   of
52   files.
29   There
55   might
924   be
17   hidden
294   files
1041   or
12   directories,
241   but
3144   to
43   see

299   have
3144   to
1   ask:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">8
483   D%
91   ls
3   +H

14   hello.c
8   hello.exe

28   <span
5   class="green">sysstuff</span>

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="Conventions"></a>Conventions
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
103   To
38   find
94   out
91   how
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
297   utilities
12   work,
234   just
270   use
6605   the
3   <tt>-h</tt>
43   option.
111   For
101   example,
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">9
483   D%
91   ls
95   -h
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
21   tells
47   about
65   options
1113   for
207   more
4   detailed
1   listings,
1   sorting
6605   the
190   list
588   by
37   date
1041   or
588   by
2   size,
8   selecting
199   only
28   certain
9   types
2059   of
39   files,
38   etc.
9   <tt>ls</tt>
1837   is
3088   a
22   read-only
1   activity;
879   it
18   never
19   makes
439   any
45   changes
3144   to
6605   the
383   file
2   system;
28   lists
650   are
80   always
5   sorted
1307   in
3   memory.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
297   utilities
132   were
5   chosen
3144   to
924   be
9   consistent
920   with
6605   the
88   names
2059   of
10   similar
22   functions
883   on
2   UNIX,
105   where
104   they
10   provided
30   much
2059   of
6605   the
6   vocabulary
2059   of
6605   the
253   original
283   UNIX
1930   C
55   shell.
58   But
9   changing
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
3088   a
69   utility
1837   is
3088   a
63   simple
1   matter:
234   just
15   rename
6605   the
33   corresponding
7   <tt>.exe</tt>
383   file
14   or,
25   better
1   still,
38   create
590   an
164   alias
1   (discussed
3   later.)
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
32   By
1   convention,
6605   the
297   utilities
12   expect
65   options
3144   to
8   come
10   ahead
2059   of
439   any
294   files
675   you
4   specify.
6   Options
650   are
4   case-sensitive.
2   We&rsquo;ve
14   tried
3144   to
270   use
1   mnemonic
11   letters
1113   for
65   options
32   (e.g.,
2   <tt>h</tt>
1113   for
1   help)
2223   and
3144   to
270   use
6605   the
122   same
13   letter
3144   to
19   mean
6605   the
122   same
4   thing
17   across
10   related
1   utilities;
1   achieving
1061   that
1837   is
44   simply
207   more
2   feasible
920   with
1   52,
471   not
234   just
2   26
197   characters
3144   to
21   choose
1   from.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
219   Our
12   examples
15   generally
32   show
65   options
27   introduced
920   with
1   <tt>-</tt>,
241   but
675   you
76   could
4   equally
4   well
13   follow
6605   the
841   Windows
22   convention
2059   of
191   using
10   <tt>/</tt>
790   if
675   you
3   prefer.
468   If
2   indeed
675   you
84   want
199   only
8   <tt>-</tt>
1041   or
199   only
10   <tt>/</tt>
18   interpreted
857   as
590   an
192   option
15   character,
320   this
511   can
924   be
436   set
920   with
6605   the
6   <tt>SWITCHCHARS</tt>
90   environmental
39   variable,
201   which
511   can
924   be
436   set
93   either
640   from
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1041   or
640   from
6605   the
12   Control
1   Panel
42   (or
1307   in
252   your
1   <tt>autoexec.bat</tt>
383   file
126   under
841   Windows
4   9x.)
159   It
14   won&rsquo;t
299   have
439   any
13   effect
883   on
6605   the
37   standard
841   Windows
62   commands
90   like
6   <tt>dir</tt>
1041   or
7   <tt>xcopy</tt>
1041   or
883   on
16   applications
675   you
2   purchase
1   elsewhere,
241   but
879   it
380   will
102   work
883   on
364   all
6605   the
62   commands
7   supplied
920   with
6605   the
1930   C
55   shell.
111   For
101   example,
3144   to
299   have
199   only
8   <tt>-</tt>
34   recognized
857   as
590   an
192   option
15   character,
675   you
55   might
84   type
320   this
178   into
6605   the
1930   C
7   shell:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">10
483   D%
99   setenv
26   SWITCHCHARS
527   =
91   -
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
150   You
511   can
84   type
65   options
1307   in
439   any
25   order
7   (except
105   where
271   one
3   overrides
6   another,
1307   in
201   which
97   case
6605   the
77   last
35   setting
1837   is
1   used)
2223   and
675   you
26   group
72   them
13   together
1041   or
84   type
72   them
3   separately
857   as
675   you
2   choose.
111   For
101   example,
6   <tt>ls
17   -L
39   -d
1   -w</tt>
1837   is
21   exactly
6605   the
122   same
857   as
6   <tt>ls
1   -dwL</tt>
2223   and
11   produces
3088   a
5   <tt>-L</tt>
53   long
59   format
1   (very
1   detailed)
190   list
2059   of
6605   the
213   current
32   directory,
5   sorted
588   by
1   <tt>-d</tt>
37   date
1   (newest
4   ones
1   last),
920   with
9   sizes
2059   of
439   any
103   directories
6   filled
1307   in
588   by
2   <tt>-w</tt>

27   down
109   through
6605   the
319   directory
6   tree,
21   adding
157   up
364   all
6605   the
9   sizes
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
294   files
28   found
6   there.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
150   You
511   can
80   always
1   unambiguously
412   end
6605   the
65   options
920   with
4   <tt>--</tt>
1307   in
97   case
675   you
299   have
3088   a
320   filename
1041   or
590   an
77   argument
129   string
1061   that
9   begins
920   with
271   one
2059   of
1   option-introducing
55   characters.
139   Also,
30   since
6605   the
1129   shell
135   does
6605   the
45   wildcard
3   expansion,
102   it&rsquo;s
3088   a
49   bit
207   more
19   convenient
2223   and
12   faster
1113   for
6605   the
297   utilities
3144   to
43   look
1113   for
439   any
65   options
37   right
277   at
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
81   what
76   could
924   be
3088   a
44   very
53   long
190   list
11   &ndash;
157   up
3144   to
5   32
1   kilobytes
11   &ndash;
2059   of
52   filenames
1041   or
176   other
230   command-line
19   text.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   We&rsquo;ll
80   always
13   follow
6605   the
841   Windows
22   convention
2059   of
191   using
6   <tt>\</tt>
1307   in
52   filenames
1307   in
320   this
3   book
2223   and

1   advise

675   you

6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1   cares

64   because

841   Windows
442   software
4   does.
103   To
101   some
1   fair
1   degree,

3088   a

2059   of
1   &ldquo;when
1307   in
1   Rome,

6605   the
1   Romans

675   you

176   do
1   prefer,

10   <tt>/</tt>
920   with
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
364   all
6605   the

9   Do
1   remember,
3   however,
1061   that
790   if
675   you
84   type
3088   a
320   filename
31   starting
920   with
10   <tt>/</tt>
3144   to

6605   the
2   root,

3144   to
924   be
1   careful
1061   that

590   an
43   option.
84   (This
1837   is
3088   a

6605   the

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="echo"></a>echo
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
2   href="Utilities/echo.htm"><tt>echo</tt></a>
1837   is
3088   a
20   little
58   different
171   than
6605   the
2   vanilla
841   Windows
3   echo.
159   It
135   does
199   only
271   one
1   thing:
879   it
35   prints
34   whatever
74   arguments
80   words
675   you
45   give
4   it;
15   there&rsquo;s
227   no
1   <tt>echo&nbsp;on</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>echo&nbsp;off</tt>-style
60   status
25   reporting
3   function.
58   But
879   it
135   does
2   offer
30   much
1   finer
41   control
53   over
81   what
19   gets
2   printed:
675   you
511   can
60   write
72   binary
5   values,
21   choose
471   not
3144   to
11   append
3088   a
257   new
372   line
2223   and
60   write
3144   to
17   stderr
46   instead
44   stdout.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
30   Here&rsquo;s
590   an
43   example
105   where
6605   the
22   ANSI
121   escape
39   sequences
9   turning
1   brightness
2223   and
46   color
883   on
2223   and
91   off
650   are
11   embedded
178   into
3088   a
129   string
78   being
2   echoed.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">11
483   D%
296   echo
1   "Have
3088   a
1   $ansi('bright
1   red')NICE$ansi()
1   day."
1   Have
3088   a
1   <b>NICE</b>
2   day.
1652   </div>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="MvCpRm"></a>mv,
39   cp
2223   and
3   rm:
1   move,
60   copy
2223   and
14   remove
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
983   The
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/mv.htm"><tt>mv</tt></a>
1   (move),
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/cp.htm"><tt>cp</tt></a>
1   (copy)
2223   and
3314   <a
4   href="Utilities/rm.htm"><tt>rm</tt></a>
1   (remove)
1   trio
42   allows
294   files
2223   and
103   directories
3144   to
924   be
35   treated
857   as
63   simple
2   objects.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/mv.htm"><tt>mv</tt></a>
380   will
16   move
93   either
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
4   treating
72   them
44   simply
857   as
1   objects,
115   even
17   across
83   disk
5   partitions.
106   In
320   this
101   example,
6605   the
94   two
1   <tt>hello</tt>
294   files
650   are
7   moved
178   into
3088   a
257   new
32   directory,
1   illustrating
91   how
1   <tt>mv</tt>
3   understands
1061   that
790   if
15   there&rsquo;s
3088   a
1   many-to-one
1   relationship,
6605   the
20   destination
289   has
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
92   directory.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">12
483   D%
19   mv
1   hello*
88   hello
3   13
483   D%
91   ls
7   <b>hello
6   memos</b>
28   <span
5   class="green">sysstuff</span>
5   14
483   D%
91   ls
88   hello
14   hello.c
8   hello.exe
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
8   Similarly,
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/cp.htm"><tt>cp</tt></a>
380   will
60   copy
3088   a
383   file
1041   or
115   even
590   an
33   entire
92   directory.
983   The
30   copies
2   <tt>cp</tt>
11   produces
650   are
80   always
4   exact
7   logical
1   copies,
920   with
15   correct
19   timestamps
2223   and
6   attribute
15   bits
2223   and
33   including
439   any
17   hidden
1041   or
110   system
52   files.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">15

88   hello
4   newhello
6   16
483   D%
91   ls
7   <b>hello

1604   <p>
2   <tt>cp</tt>

471   not
9   consider

590   an
106   error
3144   to
60   copy

31   existing

6605   the
383   file

3144   to
924   be
3   overwritten

122   its
22   read-only
49   bit
11   set.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
12   Finally,
3314   <a
4   href="Utilities/rm.htm"><tt>rm</tt></a>
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
14   remove
3088   a
383   file
1041   or
115   even
590   an
33   entire
92   directory.
58   But
879   it
135   does
7   insist
1061   that
675   you
30   tell
879   it
675   you
31   really
19   mean
879   it
790   if
675   you
10   ask
3144   to
14   remove
3088   a
319   directory
26   that&rsquo;s
471   not
16   empty
1041   or
41   anything

21   marked

1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">19

1604   <p>
23   As
675   you
511   can
43   see
640   from
94   these
2   examples,
6605   the
2   general
5   style
2059   of
6605   the
297   utilities
1837   is
7   fairly
1   terse.
9   Like
6605   the
1   proverbial
1   Vermont
1   farmer,

30   don&rsquo;t
5   say
41   anything
42   unless
1   they&rsquo;ve
9   got
32   something
3144   to
1   say.
8   Even
9   copying
1041   or
4   removing
3088   a
319   directory
7   happens

1   fanfare

53   long

6605   the
11   appropriate
1   &ldquo;yes,
22   I
31   really
19   mean
1   it&rdquo;
65   options
650   are
1   supplied.

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="more"></a>more
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
7   href="Utilities/more.htm"><tt>more</tt></a>
1837   is
590   an
7   especially
14   fast
2   browsing
3   filter.
29   There
650   are
94   two
14   ways
3144   to
270   use
8   more.
983   The
281   first
1837   is
1307   in
3088   a
3   pipeline,
6605   the
90   way
2   &ldquo;vanilla&rdquo;
207   more
55   might
924   be
281   used
268   when
675   you
2   suspect
6605   the
111   data
193   may
924   be
68   longer
171   than
3088   a
1   screenful:
1679   </p>
1655   <div

1604   <p>

1604   <p>
3314   <a

1   &ldquo;general

6605   the
37   regular
63   expression
25   syntax
104   they
8   implement

2   traditional;
102   it&rsquo;s
590   an
3   accepted
37   standard
2223   and
6   we&rsquo;ve
42   followed
61   it.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
6   <tt>fgrep</tt>
2223   and
6   <tt>grep</tt>
650   are
281   used
3144   to
4   scan
109   through
53   long
28   lists
2059   of
294   files
1041   or
11   filter
111   data
8   coming
109   through
3088   a
21   pipe
1113   for
56   strings
1041   or
16   patterns

1   They&rsquo;ll
11   quickly
38   report
364   all
6605   the
26   matching
15   lines.
468   If
675   you
2   like,
675   you
511   can
51   get
207   more
1041   or
13   less
2   detail
1307   in
6605   the
2   output,

299   have
372   line
21   numbers

1679   </p>
1604   <p>
6   <tt>fgrep</tt>
2223   and
6   <tt>grep</tt>

6605   the
5   ability

1113   for
3088   a
23   large

2059   of
16   patterns

1   parallel

4   <tt>-s</tt>
1041   or
6   <tt>-f</tt>

4   almost

1   discernible
15   performance
1   degradation.
2   They&rsquo;re
44   very
6   fast.
11   Both
1   precompile
2223   and
1   optimize

2   patterns,

3   direct
16   kernel

2223   and

44   very
14   high
15   performance

10   structure

49   allow
4   extremely
14   fast
5   scanning

23   large
2   amounts

27   data.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="fgrep"></a>fgrep
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/fgrep.htm"><tt>fgrep</tt></a>
1837   is
6605   the
1   simpler
2223   and
7   slightly
12   faster
2059   of
6605   the
94   two
76   search
22   utilities.
159   It
135   does
3088   a
63   simple
129   string
24   compare
64   between
6605   the
129   string
23   you&rsquo;re
25   looking
1113   for
2223   and
6605   the
197   characters
883   on
197   each
75   line.
468   If
6605   the
76   search
129   string
1837   is
28   found
19   anywhere
883   on
6605   the
31   line,
102   it&rsquo;s
3088   a
19   match.
29   There
650   are
101   some
65   options
1113   for
9   ignoring
15   differences
1307   in
2   upper/lower-case
1041   or
1307   in
6605   the
10   amount
2059   of
68   white
67   space
2   (spaces
2223   and
2   tabs)
64   between
80   words
241   but
5   mostly
102   it&rsquo;s
11   quite
63   simple
2   comparison.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
30   Here&rsquo;s
590   an
43   example

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="GrepAndRegularExpressions"></a>grep
2223   and
37   regular
25   expressions
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/grep.htm"><tt>grep</tt></a>
20   looks
1113   for
94   special
16   patterns
26   called
37   regular
9   expressions,
201   which
650   are
10   similar
3144   to
9   (but
7   slightly
58   different
1   from)
320   filename
8   wildcarding.
983   The
6   grammar
1837   is
4   recursive,
54   meaning
3088   a
37   regular
63   expression
3144   to
924   be
16   matched
511   can
924   be
3   written,
1307   in
2   turn,
857   as
3088   a
13   nested
29   series
2059   of
37   regular
25   expressions
1307   in
7   decreasing
5   precedence:
1679   </p>
10   <table
1   class="narrowrule">

1768   </td>

37   regular
15   expression.

6605   the

97   inside

2223   and
17   remember
6605   the
44   literal

1061   that
14   matched.
1679   </p>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>
1604   <p>
10   At
6605   the
1   lowest
2   layer,
675   you
45   give
3088   a
172   character
1041   or
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
924   be
16   matched
1   anchored,
790   if
675   you
4   want,
3144   to
65   match
234   just
6605   the
45   beginning
1041   or
234   just
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
75   line.
10   At
6605   the
71   next
2   layer,
6605   the
16   <tt>*</tt>
172   character
30   lets
675   you
65   match
3088   a
243   variable
165   number
2059   of
2   repetitions
2059   of
3088   a
19   pattern.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
106   When
675   you
84   type
3088   a
37   regular
63   expression
883   on
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
8   keep
1307   in
1   mind:
3   (1)
10   Many
2059   of
6605   the
197   characters
299   have
94   special
54   meaning
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
299   have
3144   to
924   be
97   inside
17   quotes.
2   (2)
150   You
299   have
3144   to
84   type
5   <tt>^^</tt>
3144   to
51   get
234   just
271   one
5   circumflex
64   because
12   <tt>^</tt>
1837   is
6605   the
13   shell&rsquo;s
117   default
121   escape
37   character.
1   (3)
16   <tt>*</tt>
1837   is
3088   a
2   postfix
4   operator.
159   It
2   operates
883   on
6605   the
32   preceding
37   regular
2   expression;
588   by
9   itself,
879   it
1837   is
471   not
3088   a
3   &ldquo;match
29   zero
1041   or
207   more
1   characters&rdquo;
45   wildcard
172   character
857   as
675   you
193   may
924   be
281   used
3144   to
920   with
7   filenames.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
30   Here&rsquo;s
590   an
43   example
2059   of
7   searching
109   through
364   all
6605   the
51   source
66   code
1113   for
3088   a
23   large
9   application,
25   looking
1113   for
364   all
30   occurrences
2059   of
111   lines
1061   that
22   begin
920   with
1   <tt>statement</tt>
42   followed
588   by
3088   a
2   <tt>y</tt>
7   somewhere
883   on
6605   the
372   line
2223   and
18   showing
6605   the
372   line
21   numbers
2059   of
439   any
20   matches.
53   (The
4   <tt>-s</tt>
192   option
21   tells
4   <tt>pushd</tt>
2223   and
4   <tt>popd</tt>
3144   to
102   work
1   silently.)
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">51

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="sed"></a>sed
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
2   href="Utilities/sed.htm"><tt>sed</tt></a>
1837   is
3088   a
6   stream
4   editor.
13   Just
857   as
675   you
55   might
10   think
2059   of
191   using
3088   a
37   regular
4   editor
3144   to
29   edit
3088   a
39   file,
5   deleting
1041   or
4   inserting
11   lines,
21   doing
12   search/replace
4   operations,
22   etc.,
4   <tt>sed</tt>
30   lets
675   you
29   edit
3088   a
6   stream
2059   of
3   data:
28   individual
111   lines
650   are
125   read
640   from
7   stdin,
6   edited
10   according
3144   to
6605   the
159   script
675   you
45   give
2223   and
63   written
3144   to
44   stdout.
261   A
44   very
63   simple
32   sort
2059   of
159   script
55   might
924   be
91   given
37   right
883   on
6605   the
428   command
75   line.
30   Here&rsquo;s
3088   a
63   simple
1   search/replace:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">54
483   D%
296   echo
88   hello
43   world
498   |
51   sed
1   s/world/everybody/
88   hello
1   everybody
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
4   <tt>sed</tt>
55   uses
6605   the
122   same
37   regular
25   expressions
281   used
588   by
2   <tt>grep</tt>.
12   It&rsquo;s
44   possible
3144   to
6   pick
157   up
2   pieces
2059   of
6605   the
58   input
857   as
6   tagged
25   expressions
2223   and
16   move
72   them
2   around.
106   In
320   this
101   example,
6605   the
94   two
56   strings
883   on
93   either
2   side
2059   of
6605   the
67   space
650   are
1   tagged,
189   then
1   swapped
2   around.
3   Quotes
650   are
281   used
45   around
6605   the
12   search/replace
428   command
113   so
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
380   will
11   treat
879   it
857   as
271   one
53   long
44   literal
129   string
3144   to
924   be
73   passed
3144   to
1   <tt>sed</tt>.
1   Parentheses,
42   spaces
2223   and
1   asterisks
19   otherwise
299   have
94   special
5   meaning.
23   Notice
91   how
6605   the
16   <tt>*</tt>
3   construct,
54   meaning
65   match
29   zero
1041   or
207   more
30   occurrences
38   actually
33   matches
857   as
25   many
2   repetitions
857   as
2   possible.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">55
483   D%
296   echo
88   hello
43   world
498   |
51   sed
1   's/\(.*\)
1   \(.*\)/\2
1   \1/'
43   world
88   hello
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
111   For
207   more
16   complex
4   operations,
4   <tt>sed</tt>
223   offers
3088   a
2   wide
10   array
2059   of
44   operators
33   including
115   even
5   conditional
2   branches
2223   and
3088   a
13   hold
45   buffer
105   where
3088   a
129   string
511   can
924   be
4   saved
5   temporarily
640   from
271   one
372   line
3144   to
6605   the
5   next.
468   If
252   your
159   script
1837   is
44   very
2   long,
6605   the
6   <tt>-f</tt>
192   option
30   lets
675   you
94   specify
879   it
1307   in
3088   a
96   file.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="diff"></a>diff
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/diff.htm"><tt>diff</tt></a>
1837   is
590   an
4   extremely
14   fast
2223   and
2   flexible
69   utility
1113   for
11   quickly
12   comparing
53   ASCII
39   files,
25   looking
1113   for
2   differences.
106   In
6605   the
6   simplest
10   form,
675   you
44   simply
45   give
879   it
94   two
52   filenames
33   corresponding
3144   to
6605   the
26   old
2223   and
257   new
26   versions
2223   and
20   let
879   it
19   go
3144   to
12   work,
25   reporting
3   sections
1061   that
299   have
382   been
16   deleted
1041   or
104   added
1307   in
3088   a
6   traditional
16   format.
111   For
101   example,
3088   a
442   software
1   developer
55   might
270   use
879   it
3144   to
24   compare
26   old
2223   and
257   new
26   versions
2059   of
3088   a
1930   C
1   program:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">56
483   D%
36   diff
1   archive\parse.c
1   parse.c
2   1493
29   c
2   1493
49   &lt;
2   d-&gt;inline_cnt
527   =
1   src-&gt;inline_cnt++;
3   ---
49   &gt;
2   d-&gt;inline_cnt
527   =
1   ++src-&gt;inline_cnt;
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
45   Each
78   change
1837   is
27   reported
1307   in
3   terms
2059   of
6605   the
372   line
165   number
1041   or
22   range
1307   in
6605   the
26   old
3   version,
57   whether
102   it&rsquo;s
590   an
5   addition,
78   change
1041   or
2   deletion,
6605   the
372   line
21   numbers
1307   in
6605   the
257   new
65   version
2223   and
189   then
6605   the
9   affected
111   lines
640   from
197   each
39   file,
29   separated
588   by
3088   a
372   line
2059   of
1   <tt>---</tt>.
2   <tt>diff</tt>
16   supports
6605   the
6   traditional
65   options
1113   for
9   ignoring
15   differences
1307   in
2   upper/lower-case
1041   or
1307   in
6605   the
10   amount
2059   of
68   white
67   space
883   on
6605   the
31   line,
1113   for
10   recursively
12   comparing
33   entire
319   directory
3   trees
2059   of
39   files,
38   etc.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
15   One
2059   of
1   <tt>diff</tt>&rsquo;s
35   most
3   novel
5   features
1837   is
122   its
5   ability
920   with
6605   the
2   <tt>-!</tt>
192   option
3144   to
10   generate
3088   a
3   merged
24   listing
105   where
106   text
26   that&rsquo;s
16   deleted
1837   is
26   shown
1307   in
11   red,
257   new
106   text
1837   is
26   shown
1307   in
9   green
2223   and
6605   the
16   rest
1837   is
10   displayed
1   normally.
181   This
19   makes
879   it
4   extremely
9   easy
3144   to
1   view
252   your
45   changes
1307   in
5   context.
8   (To
270   use
320   this
18   option,
17   remember
1061   that
12   <tt>!</tt>
1837   is
3088   a
94   special
172   character
3144   to
6605   the
5   shell;
84   type
879   it
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
192   option
190   list
113   so
1   there&rsquo;ll
924   be
3088   a
67   space
1   following.)
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="HeadTail"></a>head
2223   and
18   tail
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
2   href="Utilities/head.htm"><tt>head</tt></a>
2223   and
3314   <a
4   href="Utilities/tail.htm"><tt>tail</tt></a>
650   are
281   used
3144   to
26   display
234   just
6605   the
281   first
1041   or
77   last
84   few
111   lines
1041   or
197   characters
2059   of
3088   a
96   file.
10   Normally,
104   they
7   expand
439   any
19   tabs
178   into
42   spaces
113   so
675   you
30   don&rsquo;t
44   need
3144   to
11   filter
72   them
109   through
8   more.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
6   <tt>tail</tt>
1837   is
14   particularly
1   interesting.
468   If
364   all
675   you
84   want
1837   is
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
44   very
23   large
39   file,
6   <tt>tail</tt>
37   doesn&rsquo;t
5   waste
96   time
46   reading
6605   the
50   whole
383   file
640   from
87   start
3144   to
1   finish.
13   Instead,
879   it
1   jumps
37   right
3144   to
6605   the
412   end
2223   and
26   reads
879   it
1   backwards!
468   If
6605   the
383   file
1837   is
2   truly
23   large
2   (on
6605   the
25   order
2059   of
35   several
1   megabytes)
2223   and
364   all
675   you
84   want
1837   is
3088   a
20   little
49   bit
91   off
6605   the
5   end,
320   this
1837   is
6605   the
13   difference
64   between
1   chugging
15   along
1113   for
35   several
23   seconds
14   versus
9   getting
590   an
4   almost
1   instantaneous
2   response.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
6   <tt>tail</tt>
190   also
289   has
3088   a
6   <tt>-f</tt>
13   follow
43   option.
6   What
1061   that
99   means
1837   is
1061   that
268   when
879   it
19   gets
3144   to
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
39   file,
879   it
1   enters
590   an
2   endless
5   loop,
3   sleeping
1113   for
3088   a
4   second,
189   then
3   waking
157   up
3144   to
43   see
790   if
207   more
289   has
382   been
41   added.
181   This
1837   is
14   particularly
33   useful
4   if,
95   e.g.,
675   you
299   have
590   an
2   operation,
5   say
3088   a
23   large
1   make,
5   active
1307   in
271   one
66   window
920   with
122   its
64   output
6   redirected
3144   to
3088   a
96   file.
3   From
55   another
66   window
675   you
511   can
1   periodically
12   check
1307   in
883   on
6605   the
2   progress
588   by
3   typing:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">57
483   D%
18   tail
47   -f
1   e:\tmp\make.log
53   :
11   ^C
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
6   <tt>tail</tt>
30   lets
675   you
4   watch
111   lines
51   get
104   added
63   without
1   consuming
30   much
9   processor
6   resource
1   (since
879   it
1   sleeps
1307   in
6605   the
16   kernel
35   most
2059   of
6605   the
1   time)
113   so
675   you
511   can
4   watch
3088   a
65   background
7   activity
2   progress
63   without
4   affecting
122   its
4   performance.
11   After
18   you&rsquo;ve
1   watched
1113   for
3088   a
1   while,
234   just
84   type
5   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>C</kbd>
3144   to
17   interrupt
2223   and
51   get
5   out.
983   The
17   interrupt
199   only
8   goes
3144   to
6605   the
6   <tt>tail</tt>
1   program;
6605   the
27   application
91   off
1307   in
6605   the
65   background
1041   or
1307   in
55   another
66   window
14   creating
6605   the
383   file
1837   is
471   not
9   affected
2223   and
380   will
19   go
883   on
47   about
122   its
5   business
42   until
675   you
8   come
51   back
10   once
25   again
3144   to
12   check
883   on
61   it.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="cut"></a>cut
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
2   href="Utilities/cut.htm"><tt>cut</tt></a>
1837   is
3088   a
63   simple
11   filter
1113   for
8   selecting
94   out
234   just
28   certain
35   fields
1041   or
172   character
7   positions
2059   of
197   each
372   line
2059   of
8   input.
150   You
21   choose
81   what
197   characters
131   should
924   be
18   interpreted
857   as
6605   the
39   field
7   delimiters
2223   and
201   which
35   fields
131   should
924   be
23   copied
3144   to
6605   the
19   output.
111   For
101   example,
790   if
675   you
5   kept
252   your
6   phone
3   book
1307   in
1   <tt>phone.txt</tt>,
675   you
55   might
2   strip
91   off
234   just
6605   the
281   first
97   word
640   from
197   each
372   line
3144   to
51   get
1   everyone&rsquo;s
281   first
2   names:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">58
483   D%
7   cut
1   -f1
1   -d'
12   '
1   phone.txt
1   Ed
1   Helen
1   Jack
1   Vickie
53   :
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
983   The
6   <tt>-f</tt>
192   option
99   means
675   you
84   want
3144   to
16   count
588   by
4   fields,
8   selecting
6605   the
281   first
39   field
2223   and
1061   that
6605   the
5   delimiter
1837   is
3088   a
67   space
37   character.
1   (Notice
6605   the
52   quotes
45   around
6605   the
1   space.)
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="split"></a>split
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
2   href="Utilities/split.htm"><tt>split</tt></a>
30   lets
675   you
38   break
157   up
3088   a
23   large
383   file
178   into
1   smaller,
1   fixed-size
2   pieces
13   counting
93   either
588   by
111   lines
1041   or
588   by
55   characters.
45   Each
2059   of
6605   the
6   smaller
294   files
879   it
13   creates
650   are
1   numbered,
95   e.g.,
1   <tt>chunk.001</tt>,
1   <tt>chunk.002</tt>,
1   <tt>chunk.003</tt>,
38   etc.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
21   An
43   example
2059   of
105   where
675   you
55   might
270   use
2   <tt>split</tt>
161   would
924   be
790   if
675   you
11   wanted
3144   to
60   copy
3088   a
383   file
3144   to
1   CD,
241   but
879   it
363   was
13   too
1   big.
150   You
76   could
270   use
2   <tt>split</tt>
3144   to
38   break
879   it
157   up
178   into
1   600
1   MB
2   chunks.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="tabs"></a>tabs
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
4   href="Utilities/tabs.htm"><tt>tabs</tt></a>
30   lets
675   you
7   expand
1041   or
2   unexpand
28   tab
197   characters
15   based
883   on
3088   a
436   set
2059   of
28   tab
18   settings
675   you
45   give
61   it.
30   Tab
18   settings
650   are
1   religious.
22   I
90   like
72   them
23   every
61   3
42   spaces
241   but
675   you
16   probably
90   like
32   something
5   else.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="tr"></a>tr
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/tr.htm"><tt>tr</tt></a>
1837   is
3088   a
55   another
63   simple
11   filter
1113   for
3   translating
197   characters
640   from
58   input
3144   to
19   output.
111   For
101   example,
675   you
76   could
3   translate
26   everything
640   from
32   lower
3144   to
21   upper
97   case
588   by
3   typing:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">59
483   D%
15   tr
1   a-z
1   A-Z
88   hello
43   world
1   HELLO
1   WORLD
6   ^Z
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
12   We
49   typed
6605   the
281   first
1   <tt>hello
1   world</tt>
2223   and
4   <tt>tr</tt>
289   has
234   just
6   echoed
879   it
1307   in
21   upper
43   case.
1   <tt>^Z</tt>
1837   is
6605   the
11   end-of-file
172   character
43   defined
588   by
12   Windows.
4   <tt>tr</tt>
190   also
289   has
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
65   options
1113   for
1   squeezing
94   out
7   repeated
39   sequences
2059   of
6605   the
122   same
172   character
1041   or
57   editing
94   out
234   just
28   certain
197   characters
2223   and
115   even
1113   for
1   normalizing
6605   the
106   text
1307   in
3088   a
39   file,
3   ensuring
1061   that
23   every
372   line
11   ends
920   with
3088   a
9   carriage
1   return/line
2   feed
5   combination.
14   That&rsquo;s
1   handy
790   if
23   you&rsquo;re
1   importing
3088   a
383   file
640   from
55   another
11   operating
6   system.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="strings"></a>strings
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
2   href="Utilities/strings.htm"><tt>strings</tt></a>
30   lets
675   you
44   simply
190   list
94   out
364   all
6605   the
53   ASCII
56   strings
1307   in
590   an
19   otherwise
72   binary
96   file.
261   A
31   really
63   simple
270   use
161   would
924   be
17   extract
56   strings
640   from
3088   a
1   spreadsheet
96   file.
1   Various
65   options
650   are
16   available
3144   to
1   trimming
6605   the
64   output
113   so
199   only
56   strings
2059   of
3088   a
6   minimum
7   length,
38   etc.
106   In
320   this
101   example,
40   we
270   use
6605   the
2   <tt>-a</tt>
192   option
3144   to
38   find
364   all
8   strings,
115   even
47   those
1061   that
3   aren&rsquo;t
1   null-terminated:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">60
483   D%
56   strings
29   -a
1   Automobile.xls
498   |
18   fgrep
30   -i
1   miles
3   Miles
3   Low
3   Miles
1   Hi
3   Miles
1   Adj
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
1   <tt>strings</tt>
511   can
190   also
20   let
675   you
17   extract
13   Unicode
2   strings:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">61

56   strings
19   -u
1   c:\windows\system32\ntdll.dll
498   |
11   f
1   PageHeap
1   PageHeapFlags
1   PageHeapSizeRangeStart

53   :

2059   of

1129   shell

1679   </p>
1604   <p>
181   This

1604   <p>
983   The

511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to

2223   and

21   tapes
2223   and
4   diskettes.
983   The
3314   <a

675   you

3088   a
342   tape

4   interchange
920   with

2   own.

1604   <p>

1679   </p>
1604   <p>
468   If
675   you

3088   a

2   4mm
14   DAT
7   drives.

1   $10

6   close

3   terms

3   cost

2   megabyte

3   weight

2   megabyte

468   If

2   store

1   concerned

1   shipping

14   DAT

1   win
1   hands
1   down.
139   Also,
14   DAT

1   better-supported

111   For

3088   a

1   written).
139   Also,

6605   the

522   <h4>

1604   <p>
103   To

1   class="codesample">67

1652   </div>
1604   <p>
983   The
342   tape
19   device
1837   is
3314   <a
1   href="29-SpecialDevices.htm"><tt>\\.\tape0</tt></a>
126   under
12   Windows.
39   That

1   Microsoft.
468   If
675   you

207   more

6605   the
7   others

924   be

1   <tt>\\.\tape1</tt>,
1   <tt>\\.\tape2</tt>,
38   etc.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
106   When
46   reading
3088   a
25   tape,
29   <tt>tar</tt>
380   will
37   automatically
10   recognize

29   <tt>tar</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>cpio</tt>

2223   and

1   cpio)

380   will
37   automatically
176   do
34   whatever
1   "byte-flipping"
1837   is
24   required

6605   the
342   tape
363   was
63   written
883   on
22   machine
920   with
3088   a
58   different
4   bytesex.
1   (More
47   about
10   bytesex
3   later.)
139   Also,
29   <tt>tar</tt>
380   will
176   do
122   its
8   best
3144   to
19   determine

45   blocksize
281   used

790   if
675   you
30   don&rsquo;t
30   tell
61   it.
35   Under
841   Windows
81   NT
2   3.5,
6605   the
45   blocksize
135   does
299   have
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
30   multiple
2059   of
13   512
41   bytes
3144   to
924   be
1   readable;
29   <tt>tar</tt>
380   will
4   iterate
109   through
364   all
6605   the
2   possibilities

879   it
13   finds
6605   the
37   right
11   one.
35   Under
841   Windows

9   3.51

10   later,

342   tape
112   drive

1   i/o,&rdquo;

19   determine
6605   the
45   blocksize

16   record

1679   </p>
1604   <p>
111   For
3088   a
20   little
207   more
5   diagnostic
34   information

511   can

6605   the
2   <tt>-v</tt>

1   <tt>-L</tt>.
4   You&rsquo;ll

1   (<tt>tar</tt>

1   <tt>cpio</tt>),
10   bytesex

2223   and
6605   the
10   offsets

6605   the

6605   the

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="ExtractingTheContentsOfATarTape"></a>Extracting
6605   the

1604   <p>
468   If
675   you
511   can

6605   the

2059   of
3088   a

675   you

9   Do

6605   the

3144   to

6605   the

6605   the

6605   the
2   <tt>-x</tt>

1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">68

189   tar
2   -Lx
13   \\.\tape0
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
32   By
38   default,
29   <tt>tar</tt>
380   will
17   extract
26   everything
883   on
6605   the
342   tape

6605   the

468   If
364   all
675   you

1837   is
234   just
3088   a
20   particular

675   you
511   can
94   specify
879   it

6605   the
428   command
75   line.
2   Wildcards
511   can
190   also
924   be
31   used.
58   But
17   remember
1061   that
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
56   normally
3   expands
18   wildcards
98   before

29   starts

27   application

522   <h4>
3314   <a

1679   </p>
14   <ol>

1604   <p>
1   You&rsquo;re

8   Vista
1041   or

3   administrator,
2223   and

380   will

1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
150   You

299   have
6605   the
342   tape

1   installed.
150   You

3   driver

6605   the

1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
342   tape
17   itself
1837   is
234   just
471   not
7   compatible
920   with
252   your
26   drive.
4   Every
342   tape
112   drive
5   technology
1837   is
1   constantly
78   being
13   improved.
16   New
2   generation
55   drives
511   can
10   usually
125   read
21   tapes
63   written
883   on
6605   the
24   older
5   drives,
241   but
64   because
6605   the
16   newer
55   drives
6   typically
270   use
1   newer,
1   higher-density
16   media
2223   and
207   more
1   sophisticated
1   recording
3   formats,
1061   that
29   compatibility
511   can
924   be
1   one-way
8   only.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   Examples
650   are
35   trying
3144   to
125   read
3088   a
1   DDS-2
14   DAT
342   tape

3088   a
1   DDS-1
112   drive
1041   or
3088   a
1   DC-6525
1   (525MB)

3088   a
112   drive

1   DC-600&rsquo;s
1041   or
590   an
4   Exabyte
1   8500

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="AsciiTextVersusBinaryFiles"></a>ASCII
106   text
14   versus
72   binary
294   files
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
15   One
11   final
2   consideration
1837   is
1061   that
32   Unix
2223   and
841   Windows
4   differ
883   on
32   their
4   line-end
5   conventions.
32   Unix
55   uses
3088   a
110   single
8   newline
3   <tt>\n</tt>
172   character
3144   to
12   mark
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
3   line;
841   Windows
55   uses
3088   a
9   carriage
4   return-newline
2   <tt>\r\n</tt>
5   combination.
1043   Hamilton
29   <tt>tar</tt>
7   assumes
1061   that
64   because
29   <tt>tar</tt>
1837   is
1   fundamentally
3088   a
32   Unix
13   format,
1061   that
439   any
53   ASCII
294   files
18   stored
1307   in
3088   a
29   <tt>tar</tt>
383   file
380   will
16   probably
13   follow
6605   the
32   Unix
4   convention.
1   Consequently,
268   when
16   extracting
590   an
53   ASCII
106   text
39   file,
29   <tt>tar</tt>
380   will
17   convert
640   from
3   <tt>\n</tt>
3144   to
1   <tt>\r\n</tt>;
268   when
21   adding
3088   a
383   file
3144   to
6605   the
238   archive,
879   it
380   will
176   do
6605   the
9   reverse.
9   Binary
294   files
650   are
471   not
1   converted.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
150   You
511   can
14   override
320   this
117   default
8   behavior
588   by
14   specifying
93   either
3   <tt>-r</tt>
3144   to
28   turn
91   off
439   any
2   conversions.
983   The
2   <tt>-R</tt>
192   option
39   causes
15   conversions
3144   to
80   always
924   be
8   done,
115   even
883   on
294   files
1061   that
21   appear
3144   to
924   be
4   binary.
150   You
511   can
190   also
270   use
6605   the
3   <tt>TARBINARY</tt>
2223   and
2   <tt>TARASCII</tt>
76   environment
111   variables
3144   to
190   list
294   files
1061   that
131   should
924   be
66   considered
857   as
78   being
271   one
84   type
14   versus
6605   the
176   other
15   based
883   on
6605   the
6   filename,
15   regardless
2059   of
8   content.
111   For
101   example,
1   database
1   products
12   often
38   create
294   files
920   with
3088   a
11   lot
2059   of
53   ASCII
111   data
241   but
201   which
31   really
131   should
924   be
66   considered
857   as
4   binary.
2   Postscript
294   files
920   with
1   encapsulated
2   images
650   are
55   another
6   example.
30   These
294   files
131   should
18   never
2   translated
857   as
790   if
104   they
132   were
37   ordinary
53   ASCII
52   files.
150   You
511   can
14   indicate
1061   that
588   by
35   setting
6605   the
3   <tt>TARBINARY</tt>
76   environment
47   variable.
111   For
101   example,
1307   in
6605   the
22   System
4   applet
1307   in
6605   the
12   Control
1   Panel,
675   you
55   might
436   set
1   <tt>TARBINARY&nbsp;=&nbsp;*.ps</tt>
3144   to
53   make
879   it
11   treat
364   all
2   Postscript
294   files
857   as
72   binary
27   data.
1679   </p>
