1604   <p>
4   During
2   installation,
3088   a
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
26   group
1837   is
33   created
1307   in
6605   the
22   Start
7   menu
920   with
5   shortcuts
3144   to
42   open
3088   a
94   local
60   copy
2059   of
320   this
19   User
3   Guide
2223   and
1113   for
31   starting
6605   the
1930   C
55   shell.
11   Another
16   shortcut
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
33   created
883   on
6605   the
6   desktop.
23   Notice
1061   that
30   multiple
26   versions
511   can
924   be
16   installed
1   side-by-side.
1679   </p>
3314   <a
1   href="Images/Screenshots/HamiltonCshellIconShortcut.png">

9   alt="Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
16   shortcut
1   properties"
197   class="shadow"/>
420   </a>
1604   <p>
983   The
5   shortcuts
14   invoke
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
857   as
3314   <a
1   href="Utilities/csh.htm"><tt>csh&nbsp;-L</tt></a>.
983   The
5   <tt>-L</tt>
192   option
29   starts
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
857   as
3088   a
2   "login"
980   shell,
25   causing
879   it
3144   to
43   look
1113   for
3088   a
3314   <a
3   href="46-LoginCsh.htm"><tt>login.csh</tt></a>
96   file.
39   That
1307   in
28   turn
39   causes
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
436   set
157   up
122   its
3314   <a
1   href="40-EnvironmentVariables.htm#PATH">
1   <tt>PATH</tt></a>
243   variable
113   so
879   it
511   can
38   find
122   its
3314   <a
1   href="51-ExternalUtilities.htm">
1   <tt>Bin</tt></a>
2223   and
3314   <a
1   href="53-Samples.htm"><tt>Samples</tt></a>
55   directories.
1679   </p>
3314   <a
1   href="Images/Screenshots/HamiltonCshellIconShortcutLayout.png">

983   The
1930   C
1129   shell
3   opens
1307   in
1307   in
3088   a
4   25
111   lines
38   x
9   80
197   characters
66   window
178   into
3088   a
2   1000
111   lines
38   x
9   80
197   characters
13   buffer.
181   This
511   can
924   be
21   changed
3144   to
41   anything
675   you
10   like.
1679   </p>
3314   <a

1   href="52-PredefinedAliases.htm#xcopy"><tt>xcopy</tt></a>
164   alias
3144   to
146   run
6605   the
841   Windows
7   <tt>xcopy</tt>
428   command
920   with
51   wildcarding
29   turned
13   off.
1679   </p>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

2   page.
4   (Not
1   implemented.)
1768   </td>

1604   <p>
113   All
13   external
297   utilities

1   <tt>whereis</tt>

920   with
6605   the
3   <tt>-h</tt>

13   external
69   utility
193   may
924   be
11   renamed
44   simply
588   by
2   renaming
6605   the
40   executable
96   file.

3   Older
9   BSD
8   4.3
152   name
1113   for

7   <tt>xcopy</tt>
428   command
920   with
1129   shell
51   wildcarding
29   turned
91   off
113   so
7   <tt>xcopy</tt>
380   will
102   work
5   sensibly.
1679   </p>
1768   </td>

1604   <p>
983   The

1930   C

1129   shell

3144   to

1041   or
2   experiment

1043   Hamilton
1930   C

2   Deliberately,

1   trivial.

261   A
63   simple
1930   C
18   program
1061   that
35   prints
94   out
6605   the
2   <tt>*argv[]</tt>
2   (argument)
2223   and
1   <tt>*envp[]</tt>

3   variable)
2   arrays.

1061   that
9   wildcarding,
243   variable
1   substitutions,
9   quoting
2223   and
428   command
34   substitutions
650   are
58   done

6605   the
1930   C
18   program
1837   is
3   started.
468   If
675   you
176   do
3088   a
11   lot
2059   of
9   wildcarding,
675   you
511   can
38   create
2223   and
28   pass
1   <i><b>very</b></i>

1679   </p>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

3314   <a

57   <h4>Topics</h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
1   href="#FreeImplementations">Free
8   implementations
883   on
6605   the
1   web</a>

1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="FreeImplementations"></a>Free
8   implementations
883   on
6605   the
2   web
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
135   does
471   not
26   include
1   awk,
15   perl
1041   or
5   vi
1113   for
6605   the
63   simple
7   reason
1061   that
87   there
650   are
1   authoritative,
10   free
8   implementations
55   already
16   available
883   on
6605   the
1   net.
14   Here
650   are
13   my
1   recommendations:
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="awk"></a>awk
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
2   Brian
1   Kernighan
1837   is
6605   the
1   &ldquo;K&rdquo;
1307   in
1   awk.
3   From
4   his
3314   <a
1   href="http://cm.bell-labs.com/who/bwk/">home
8   page
277   at
1   Bell
1   Labs</a>,
8   you'll
38   find
3088   a
6   link
3144   to
3314   <a
1   href="http://cm.bell-labs.com/cm/cs/awkbook/index.html">The
1   Awk
13   Programming
7   Language
1   page</a>.
983   The
15   latest
65   version
2059   of
6605   the
3314   <a
1   href="http://www.cs.princeton.edu/~bwk/btl.mirror/">One
4   True
1   Awk</a>
511   can
924   be
1   downloaded
640   from
1   Brian's
1   mirror
277   at
1   Princeton.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
106   When
2   Brian
4   says
320   this
983   The
1   One,
22   I
1   trust
4   his
1   judgment.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="perl"></a>perl
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
29   There
1837   is
66   still
199   only
271   one
23   root
4   codebase
1113   for
1   perl,
6605   the
271   one
33   created
588   by
1   Larry
1   Wall.
5   My
7   choice
1113   for
6605   the
8   best
8   page
640   from
201   which
3144   to
2   download
6605   the
15   latest
51   source
1041   or
841   Windows
40   executable
1837   is
3314   <a
1   href="http://www.perl.com/pub/a/language/info/software.html">
6605   the
1   O'Reilly
3   page</a>
2   maintained
588   by
1   Tom
1   Christiansen.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="vi"></a>vi
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
1   Hands
3   down,
6605   the
8   best
5   vi
4   ever
63   written
1837   is
1   Vim,
15   short
1113   for
1   Vi-Improved,
588   by
2   Bram
1   Moolenar.
3   From
3314   <a
1   href="http://www.vim.org/">the
14   Vim
40   home
3   page</a>
1837   is
3088   a
6   link
3144   to
6605   the
3314   <a
1   href="http://www.vim.org/download.php">downloads
3   page</a>
640   from
201   which
675   you
511   can
2   download
56   both
51   source
2223   and
3088   a
841   Windows
3   executable.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
2   Bram
1   hopes
1061   that
790   if
675   you
38   find
14   Vim
1   useful,
1061   that
22   you&rsquo;ll
53   make
3088   a
1   donation
3144   to
62   help
1   needy
12   children
1307   in
1   Uganda.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
103   To
270   use
14   Vim
126   under
6605   the
1930   C
980   shell,
102   it's
5   helpful
3144   to
14   invoke
879   it
17   via
94   these
5   aliases,
18   predefined
1307   in
6605   the
117   default
3314   <a
1   href="47-StartupCsh.htm">Startup.csh</a>:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">alias
3   vim
26   env
25   -D
6   SHELL=
2   vim.exe
164   alias
2   gvim
26   env
25   -D
6   SHELL=
2   gvim.exe
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
14   Vim
511   can
146   run
13   external
228   commands,
95   e.g.,
1   <tt>:!csh</tt>
3144   to
2   "shell
3   out"
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
980   shell,
1041   or
1   <tt>:%!tr&nbsp;a-z&nbsp;A-Z</tt>
3144   to
1   uppercase
26   everything
1307   in
6605   the
45   buffer
588   by
1   filtering
879   it
109   through
6605   the
3314   <a
3   href="Utilities/tr.htm"><tt>tr</tt></a>
11   utility.
14   Vim
135   does
320   this
588   by
6   passing
6605   the
428   command
3144   to
10   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   Unfortunately,
790   if
6605   the
3314   <a
5   href="40-EnvironmentVariables.htm#SHELL"><tt>SHELL</tt></a>
76   environment
243   variable
1837   is
13   defined,
14   Vim
19   gets
1   confused.
159   It
380   will
270   use
22   it,
241   but
879   it
66   still
9   expects
1061   that
879   it
4   points
277   at
16   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>
2223   and
879   it
9   constructs
3088   a
428   command
372   line
1   accordingly,
201   which
28   doesn't
102   work
920   with
6605   the
1930   C
55   shell.
12   Since
675   you
20   can't
14   delete
6605   the
3   <tt>SHELL</tt>
243   variable
640   from
6605   the
1930   C
21   shell's
4   environment,
94   these
31   aliases
270   use
6605   the
3314   <a
1   href="Utilities/env.htm">
1   <tt>env</tt></a>
69   utility
857   as
590   an
2   interlude
3144   to
14   delete
6605   the
3   <tt>SHELL</tt>
243   variable
640   from
6605   the
76   environment
73   passed
3144   to
1   Vim.
1679   </p>

57   <h4>Topics</h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
1   href="#DoesItWork">Does
879   it
1   work?</a><br/>
3314   <a
2   href="#LoginCsh">Login.csh</a><br/>

2   href="#StartupCsh">Startup.csh</a><br/>

1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="DoesItWork"></a>Does
879   it
1   work?</h4>
1604   <p>
2   Of
4   course
879   it
4   does.
12   Cygwin
11   includes
3088   a
11   lot
2059   of
5   helpful
17   GNU
297   utilities
1061   that
1   nicely
2   complement
6605   the
436   set
10   provided
920   with
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
980   shell,
113   so
2059   of
4   course
675   you
131   should
924   be
29   able
3144   to
270   use
72   them
920   with
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
2059   of
4   course
675   you
3   can.
150   You
511   can
115   even
146   run
2   <tt>bash</tt>
52   scripts
640   from
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
790   if
104   they
87   start
920   with
1   <tt>#!/bin/bash</tt>.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
103   To
270   use
6605   the
12   Cygwin
435   tools
920   with
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
199   only
8   requires
1061   that
6605   the
12   Cygwin
3   <tt>bin</tt>
319   directory
924   be
23   listed
883   on
6605   the
76   search
89   path
2223   and
1061   that
6605   the
17   GNU
297   utilities
22   know
3144   to
12   expect
1   Windows-format
52   filenames
920   with
112   drive
11   letters
2223   and
3   backslashes.
106   In
5   addition,
30   since
101   some
17   GNU
297   utilities
299   have
6605   the
122   same
88   names
857   as
6605   the
1043   Hamilton
26   versions
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
161   would
56   normally
7   run,
102   it's
5   helpful
3144   to
299   have
3088   a
90   way
94   specify
17   GNU
65   version
790   if
49   that's
81   what
675   you
7   want.
983   The
9   easy
90   way
3144   to
176   do
320   this
17   via
6605   the
1930   C
21   shell's
23   <tt>login.csh</tt>
2223   and
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
9   scripts.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
2   name="LoginCsh"></a>Login.csh
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
12   Here's
3088   a
45   sample
23   <tt>login.csh</tt>
383   file
675   you
55   might
20   add
3144   to
252   your
40   home
92   directory.
159   It
20   inherits
41   anything
1061   that
55   might
56   normally
924   be
436   set
157   up
1307   in
6605   the
117   default
23   <tt>login.csh</tt>
159   script
588   by
1   source'ing
22   it,
189   then
4   adds
6605   the
12   Cygwin
3   <tt>bin</tt>
319   directory
3144   to
6605   the
3314   <a
3   href="41-ProcessWideVariables.htm#path"><tt>path</tt></a>
243   variable
2223   and
12   sets
590   an
76   environment
243   variable
3144   to
30   tell
6605   the
17   GNU
1   utilies
3144   to
12   expect
841   Windows
7   filenames.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">#
4   Source
6605   the
117   default
17   login.csh
51   source
3   $shell:h:h\login.csh
597   #
9   Add
12   Cygwin
3144   to
6605   the
76   search
89   path
436   set
89   path
527   =
3   $path
1   C:\Cygwin64\bin
597   #
3   Tell
6605   the
17   GNU
297   utilities
471   not
3144   to
10   complain
47   about
841   Windows
52   filenames
597   #
920   with
112   drive
11   letters
2223   and
1   backslashes
99   setenv
1   CYGWIN
527   =
1   nodosfilewarning
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
983   The
26   32-bit
65   version
2059   of
12   Cygwin
1837   is
56   normally
16   installed
277   at
1   <tt>C:\Cygwin</tt>.
983   The
21   64-bit
65   version
1837   is
56   normally
16   installed
277   at
1   <tt>C:\Cygwin64</tt>.
14   Here
1   I've
13   assumed
6605   the
21   64-bit
65   version
2223   and
1061   that
102   it's
382   been
16   installed
1307   in
6605   the
12   usual
3   location.
13   Setting
6605   the
1   <tt>CYGWIN</tt>
76   environment
243   variable
3144   to
1   <tt>nodosfilewarning</tt>
21   tells
6605   the
17   GNU
297   utilities
3144   to
12   expect
841   Windows
7   filenames.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
2   name="StartupCsh"></a>Startup.csh
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
16   Some
2059   of
6605   the
17   GNU
228   utilities,
90   like
9   <tt>ls</tt>
2223   and
6   <tt>grep</tt>
2223   and
7   others
17   provide
10   similar
22   functions
857   as
6605   the
1043   Hamilton
26   versions
2059   of
6605   the
122   same
12   name,
241   but
8   sometimes
3088   a
20   little
1   differently.
1   Whichever
65   version
14   comes
281   first
1307   in
6605   the
76   search
89   path
1837   is
6605   the
271   one
1061   that
380   will
924   be
12   run.
468   If
5   you've
104   added
12   Cygwin
3144   to
6605   the
89   path
857   as
3   suggested
1   above,
8   you'll
51   get
6605   the
1043   Hamilton
5   version.
39   That
55   might
471   not
80   always
924   be
81   what
675   you
7   want.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
12   Here's
3088   a
45   sample
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
383   file
675   you
55   might
20   add
3144   to
252   your
40   home
92   directory.
159   It
20   inherits
640   from
6605   the
640   from
6605   the
117   default
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
24   script,
189   then
4   defines
590   an
164   alias
3144   to
20   let
675   you
94   specify
675   you
84   want
6605   the
17   GNU
65   version
2059   of
2   something.
1   Again,
1   note
1061   that
1   I'm
7   assuming
6605   the
21   64-bit
65   version
2059   of
2   Cygwin,
16   installed
1307   in
6605   the
12   usual
2   place.
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">#
4   Source
6605   the
117   default
26   startup.csh
51   source
3   $shell:h:h\startup.csh
597   #
2   Alias
3144   to
146   run
6605   the
17   GNU
297   utilities
1061   that
8   come
920   with
12   Cygwin
164   alias
1   gnu
1   c:\Cygwin64\bin\^!^*
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
103   To
146   run
6605   the
17   GNU
65   version
2059   of
2   something,
44   simply
1   prepend
1   <tt>gnu</tt>
50   onto
6605   the
7   front
2059   of
6605   the
29   command,
95   e.g.,
1   <tt>gnu&nbsp;ls</tt>
3144   to
146   run
6605   the
17   GNU
65   version
2059   of
4   <tt>ls</tt>.
1679   </p>

446   <h3>
1   Compatibility<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="54.1-UsingWithCygwin.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="56-CommonProblems.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
57   <h4>Topics</h4>
1604   <p>
3314   <a
1   href="#BuglistFixed">Berkeley
8   4.3
2   Buglist
46   problems
299   have
382   been
1   fixed.</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#EaseOfUser">The
35   language
1837   is
207   more
9   consistent
2223   and
6   easier
3144   to
1   use.</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#Compiler">Modern
14   compiler
5   technology
289   has
382   been
1   employed.</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#Extensions">Extensions</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#Restrictions">Restrictions
2223   and
2   unimplemented
1   features</a><br/>
3314   <a
1   href="#Adaptation">Adaptation
1113   for
1   Windows</a><br/>
3314   <a
4   href="#BSDMode">Berkeley
23   Compatibility
1   Mode</a><br/>
3314   <a
55   href="#SeeAlso">See
55   also</a><br/>
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
181   This
9   section
6   details
6605   the
19   specific
15   differences
64   between
6605   the
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
6605   the
253   original
283   UNIX
1930   C
55   shell.
159   It
190   also
1   describes
6605   the
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
21   shell's
3314   <a
4   href="#BSDMode">Berkeley
29   compatibility
1   mode</a>,
281   used
1113   for
92   running
67   Berkeley
1930   C
1129   shell
9   scripts.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="BuglistFixed"></a>Berkeley
8   4.3
2   Buglist
46   problems
299   have
382   been
264   fixed.
523   </h4>
14   <ol>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   Shell
25   procedures
299   have
382   been
10   provided
857   as
3088   a
207   more
5   powerful
5   alternative
3144   to
6605   the
2   clumsy
77   argument
27   mechanism
1113   for
6   aliases.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
78   <p
1   >Commands
49   typed
20   within
7   loops
1041   or
176   other
41   control
8   structures
650   are
88   properly
104   added
3144   to
6605   the
112   history
39   list.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
12   Control
8   structures
650   are
10   recursively
1   parsed,
19   allowing
4   piping
64   between
21   them.
111   For
25   example:
1679   </p>
1655   <div
4   class="codesample"
5   style="font-size:
1   0.9em">1
64   C%
33   foreach
109   i
11   (a
89   b
11   c)
296   echo
3   $i;
412   end
498   |
16   wc
61   3
61   3
3   9
1652   </div>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
39   Any
2059   of
6605   the
3   <tt>:</tt>
57   editing
10   modifiers
511   can
924   be
281   used
883   on
439   any
14   substitution.
139   Also,
3088   a
67   space
97   inside
6605   the
76   search
129   string
1307   in
3088   a
1   <tt>:s/<var>...</var>/<var>...</var>/</tt>
428   command
380   will
65   match
6605   the
67   space
64   between
94   two
27   words.
106   In
6605   the
283   UNIX
1930   C
980   shell,
199   only
28   certain
10   modifiers
76   could
924   be
281   used
883   on
3088   a
91   given
84   type
2059   of
39   substitution
2223   and
879   it
1837   is
471   not
44   possible
3144   to
11   perform
3088   a
12   search/replace
1061   that
1   crossed
97   word
2   boundaries.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
14   </ol>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="EaseOfUse"></a>The
35   language
1837   is
207   more
9   consistent
2223   and
6   easier
3144   to
5   use.
523   </h4>
14   <ol>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
4   <tt>set</tt>,
13   <tt>setenv</tt>
2223   and
5   <tt>alias</tt>
62   commands
380   will
410   now
25   accept
6605   the
122   same
11   basic
6   syntax.
983   The
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
60   had
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
1   anomalies:
590   an
4   <tt>=</tt>
11   sign
363   was
24   required
1113   for
3088   a
10   <tt>set</tt>
241   but
471   not
1113   for
13   <tt>setenv</tt>
2223   and
2   <tt>alias</tt>;
6   parenthesis
132   were
24   required
45   around
3088   a
97   word
190   list
1113   for
3088   a
10   <tt>set</tt>
241   but
471   not
1113   for
13   <tt>setenv</tt>
2223   and
2   <tt>alias</tt>;
6605   the
10   <tt>set</tt>
94   statement
18   ignored
364   all
241   but
6605   the
281   first
77   argument
97   word
241   but
5   <tt>alias</tt>
161   would
1   not,
38   etc.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
4   Variables
1041   or
97   word
28   lists
650   are
80   always
13   indexed
13   counting
6605   the
281   first
97   word
857   as
14   element
5   zero.
983   The
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
6   counted
640   from
29   zero
268   when
9   indexing
920   with
2   <tt>:<var>n</var></tt>
11   notation
241   but
640   from
271   one
268   when
191   using
1   <tt>[<var>n</var>]</tt>
2   notation.
2   <tt>argv[0]</tt>
1837   is
6605   the
281   first
77   argument
8   word,
471   not
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
1129   shell
159   script
78   being
5   executed.
983   The
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
159   script
1837   is
5   kept
1307   in
6605   the
94   local
243   variable
1   <tt>$scriptname</tt>.
181   This
511   can
924   be
2   overridden
588   by
35   setting
6605   the
7   inheritable
5   per-thread
243   variable
1   <tt>bsdargv&nbsp;=&nbsp;1</tt>,
25   causing
2   <tt>argv[0]</tt>
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
19   script.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
106   In
7   keeping
920   with
6605   the
1   desire
3144   to
2   consistently
10   index
640   from
4   zero,
6605   the
77   last
428   command
6   entered
178   into
6605   the
112   history
10   list,
2   <tt>!!</tt>,
1837   is
66   considered
6605   the
1   0-th
1   element;
4   <tt>!-1</tt>
1837   is
6605   the
372   line
98   before
61   it.
983   The
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
66   considered
94   these
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
6   same.
261   A
19   builtin
39   variable,
2   <tt>bsdhistory</tt>,
1837   is
10   provided
1113   for
47   those
15   whose
2   fingers
3   prefer
6605   the
67   Berkeley
1   numbering
1   convention:
790   if
675   you
436   set
1   <tt>bsdhistory
527   =
1   1</tt>,
4   <tt>!!</tt>
2223   and
4   <tt>!-1</tt>
650   are
6605   the
6   same.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
3   Where
590   an
63   expression
1837   is
2   expected,
7   conventional
14   high
22   level
35   language
25   syntax
1837   is
410   now
3   acceptable.
983   The
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
24   required
42   spaces
45   around
439   any
63   expression
7   operators,
3088   a
243   variable
30   reference
24   required
3088   a
7   <tt>$</tt>
3144   to
54   introduce
22   it,
6   parenthesis
132   were
24   required
3144   to
23   avoid
2   confusing
1   "less
1   than"
920   with
28   i/o
3   redirection,
38   etc.
6   What
60   had
3144   to
924   be
49   typed
857   as
1679   </p>
1655   <div
4   class="codesample"
5   style="font-size:
2   0.9em">@
109   i
527   =
1   ($j
117   +
61   3
41   *
1   $k
49   &lt;
5   10)
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
126   under
6605   the
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
511   can
410   now
924   be
49   typed
7   (for
1   example)
857   as
1679   </p>
1655   <div
4   class="codesample"
5   style="font-size:
2   0.9em">@
109   i
527   =
1   j+3*k
49   &lt;
21   10
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
53   (The
253   original
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
63   expression
25   syntax
1837   is
66   still
1   entirely
4   acceptable
2223   and
380   will
66   still
15   produce
15   correct
1   results.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
8   Inside
3088   a
4   <tt>[<var>...</var>]</tt>
10   array
1   index,
6605   the
1129   shell
80   always
20   looks
1113   for
590   an
11   expression,
18   never
590   an
1   editing-style
97   word
1   select.
1   Syntax
2223   and
2   keying
9   rules
650   are
6605   the
122   same
857   as
920   with
439   any
15   expression.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
8   <tt>case</tt>
94   statement
410   now
22   accepts
590   an
63   expression
3144   to
924   be
16   matched
46   rather
171   than
199   only
3088   a
19   pattern.
8   (To
94   specify
3088   a
5   static
4   pattern,
1   enclose
879   it
1307   in
1   quotes.)
103   To
19   determine
3088   a
65   match
27   against
3088   a
8   <tt>case</tt>
1   clause,
6605   the
8   <tt>case</tt>
63   expression
1837   is
1   evaluated,
9   converted
3144   to
3088   a
129   string
2223   and
189   then
281   used
857   as
3088   a
46   pattern
3144   to
24   compare
27   against
6605   the
9   <tt>switch</tt>
21   value.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
25   various
58   different
412   end
73   statements
281   used
588   by
6605   the
283   UNIX
1930   C
980   shell,
1   <tt>end</tt>,
4   <tt>endif</tt>
2223   and
1   <tt>endsw</tt>,
299   have
382   been
12   replaced
588   by
3088   a
110   single
5   <tt>end</tt>
30   statement.
8   Similarly,
6605   the
94   two
38   break
10   statements,
10   <tt>break</tt>
2223   and
1   <tt>breaksw</tt>,
299   have
382   been
12   replaced
920   with
3088   a
110   single
10   <tt>break</tt>
30   statement.
111   For
29   compatibility
920   with
31   existing
226   scripts,
6605   the
6   obsolete
6   keywords
650   are
4   implemented
857   as
31   aliases
1307   in
6605   the
117   default
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
159   script
7   supplied
920   with
6605   the
1   product.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
12   Since
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
10   free
59   format
9   (i.e.,
257   new
73   statements
44   need
471   not
22   begin
883   on
3088   a
257   new
1   line),
6605   the
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
22   convention
2059   of
1   chaining
11   <tt>if</tt>
73   statements
920   with
3088   a
110   single
5   <tt>end</tt>
790   if
6605   the
2   <tt>else</tt>
2223   and
11   <tt>if</tt>
650   are
883   on
6605   the
122   same
372   line
22   isn't
9   sensible
2   (though
879   it
1837   is
21   supported
1307   in
3314   <a
4   href="#BSDMode">Berkeley
23   Compatibility
1   Mode</a>
18   explicitly
1113   for
1   compatibility).
13   Instead,
590   an
3   <tt>elif</tt>
8   keyword
289   has
382   been
41   added.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
1   obscure
270   use
2059   of
35   several
10   <tt>break</tt>
73   statements
1307   in
3088   a
8   row
883   on
3088   a
110   single
372   line
3144   to
38   break
94   out
2059   of
35   several
13   levels
2059   of
41   control
73   statements
277   at
10   once
289   has
382   been
2   eliminated.
106   In
122   its
3   place,
3088   a
40   label
193   may
924   be
152   specified
857   as
590   an
18   operand
3144   to
14   indicate
6605   the
41   control
10   structure
94   out
2059   of
201   which
879   it
131   should
2   break.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
14   </ol>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="Compiler"></a>Modern
14   compiler
5   technology
289   has
382   been
1   employed.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3   Statements
650   are
15   parsed
2223   and
15   compiled
178   into
590   an
30   internal
32   form
98   before
439   any
34   substitutions
1041   or
176   other
11   evaluation
1837   is
1   attempted.
181   This
223   offers
590   an
4   enormous
15   performance
1   improvement,
14   particularly
268   when
9   iteration
1837   is
2   involved.
53   (The
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
161   would
38   actually
2   reparse
197   each
94   statement
97   inside
3088   a
3   <tt>foreach</tt>
23   loop
197   each
96   time
109   through
6605   the
1   loop.)
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
468   If
1   command-
1041   or
1   variable-substitution
13   creates
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
84   following
7   reserved
80   words
1041   or
4   tokens,
6605   the
94   special
3   semantic
54   meaning
380   will
924   be
1   lost
30   since
39   substitution
1837   is
58   done
61   after
13   parsing
2059   of
94   statement
7   structure.
13   Instead,
104   they
380   will
44   simply
924   be
35   treated
857   as
172   character
7   strings.
30   These
7   reserved
80   words
3   are:
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   <i>Introducing
3088   a
4   clause
1307   in
3088   a
2   structured
1   statement:</i>
1679   </p>
1655   <div
2   class="codesample">alias
5   elif
790   if
9   setkey
9   unproc
38   break
56   else
94   local
51   source
9   unset
588   by
412   end
8   onintr
18   switch
18   unsetenv
90   calc
23   eval
110   proc
189   then
3   unsetkey
97   case
44   exit
10   repeat
96   time
42   until
23   continue
1113   for
159   return
3144   to
95   while
117   default
33   foreach
436   set
4   unalias
284   @
176   do
14   goto
99   setenv
15   unlocal
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
1   <i>Anywhere:</i>
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">(
210   )
49   &lt;
49   &gt;
2   &amp;=
498   |
30   ;
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
1   <i>In
590   an
1   expression:</i>
1679   </p>
1655   <div
1   class="codesample">+
91   -
41   *
23   /
60   %
527   =
1652   </div>
1604   <p>
8   Similarly,
7   labels
29   cannot
924   be
7   run-time
21   evaluated
3144   to
43   see
81   what
6605   the
40   label
883   on
3088   a
94   statement
1   is;
879   it
64   must
924   be
21   evaluated
268   when
6605   the
94   statement
1837   is
281   first
1   parsed.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="Extensions"></a>Extensions
523   </h4>
14   <ol>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
39   Command
372   line
57   editing
920   with
6605   the
7   arrow
7   keys,
22   etc.,
2223   and
6605   the
4   <tt>setkey</tt>

10   new.

115   </li>

1604   <p>
983   The
72   procedure
1   mechanism,
6605   the
2   <tt>proc</tt>,
2   <tt>unproc</tt>

1   <tt>return</tt>

2223   and
6605   the
25   various
19   builtin
25   procedures
650   are
10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>

1604   <p>

111   variables
2223   and
6605   the
6   <tt>local</tt>

2   <tt>unlocal</tt>

10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
270   use
2059   of
46   color
18   highlighting
3144   to
14   indicate
8   exception
8   situations
1307   in
320   filename
1041   or
428   command
46   completion
1837   is
10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
8   <tt>for</tt>
11   statement,
1   providing
25   numeric
1   iteration,
2223   and
6605   the
7   <tt>calc</tt>
11   statement,
201   which
25   writes
6605   the
48   result
2059   of
63   expression
11   evaluation
3144   to
6   stdout,
650   are
10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>

1604   <p>
983   The
3   <tt>**</tt>
2223   and
1   <tt>**=</tt>
1   exponentiation
44   operators
650   are
10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
2   Floating
39   point
3   arithmetic
1837   is
10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
89   path
19   hashing
27   mechanism
1837   is
6   substantially
13   less
3   sensitive
3144   to
1   blindspots
96   caused
588   by
14   creating
3088   a
257   new
40   executable
1307   in
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
2   <tt>path</tt>
103   directories
2223   and
471   not
8   manually
14   specifying
1   <tt>rehash</tt>.
983   The
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
161   would
471   not
924   be
29   able
3144   to
38   find
6605   the
257   new
2   file;
320   this
1129   shell
19   makes
3088   a
33   second
28   pass
109   through
6605   the
2   <tt>path</tt>
103   directories
5   whenever
19   hashing
3   fails,
25   looking
1113   for
320   this
32   sort
2059   of
33   problem
98   before
879   it
17   reports
4   failure.
468   If
879   it
13   finds
3088   a
1   blindspot,
879   it
37   automatically
1   rehashes
1061   that
92   directory.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
9   History
35   references
650   are
5   allowed
1307   in
6605   the
25   inline
106   text
7   supplied
920   with
6605   the
5   <tt>&lt;&lt;</tt>
28   i/o
25   redirection
4   mechanism.
139   Also,
6605   the
25   inline
106   text
1837   is
1   remembered
1307   in
6605   the
112   history
10   list,
197   each
372   line
857   as
3088   a
110   single
25   word.
181   This
3   avoids
6605   the
55   user
25   having
3144   to
17   remember
2223   and
1   retype
6605   the
25   inline
106   text
439   any
96   time
271   one
2059   of
94   these
73   statements
1837   is
3   recalled
640   from
6605   the
112   history
190   list
1041   or
790   if
6605   the
112   history
190   list
1837   is
3   dumped
1113   for
270   use
1307   in
3088   a
159   script
96   file.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1   <p>Exclusion
3   ranges,
95   e.g.,
1   <tt>[^a-z]</tt>,
511   can
924   be
281   used
1307   in
3088   a
45   wildcard
19   pattern.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
12   Escape
39   sequences
3144   to
3   encode
94   special
197   characters
32   (e.g.,
1   "<tt>^a</tt>
1113   for
1   audible
1   bell
1041   or
1   "<tt>^b</tt>
1113   for
1   backspace)
650   are
34   recognized
1307   in
6605   the
74   arguments
3144   to
439   any
29   command,
471   not
234   just
3   echo.
13   Because
320   this
13   processing
1837   is
30   internal
3144   to
6605   the
980   shell,
879   it
1837   is
471   not
14   necessary
3144   to
84   type
94   two
9   escapes
1307   in
3088   a
8   row
3144   to
44   access
320   this
1   feature.
1   (Refer
3144   to
6605   the
2   <tt>echo</tt>
428   command
62   help
204   screen
1113   for
3088   a
24   complete
4   list.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
3   Argument
28   lists
73   passed
3144   to
3088   a
107   child
70   process
511   can
924   be
30   much
12   larger
171   than
650   are
5   allowed
126   under
2   UNIX.
983   The
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
42   allows
199   only
4   roughly
1   6K
197   characters
3144   to
924   be
1   passed,
13   depending
883   on
6605   the
1   revision
1   level;
320   this
1129   shell
42   allows
157   up
3144   to
3   32K
3144   to
924   be
73   passed
3144   to
3088   a
107   child
6   process,
6605   the
16   kernel
26   limit
883   on
12   Windows.
29   There
1837   is
227   no
428   command
372   line
26   limit
3144   to
590   an
30   internal
428   command
28   such
857   as
1   <tt>echo</tt>.
181   This
1837   is
2059   of
20   particular
1   importance
268   when
51   wildcarding
1837   is
281   used
1   heavily.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   Quoted
56   strings
650   are
26   shown
1307   in
6605   the
112   history
190   list
21   exactly
857   as
104   they
161   would
299   have
3144   to
924   be
13   typed.
53   (The
67   Berkeley
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
21   marked
3088   a
172   character
857   as
17   quoted
588   by
35   setting
122   its
2   high-order
1   bit;
35   setting
1   aside
1   portability
1   issues,
879   it
60   had
6605   the
1   side-effect
2059   of
471   not
78   being
8   visible
1307   in
6605   the
112   history
4   list.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
2   Parentheses
1307   in
590   an
77   argument
190   list
3144   to
590   an
40   executable
94   statement
44   need
471   not
924   be
2   escaped,
113   so
53   long
857   as
104   they
650   are
14   matched.
1   Semicolons,
28   i/o
25   redirection
1   symbols,
22   etc.,
97   inside
94   these
8   parentheses
650   are
35   treated
44   simply
857   as
106   text
2223   and
650   are
73   passed
2   straight
109   through
3144   to
6605   the
13   application.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
2   <tt>:b</tt>
1   (base),
2   <tt>:#</tt>
1   (count),
2   <tt>:A</tt>
2   (alternate
2   shortname)
2   <tt>:L</tt>
1   (longname),
2   <tt>:m</tt>
1   (mixedpath)
2223   and
2   <tt>:M</tt>
1   (mixedcase

44   operators

10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
4   indefinite
319   directory
45   wildcard
3   construct,
2   <tt>...</tt>,
1837   is
10   new.
1679   </p>
115   </li>

1   <tt>##</tt>&nbsp;...&nbsp;<tt>##</tt>
11   embedded

1837   is
10   new.
1679   </p>

522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="Restrictions"></a>Restrictions
2223   and
2   unimplemented
5   features
523   </h4>
14   <ol>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
4   Job
41   control
1837   is
471   not
11   supported.
4   Job
41   control
1837   is
471   not
2   feasible
126   under
841   Windows
64   because
10   once
271   one
79   thread
640   from
439   any
70   process
20   within
3088   a
66   window
289   has
150   started
3144   to
125   read
6605   the
7   keyboard,
6605   the
125   read
511   can
471   not
924   be
1   interrupted.
1   (Fortunately,
271   one
511   can
80   always
42   open
207   more
1   windows.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
270   use
2059   of
1   <tt>\!</tt>
97   inside
3088   a
52   prompt
129   string
3144   to
51   get
6605   the
94   statement
165   number
1837   is
471   not
11   supported.
39   Use
1   <tt>$@</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>$stmtnumber</tt>
10   instead.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
84   following
10   statements,
364   all
7   fairly
19   specific
3144   to
2   UNIX,
650   are
471   not
3   supported:
1   <tt>alloc</tt>,
2   <tt>glob</tt>,
2   <tt>limit</tt>,
2   <tt>notify</tt>,
1   <tt>stop</tt>.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
14   </ol>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="Adaptation"></a>Adaptation
1113   for
841   Windows
523   </h4>
14   <ol>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
21   Win32
135   does
471   not
17   provide
3088   a
1   <tt>fork()</tt>
25   call
1113   for
2   inexpensively
1   cloning
590   an
3   independent
60   copy
2059   of
3088   a
92   running
6   process,
24   complete
920   with
122   its
51   own
48   separate
17   memory
1   image.
13   Instead,
21   Win32
15   provides
3088   a
12   faster
5   alternative
26   called
6   threads,
201   which
13   creates
590   an
3   separately
2   scheduled
2   flow
2059   of
41   control
109   through
6605   the
17   memory
67   space
2059   of
3088   a
110   single
20   process.
1679   </p>
78   <p
2   class="continue">
106   In
5   general,
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
3   spawns
3088   a
257   new
79   thread
19   anywhere
6605   the
67   Berkeley
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
161   would
299   have
281   used
3088   a
20   process.
7   Using
3088   a
257   new
79   thread
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
257   new
5   invocation
2059   of
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
1   saves
53   over
3088   a
33   second
197   each
16   time.
7   Individual
33   threads
1   manage
32   their
51   own
1   notions
2059   of
213   current
103   directories
2223   and
213   current
83   disk
2223   and
28   certain
5   per-thread
111   variables
241   but
6605   the
1   dictionary
2059   of
5   aliases,
25   procedures
2223   and
35   most
111   variables
1837   is
30   shared
6   among
364   all
20   threads.
1679   </p>
78   <p
2   class="continue">
983   The
48   result
1837   is
1061   that
65   background
13   activities
2223   and
1930   C
1129   shell
52   scripts
511   can
78   change
22   variables,
21   define
3   procedures,
22   etc.,
1113   for
270   use
588   by
6605   the
176   other
20   threads.
111   For
101   example,
25   procedures
511   can
924   be
63   written
857   as
8   self-loading
9   scripts.
10   (See
6605   the
1   <tt>whereis.csh</tt>
383   file
1113   for
590   an
1   example.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
841   Windows
7   conventions
650   are
1   followed:
93   either
6605   the
6   <tt>\</tt>
1041   or
6605   the
10   <tt>/</tt>
197   characters
511   can
924   be
281   used
1307   in
3088   a
1   filename;
6605   the
1   "<tt>^</tt>
172   character
1837   is
56   normally
6605   the
121   escape
2   character;
103   directories
1307   in
6605   the
7   <tt>PATH</tt>
76   environment
243   variable
650   are
29   separated
588   by
3   semicolons,
38   etc.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
10   Labels
29   cannot
924   be
3088   a
110   single
1   letter.
84   (This
1837   is
3144   to
23   avoid
2   confusing
6605   the
112   drive
13   letter
1307   in
6605   the
37   pathname
2059   of
590   an
40   executable
383   file
857   as
3088   a
1   label.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
3   Executable
294   files
650   are
34   recognized
588   by
32   their
7   extension.
983   The
84   following
3   extensions
650   are
34   recognized
6   (in
320   this
1   order):
4   <tt>.csh</tt>,
3   <tt>.exe</tt>,
1   .<tt>com</tt>,
2   <tt>.cmd</tt>,
1   <tt>.bat</tt>.
10   <tt>.csh</tt>
294   files
650   are
18   interpreted
857   as
1930   C
1129   shell
52   scripts
588   by
3088   a
257   new
8   thread,
7   <tt>.exe</tt>
2223   and
4   <tt>.com</tt>
294   files
650   are
13   executed
920   with
6605   the
8   CreateProcess
16   kernel
29   function
126   under
12   Windows.
1   <tt>.Cmd</tt>
294   files
650   are
18   interpreted
588   by
3088   a
107   child
70   process
92   running
10   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>.
1   <tt>.Bat</tt>
294   files
650   are
73   passed
3144   to
10   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
4   <tt>PROMPT1</tt>
2223   and
3   <tt>PROMPT2</tt>
111   variables
650   are
281   used
3144   to
436   set
6605   the
3   primary
2223   and
1   secondary
52   prompt
7   strings.
7   Using
6605   the
283   UNIX
1930   C
1129   shell
243   variable
1   <tt>PROMPT</tt>
161   would
299   have
1   conflicted
920   with
1   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>'s
270   use
2059   of
6605   the
122   same
152   name
2223   and
161   would
299   have
7   meant
3088   a
1   nonsense
52   prompt
129   string
439   any
96   time
93   either
428   command
9   processor
363   was
21   invoked
588   by
4   other.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
84   following
18   startup
1041   or
176   other
294   files
299   have
382   been
11   renamed
3144   to
924   be
207   more
9   consistent
920   with
841   Windows
320   filename
1   conventions:
1   <tt>~/.cshrc</tt>
857   as
1   <tt>~\startup.csh</tt>;
1   <tt>~/.login</tt>
857   as
1   <tt>~\login.csh</tt>;
1   <tt>~/.logout</tt>
857   as
1   <tt>~\logout.csh</tt>;
2223   and
1   <tt>~/.history</tt>
857   as
1   <tt>~\history.csh</tt>.
983   The
1   <tt>~\login.csh</tt>
383   file
1837   is
125   read
2   before,
46   rather
171   than
61   after
6605   the
1   <tt>~\startup.csh</tt>
96   file.
106   When
31   starting
6605   the
1129   shell
857   as
3088   a
257   new
1   session,
44   very
20   little
90   environmental
34   information
193   may
924   be
1   passed;
6605   the
23   <tt>login.csh</tt>
1837   is
207   more
1   usefully
6605   the
281   first
383   file
125   read
1307   in
320   this
3   situation.
106   When
31   starting
3088   a
1   subshell,
93   either
640   from
2   <tt>csh.exe</tt>
1041   or
5   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>,
6605   the
76   environment
1837   is
1   presumably
55   already
436   set
71   up.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
11   comment
15   character,
1   <tt>#</tt>,
64   must
924   be
42   followed
588   by
101   some
68   white
67   space
3144   to
924   be
66   considered
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
3088   a
11   valid
11   comment
7   (except
1307   in
3314   <a
4   href="#BSDMode">Berkeley
23   Compatibility
1   Mode</a>).
1   (That's
64   because
4   <tt>#</tt>
1837   is
3088   a
13   legal
172   character
1307   in
3088   a
320   filename
126   under
1   Windows.)
1679   </p>
115   </li>
14   </ol>
522   <h4>
3314   <a
1   name="BSDMode"></a>Berkeley
23   Compatibility
10   Mode
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
67   Berkeley
23   Compatibility
10   Mode
15   provides
7   fairly
2   strict
29   compatibility
920   with
6605   the
253   original
9   BSD
1930   C
55   shell.
2   Triggered
588   by
3088   a
159   script
1061   that
29   starts
920   with
3   <tt>#!/bin/csh</tt>
1041   or
6   interactively
790   if
6605   the
1129   shell
1837   is
21   invoked
920   with
6605   the
3   <tt>-B</tt>
18   option,
879   it
39   causes
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
70   process
73   statements
1307   in
3088   a
207   more
6   fully
2   Berkeley-compatible
3   fashion.
2   (Scripts
1061   that
176   do
471   not
87   start
920   with
3   <tt>#!/bin/csh</tt>
380   will
66   still
924   be
9   processed
10   according
3144   to
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2   rules,
115   even
790   if
6605   the
3   <tt>-B</tt>
192   option
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
6   request
67   Berkeley
29   compatibility
2   interactively.)
106   In
29   compatibility
2   mode:
1679   </p>
14   <ol>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
3   <tt>status</tt>
243   variable
380   will
18   reflect
6605   the
159   return
66   code
640   from
6605   the
5   rightmost
11   stage
2059   of
3088   a
7   pipeline
5   returning
3088   a
17   non-zero
21   code.
983   The
1   <tt>tailstatus</tt>
243   variable
380   will
924   be
22   ignored.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
113   All
6605   the
1129   shell
111   variables
380   will
924   be
6   snapshotted
2223   and
364   all
257   new
111   variables
56   made
94   local
3144   to
6605   the
16   thread.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
2   Berkeley-style
1   <tt>$<var>var</var>[<var>...</var>]</tt>
9   indexing
11   notation
380   will
924   be
14   used,
105   where
6605   the
9   indexing
1837   is
588   by
97   word
10   selection
44   operators
2   (like
6605   the
1   <tt>:</tt>-editing
2   operators)
46   rather
171   than
588   by
15   expression.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
113   All
243   variable
4   arrays
7   (except
1   <tt>argv</tt>)
380   will
87   start
920   with
14   element
35   1.
3   Accessing
14   element
120   0
380   will
45   give
3088   a
5   null.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
2   <tt>$0</tt>
1041   or
3   <tt>$argv[0]</tt>
380   will
924   be
6605   the
2   scriptname.
3   <tt>$argv</tt>
380   will
924   be
6605   the
16   rest
2059   of
6605   the
77   argument
2   vector.
983   The
1   <tt>bsdargv</tt>
243   variable
380   will
924   be
22   ignored.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
4   <tt>#</tt>
172   character
380   will
471   not
44   need
3144   to
924   be
42   followed
588   by
68   white
67   space
3144   to
924   be
66   considered
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
3088   a
6   comment.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
16   patterns
1307   in
3088   a
8   <tt>case</tt>
36   test
2   (inside
3088   a
1   <tt>switch</tt>)
380   will
924   be
56   strings
2223   and
44   need
471   not
924   be
2   quoted,
46   rather
171   than
19   arbitrary
13   expressions.
139   Also,
6605   the
9   <tt>switch</tt>
105   value
1837   is
21   evaluated
857   as
3088   a
5   wordlist
201   which
193   may
38   contain
243   variable
1041   or
428   command
34   substitutions
2223   and
18   wildcards
2223   and
189   then
3   rendered
857   as
3088   a
35   string.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
4   <tt>endif</tt>
2223   and
2   <tt>endsw</tt>
380   will
924   be
18   predefined
31   aliases
1113   for
5   <tt>end</tt>
9   (but
199   only
268   when
9   closing
590   an
11   <tt>if</tt>
1041   or
4   <tt>switch</tt>,
2   respectively).
10   <tt>break</tt>
380   will
199   only
38   break
94   out
2059   of
590   an
5   enclosing
23   loop
1   (<tt>foreach</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>while</tt>).
2   <tt>breaksw</tt>
380   will
199   only
38   break
94   out
2059   of
3088   a
9   <tt>switch</tt>
30   statement.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
1   special-case
270   use
2059   of
1   <tt>else&nbsp;if</tt>
883   on
3088   a
110   single
372   line
1837   is
34   recognized
857   as
3088   a
90   way
3144   to
2   chain
35   several
11   <tt>if</tt>
73   statements
13   together
920   with
3088   a
110   single
4   <tt>endif</tt>
277   at
6605   the
9   end.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   <tt>set
2   <var>var</var></tt>
2223   and
3   <tt>setenv
2   <var>var</var></tt>
380   will
436   set
3   <tt><var>var</var></tt>
3144   to
3088   a
48   null
129   string
1   (considered
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
3   "set"
1   state),
471   not
9   dump
122   its
21   value.
139   Also,
10   <tt>set</tt>
22   accepts
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
111   variables
2223   and
12   sets
197   each
2059   of
72   them
3144   to
6605   the
48   null
35   string.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
106   When
6605   the
3   <tt>$?<var>var</var></tt>
2   (existence)
12   construct
1837   is
281   used
920   with
3088   a
18   predefined
39   variable,
879   it
14   tests
57   whether
6605   the
243   variable
1837   is
1307   in
6605   the
3   "set"
1   state,
471   not
234   just
57   whether
879   it
1   exists.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
78   <p
1   ><tt>/</tt>
2223   and
1   <tt>/=</tt>
380   will
11   perform
33   integer
4   division.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
37   right
18   operand
2059   of
6605   the
4   <tt>=~</tt>
2223   and
4   <tt>!~</tt>
46   pattern
26   matching
44   operators
380   will
924   be
25   taken
857   as
3088   a
97   word
201   which
193   may
38   contain
4   wildcards.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
106   In
590   an
11   expression,
3088   a
243   variable
152   name
64   must
924   be
15   preceded
588   by
2   <tt>$</tt>.
468   If
879   it
1   isn't,
6   it'll
924   be
25   taken
857   as
3088   a
44   literal
35   string.
139   Also,
6605   the
1   right-hand
2   side
2059   of
3088   a
2   <tt>==</tt>
16   comparison
1837   is
25   taken
857   as
3088   a
13   string,
471   not
590   an
15   expression.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   <tt>:</tt>-style
57   editing
44   operators
380   will
471   not
924   be
34   recognized
61   after
3088   a
428   command
14   substitution.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
15   <tt>onintr</tt>
9   expects
3088   a
2   <tt>goto
1   </tt>label,
471   not
3088   a
94   statement
8   following.
139   Also,
15   <tt>onintr</tt>
2223   and
1   <tt>onintr&nbsp;-</tt>
650   are
410   now
34   recognized
857   as
2   enabling
1041   or
3   disabling
3   interrupts,
8   respectively.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
1   <tt>$</tt><i>var</i><tt>[</tt><i>n</i><tt>-]</tt>
1837   is
34   recognized
857   as
5   referring
3144   to
13   elements
1   <i>n</i>
109   through
2   last.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
12   Escape
39   sequences
650   are
1   preserved,
471   not
1   interpreted,
97   inside
110   single
2223   and
25   double
52   quotes
42   except
268   when
7   escaping
9   escapes
1041   or
1   newlines.
106   In
47   those
11   cases
105   where
9   escapes
650   are
3   recognized,
6605   the
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2   enhancements
1113   for
39   sequences
28   such
857   as
1   <tt>^r</tt>,
1   <tt>^n</tt>,
22   etc.,
650   are
2   disabled.
8   Inside
6   quotes,
6605   the
67   Berkeley
1930   C
1129   shell
24   required
94   two
121   escape
197   characters
3144   to
121   escape
3088   a
6   newline.
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
21   shell's
67   Berkeley
44   mode
22   accepts
93   either
271   one
1041   or
94   two
121   escape
197   characters
97   inside
52   quotes
857   as
3088   a
90   way
2059   of
7   escaping
3088   a
6   newline.
139   Also,
4   embedding
3088   a
8   newline
178   into
3088   a
17   quoted
129   string
289   has
58   different
27   results
12   (as
879   it
135   does
1307   in
6605   the
67   Berkeley
1930   C
3   shell)
13   depending
883   on
57   whether
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
92   running
3088   a
159   script
1041   or
10   not.
8   Inside
3088   a
24   script,
6605   the
8   newline
20   turns
178   into
102   2
2   spaces;
4   otherwise,
102   it's
6   preserved
857   as
3088   a
44   literal
6   newline.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
106   When
52   quotes
650   are
281   used
1307   in
6605   the
2   eof-string
1113   for
3088   a
20   here
2   document,
104   they
64   must
21   appear
21   exactly
857   as
281   used
1307   in
6605   the
253   original
5   <tt>&lt;&lt;</tt>
30   statement.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
3   Comments
1307   in
6605   the
7   middle
2059   of
3088   a
2   multi-line
94   statement
412   end
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
1061   that
6   physical
75   line.
20   They
176   do
471   not
146   run
364   all
6605   the
90   way
3144   to
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
33   entire
30   statement.
181   This
363   was
3088   a
2   trick
1307   in
6605   the
67   Berkeley
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
8   embed
11   comments
178   into
6605   the
7   middle
2059   of
3088   a
30   statement.
181   This
7   feature
1837   is
4   implemented
588   by
6   rewriting
6605   the
11   comments
857   as
28   they're
125   read
588   by
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
178   into
11   embedded
11   comments
4   wherever
104   they
4   occur.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
14   </ol>
1604   <p>
30   These
45   changes
131   should
49   allow
35   most
52   scripts
3144   to
146   run
63   without
4   problems.
3   However,
87   there
380   will
66   still
924   be
3088   a
84   few
2   differences:
1679   </p>
14   <ol>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
121   escape
172   character
380   will
66   still
924   be
5   controlled
588   by
6605   the
2   <tt>escapesym</tt>
243   variable
2   (shared
17   across
364   all
2   threads),
201   which
9   defaults
3144   to
3   <tt>^</tt>,
471   not
2   <tt>\</tt>.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
5   Environmental
111   variables
380   will
66   still
924   be
3   shared.
2   Changing
72   them
1307   in
3088   a
159   script
380   will
78   change
72   them
857   as
6   seen
588   by
6605   the
6   parent.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
94   special
54   meaning
2059   of
35   several
10   <tt>break</tt>
73   statements
883   on
271   one
372   line
380   will
471   not
924   be
11   supported.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
983   The
84   following
62   commands
650   are
471   not
3   supported:
1   <tt>bg</tt>,
1   <tt>exec</tt>,
1   <tt>fg</tt>,
2   <tt>glob</tt>,
1   <tt>jobs</tt>,
2   <tt>limit</tt>,
1   <tt>nice</tt>
9   (but
3   <tt>eval</tt>
24   gives
10   similar
2   functionality),
1   <tt>nohup</tt>,
2   <tt>notify</tt>,
1   <tt>stop</tt>,
1   <tt>suspend</tt>,
1   <tt>unlimit</tt>
2223   and
1   <tt>%<var>job</var></tt>.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
115   <li>
1604   <p>
29   No
16   attempt
1837   is
56   made
3144   to
70   process
439   any
230   command-line
74   arguments
84   following
6605   the
3   <tt>#!/bin/csh</tt>
277   at
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
3088   a
24   script,
9   nor
1837   is
439   any
16   attempt
56   made
3144   to
8   implement
6605   the
1   generalized
283   UNIX
22   convention
3144   to
49   allow
176   other
3   shells
1041   or
35   language
2   processors
3144   to
924   be
21   invoked
15   based
883   on
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
1061   that
281   first
75   line.
1679   </p>
115   </li>
14   </ol>

446   <h3>
4   Common
2   problems<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="55-Compatibility.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="57-ProblemsWithTar.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
522   <h4>
106   When
22   I
47   try
3144   to
87   start
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
640   from
3088   a
3   shortcut,
879   it
1   dies
2223   and
8   goes
7   away
98   before
22   I
511   can
125   read
122   its
5   messages.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
2   Your
16   shortcut
16   probably
289   has
590   an
106   error
1307   in
6605   the
1   Target
9   field.
1   Right-click
6605   the
5   icon
1113   for
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
2   click
4   properties
3144   to
1   bring
157   up
590   an
29   edit
29   window.
5   Check
6605   the
428   command
372   line
65   options
1041   or
2   re-run
4   setup
3144   to
2   repair
252   your
2   installation.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
1129   shell
14   won&rsquo;t
146   run
13   my
257   new
5   program.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
7   Path
19   hashing
511   can
8   sometimes
15   produce
2   surprising
27   results
790   if
675   you
38   create
3088   a
16   newer
65   version
1307   in
252   your
213   current
319   directory
2059   of
3088   a
428   command
1061   that
55   already
9   exists
1307   in
55   another
2059   of
252   your
89   path
55   directories.
983   The
1129   shell
14   won&rsquo;t
22   know
18   you&rsquo;ve
58   done
1   this;
122   its
13   hash
380   will
66   still
199   only
190   list
6605   the
24   older
5   version.
103   To
1   overcome
320   this
1   problem,
270   use
93   either
6605   the
1   <tt>rehash</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>unhash</tt>
71   commands.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
1129   shell
14   won&rsquo;t
16   execute
62   commands
1307   in
6605   the
213   current
92   directory.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
150   You
44   need
3144   to
20   add
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
3144   to
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
103   directories
1307   in
6605   the
7   <tt>PATH</tt>
47   variable.
16   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>
80   always
6   checks
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
98   before
25   looking
1307   in
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
7   <tt>PATH</tt>
2   directories;
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
6   checks
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
199   only
790   if
102   it&rsquo;s
18   explicitly
23   listed
1307   in
6605   the
76   search
11   path.
181   This
1837   is
6   why
6605   the
37   standard
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
383   file
11   includes
3088   a
84   few
111   lines
277   at
6605   the
45   beginning
3144   to
20   add
6605   the
1   <tt>.</tt>,
3   <tt>bin</tt>
2223   and
2   <tt>samples</tt>
103   directories
3144   to
6605   the
89   path
790   if
21   they&rsquo;re
471   not
55   already
4   listed.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
1129   shell
4   keeps
92   running
6605   the
26   old
65   version
13   my
1129   shell
9   procedure.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
468   If
675   you
21   define
3088   a
1129   shell
72   procedure
920   with
4   <tt>proc</tt>
1307   in
3088   a
10   <tt>.csh</tt>
159   script
383   file
2223   and
189   then
16   execute
6605   the
24   script,
6605   the
72   procedure
1837   is
15   compiled
178   into
590   an
30   internal
32   form
26   that&rsquo;s
30   much
12   faster
3144   to
146   run
2223   and
102   it&rsquo;s
5   kept
45   around
1307   in
17   memory
3144   to
53   make
879   it
146   run
6605   the
71   next
96   time
115   even
6   faster.
468   If
675   you
78   change
6605   the
106   text
1307   in
6605   the
159   script
383   file
241   but
30   don&rsquo;t
18   explicitly
2   throw
7   away
6605   the
26   old
15   definition
191   using
1   <tt>unproc</tt>,
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
14   won&rsquo;t
22   know
102   it&rsquo;s
9   supposed
3144   to
1   recompile.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
1129   shell
14   won&rsquo;t
146   run
439   any
16   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>
30   internal
71   commands.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
11   Most
1   probably,
6605   the
1129   shell
1837   is
2   unable
3144   to
38   find
252   your
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
383   file
268   when
879   it
29   starts
71   up.
181   This
1837   is
6605   the
383   file
1061   that
131   should
13   hold
6605   the
31   aliases
6605   the
1129   shell
55   uses
3144   to
9   intercept
4   <tt>cmd.exe</tt>&rsquo;s
19   builtin
71   commands.
5   Check
3144   to
43   see
1061   that
252   your
2   <tt>HOME</tt>
243   variable
1837   is
436   set
3144   to
6605   the
319   directory
105   where
18   you&rsquo;ve
4   placed
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
2223   and
1061   that
252   your
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
383   file
14   isn&rsquo;t
1   garbled.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
7   <tt>copy</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>rename
1   *.*</tt>
37   doesn&rsquo;t
102   work
9   right.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
5   <tt>copy</tt>,
5   <tt>xcopy</tt>,
10   <tt>rename</tt>
2223   and
10   <tt>del</tt>
90   like
3144   to
176   do
32   their
51   own
45   wildcard
6   expansion.
103   To
53   make
72   them
102   work
1   sensibly,
924   be
10   sure
252   your
26   startup.csh
383   file
11   includes
2223   and
1061   that
675   you
270   use
6605   the
31   aliases
2223   and
72   procedure
9   definitions
40   we
2   supply
3144   to
9   intercept
94   these
62   commands
3144   to
28   turn
91   off
1129   shell
51   wildcarding
234   just
53   long
7   enough
3144   to
146   run
21   them.
30   These
9   definitions
511   can
190   also
2   serve
857   as
3088   a
1   model
790   if
675   you
2   discover
176   other
16   applications
1061   that
64   must
176   do
32   their
51   own
8   wildcarding.
111   For
207   more
2   information,
20   refer
3144   to
6605   the
4   discussion
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
3314   <a
1   href="10-Wildcarding.htm#XcopyProblem">wildcarding</a>
1   chapter.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
2   <tt>-!</tt>
192   option
37   doesn&rsquo;t
43   work.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
983   The
7   exclamation
39   point
1837   is
3088   a
94   special
172   character
1113   for
6605   the
55   shell.
983   The
1129   shell
30   lets
675   you
6   pick
157   up
106   text
94   out
2059   of
32   previous
62   commands
191   using
112   history
35   references
1061   that
22   begin
920   with
12   <tt>!</tt>
42   followed
588   by
3088   a
129   string
1061   that
21   tells
81   what
106   text
23   you&rsquo;re
1   retrieving.
103   To
23   avoid
25   having
590   an
7   exclamation
13   confused
857   as
3088   a
112   history
8   reference,
924   be
10   sure
6605   the
7   exclamation
1837   is
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
8   word,
113   so
6605   the
71   next
172   character
1837   is
3088   a
67   space
1041   or
3088   a
2   tab.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
2   <tt>grep
1   '^foo'</tt>
37   doesn&rsquo;t
43   work.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
983   The
5   circumflex
289   has
94   special
54   meaning
857   as
6605   the
121   escape
172   character
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
980   shell,
115   even
97   inside
17   quotes.
468   If
675   you
84   want
3144   to
28   pass
3088   a
44   literal
12   <tt>^</tt>
3144   to
6   <tt>grep</tt>
42   (or
41   anything
1   else)
640   from
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
675   you
64   must
84   type
5   <tt>^^</tt>
42   unless
6605   the
34   immediately
32   preceding
172   character
363   was
1   <tt>[</tt>.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
4   <tt>du</tt>,
6   <tt>pwd</tt>
2223   and
6   <tt>vol</tt>
5   waste
96   time
1   sitting
2223   and
1   spinning
268   when
104   they
11   hit
3088   a
4   removable
112   drive
26   that&rsquo;s
1   empty.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
468   If
675   you
299   have
3088   a
4   removable
16   media
19   device
176   other
171   than
1   <tt>A:</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>B:</tt>,
94   these
297   utilities
380   will
56   normally
47   try
3144   to
38   report
21   them.
14   That&rsquo;s
16   probably
471   not
675   you
4   want,
277   at
24   least
471   not
1   usually;
675   you
511   can
94   specify
234   just
6605   the
436   set
2059   of
55   drives
675   you
176   do
84   want
27   reported
191   using
6605   the
5   <tt>DRIVEMASK</tt>
90   environmental
47   variable.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
4   <tt>cd
1   /foo</tt>
37   doesn&rsquo;t
43   work.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
18   tries
3144   to
2   serve
17   users
8   coming
56   both
283   UNIX
2223   and
1   MS-DOS
1   backgrounds.
103   To
176   do
3   this,
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
364   all
6605   the
297   utilities
25   accept
428   command
372   line
65   options
31   starting
920   with
93   either
8   <tt>-</tt>
2   (UNIX-style)
1041   or
10   <tt>/</tt>
1   (DOS-style).
20   They
190   also
10   recognize
52   filenames
49   typed
920   with
93   either
15   forward
1041   or
10   backward
1   slashes.
106   When
675   you
84   type
1   <tt>cd&nbsp;/foo</tt>,
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
2   guesses
14   wrong
2223   and
3   thinks
23   you&rsquo;re
35   trying
3144   to
45   give
879   it
3088   a
428   command
372   line
192   option
1061   that
879   it
10   can&rsquo;t
1   recognize.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
468   If
320   this
1837   is
31   really
471   not
81   what
675   you
1   intend,
436   set
6605   the
6   <tt>SWITCHCHARS</tt>
90   environmental
243   variable
3144   to
234   just
6605   the
19   specific
197   characters
675   you
84   want
3   recognized.
20   E.g.,
675   you
55   might
26   include
320   this
1307   in
252   your
26   <tt>startup.csh</tt>
383   file
3144   to
58   cause
199   only
8   <tt>-</tt>
3144   to
924   be
1   recognized:
3   <tt>setenv
26   SWITCHCHARS
527   =
1   -</tt>.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
22   I
10   can&rsquo;t
436   set
13   my
51   own
204   screen
14   colors.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
3   Yes,
675   you
3   can.
58   But
675   you
29   cannot
176   do
879   it
234   just
588   by
4   embedding
22   ANSI
121   escape
39   sequences
178   into
252   your
52   prompt
30   since
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
380   will
34   immediately
7   reset
6605   the
197   colors
51   back
3144   to
81   what
879   it
3   thinks
104   they
131   should
2   be.
103   To
436   set
252   your
51   own
1   preferences
1113   for
204   screen
4   colors,
675   you
64   must
270   use
6605   the
5   <tt>COLORS</tt>
90   environmental
47   variable.
5   See
6605   the
11   chapter
883   on
2   customizing
6605   the
1129   shell
1041   or
6605   the
1   <tt>colors.csh</tt>
159   script
1307   in
6605   the
4   <tt>Samples</tt>
319   directory
1113   for
207   more
6   information.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
2   <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>Enter</kbd>
37   doesn&rsquo;t
102   work
3144   to
1   grab
62   commands
640   from
6605   the
112   history
39   list.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
2   <kbd>Alt</kbd>-<kbd>Enter</kbd>
1837   is
1   gobbled
157   up
588   by
6605   the
110   system
857   as
3088   a
3   keystroke
16   combination
281   used
3144   to
5   signal
1061   that
590   an
27   application
131   should
924   be
2   toggled
51   back
2223   and
2   forth
64   between
6605   the
18   desktop
2223   and
3088   a
2   full-screen
1   session.
35   Under
6605   the
94   these
5   systems,
22   you&rsquo;ll
299   have
3144   to
84   type
3   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>-<kbd>Shift</kbd>-<kbd>Enter</kbd>
10   instead.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
22   I
10   can&rsquo;t
45   wildcard
52   filenames
920   with
1   <tt>$</tt>'s,
42   spaces
1041   or
52   quotes
1307   in

1604   <p>
3   Yes,
675   you
3   can.
103   To

234   just
20   quote
1041   or
121   escape
6605   the

55   characters.

3144   to

6605   the
294   files
1061   that

920   with

1   <tt>^$*</tt>
1041   or
1   <tt>'$'*</tt>.
1679   </p>

446   <h3>
5   Problems
46   reading
1041   or

522   <h4>
22   I
22   know
15   there&rsquo;s
111   data
883   on
13   my
25   tape,
241   but
189   tar
1   acts
90   like
102   it&rsquo;s
2   blank.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
29   There
650   are
94   two
3   possibilities.
468   If
102   it&rsquo;s
3088   a
14   DAT
342   tape
675   you
2   wrote
1   yourself
883   on
320   this
122   same
9   machine,
42   (or
790   if
675   you
511   can
3   recreate
6605   the
33   problem
191   using
3088   a
342   tape
675   you
38   create
1   yourself),
102   it&rsquo;s
6   likely
252   your
112   drive
289   has
3088   a
10   firmware
85   bug
1307   in
122   its
243   variable
35   block
4   support.
1   (Variable
35   block
28   i/o
42   allows
189   tar
3144   to
125   read
3088   a
342   tape
63   without
3   knowing
81   what
45   blocksize
363   was
281   used
3144   to
60   write
6605   the
1   tape.)
983   The
18   workaround
1837   is
3144   to
125   read
6605   the
342   tape
191   using
6605   the
2   <tt>-V</tt>
192   option
3144   to
30   tell
189   tar
471   not
3144   to
270   use
243   variable
35   block
3   i/o.
468   If
6605   the
342   tape
3   wasn&rsquo;t
63   written
920   with
3088   a
37   standard
8   blocksize,
879   it
193   may
16   take
3088   a
95   while
68   longer
1113   for
189   tar
3144   to
2   figure
94   out
81   what
45   blocksize
363   was
281   used
4   (without
243   variable
45   blocksize
2   support,
879   it
289   has
3144   to
47   try
364   all
6605   the
1   possibilities),
241   but
277   at
24   least
879   it
380   will
43   work.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
983   The
33   second
9   possibility
1837   is
1061   that
6605   the
342   tape
363   was
63   written
920   with
8   hardware
10   compression
29   turned
6   on,
241   but
252   your
112   drive
37   doesn&rsquo;t
54   support
4   compression.
150   You
511   can
38   find
94   out
790   if
252   your
112   drive
16   supports
10   compression
191   using
6605   the
1   <tt>mt
1   status</tt>
47   command.
29   There
14   isn&rsquo;t
439   any
18   workaround
1113   for
46   reading
3088   a
342   tape
63   written
920   with
10   compression
883   on
3088   a
112   drive
1061   that
37   doesn&rsquo;t
54   support
4   it;
22   you&rsquo;ll
299   have
3144   to
6   rewrite
6605   the
342   tape
14   .
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
106   When
22   I
125   read
1041   or
60   write
3088   a
25   tape,
81   what
135   does
879   it
19   mean
790   if
101   some
2059   of
6605   the
294   files
650   are
23   listed
1307   in
1   yellow?
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
159   It
99   means
47   those
21   appear
3144   to
924   be
53   ASCII
106   text
294   files
2223   and
1061   that
189   tar
289   has
14   tried
3144   to
17   convert
6605   the
372   line
4   endings
64   between
6605   the
2   PC
22   convention
2059   of
3088   a
1   CarriageReturn-LineFeed
16   combination
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
197   each
372   line
2223   and
6605   the
283   UNIX
22   convention
2059   of
234   just
3088   a
110   single
1   LineFeed
37   character.
53   (The
4   assumption
1837   is
1061   that
30   since
6605   the
189   tar
59   format
1837   is
1   basically
3088   a
283   UNIX
4   standard,
294   files
1307   in
3088   a
189   tar
80   archive
131   should
13   follow
6605   the
283   UNIX
22   convention
241   but
924   be
18   stored
1307   in
6605   the
2   PC
22   convention
883   on
252   your
10   hard
1   disk.)
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
150   You
511   can
13   suppress
320   this
4   automatic
5   conversion
588   by
191   using
6   <tt>tar
1   -r</tt>.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
22   I
511   can
125   read
6605   the
21   tapes
22   I
1   create,
241   but
104   they
10   can&rsquo;t
125   read
72   them
883   on
32   their
9   machine.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
29   There
650   are
3088   a
8   couple
3   possibilities.
15   One
1837   is
1061   that
18   you&rsquo;ve
63   written
6605   the
342   tape
1307   in
6605   the
14   wrong
10   bytesex
1113   for
6605   the
176   other
22   machine
2223   and
6605   the
176   other
1837   is
1061   that
18   you&rsquo;ve
63   written
6605   the
342   tape
191   using
10   compression
2223   and
1061   that
6605   the
112   drive
883   on
6605   the
176   other
22   machine
37   doesn&rsquo;t
54   support
4   compression.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
32   By
117   default
189   tar
13   creates
21   tapes
1307   in
3   little-endian
13   format,
54   meaning
1061   that
268   when
879   it
25   writes
3088   a
5   16-bit
72   binary
165   number
883   on
6605   the
25   tape,
879   it
25   writes
6605   the
7   byte
920   with
6605   the
24   least
7   significant
1   byes
13   (the
20   little
2   end)
4   first.
16   Some
283   UNIX
1041   or
2   Linux
1   workstations
13   follow
6605   the
3   opposite
4   convention.
983   The
9   solution
1837   is
3144   to
60   write
21   tapes
1307   in
7   big-endian
59   format
191   using
6   <tt>tar
1   -bB</tt>.
58   But
790   if
26   that&rsquo;s
471   not
2   convenient,
6605   the
18   workaround
883   on
6605   the
283   UNIX
22   machine
1837   is
3144   to
125   read
6605   the
342   tape
191   using
6605   the
84   following
428   command
31   line,
105   where
1   tapedevice
7   refers
3144   to
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
342   tape
1   unit
883   on
1061   that
283   UNIX
2   machine:
1679   </p>
1   <tt>dd
1   conv=swab
49   &lt;
1   /dev/<var>tapedevice</var>
498   |
189   tar
1   xf
1   -</tt>
522   <h4>
41   Tar
3   complains
47   about
1   &ldquo;garbled
1   headers.&rdquo;
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
29   There
650   are
94   two
3   possibilities.
15   One
1837   is
1061   that
252   your
342   tape
289   has
3088   a
9   bad
2   spot.
983   The
176   other
1837   is
1061   that
252   your
80   archive
14   isn&rsquo;t
31   really
3088   a
189   tar
80   archive
277   at
7   all.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
106   When
46   reading
590   an
238   archive,
189   tar
9   expects
6605   the
111   data
3144   to
6   fit
3088   a
37   standard
3   layout
43   defined
588   by
6605   the
27   POSIX
3   standard.
45   Each
383   file
1307   in
6605   the
80   archive
1837   is
6   expected
3144   to
924   be
15   preceded
588   by
3088   a
5   512-byte
27   header
6   telling
6605   the
6   filename,
6605   the
2   timestamp,
38   etc.
45   Each
27   header
289   has
3088   a
9   checksum
113   so
189   tar
511   can
10   verify
6605   the
111   data
31   really
1837   is
1   good.
468   If
879   it
10   encounters
3088   a
27   header
1061   that
37   doesn&rsquo;t
6   fit
6605   the
4   standard,
189   tar
7   assumes
879   it
289   has
879   it
3088   a
9   bad
2   spot
1307   in
6605   the
24   archive.
58   But
46   rather
171   than
234   just
45   give
6   up,
189   tar
1   scans
27   down
109   through
6605   the
16   rest
2059   of
6605   the
238   archive,
1   byte-by-byte,
25   looking
1113   for
3088   a
257   new
27   header
1061   that
38   actually
1837   is
2   valid.
1679   </p>
1604   <p>
1   Tapes
176   do
6   occasionally
1   develop
9   bad
1   spots,
2223   and
320   this
5   ability
3144   to
4   scan
15   forward
511   can
924   be
1   invaluable
1307   in
2   retrieving
111   data
1061   that
19   otherwise
161   would
924   be
231   completely
8   lost.
58   But
790   if
6605   the
111   data
31   really
14   isn&rsquo;t
3088   a
189   tar
383   file
277   at
6   all,
189   then
5   scanning
10   ahead
1837   is
471   not
17   going
3144   to
2   achieve
11   anything.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
2   Why
10   can&rsquo;t
22   I
125   read
1041   or
60   write
3088   a
342   tape
126   under
841   Windows
1   9x?
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
841   Windows
17   9x
37   doesn&rsquo;t
54   support
6605   the
342   tape
3   backup
8   API
281   used
588   by
11   tar.
23   As
3088   a
1   consequence,
189   tar
289   has
227   no
90   way
2059   of
1   talking
3144   to
6605   the
342   tape
112   drive
126   under
841   Windows
7   9x.
983   The
199   only
1   solution,
790   if
675   you
44   need
342   tape
2   support,
1837   is
3144   to
2   upgrade
640   from
841   Windows
17   9x
3144   to
841   Windows
1   NT/2000/XP/Server.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
106   When
22   I
47   try
3144   to
125   read
3088   a
189   tar
25   tape,
189   tar
4   says
879   it
363   was
63   written
920   with
3088   a
58   different
45   blocksize
1041   or
1061   that
6605   the
45   blocksize
1837   is
12   larger
171   than
13   my
8   hardware
511   can
4   support.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
8   Very
1   likely,
23   you&rsquo;re
35   trying
3144   to
125   read
3088   a
14   DAT
342   tape
33   created
883   on
3088   a
1   Silicon
1   Graphics
9   machine.
261   A
11   lot
2059   of
5   SGI
16   machines
132   were
436   set
157   up
3144   to
60   write
21   tapes
920   with
3088   a
117   default
45   blocksize
2059   of
1   256K.
14   That&rsquo;s
30   much
12   larger
171   than
35   most
4   PC&rsquo;s
511   can
4   support.
11   Most
4   PC&rsquo;s
380   will
199   only
54   support
3088   a
14   maximum
45   blocksize
2059   of
47   about
1   64K;
4   PC&rsquo;s
191   using
3088   a
1   PCI
2   bus
380   will
19   go
3144   to
47   about
1   102K,
241   but
66   still
5   far
15   short
2059   of
81   what
5   SGI
1   uses.
983   The
18   workaround
1837   is
3144   to
6   rewrite
6605   the
342   tape
883   on
6605   the
5   SGI
191   using
3088   a
207   more
4   reasonable
7   blocksize.
150   You
511   can
176   do
320   this
191   using
6605   the
283   UNIX
6   <tt>tar
1   b</tt>
192   option
3144   to
94   specify
3088   a
6   smaller
1   &ldquo;blocking
1   factor.&rdquo;
5   (You
3   multiply
6605   the
283   UNIX
6   blocking
7   factor
588   by
13   512
3144   to
51   get
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
1   bytes/block.)
261   A
19   good
7   choice
1837   is
3088   a
6   blocking
7   factor
2059   of
1   20,
54   meaning
3088   a
2   10,240-byte
8   blocksize,
201   which
1   corresponds
3144   to
6605   the
27   POSIX
37   standard
1113   for
189   tar
4   tapes.
983   The
24   complete
428   command
372   line
883   on
6605   the
5   SGI
380   will
43   look
32   something
90   like
5   this:
1679   </p>
6   <tt>tar
1   cvb
8   20
1   <var>files-to-be-added-to-the-tape</var></tt>

446   <h3>
841   Windows
17   9x
2   problems<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="57-ProblemsWithTar.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="59-ReleaseNotes.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
1604   <p>
3   Yes,
1   really.
468   If
675   you
511   can
66   still
38   find
3088   a
60   copy
2059   of
841   Windows
6   9x,
19   our
15   latest
27   build
1113   for
841   Windows
28   7
131   should
66   still
146   run
883   on
61   it.
12   We
234   just
38   don't
3   recommend
61   it.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
6   close
3   button
37   doesn&rsquo;t
102   work
883   on
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
126   under
841   Windows
7   9x.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
243   Microsoft
289   has
1   acknowledged
1061   that
320   this
1837   is
3088   a
85   bug
1307   in
841   Windows
7   9x.
106   When
675   you
2   click
6605   the
6   close
3   button
1041   or
3   shutdown
6605   the
6   system,
364   all
43   console
16   applications
650   are
9   supposed
3144   to
51   get
3088   a
5   signal
6   telling
72   them
3144   to
7   exit.
841   Windows
81   NT
2   implements
320   this
1   correctly,
241   but
841   Windows
17   9x
135   does
10   not.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
50   whole
1930   C
1129   shell
66   window
3   fills
920   with
364   all
2   sorts
2059   of
15   random
2   colored
1   trash.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
181   This
1837   is
3088   a
10   known
841   Windows
17   9x
6   bug.
7   Not
364   all
44   possible
24   size
43   console
20   windows
102   work
9   right.
106   In
5   general,
199   only
1   25,
3   43
2223   and
1   50-line
20   windows
38   actually
43   work.
468   If
675   you
47   try
3144   to
436   set
590   an
19   arbitrary
24   size
66   window
32   (e.g.,
191   using
6605   the
9   setrows
1   utility),
3   chances
650   are
102   it&rsquo;s
471   not
17   going
3144   to
43   work.
15   One
2059   of
6605   the
8   failure
2   modes
1837   is
25   having
6605   the
50   whole
66   window
10   fill
920   with
15   random
2   colored
5   trash
55   characters.
29   There
1837   is
227   no
10   known
18   workaround
42   except
3144   to
436   set
6605   the
66   window
24   size
51   back
3144   to
3088   a
35   setting
1061   that
12   works.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
983   The
1930   C
1129   shell
37   doesn&rsquo;t
102   work
37   right
920   with
3088   a
6   scroll
16   bar
126   under
841   Windows
7   9x.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
181   This
1837   is
3088   a
10   known
841   Windows
17   9x
6   bug.
468   If
675   you
47   try
3144   to
436   set
6605   the
45   buffer
24   size
12   larger
171   than
6605   the
66   window
24   size
113   so
675   you
511   can
299   have
3088   a
6   scroll
16   bar
883   on
6605   the
1930   C
13   shell&rsquo;s
12   window,
3   chances
650   are
22   you&rsquo;ll
8   encounter
46   problems
28   such
857   as
471   not
25   having
6605   the
372   line
920   with
6605   the
17   cursor
4   pop
178   into
6605   the
66   window
268   when
675   you
6   type,
38   etc.
29   There
1837   is
227   no
10   known
18   workaround
42   except
3144   to
436   set
6605   the
45   buffer
24   size
51   back
3144   to
3088   a
35   setting
1061   that
12   works.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
106   When
22   I
60   write
3144   to
1   <tt>lpt1:</tt>
126   under
841   Windows
6   9x,
879   it
37   doesn&rsquo;t
43   work.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
181   This
19   appears
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
85   bug
1307   in
841   Windows
17   9x
1061   that
4   prevents
21   Win32
43   console
16   applications
640   from
56   writing
3144   to
6605   the
1   printer.
983   The
199   only
18   workaround
6   we&rsquo;ve
28   found
1837   is
3144   to
60   write
6605   the
111   data
3144   to
3088   a
383   file
883   on
14   disk,
189   then
270   use
6605   the
10   DOS
7   <tt>copy</tt>
428   command
3144   to
60   copy
1061   that
383   file
3144   to
1   <tt>lpt1:</tt>.
1679   </p>
522   <h4>
106   When
22   I
146   run
1   PKZip
640   from
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
126   under
841   Windows
6   9x,
22   I
30   don&rsquo;t
43   see
6605   the
19   output.
523   </h4>
1604   <p>
181   This
19   appears
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
85   bug
1307   in
841   Windows
17   9x
1061   that
4   affects
101   some
5   16-bit
6   applications.
983   The
18   workaround
6   we&rsquo;ve
28   found
1837   is
3144   to
270   use
590   an
164   alias
3144   to
14   invoke
2   pkzip
42   (or
1   pkunzip)
17   via
1   <tt>command.com</tt>:
1679   </p>
3   <tt>alias
2   pkzip
428   command
19   /c
1   pkzip</tt>
