790   if
675   you
4   attempted
3144   to
4   "cd
1   +c"
3144   to
271   one
2059   of
21   them.
199   That's
264   fixed.
213   Fix
211   Level
2   5.2.d
211   Changes:
1   880.
983   The
3   vectormath.csh
45   sample
159   script
289   has
382   been
41   added.
3   881.
261   A
85   bug
1061   that
96   caused
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
45   crash
2   randomly
268   when
3088   a
79   thread
2   exited,
96   caused
588   by
1   failing
3144   to
4   lock
3088   a
30   shared
39   variable,
289   has
382   been
264   fixed.
2   882.
261   A
85   bug
1061   that
96   caused
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
45   crash
790   if
590   an
77   argument
3144   to
3088   a
1   user-
43   defined
72   procedure

6605   the
122   same
152   name
857   as
3088   a
19   builtin
243   variable

382   been
264   fixed.

211   Level
1   5.2.e
211   Changes:
3   881.
468   If
3088   a
20   here
11   document
2   (using
1   &lt;&lt;)
24   contained
3088   a
39   substitution
15   plus
3088   a
20   left
1   bracket

588   by
3088   a

1   quote,
6605   the
48   result
24   contained
3088   a
12   spurious
4   circumflex.
199   That's
264   fixed.
213   Fix
211   Level
1   5.2.f
211   Changes:
2   882.

122   same
2   mistake
1061   that
96   caused
15   random
45   crash

79   thread
44   exit

271   one
4   place
1307   in

2   5.2.d

4   appeared
1307   in

176   other
1   places,
410   now
264   fixed.

211   Level
3   5.2.g

1   883.

29   -x

372   line

3144   to

2223   and

1837   is

3144   to

6605   the

1   884.

1   chasing
6605   the

2   described

3   881.
1   885.

2   samples.
1   Known
1   Bugs
2223   and
1   Limitations
35   1.
983   The
13   keyboard
57   editing
6   logic
199   only
6   checks
3144   to
43   see
790   if
6605   the
1   cursor's
382   been
7   moved
588   by
3088   a
65   background
70   process
1041   or
79   thread
268   when
879   it
26   reads
6605   the
281   first
3   keystroke.
39   That
1   catches
35   most
3   situations,
241   but
790   if
675   you
22   begin
19   typing
3088   a
428   command
2223   and
189   then
101   some
65   background
7   activity
29   starts
56   writing
3144   to
6605   the
204   screen
1041   or
6   moving
6605   the
1   cursor,
6605   the
48   result
511   can
924   be
3088   a
2   scrambled
2   display.
23   2.
1   Ctrl-S
2223   and
1   Ctrl-Q
2   flow
41   control
3144   to
6605   the
43   console
66   window
1837   is
471   not
11   supported.
22   3.
35   Under
841   Windows
231   7,
6605   the
26   32-bit
65   version
2059   of
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
20   can't
30   tell
268   when
3088   a
107   child
43   console
9   application,
95   e.g.,
225   su,
380   will
87   start
157   up
857   as
590   an
12   elevated
70   process
1307   in
3088   a
48   separate
29   window.
8   So
879   it
5   waits
1113   for
879   it
3144   to
24   complete
46   rather
171   than
37   automatically
3   prompting
1113   for
3088   a
257   new
47   command.
983   The
18   workaround
1837   is
3144   to
270   use
6605   the
29   &amp;
40   operator
3144   to
30   tell
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
146   run
879   it
857   as
3088   a
65   background
20   process.
17   4.
9   Long
13   Unicode
9   paths
32   (e.g.,
1   \\?\c:\Windows)
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
38   don't
51   get
73   passed
3144   to
107   child
30   processes
21   correctly
64   because
6605   the
51   wildcarding
58   done
588   by
6605   the
243   Microsoft
1   setargv
2223   and
1   wsetargv
7   library
18   routines
10   fails
790   if
6605   the
89   path
38   actually
2   exists;
879   it
49   works
790   if
6605   the
89   path
135   does
471   not
25   exist.
983   The
18   workaround
1837   is
3144   to
20   add
590   an
10   extra
3   backslash
3144   to
6605   the
7   front
2059   of
6605   the
11   path.

2   unsatisfactory

439   any
8   way,

2   purchase
2223   and

6   why
6605   the

2   unsatisfactory

1   refund.

51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
5   Dump
6605   the
1   argv[]
2223   and
1   envp[]
28   lists
73   passed
3144   to
6605   the
5   program.
52   */
51   /*

65   (c)
8   1989-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
6   /***************************************************************************/
20   #include
5   &lt;stdio.h&gt;
20   #include
6   &lt;stdlib.h&gt;
20   #include
3   "<a
3   href="internat.htm">internat.h</a>"
6   void
4   cdecl
230   main
84   (
12   int
6   argc,
23   char
2   *argv[],
23   char
2   *envp[]
210   )
34   {
12   int
8   i;
3   Internationalize();
6   printf
1   ("argc
527   =
1   %d\n",
1   argc);
1113   for
11   (i
527   =
10   0;
109   i
49   &lt;
3   argc;
6   i++)
6   printf
1   ("argv[%d]
527   =
2   '%s'\n",
22   i,
4   argv[i]);
1113   for
11   (i
527   =
10   0;
3   envp[i];
6   i++)
6   printf
1   ("envp[%d]
527   =
2   '%s'\n",
22   i,
3   envp[i]);
3   exit(0);
49   }

851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
12   Find
6605   the
4   average
2059   of
439   any
25   numeric
45   values
1307   in
3088   a
39   list.
468   If
12   none
2059   of
6605   the
597   #
13   elements
650   are
6   numeric,
159   return
16   0.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1996-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   average(
45   values
210   )
94   local
22   i,
5   j,
49   n
284   @
44   j
527   =
120   0
284   @
49   n
527   =
120   0
790   if
3   ($#values)
189   then
1113   for
109   i
527   =
120   0
3144   to
5   $#values
91   -
214   1
176   do
790   if
3   (isnumber(values[i]))
189   then
284   @
44   j
14   +=
7   values[i]
284   @
1   n++
412   end
412   end
790   if
1   (n)
284   @
44   j
11   /=
49   n
412   end
159   return
44   j
412   end
4   average
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

446   <h3>
1   basename.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="average.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="bits.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
6   Emulate
6605   the
27   POSIX
4   basename
428   command
3144   to
17   extract
234   just
6605   the
77   last
4   component
597   #
2059   of
3088   a
5   pathname,
5   deleting
439   any
2   suffix,
790   if
25   specified.
597   #
91   Usage:
4   basename
129   string
99   [
3   suffix
93   ]
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1996-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   basename(
13   string,
3   suffix
210   )
94   local
1   base,
22   i,
44   j
790   if
84   (
2   $#string
69   ==
120   0
210   )
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
2   basename:
29   No
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
25   specified.
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
159   return
412   end
790   if
84   (
2   $#string
49   &gt;
214   1
210   )
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
2   basename:
15   Only
271   one
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
131   should
924   be
25   specified.
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
412   end
284   @
6   base
527   =
1   $string:t
790   if
1   (base
69   ==
7   "")
284   @
6   base
527   =
4   "\"
790   if
1   (suffix
69   ==
12   ""
32   &amp;&amp;
3   suffix
28   !=
1   base)
159   return
6   base
284   @
109   i
527   =
1   strlen(base)
284   @
44   j
527   =
1   strlen(suffix)
159   return
109   i
49   &gt;
44   j
32   &amp;&amp;
1   lower(substr(base,
109   i
91   -
44   j
117   +
7   1))
69   ==
1   lower(suffix)
13   ?
34   ^
1   substr(base,
32   1,
109   i
91   -
3   j)
53   :
6   base
412   end
4   basename
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>

993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   Calculate
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
15   bits
24   required
3144   to
2   represent
3088   a
25   numeric
105   value
857   as
597   #
590   an
12   integer.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1989-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   bits(
49   n
210   )
159   return
1   ceil(log2
3   (n
117   +
7   1))
412   end
15   bits
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

446   <h3>
1   blksize.c<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="bits.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="bumpdate.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
6   <pre><tt>/***************************************************************************/
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
24   Read
640   from
2   Stdin,
18   Write
3144   to
2   Stdout,
191   using
152   specified
1   Blocksize
52   */
51   /*
64   Copyright
65   (c)
6   1994-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
6   /***************************************************************************/
51   /*
1   blksize.c:
1   Accepts
234   just
271   one
1   (optional)
8   argument,
6605   the
45   blocksize
2   desired,
1307   in
10   bytes.
52   */
20   #include
4   &lt;windows.h&gt;
20   #include
6   &lt;stdlib.h&gt;
6   void
2   main(
12   int
6   argc,
23   char
2   **argv
210   )
34   {
2   HANDLE
4   Stdin
527   =
1   GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE),
8   Stdout
527   =
2   GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
23   char
1   *buffer,
2   *p;
5   DWORD
7   length,
8   blocksize,
2   remaining;
1   SYSTEM_INFO
1   sysinfo;
51   /*
11   First
8   arg
1837   is
7   blocksize.
468   If
3   missing,
117   default
3144   to
13   512
10   bytes.
52   */
45   blocksize
527   =
2   argc
49   &gt;
214   1
13   ?
1   atoi(argv[1])
53   :
1   512;
51   /*
1   Allocate
6605   the
5   buffer,
3   ensuring
1061   that
102   it's
2   page-aligned
113   so
40   we
12   won't
299   have
46   problems
21   doing
28   i/o
3   to/from
3088   a
19   device
28   such
857   as
3088   a
342   tape
1041   or
7   diskette.
52   */
1   GetSystemInfo(&amp;sysinfo);
45   buffer
527   =
1   (char
1   *)(((ULONG)malloc(blocksize
117   +
2   sysinfo.dwPageSize)
117   +
2   sysinfo.dwPageSize)
29   &amp;
1   ~(sysinfo.dwPageSize
91   -
1   1));
95   while
1   (ReadFile(Stdin,
5   buffer,
8   blocksize,
3   &amp;length,
2   NULL)
32   &amp;&amp;
5   length)
34   {
790   if
2   (remaining
527   =
45   blocksize
91   -
5   length)
34   {
51   /*
1   Apparently
46   reading
640   from
3088   a
21   pipe
1041   or
6605   the
43   console
2223   and
9   getting
13   less
171   than
3088   a
31   full
45   blocksize
165   number
2059   of
55   characters.
1   Keep
46   reading
42   until
40   we
299   have
7   enough
3144   to
1113   for
3088   a
50   whole
45   blocksize
3144   to
64   output
42   (or
42   until
1   End-Of-File).
52   */
32   p
527   =
45   buffer
117   +
4   length;
95   while
2   (remaining
32   &amp;&amp;
1   ReadFile(Stdin,
17   p,
2   remaining,
3   &amp;length,
2   NULL)
32   &amp;&amp;
5   length)
34   {
10   remaining
6   -=
4   length;
32   p
14   +=
4   length;
49   }
38   length
527   =
45   blocksize
91   -
2   remaining;
49   }
6   WriteFile(Stdout,
5   buffer,
7   length,
3   &amp;length,
6   NULL);
49   }
1   CloseHandle(Stdin);
1   CloseHandle(Stdout);
2   ExitProcess(0);
49   }
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

446   <h3>
1   bumpdate.csh<br/>

2   href="blksize.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   Calculate
6605   the
37   date
49   n
165   number
14   days
15   forward
1041   or
10   backward
640   from
3088   a
91   given
12   date.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
6   1991-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   bumpdate(bump,
7   month,
7   day,
6   year)
94   local
15   d
284   @
15   d
527   =
4   `julian
2   $month
4   $day
1   $year`
117   +
3   bump
159   return
1   `caldate
1   $d`
412   end
2   bumpdate
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

6605   the
16   calendar

3088   a

6605   the

3   algorithms

1307   in

6605   the
28   day

3088   a

1113   for
6605   the

26   month

284   @

7   (month

1   Sat^r^n"

12   week
527   =
6   concat(week,
11   "
1   ")
412   end
597   #
27   Print
364   all
6605   the
14   days
284   @
109   i
527   =
214   1
790   if
1   (b_date
69   ==
1   2299156)
189   then
597   #
106   In
9   October
1   1582,
6605   the
10   Julian
16   calendar
363   was
12   replaced
920   with
6605   the
597   #
6   Gregorian
16   calendar
2223   and
4   Oct

363   was
34   immediately
42   followed
588   by
4   Oct
4   15
597   #
588   by
1   decree
2059   of
2   Pope
1   Gregory
1   XIII.

924   be
3   aware
1061   that
1   Britain
597   #
21   did

1   adopt
6605   the
6   Gregorian
16   calendar
42   until
2   Sept
3   2,
1   1752
12   (which
597   #
363   was
42   followed
588   by
2   Sept
1   14.)
181   This
15   routine
35   prints
3088   a
16   calendar
10   according
597   #
3144   to
2   Pope
1   Gregory's
1   decree.
1113   for
2   c_date
527   =
2   b_date
3144   to
5   e_date
176   do
284   @
12   week
527   =
6   concat(week,
3   printf("%3d
4   ",
2   i++))
790   if
11   (i
69   ==
2   5)
284   @
109   i
527   =
4   15
790   if
2   (c_date
28   !=
5   e_date
32   &amp;&amp;
2   ++day
60   %
28   7
69   ==
4   6)
284   @
12   week
527   =
6   concat(week,
2   "^r^n")
412   end
56   else
1113   for
2   c_date
527   =
2   b_date
3144   to
5   e_date
176   do
284   @
12   week
527   =
1   (today
69   ==
1   c_date)
13   ?
34   ^
6   concat(week,
1   ansi("bright
1   yellow"),
34   ^
3   printf("%3d
4   ",
1   i++),
1   ansi())
53   :
34   ^
6   concat(week,
3   printf("%3d
4   ",
2   i++))
790   if
2   (c_date
28   !=
5   e_date
32   &amp;&amp;
2   ++day
60   %
28   7
69   ==
4   6)
284   @
12   week
527   =
6   concat(week,
2   "^r^n")
412   end
412   end
90   calc
12   week
296   echo
412   end
16   calendar
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

5   Customize
6605   the
204   screen
14   colors.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
6   1991-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
181   This
159   script
10   shows
675   you
91   how
3144   to
7   customize
6605   the
204   screen
197   colors
281   used
588   by
597   #
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
122   its
22   utilities.
150   You
55   might
234   just
270   use
3088   a
159   script
90   like
597   #
320   this
1113   for
9   changing
252   your
4   colors,
4   perhaps
6   calling
879   it
640   from
252   your
17   login.csh
597   #
1041   or
675   you
55   might
8   embed
94   these
46   color
18   settings
11   directly
178   into
252   your
17   login.csh
597   #
1041   or
1   (after
6   rewriting
72   them
857   as
1   SET
1   statements)
178   into
252   your
1   config.sys.
597   #
30   These
650   are
6605   the
90   environmental
111   variables
2   controlling
204   screen
1   colors:
597   #
22   Name
39   Use
47   Default
597   #
7   ADDITIONS
15   Lines
104   added
28   found
588   by
3   diff.
31   Bright
18   White
883   on
19   Green
597   #
26   COLORS
13   Normal
204   screen
197   colors
18   White
883   on
3   Blue
597   #
7   DELETIONS
15   Lines
16   deleted
28   found
588   by
3   diff.
31   Bright
18   White
883   on
16   Red
597   #
12   DIRECTORIES
23   Directories
23   listed
588   by
3   ls.
31   Bright
597   #
3   DUPLICATES
106   When
320   filename
46   completion
33   matches
19   Green
597   #
207   more
171   than
271   one
32   name.
597   #
5   FOREIGNFILES
3   Filetypes
1061   that
299   have
227   no
2   counterpart
31   Bright
16   Red
597   #
883   on
5   OS/2.
597   #
12   HIGHLIGHT
18   Current
83   disk
1041   or
92   directory.
31   Bright
597   #
3   MATCHFAIL
106   When
320   filename
1041   or
428   command
46   completion
31   Bright
16   Red
597   #
28   doesn't
65   match
11   anything.
597   #
7   MOREEOF
97   End
1041   or
8   Top
2059   of
25   File
1307   in
8   more.
19   Green
597   #
7   MOREERROR
5   Unrecognizable
428   command
3144   to
8   more.
31   Bright
18   White
883   on
16   Red
597   #
7   MOREFILLIN
19   User
9   response
3144   to
207   more
9   prompt.
5   Black
597   #
6   MOREPROMPT
8   Prompt
372   line
1307   in
8   more.
16   Red
883   on
18   White
597   #
4   MORETOPMEM
8   Top
2059   of
5   Memory
63   message
640   from
8   more.
31   Bright
6   Yellow
597   #
8   SYSTEMDIRS
23   Directories
920   with
6605   the
22   System
49   bit
18   on.
31   Bright
19   Green
597   #
7   SYSTEMFILES
29   Files
920   with
6605   the
22   System
49   bit
18   on.
19   Green
597   #
983   The
197   colors
16   available
1307   in
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
597   #
8   magenta
42   (or
19   blue
1   red),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
2223   and
8   white.
12   Foreground
197   colors
597   #
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
10   dim,
3   blink
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
8   keyword
1   "on"
5   introduces
597   #
65   background
14   colors.
113   All
6605   the
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
15   along
920   with
6605   the
6   keywords
597   #
16   bright,
10   dim,
1   blink,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on

924   be
1307   in
3   upper,
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
597   #
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
90   environmental
111   variables
64   must
924   be
364   all
1307   in
21   upper
43   case.
597   #
1   (Blink

11   true
3   blinking
199   only
3   full-screen;
1307   in
3088   a

446   <h3>
1   decimal.csh<br/>

2   href="colors.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
4   Evaluate
3088   a
129   string
857   as
3088   a
27   decimal
16   number.
597   #
597   #
1   Overcome
6605   the
21   shell's
12   usual
3   interpretation
2059   of
3088   a
129   string
920   with
17   leading
597   #
2   zeroes
857   as
590   an
15   octal
15   number,
1   forcing,
95   e.g.,
1   0170
3144   to
13   evaluate
857   as
1   170,
597   #
471   not
2   120.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
2   2001-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   decimal(x)
94   local
22   i,
44   j
1113   for
109   i
527   =
214   1
3144   to
1   strlen(x)
176   do
284   @
44   j
527   =
1   substr
1   (x,
2   i)
790   if
6   (j
19   =~
1   '[1-9]*'
32   &amp;&amp;
1   isnumber(j))
159   return
44   j
117   +
120   0
412   end
159   return
120   0
412   end
27   decimal
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

1   deltahrs.csh<br/>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   Calculate
6605   the
13   difference
1307   in
11   hours
2223   and
2   fractions
2059   of
590   an
3   hour
64   between
597   #
94   two
4   times,
91   given
1307   in
11   hours
2223   and
3   minutes.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
1   2009-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
3   minutes(
7   t
210   )
159   return
84   (
7   t
91   -
3   floor(
7   t
210   )
210   )
41   *
16   100
412   end
110   proc
1   deltahrs(
1   begin,
412   end
210   )
94   local
1   delta,
8   hours,
4   mins
436   set
22   begin
527   =
1   $begin:S/:/./
436   set
412   end
527   =
1   $end:S/:/./
790   if
84   (
412   end
49   &lt;
22   begin
210   )
189   then
284   @
412   end
14   +=
19   12
412   end
284   @
11   hours
527   =
3   floor(
412   end
210   )
91   -
3   floor(
22   begin
210   )
284   @
4   mins
527   =
3   minutes(
412   end
210   )
91   -
3   minutes(
22   begin
210   )
790   if
84   (
4   mins
49   &lt;
120   0
210   )
189   then
284   @
1   hours--
284   @
4   mins
14   +=
3   60
412   end
159   return
11   hours
117   +
1   mins/60
412   end
1   deltahrs
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>

993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
6   Emulate
6605   the
27   POSIX
4   dirname
428   command
3144   to
17   extract
364   all
241   but
6605   the
77   last
22   level
597   #
2059   of
3088   a
5   pathname.
597   #
91   Usage:
4   dirname
129   string
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1996-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   dirname(
129   string
210   )
790   if
1   (string
28   !=
7   "")
189   then
94   local
1   dir,
22   i,
44   j
284   @
16   dir
527   =
1   $string:h
1113   for
109   i
527   =
1   strlen(dir)
588   by
4   -1
3144   to
214   1
176   do
284   @
44   j
527   =
1   substr(dir,
22   i,
17   1)
790   if
6   (j
28   !=
4   '/'
32   &amp;&amp;
44   j
28   !=
3   '\')
38   break
412   end
790   if
6   (j
69   ==
4   '/'
18   ||
44   j
69   ==
3   '\')
189   then
284   @
16   dir
527   =
1   '\'
56   else
790   if
6   (j
69   ==
4   ':'
32   &amp;&amp;
109   i
69   ==
7   2)
284   @
16   dir
527   =
1   concat(substr(dir,
32   1,
1   2),
3   '\')
412   end
159   return
16   dir
56   else
159   return
14   "."
412   end
412   end
4   dirname
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   dumpenv.c<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="dirname.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="duplicat.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
6   <pre><tt>/***************************************************************************/
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
5   Dump
6605   the
213   current
1   environmentals
857   as
99   setenv
7   statements.
52   */
51   /*
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1989-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
6   /***************************************************************************/
20   #include
5   &lt;stdio.h&gt;
20   #include
2   &lt;string.h&gt;
20   #include
6   &lt;stdlib.h&gt;
51   /*
181   This
20   little
69   utility
380   will
9   dump
94   out
252   your
90   environmental
111   variables
1307   in
3088   a
32   form
1061   that
511   can
924   be
13   executed
1307   in
3088   a
17   login.csh
96   file.
159   It
20   looks
1113   for
439   any
197   characters
1061   that
44   need
5   enclosing
110   single
52   quotes
2223   and
55   uses
6605   the
28   individual
15   escapesym
172   character
1   (assumed
3144   to
924   be
1   '^')
3144   to
121   escape
439   any
1061   that
7   require
207   more
171   than
234   just
110   single
17   quotes.
1   (escapesym
1   chars,
13   assumed
3144   to
924   be
1   '^',
650   are
471   not
6   further
1   quoted;
40   we
8   assume
790   if
320   this
2   appears,
102   it's
16   probably
7   meant
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
20   quote
2059   of
6605   the
71   next
2   character.)
106   When
879   it
25   writes
94   out
6605   the
12   PATH
39   variable,
879   it
3   inserts
1   ".;",
7   representing
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
3144   to
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
6605   the
129   string
790   if
102   it's
471   not
55   already
6   there.
181   This
1837   is
3088   a
1   convenience
1307   in
11   converting
640   from
1   cmd.exe's
22   convention
2059   of
80   always
35   trying
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
281   first
3144   to
1   csh.exe's
2059   of
35   trying
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
199   only
790   if
675   you
94   specify
61   it.
5   (You
511   can
3   conditionally
1   compile-out
320   this
192   option
588   by
1   #defining
1   TruePATH.)
52   */
23   char
1   chars_needing_quotes[]
527   =
1   "!\n\r'\"`
1   &amp;|;&lt;&gt;()*?{}[]~$";
6   void
4   cdecl
230   main
84   (
12   int
6   argc,
23   char
2   *argv[],
23   char
2   *envp[]
210   )
34   {
4   register
23   char
1   *e;
12   int
8   i;
1113   for
11   (i
527   =
10   0;
3   envp[i];
6   i++)
34   {
1113   for
1   (e
527   =
3   envp[i];
2   *e
32   &amp;&amp;
1   !strchr(chars_needing_quotes,
1   *e);
1   e++)
30   ;
790   if
2   (*e)
34   {
51   /*
2   Enclose
6605   the
105   value
1307   in
17   quotes.
52   */
10   e
527   =
1   strchr(envp[i],
1   '=');
2   *e
527   =
1   '\0';
6   printf
2   ("setenv
1   %s='",
3   envp[i]);
597   #
1   ifndef
1   TruePATH
790   if
1   (strcmp(envp[i],
1   "PATH")
69   ==
120   0
32   &amp;&amp;
1   (e[1]
28   !=
1   '.'
18   ||
1   e[2]
28   !=
1   ';'))
34   {
51   /*
12   PATH
243   variable
28   doesn't
55   already
87   start
920   with
1   ".;"
52   */
1   putchar('.');
1   putchar(';');
49   }
597   #
7   endif
95   while
1   (*++e)
18   switch
2   (*e)
34   {
97   case
1   '!':
97   case
1   '"':
97   case
1   '\'':
97   case
1   '`':
3   putchar('^');
2   putchar(*e);
3   break;
97   case
1   '\n':
3   putchar('^');
1   putchar('n');
3   break;
97   case
1   '\r':
3   putchar('^');
1   putchar('r');
3   break;
9   default:
2   putchar(*e);
49   }
1   fputs("'\n",
1   stdout);
49   }
56   else
51   /*
17   Ignore
6605   the
9   possibility
2059   of
3088   a
12   PATH
243   variable
1061   that
147   didn't
299   have
277   at
24   least
271   one
2   semicolon.
52   */
6   printf
2   ("setenv
1   %s\n",
3   envp[i]);
49   }
3   exit(0);
49   }
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

446   <h3>
1   duplicat.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="dumpenv.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="e2a.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
6   Look
1113   for
5   duplicate
294   files
19   anywhere
1307   in
3088   a
319   directory
7   tree.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
4   1990-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
159   It
49   works
588   by
281   first
2   constructing
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
89   path
5   names,
271   one
26   per
31   line,
597   #
2059   of
26   everything
1307   in
6605   the
3   tree
191   using
6605   the
29   -r
3   (recursive)
192   option
2059   of
3   ls.
983   The
597   #
5   ``...``
33   part
1837   is
428   command
39   substitution
3144   to
26   paste
6605   the
27   results
178   into
6605   the
33   foreach
597   #
5   loop,
197   each
372   line
2059   of
64   output
25   taken
857   as
3088   a
110   single
25   word.
84   (This
8   way,
879   it
49   works
115   even
597   #
883   on
52   filenames
50   containing
42   spaces
2223   and
94   special
4   characters.)
983   The
1   :gt
40   operator
597   #
99   means
3   globally
29   edit
6605   the
190   list
3144   to
1   trim
197   each
37   pathname
27   down
3144   to
234   just
6605   the
18   tail
597   #
1   part;
95   e.g.,
91   given
1   "x\y\z.c",
6605   the
18   tail
1837   is
234   just
1   "z.c".
2   (There
650   are
176   other
597   #
37   pathname
57   editing
44   operators
1113   for
2   grabbing
234   just
6605   the
319   directory
1   containing,
597   #
26   everything
42   except
6605   the
7   extension,
6605   the
6   fully-qualified
152   name
1113   for
3088   a
10   relative
597   #
5   pathname,
9   etc.)
597   #
597   #
983   The
33   foreach
23   loop
25   writes
197   each
152   name
94   out
3144   to
6605   the
3   pipe,
271   one
26   per
75   line.
1   (I've
281   used
597   #
3088   a
90   calc
94   statement
46   rather
171   than
590   an
296   echo
1307   in
97   case
3088   a
320   filename
11   includes
94   special
597   #
4   characters.)
983   The
32   sort
7   puts
364   all
6605   the
111   lines
178   into
1   alphabetical
25   order
2223   and
6605   the
597   #
6605   the
11   uniq
39   -d
428   command
24   gives
234   just
6605   the
2   duplicates.
110   proc
1   duplicat(startdir)
94   local
109   i
33   foreach
109   i
6   (``ls
1   -1r
1   $startdir``:gt)
90   calc
8   i;
412   end
498   |
32   sort
498   |
11   uniq
39   -d
412   end
1   duplicat
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

436   <small><a
2   href="dumpenv.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="e2a.htm">Next</a></small>

29   Calculate
268   when

7   b,

5   d,
3   e,
3   f,
1   g,
1   h,

9   May

284   @

1   1583)

597   #

1   factor.csh<br/>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   Calculate
6605   the
1   prime
2   factors
2059   of
590   an
12   integer.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1989-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   factor(n)
790   if
3   (n
49   &gt;
7   3)
189   then
1113   for
109   i
527   =
102   2
3144   to
1   floor(sqrt(n))
176   do
790   if
3   (n
60   %
109   i
69   ==
10   0)
189   then
296   echo
26   $i
159   return
1   factor(n//i)
412   end
412   end
412   end
159   return
49   n
412   end
7   factor
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

446   <h3>
1   findinclude.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="finance.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="fixup.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
10   Search
6605   the
6   INCLUDE
103   directories
1113   for
6605   the
152   specified
27   header
96   file.
597   #
111   For
25   example:
597   #
597   #
3   9
64   C%
4   findinclude.csh
1   winnt.h
597   #
2   C:\Program
2   Files\Microsoft
1   SDKs\Windows\v6.0A\include\winnt.h
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
2   2011-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
2   findinclude(
1   includefile
210   )
597   #
7   Split
6605   the
15   raw
6   INCLUDE
243   variable
178   into
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
12   directories,
597   #
271   one
26   per
372   line
191   using
1   splitstring,
189   then
4   iterate
53   over
6605   the
597   #
190   list
191   using
4   ``
57   ...
4   ``
3144   to
125   read
50   whole
111   lines
857   as
27   words.
33   foreach
109   i
84   (
1   ``splitstring
2   $INCLUDE
1   ";"``
210   )
597   #
5   Check
3144   to
43   see
790   if
6605   the
3   desired
27   header
383   file
9   exists
1307   in
597   #
320   this
6   INCLUDE
92   directory.
790   if
84   (
34   -e
2   $i\$includefile
210   )
296   echo
2   $i\$includefile
412   end
412   end
284   @
2   findinclude(
18   argv
210   )
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

446   <h3>
1   fixup.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="findinclude.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="internat.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
13   Fixup
51   source
294   files
3144   to
16   discard
439   any
3   extraneous
19   tabs
1041   or
42   spaces
277   at
6605   the
597   #
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
11   lines,
3144   to
17   ensure
1061   that
364   all
111   lines
412   end
88   properly
920   with
22   \r\n
597   #
2223   and
3144   to
17   ensure
1061   that
19   timestamp
511   can
924   be
3   represented
21   exactly
883   on
3088   a
18   FAT
597   #
1041   or
10   HPFS
8   partition.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
6   1994-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   fixup(
294   files
210   )
94   local
22   i,
1   ts,
2   tf
33   foreach
109   i
1   ($files)
790   if
9   (-e
5   $i)
189   then
436   set
3   ts
527   =
1   `timestmp
2   $i`
597   #
3   Construct
3088   a
6   temporary
152   name
588   by
9   pasting
6605   the
1   seconds+hundredths
597   #
50   onto
6605   the
23   root
2059   of
6605   the
96   file.
436   set
2   tf
527   =
1   $i:r.$substr(`date`:4,8):s/.//
15   tr
45   -n
49   &lt;
26   $i
498   |
51   sed
1   's/^[
7   ][
1   ]*$//'
49   &gt;
3   $tf
14   touch
18   -2
1   $ts
3   $tf
19   mv
3   $tf
26   $i
56   else
296   echo
26   $i
135   does
471   not
25   exist.
412   end
412   end
412   end
6   fixup
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

6605   the

6605   the

6605   the

1   ASCII_CodePage
2   437
597   #
21   define
2   Internationalize()
790   if
1   (GetOEMCP()
28   !=

11   \

446   <h3>
1   julian.csh<br/>

2   href="internat.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   Calculate
6605   the
10   Julian
28   day
165   number
1113   for
6605   the
152   specified
12   date.
597   #
3   Based
883   on
3   algorithms
3   published
1307   in
3   Computer
7   Language
3   magazine,
597   #
3   December,
3   1990.
26   Used
920   with
3   permission.
110   proc
2   julian(month,
7   day,
6   year)
597   #
983   The
10   Julian
28   day
165   number
1837   is
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
14   days
64   between
1   noon
2   GMT
597   #
5   Jan
32   1,
4   4713
3   BC
2223   and
1061   that
12   date.
1   (Years
2   B.C.
650   are
1   negative.)
94   local
32   a,
7   b,
1   year_corr,
4   Month,
109   i
436   set
2   Month
527   =
8   January
4   February
9   March
4   April
9   May
4   June
34   ^
7   July
4   August
5   September
9   October
4   November
5   December
790   if
6   (year
69   ==
6   '')
189   then
94   local
6   dt
436   set
6   dt
527   =
2   `dt`
284   @
24   year
527   =
2   $dt:3
790   if
1   (day
69   ==
6   '')
189   then
284   @
28   day
527   =
26   month
69   ==
4   ''
13   ?
2   $dt:2
53   :
26   month
284   @
26   month
527   =
2   $dt:1
412   end
412   end
790   if
7   (month
10   !~
2   '[0-9]*')
189   then
284   @
26   month
527   =
2   "$lower(month)*"
1113   for
109   i
527   =
120   0
3144   to
6   11
176   do
790   if
2   (lower(Month[i])
19   =~
1   month)
38   break
412   end
284   @
26   month
527   =
109   i
117   +
214   1
412   end
790   if
7   (month
49   &lt;
214   1
18   ||
26   month
49   &gt;
19   12
18   ||
24   year
49   &lt;
1   -4713
18   ||
24   year
49   &gt;
1   2900)
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
1   julian:
1   Invalid
7   Date
159   return
4   -1
412   end
597   #
1   Correct
1113   for
4   negative
6   year.
790   if
6   (year
49   &lt;
10   0)
189   then
284   @
1   year++
284   @
2   year_corr
527   =
214   1
284   @
89   b
527   =
214   1
56   else
284   @
2   year_corr
527   =
89   b
527   =
120   0
412   end
790   if
7   (month
6   &lt;=
7   2)
189   then
284   @
2   year--
284   @
26   month
14   +=
19   12
412   end
597   #
3   Cope
920   with
6605   the
6   Gregorian
16   calendar
1   reform
790   if
6   (year
41   *
1   10000
117   +
26   month
41   *
16   100
117   +
28   day
49   &gt;
1   15821015)
189   then
284   @
3088   a
527   =
1   year//100
284   @
89   b
527   =
102   2
91   -
3088   a
117   +
1   a//4
412   end
284   @
3088   a
527   =
3   floor(365.25
41   *
24   year
91   -
1   year_corr)
117   +
34   ^
3   floor(30.6001
41   *
7   (month
117   +
7   1))
117   +
28   day
117   +
1   1720994
117   +
89   b
597   #
4   4713
3   BC
363   was
471   not
3088   a
2   leap
6   year.
790   if
11   (a
49   &lt;
1   59)
284   @
1   a++
159   return
3088   a
412   end
1   julian
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>

3144   to

8   pretty

1307   in

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
1   "Make"
6605   the
29   c
12   programs
1307   in
320   this
92   directory.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1989-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
13   Just
16   discard
439   any
18   wildcards
1061   that
38   don't
15   produce
20   matches.
436   set
11   nonomatch
527   =
102   2
110   proc
1   make(cfile)
597   #
53   make
9   (i.e.,
1   recompile)
3088   a
91   given
3   .c
383   file
790   if
597   #
11   a)
19   there's
227   no
33   corresponding
5   .exe,
1041   or
597   #
17   b)
6605   the
7   .exe
1837   is
24   older
171   than
6605   the
3   .c
383   file
1041   or
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
2   .h
8   headers
8   (if
597   #
87   there
650   are
1   any).
436   set
23   root
527   =
1   $cfile:r
790   if
11   (!
34   -e
2   $root.exe
18   ||
15   !
2   `newer
2   $root.exe
26   $i
1   *.h`)
189   then
5   cl
1   -debug:none
1   -Dcdecl=
1   $cfile
1   user32.lib
27   rm
1   $root.obj
412   end
412   end
33   foreach
109   i
1   (*.c)
53   make
26   $i
412   end
160   </tt></pre>

58   <pre><tt>#
12   Find
6605   the
14   maximum
25   numeric
105   value
94   out
2059   of
3088   a
39   list.
468   If
12   none
2059   of
6605   the
13   elements
597   #
650   are
6   numeric,
159   return
16   0.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1996-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   max(
45   values
210   )
94   local
22   i,
44   j
284   @
44   j
527   =
120   0
790   if
3   ($#values)
189   then
1113   for
109   i
527   =
120   0
3144   to
5   $#values
91   -
214   1
176   do
790   if
3   (isnumber(values[i]))
189   then
284   @
44   j
527   =
7   values[i]
38   break
412   end
412   end
1113   for
109   i
527   =
109   i
117   +
214   1
3144   to
5   $#values
91   -
214   1
176   do
790   if
2   (isnumber(values[i])
32   &amp;&amp;
7   values[i]
49   &gt;
3   j)
284   @
44   j
527   =
7   values[i]
412   end
412   end
159   return
44   j
412   end
1   max
43   $argv

446   <h3>
1   mcvisa.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="max.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="member.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
181   This
1837   is
3088   a
8   self-loading
72   procedure
1061   that
511   can
30   tell
57   whether
3088   a
1   MasterCard
597   #
1041   or
1   Visa
3   credit
5   card
165   number
1837   is
3   plausible
588   by
2   constructing
3088   a
94   special
597   #
9   checksum
2059   of
6605   the
5   digits.
983   The
9   checksum
281   used
1113   for
3   credit
3   cards
1837   is
597   #
5   designed
3144   to
3   catch
2   transposed
1041   or
10   incorrect
5   digits.
111   For
1   fun,
47   try
879   it
597   #
883   on
6605   the
3   cards
1307   in
252   your
1   wallet!
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
4   1990-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   mcvisa(card)
94   local
22   i,
5   j,
19   sum
284   @
19   sum
527   =
120   0
597   #
11   reverse
6605   the
13   digits
2223   and
16   discard
439   any
7   spaces.
284   @
5   card
527   =
1   reverse(card)
790   if
2   (card
19   =~
2   "*
1   *")
284   @
5   card
527   =
1   $card:gs/
12   //
790   if
2   (card
19   =~
1   "*[^0-9]*")
159   return
2   "bad"
1113   for
109   i
527   =
214   1
3144   to
1   strlen(card)
176   do
284   @
44   j
527   =
1   substr(card,
22   i,
17   1)
790   if
11   (i
60   %
102   2
69   ==
10   0)
189   then
284   @
44   j
7   *=
102   2
790   if
6   (j
11   &gt;=
5   10)
284   @
44   j
6   -=
1   9;
412   end
284   @
19   sum
14   +=
44   j
412   end
159   return
19   sum
60   %
21   10
69   ==
120   0
13   ?
1   "good"
53   :
2   "bad"
412   end
1   mcvisa
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
13   Determine
588   by
5   case-insensitive
16   comparison
790   if
6605   the
281   first
77   argument
97   word
597   #
19   appears
7   somewhere
1307   in
6605   the
190   list
91   given
588   by
6605   the
33   second
12   argument.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
6   1994-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
3   memberi
84   (
32   a,
89   b
210   )
94   local
109   i
284   @
3088   a
527   =
2   lower(
3088   a
210   )
33   foreach
109   i
84   (
7   $b
210   )
790   if
84   (
3088   a
69   ==
2   lower(
109   i
210   )
210   )
159   return
214   1
412   end
159   return
120   0
412   end
3   memberi
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>

12   Find
6605   the
6   minimum
25   numeric
105   value
94   out
2059   of
3088   a
39   list.
468   If
12   none
2059   of
6605   the
13   elements
597   #

16   0.

446   <h3>
1   myecho.c<br/>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
6   <pre><tt>/***************************************************************************/
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
261   A
3   variant
2059   of
296   echo
1061   that
35   prints
52   quotes
45   around
197   each
12   argument.
52   */
51   /*
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1989-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
6   /***************************************************************************/
20   #include
5   &lt;stdio.h&gt;
20   #include
6   &lt;stdlib.h&gt;
20   #include
2   &lt;string.h&gt;
20   #include
3   "<a
3   href="internat.htm">internat.h</a>"
6   void
4   cdecl
230   main
84   (
12   int
6   argc,
23   char
2   *argv[]
210   )
34   {
12   int
22   i,
38   length
527   =
10   0;
3   Internationalize();
1113   for
11   (i
527   =
10   0;
109   i
49   &lt;
2   argc
91   -
18   1;
6   i++)
34   {
38   length
14   +=
2   strlen(argv[i])
117   +
18   1;
6   printf
1   ("'%s'
4   ",
4   argv[i]);
49   }
38   length
14   +=
2   strlen(argv[i])
117   +
18   1;
1   printf("'%s'\n",
4   argv[i]);
1   printf("arg
38   length
527   =
2   %d
1   characters\n",
1   length);
3   exit(0);
49   }
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   List
364   all
6605   the
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
1307   in
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
1061   that
597   #
176   do
471   not
8   occur
1307   in
6605   the
152   specified
92   directory.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
4   1990-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   newfiles(olddir)
94   local
109   i
790   if
84   (
1   $#olddir
69   ==
120   0
210   )
284   @
1   olddir
527   =
14   "."
33   foreach
109   i
2   (*)
790   if
11   (!
34   -e
1   $olddir\$i)
90   calc
109   i
412   end
412   end
1   newfiles
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   percentchg.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="newfiles.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="postage.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   Calculate
6605   the
2   percentage
78   change
64   between
590   an
26   old
105   value
2223   and
3088   a
257   new
105   value
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
1   2008-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   percentchg(
1   oldvalue,
1   newvalue
210   )
790   if
1   (oldvalue
69   ==
10   0)
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
1   percentchg:
983   The
26   old
105   value
29   cannot
924   be
120   0
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
56   else
159   return
16   100
41   *
1   (newvalue
91   -
1   oldvalue)/oldvalue
412   end
412   end
2   percentchg
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

597   #
1   Reflects
6   rates
3   effective
8   January
2   22,
174   2012
110   proc
1   postage(ounces)
597   #
18   Current
9   rate
1837   is
4   45
3   cents
1113   for
6605   the
281   first
2   ounce
117   +
8   20
3   cents
1113   for
597   #
197   each
23   additional
2   ounce
1041   or
1   fraction
1   thereof,
157   up
3144   to
4   3.5
3   ounces.
597   #
2   Over
4   3.5
2   ounces,
23   large
1   envelope
6   rates
1   apply,
2223   and
6605   the
9   rate
1837   is
597   #
1   $1.50
1113   for

2   ounces
117   +
8   20
3   cents
1113   for

1   ounce.

2   nextOunce

2   ounces

4   3.5

1   .45

446   <h3>
1   posxpath.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="postage.htm">Previous</a>

2   href="rcode.htm">Next</a></small>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
12   Convert
590   an
37   ordinary
1   DOS-style
37   pathname
178   into
27   POSIX
8   format:
597   #
35   1.
21   Set
879   it
178   into
15   correct
40   mixed
97   case
30   since
27   POSIX
1837   is
1   case-
597   #
1   sensitive.
597   #
23   2.
468   If
19   there's
590   an
3   explicit
112   drive
3   letter,
924   be
10   sure
6605   the
152   name
597   #
1837   is
3088   a
13   fullpath
30   since
19   there's
227   no
90   way
3144   to
20   refer
3144   to
6605   the
597   #
213   current
319   directory
883   on
41   anything
241   but
6605   the
213   current
112   drive
597   #
126   under
27   POSIX
3   rules.
597   #
22   3.
27   Change
439   any
640   from
5   \'s
3144   to
3   /'s.
597   #
17   4.
12   Convert
439   any
112   drive
6   specification
640   from
6605   the
12   usual
8   c:
59   format
597   #
3144   to
6605   the
27   POSIX
1   //C/
16   format.
597   #
181   This
15   routine
1837   is
14   particularly
33   useful
1113   for
14   creating
1930   C
1129   shell
159   script
597   #
1   "wrappers"
45   around
27   POSIX
16   applications
28   such
857   as
47   those
883   on
6605   the
243   Microsoft
597   #
81   NT
1   Resource
1   Kit
1   CD
3144   to
17   convert
320   filename
74   arguments
3144   to
27   POSIX
59   format
597   #
98   before
6605   the
16   applications
650   are
2   invoked.
597   #
4   Note:
181   This
72   procedure
135   does
471   not
102   work
883   on
29   UNC
2   (network)
88   names
64   because
597   #
87   there
1837   is
227   no
90   way
3144   to
17   convert
3088   a
29   UNC
32   name.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
6   1994-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   posxpath(
383   file
210   )
790   if
4   (file
28   !=
7   "")
189   then
790   if
4   (file
19   =~
1   "?:*")
189   then
790   if
4   (file
69   ==
1   substr(file,
1   3,
17   1)
28   !=
1   "/")
284   @
383   file
527   =
1   fullpath(file)
436   set
383   file
527   =
2   $file:m:gSx\x/x
284   @
383   file
527   =
1   "//$upper(substr(file,
32   1,
1   1))/$substr(file,
1   4)"
56   else
436   set
383   file
527   =
2   $file:m:gSx\x/x
412   end
56   else
284   @
383   file
527   =
14   "."
412   end
159   return
2   $file
412   end
2   posxpath
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

446   <h3>
1   read.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="rcode.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="renet.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
6   Emulate
6605   the
4   Bourne
2   Shell's
125   read
29   command,
201   which
26   reads
3088   a
372   line
2059   of
597   #
8   input,
11   breaking
879   it
157   up
178   into
25   words,
201   which
650   are
189   then
2   assigned,
1   one-by-
597   #
4   one,
3144   to
6605   the
111   variables
15   whose
88   names
650   are
73   passed
857   as
12   arguments.
468   If
227   no
597   #
243   variable
152   name
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
58   input
372   line
1837   is
125   read
241   but
6   discarded.
597   #
983   The
597   #
60   status
66   code
1837   is
436   set
3144   to
120   0
790   if
1   successful
1041   or
17   non-zero
790   if
1   end-of-
597   #
383   file
363   was
2   encountered.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
8   1996-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   read(
1   Rvariables
210   )
94   local
8   input,
1   Ri,
1   nR,
5   ni
284   @
4   nR
527   =
2   $#Rvariables
91   -
214   1
436   set
58   input
527   =
1   $getline:x
284   @
5   ni
527   =
1   $#input
91   -
214   1
790   if
1   (!eofgetline)
189   then
790   if
3   (nR
69   ==
10   0)
189   then
23   eval
284   @
1   $Rvariables
527   =
58   input
56   else
790   if
3   (nR
49   &gt;
120   0
210   )
189   then
790   if
3   (nR
49   &lt;
1   ni)
189   then
1113   for
5   Ri
527   =
120   0
3144   to
4   nR
176   do
23   eval
5   "@
4   $Rvariables[Ri]
527   =
3   input[Ri]"
412   end
1113   for
5   Ri
527   =
4   nR
117   +
214   1
3144   to
5   ni
176   do
23   eval
5   "@
1   $Rvariables[nR][Ri
91   -
1   nR]
527   =
3   input[Ri]"
412   end
56   else
1113   for
5   Ri
527   =
120   0
3144   to
5   ni
176   do
23   eval
5   "@
4   $Rvariables[Ri]
527   =
3   input[Ri]"
412   end
1113   for
5   Ri
527   =
5   ni
117   +
214   1
3144   to
4   nR
176   do
23   eval
436   set
4   $Rvariables[Ri]
527   =
412   end
412   end
412   end
412   end
284   @
60   status
527   =
120   0
56   else
1113   for
5   Ri
527   =
120   0
3144   to
2   $#Rvariables

214   1
176   do
23   eval

4   $Rvariables[Ri]
527   =
412   end

60   status
527   =

597   #

412   end

125   read

58   <pre><tt>#
13   Fixup
97   case
7   statements.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
10   1992-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
97   case
97   word
1307   in
18   switch
1   (word)
597   #
11   a)
97   case
1   "a":
597   #
53   :
53   :
597   #
1   ;;
38   break
597   #
1   b|c)
43   --&gt;
97   case
1   "b":
597   #
53   :
97   case
1   "c":
597   #
53   :
597   #
38   break
2   FixBreak
4   &lt;--
1   Hand-Fixup
24   required
597   #
1   *)
9   default:
597   #
53   :
53   :
597   #
1   esac
412   end
25   /^[
1   ]*case/,/^[
1   ]*esac/{
1   s/case[
7   ][
9   ]*\([^
1   ].*\)[
7   ][
1   ]*in/switch
1   (\1)/
1   /^[^(]*)/{
5   s/\([
1   ]*\)\([^)]*\))/\1case
1   "\2":
4   \1
23   /
1   :case
1   /".*|.*"/{
5   s/\([
1   ]*\)\(case
1   "[^|]*\)|\(.*":\)/\1\2":
1   \1case
1   "\3/
89   b
97   case
49   }
49   }
1   s/case
1   "\*":/default:/
1   s/break/FixBreak/
1   /;;/s/^\([
1   ]*\)\([^
1   ].*\);;/\1\2
1   \1break/
1   /;;/s/;;/break/
1   s/esac/end/
49   }

1   First-pass
6   fixup
2059   of
13   expressions.

588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.

65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
35   1.
12   Convert
36   test
1   statements:
597   #
36   test
43   --&gt;
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
597   #
36   test
38   x
43   --&gt;
284   @
60   status
527   =
99   [
38   x
93   ]
69   ==
12   ""
597   #
36   test
57   ...
43   --&gt;
284   @
60   status
527   =
99   [
57   ...
93   ]
28   !=
120   0
597   #
57   ...

214   1
597   #

36   test
3088   a
43   --&gt;
57   ...

3088   a
28   !=
12   ""
93   ]
597   #
57   ...
36   test
57   ...
43   --&gt;
57   ...
99   [
57   ...
93   ]
597   #
23   2.
13   Fixup
63   expression
44   operators
2223   and
1   syntax:
597   #
129   string
43   --&gt;
1   "string"
597   #
45   -n
19   foo
43   --&gt;
19   foo
28   !=
12   ""
597   #
10   -z
19   foo
43   --&gt;
19   foo
69   ==
12   ""
597   #
3088   a
527   =
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
69   ==
89   b
597   #
3088   a
1   -eq
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
69   ==
89   b
597   #
3088   a
1   -gt
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
49   &gt;
89   b
597   #
3088   a
1   -ge
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
11   &gt;=
89   b
597   #
3088   a
1   -lt
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
49   &lt;
89   b
597   #
3088   a
1   -le
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
6   &lt;=
89   b
597   #
3088   a
1   -ne
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
28   !=
89   b
597   #
3088   a
15   -o
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
18   ||
89   b
597   #
3088   a
29   -a
89   b
43   --&gt;
3088   a
32   &amp;&amp;
89   b
597   #
99   [
57   ...
93   ]
43   --&gt;
84   (
57   ...
210   )
597   #
22   3.
9   Do
1   `expr
2   ...`
11   evaluation
1307   in
6605   the
1930   C
7   shell:
597   #
1   i=`expr
1   ${i}
117   +
1   1`
43   --&gt;
284   @
1   i=i
117   +
214   1
597   #
17   4.
1   PATH=a:b:c
43   --&gt;
1   PATH="a;b;c"
597   #
11   5.
1   Assignments
4   become
436   set
7   statements.
25   /^[
1   ]*test/{
3   s/^\([
3   ]*\)test[
1   ]*$/\1@
60   status
527   =
1   1/
3   s/^\([
3   ]*\)test[
7   ][
9   ]*\([^
3   ][^
1   ]*\)$/\1@
60   status
527   =
99   [
4   \2
93   ]
69   ==
3   ""/
3   s/^\([
3   ]*\)test[
7   ][
9   ]*\([^
1   ].*\)$/\1@
60   status
527   =
99   [
4   \2
93   ]
28   !=
1   0/
49   }
1   /^[^#]*[
1   ]test/{
5   s/\([
3   ]\)test[
1   ]*$/\11/
5   s/\([
3   ]\)test[
7   ][
9   ]*\([^
3   ][^
1   ]*\)$/\1[
4   \2
28   !=
12   ""
2   ]/
5   s/\([
3   ]\)test[
7   ][
9   ]*\([^
1   ].*\)$/\1[
4   \2
2   ]/
49   }
2   /^[^#]*
1   \[[^[].*\]/{
1   s/\(\[.*[
1   ]\)\([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z_0-9]*\)/\1"\2"/g
1   s/-n[
9   ]*\([^
2   ].*\)
2   \]/\1
28   !=
12   ""
2   ]/g
1   s/-z[
9   ]*\([^
2   ].*\)
2   \]/\1
69   ==
12   ""
2   ]/g
9   s/[
1   ]*=[
9   ]*/
69   ==
9   /g
9   s/[
1   ]*-eq[
9   ]*/
69   ==
9   /g
9   s/[
1   ]*-gt[
9   ]*/
49   &gt;
9   /g
9   s/[
1   ]*-ge[
9   ]*/
11   &gt;=
9   /g
9   s/[
1   ]*-lt[
9   ]*/

9   ]*/

1   /^[^#]*=`expr.*`/{

1   =][^
2   ]*\)[
1   ]*:

25   /^[

446   <h3>
1   expr2.sed<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="misc.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="quotes.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
1   Second-pass
63   expression
3   fixups.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
10   1992-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
1   Optimize
25   expressions
7   (for
4   performance,
471   not
1   functionality)
588   by
597   #
4   removing
4   superfluous
9   quoting
2223   and
3   curly
1   braces:
597   #
35   1.
8   Inside
84   (
57   ...
210   )
1   expressions:
597   #
1   "${foo}"
43   --&gt;
19   foo
597   #
1   "$foo"
43   --&gt;
19   foo
597   #
1   "123"
43   --&gt;
3   123
597   #
23   2.
106   In
284   @
1   (assignment
1   statements):
597   #
1   ${foo}
43   --&gt;
19   foo
597   #
1   $foo
43   --&gt;
19   foo
597   #
22   3.
13   Fixup
9   earlier
2   fixups
1061   that
132   were
25   looking
1113   for
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
1   wordlist:
597   #
1   A[0]
28   !=
12   ""
43   --&gt;
261   A
28   !=
12   ""
597   #
17   4.
13   Fixup
439   any
3   assignments
471   not
55   already
1   rewritten:
597   #
2   foo=...
43   --&gt;
436   set
2   foo=...
2   /^[^#]*
1   (.*)/{
1   s/"\${\([^}]*\)}"/\1/g
1   s/"\$\([^"]*\)"/\1/g
1   s/"\([1-9][0-9]*\)"/\1/g
1   s/"0"/0/g
49   }
1   /^[^#]*@
1   /{
1   s/\${\([^}]*\)}/\1/g
1   s/\$\([a-zA-Z0-9_]*\)/\1/g
49   }
1   s/\[0\]
28   !=
3   ""/
28   !=
3   ""/
25   /^[
2   ]*PATH=[^"]/{
2   s/:/;/g
2   s/=\(.*\)/="\1"/
49   }
25   /^[
3   ]*[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*[
2   ]*=/s/[a-zA-Z]/set
3   &amp;/
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

58   <pre><tt>#
4   Miscellaneous
3   fixups.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
10   1992-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
35   1.
983   The
597   #
45   beginning
3088   a
11   comment
64   must
924   be
42   followed
588   by
68   white
13   space.
597   #
5   Special
97   case
1   #===
111   lines
3144   to
14   delete
271   one
1   =.
597   #
23   2.
1   /dev/null
1   (Unix)
43   --&gt;
5   nul
2   (OS/2
1041   or
2   NT)
597   #
22   3.
1   $?
2   (sh
3   status)
43   --&gt;
2   $status
2   (csh
3   status)
597   #
17   4.
1   $!
2   (sh
77   last
2   child)
43   --&gt;
1   $child
2   (csh
77   last
2   child)
597   #
11   5.
6   $0
43   --&gt;
3   $scriptname
597   #
6   6.
12   $1
9   thru
3   $9
43   --&gt;
6   $0
9   thru
1   $8
597   #
9   7.
23   kill
2   -9
1   pid
43   --&gt;
23   kill
1   ppid
597   #
4   8.
12   Escape
439   any
1   :'s
84   following
3088   a
243   variable
7   reference.
597   #
2   9.
13   Fixup
439   any
53   :
48   null
73   statements
857   as
30   ;
73   statements
2223   and
439   any
53   :
73   statements
597   #
857   as
14   tests
1307   in
3088   a
1   while.
597   #
5   10.
13   Fixup
439   any
1   if's
63   without
1   then's
2223   and
439   any
1   fi's
1061   that
55   might
299   have
597   #
1   sneaked
9   thru
13   during
97   case
3   fixups.
597   #
2   11.
13   Fixup
439   any
7   pipes
1061   that
23   continue
3144   to
6605   the
71   next
372   line
588   by
7   escaping
597   #
6605   the
372   line
1   ends.
597   #
4   12.
20   let
43   --&gt;
284   @
1   /#[^
1   ]/{
1   s/#=/#/
1   s/#/#
23   /
49   }
1   /#
1   $/s/
1   $//
1   s/\/dev\/null/nul/
1   /^[^#']*\$\?/s/\$\?/$status/g
1   /^[^#']*\$\!/s/\$\!/$child/g
1   /^[^#']*\$0/s/\$0/$scriptname/g
1   /^[^#']*\$1/s/\$1/$0/g
1   /^[^#']*\$2/s/\$2/$1/g
1   /^[^#']*\$3/s/\$3/$2/g
1   /^[^#']*\$4/s/\$4/$3/g
1   /^[^#']*\$5/s/\$5/$4/g
1   /^[^#']*\$6/s/\$6/$5/g
1   /^[^#']*\$7/s/\$7/$6/g
1   /^[^#']*\$8/s/\$8/$7/g
1   /^[^#']*\$9/s/\$9/$8/g
25   /^[
1   ]*kill
2   -9
1   \$/s/-9
1   /p/
1   /^[^#']*\${[^}]*}:/s/\(\${[^}]*}\):/\1\\:/
1   /^[^#']*\$[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*:/s/\(\$[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*\):/\1\\:/
25   /^[
1   ]*while[
1   ]*:$/s/:/(
214   1
1   )/
1   /^[^#"']*:/{
1   /case/
15   !
34   {
1   /default/
15   !
1   s/:/;/
49   }
49   }
25   /^[
2   ]*fi[
1   ]*$/s/fi/end/
25   /^[
1   ]*if/{
1   /then$/
15   !
1   s/$/
2   then/
49   }
1   /^[^#].*|$/s/$/
1   ^/
25   /^[
1   ]*let[
1   ]/s/let/@/
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
13   Fixup
72   procedure
1   definitions.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
10   1992-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
35   1.
3   foo()
34   {
43   --&gt;
110   proc
1   foo(A)
597   #
49   }
412   end
597   #
23   2.
18   argv
2   holds
74   arguments
73   passed
3144   to
3088   a
6   .csh
1   script;
2   formal
74   arguments
597   #
3144   to
3088   a
1930   C
1129   shell
72   procedure
650   are
1   declared,
3   requiring
320   this
78   change
597   #
9   (but
471   not
97   inside
3088   a
11   comment
1041   or
17   quoted
1   string):
597   #
12   $1
9   thru
3   $9
43   --&gt;
1   $A[0]
9   thru
1   $A[8]
597   #
2   (Note
1061   that
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
4   interprets
364   all
1   subscripts
857   as
31   starting
597   #
277   at
5   zero.
139   Also,
3   argv[0]
3144   to
3088   a
1129   shell
159   script
1837   is
6605   the
281   first
8   argument,
597   #
471   not
6605   the
2   scriptname
42   unless
4   bsdargv
69   ==
18   1;
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
159   script
597   #
1837   is
28   found
1307   in
6605   the
3   $scriptname
24   variable.)
597   #
22   3.
6   shift
43   --&gt;
6   shift
261   A
1   /^[^#].*()/,/^[
1   ]*}/{
1   /()/s/\([^a-zA-Z]*\)\([a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*\).*/\1proc
1   \2(A)/
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$1/\1\$A[0]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$2/\1\$A[1]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$3/\1\$A[2]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$4/\1\$A[3]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$5/\1\$A[4]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$6/\1\$A[5]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$7/\1\$A[6]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$8/\1\$A[7]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\$9/\1\$A[8]/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${1}/\1\${A[0]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${2}/\1\${A[1]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${3}/\1\${A[2]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${4}/\1\${A[3]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${5}/\1\${A[4]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${6}/\1\${A[5]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${7}/\1\${A[6]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${8}/\1\${A[7]}/g
1   s/^\([^'#]*\)\${9}/\1\${A[8]}/g
1   s/shift/shift
1   A/g
25   /^[
1   ]*}/s/}/end/
49   }

446   <h3>
1   sh2csh.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="renet.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="sizeof.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
12   Convert
4   Bourne
1041   or
2   Korn
1129   shell
52   scripts
3144   to
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
52   scripts
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
10   1992-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
91   Usage:
1   sh2csh
99   [
294   files
93   ]
597   #
597   #
5   Translate
590   an
4   sh
159   script
3144   to
1930   C
1129   shell
2   syntax,
56   writing
3144   to
44   stdout.
468   If
597   #
30   multiple
294   files
650   are
62   specified,
28   they're
2   concatenated.
597   #
597   #
181   This
1837   is
3088   a
6   relatively
2   simple-minded
1   translation
191   using
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
51   sed
597   #
2   filters
3144   to
6   rewrite
790   if
10   statements,
3   procedures,
97   case
10   statements,
1   loops,
597   #
2   miscellaneous
4   differences,
25   expressions
2223   and
17   quotes.
597   #
597   #
45   Each
11   stage
1837   is
191   using
51   sed
3144   to
6   fixup
3088   a
19   specific
84   type
2059   of
35   language
13   difference
597   #
64   between
4   sh
2223   and
1   csh.
4   Order
1837   is
12   important
2223   and
6605   the
4   stages
64   must
924   be
3   connected
597   #
9   thru
7   pipes
46   rather
171   than
44   simply
3   concatenating
6605   the
9   scripts.
58   But
439   any
28   individual
597   #
11   stage
511   can
924   be
146   run
2   independently
1113   for
2   testing
1041   or
234   just
3144   to
43   see
81   what
879   it
4   does.
597   #
597   #
983   The
48   result
380   will
1   (hopefully)
924   be
7   fairly
19   good
790   if
6605   the
58   input
1837   is
1307   in
1   clear,
597   #
1   well-formatted
1   style,
241   but
920   with
94   these
1   limitations:
597   #
597   #
35   1.
983   The
64   output
380   will
7   depend
883   on
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
78   being
146   run
920   with
6605   the
121   escape
4   symbol
597   #
436   set
857   as
5   follows:
597   #
597   #
436   set
15   escapesym
527   =
11   \
597   #
39   Use
6605   the
2   Unix-style
5   \,
471   not
6605   the
841   Windows
597   #
597   #
117   default
4   ^,
857   as
6605   the
121   escape
1   symbol.
597   #
597   #
23   2.
38   break
73   statements
380   will
299   have
3144   to
924   be
8   manually
1   rewritten,
30   since
4   sh
597   #
4   interprets
38   break
3144   to
19   mean
38   break
94   out
2059   of
7   loops
3   only,
471   not
97   case
597   #
7   statements.
139   Also,
38   break
49   n
99   means
38   break
94   out
2059   of
49   n
9   levels,
115   even
597   #
11   breaking
94   out
2059   of
7   loops
6   entered
1307   in
6   calling
5   procedures.
983   The
51   sed
597   #
52   scripts
380   will
28   turn
38   break
178   into
2   FixBreak
1307   in
6605   the
19   output.
597   #
597   #
22   3.
35   Under
6605   the
1930   C
980   shell,
111   variables
650   are
93   either
1129   shell
243   variable
1041   or
597   #
76   environment
111   variables
640   from
6605   the
1   moment
28   they're
8   created.
597   #
597   #
17   4.
983   The
52   scripts
176   do
3088   a
8   pretty
19   good
18   job
57   editing
35   most
4   things,
241   but
101   some
597   #
11   things
234   just
38   don't
19   go
9   thru
44   very
4   well
2223   and
380   will
7   require
1   hand
1   tuning.
597   #
20   E.g.,
5   backquoted
4   expr
25   expressions
920   with
11   embedded
8   escaped
52   quotes
597   #
650   are
11   garbled
2223   and
8   escaped
3   newlines
193   may
58   cause
1   trouble.
94   local
1   seddir,
3   stageone
436   set
1   seddir
527   =
1   $scriptname:h\sh2csh
790   if
11   (!
34   -e
2   $seddir
18   ||
15   !
25   -D
1   $seddir)
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
1   "sh2csh:
13   Couldn't
38   find
6605   the
51   sed
1   scripts."
44   exit
214   1
412   end
790   if
1   ($#argv)
189   then
436   set
3   stageone
527   =
3314   <a
2   href="sh2csh/expr.htm">expr.sed</a>
1   $argv:gf
56   else
436   set
3   stageone
527   =
3314   <a
2   href="sh2csh/expr.htm">expr.sed</a>
412   end
52   cd
8   +c
2   $seddir
51   sed
47   -f
1   $stageone
498   |
51   sed
47   -f
3314   <a
1   href="sh2csh/if.htm">if.sed</a>
498   |
51   sed
47   -f
3314   <a
1   href="sh2csh/proc.htm">proc.sed</a>
498   |
51   sed
47   -f
3314   <a
1   href="sh2csh/case.htm">case.sed</a>
498   |
34   ^
51   sed
47   -f
3314   <a
1   href="sh2csh/loop.htm">loop.sed</a>
498   |
51   sed
47   -f
3314   <a
1   href="sh2csh/misc.htm">misc.sed</a>
498   |
51   sed
47   -f
3314   <a
1   href="sh2csh/expr2.htm">expr2.sed</a>
498   |
51   sed
47   -f
3314   <a
1   href="sh2csh/quotes.htm">quotes.sed</a>
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   sizeof.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="sh2csh.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="splitstring.htm">Next</a></small>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
29   Calculate
6605   the
14   total
67   space
281   used
588   by
152   specified
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
10   1992-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   sizeof(files)
597   #
1   Method
1837   is
857   as
5   follows:
597   #
35   1.
4   Get
3088   a
53   long
24   listing
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
294   files
2059   of
1   interest,
3   walking
9   thru
439   any
597   #
4   subdirectories
1061   that
193   may
299   have
382   been
25   specified.
597   #
23   2.
3   Cut
94   out
6605   the
39   field
1   6,
6605   the
5   column
18   showing
6605   the
67   space
31   used.
2   (Note
597   #
1061   that
6605   the
67   space
1837   is
25   taken
5   delimiter
2223   and
1061   that
7   repeated
42   spaces
650   are
597   #
3   ignored.)
597   #
22   3.
6   Paste
320   this
29   series
2059   of
21   numbers
51   back
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
920   with
2   backquotes
597   #
2223   and
3   globally
5   substitute
1   +'s
1113   for
6605   the
42   spaces
64   between
197   each
8   pair
2059   of
597   #
14   numbers.
597   #
17   4.
11   Run
320   this
5   constructed
94   statement
51   back
9   thru
6605   the
6   parser
2223   and
16   execute
597   #
879   it
920   with
6605   the
23   eval
30   statement.
23   eval
159   return
3   `ls
1   -Lw!
2   $files
498   |
7   cut
1   -f6
1   -rd^
1   `:gS/
1   /+/
412   end
2   sizeof
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

58   <pre><tt>#
7   Split
157   up
3088   a
129   string
178   into
30   multiple
11   lines,
4   replacing
197   each
5   occurrence
2059   of
597   #
6605   the
10   separator
106   text
920   with
3088   a
372   line
1   breaks,
56   writing
72   them
3144   to
44   stdout.
597   #
111   For
101   example,
60   write
94   out
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
6   INCLUDE
3   directories:
597   #
597   #
5   40
64   C%
2   splitstring
2   $INCLUDE
1   ";"
597   #
1   C:\Users\Nicole\include
597   #
2   c:\Program
29   Files
2   (x86)\Microsoft
8   Visual
7   Studio
1   9.0\VC\ATLMFC\INCLUDE
597   #
2   c:\Program
29   Files
2   (x86)\Microsoft
8   Visual
7   Studio
1   9.0\VC\INCLUDE
597   #
2   C:\Program
2   Files\Microsoft
1   SDKs\Windows\v6.0A\include
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
2   2011-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
2   splitstring(
8   input,
10   separator
210   )
84   (
90   calc
58   input
210   )
498   |
51   sed
1   "s/$separator/^r^n/g"
412   end
284   @
2   splitstring(
2   argv[
120   0
7   ],
2   argv[
214   1
93   ]
210   )

446   <h3>
1   timestmp.csh<br/>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
8   Extract
3088   a
19   timestamp
640   from
3088   a
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
1307   in
6605   the
59   format
597   #
18   needed
588   by
1   touch.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
6   1994-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   timestmp(
383   file
210   )
94   local
5   j,
1   t,
26   month
790   if
84   (
2   $#file
69   ==
120   0
210   )
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
3   timestmp:
29   No
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
25   specified.
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
159   return
412   end
790   if
84   (
2   $#file
49   &gt;
214   1
210   )
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
3   timestmp:
15   Only
271   one
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
131   should
924   be
25   specified.
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
412   end
790   if
84   (
15   !
34   -e
2   $file
210   )
189   then
296   echo
18   -2
3   timestmp:
1   ^"$file^"
135   does
471   not
25   exist.
284   @
60   status
527   =
102   2
159   return
412   end
436   set
7   t
527   =
3   `ls
1   -L!
1   $file`:1-4:gS/:0/:/:gs/:/
23   /
284   @
26   month
527   =
214   1
33   foreach
44   j
84   (
5   Jan
16   Feb
3   Mar
2   Apr
9   May
3   Jun
7   Jul
4   Aug
3   Sep
4   Oct
1   Nov
2   Dec
210   )
790   if
84   (
44   j
69   ==
6   t[
120   0
93   ]
210   )
38   break
284   @
1   month++
412   end
159   return
1   $printf(
1   "%02d%02d%02d%02d%02d%02d",
34   ^
7   month,
6   t[
214   1
7   ],
6   t[
102   2
7   ],
6   t[
61   3
7   ],
6   t[
35   4
7   ],
6   t[
44   5
93   ]
210   )
412   end
1   timestmp
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

446   <h3>
1   trapz.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="timestmp.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="ts.htm">Next</a></small>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
1   Trapeziodal
2   rule
25   numeric
3   integration
2059   of
29   function
2   f()
640   from
3088   a
3144   to
7   b,
597   #
191   using
49   n
5   intervals
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
4   1995-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
1   Sample
1   usage:
597   #
1   Integrate
6605   the
1   sin()
29   function
640   from
120   0
3144   to
32   1,
191   using
5   500
5   intervals
597   #
2   trapz
2   sin
120   0
214   1
5   500
597   #
8   Compare
320   this
48   result
920   with
6605   the
1   "exact"
1   integration:
597   #
90   calc
1   cos(0)
91   -
1   cos(1)
597   #
983   The
9   area
1307   in
197   each
6   interval
1837   is
1   (f(x)
117   +
1   f(x
117   +
1   dx))*dx/2.
1   Summing
597   #
6605   the
2   areas
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
5   intervals
24   gives
6605   the
14   total
2   area,
241   but
3088   a
597   #
63   simple
8   optimization
1837   is
3144   to
16   move
6605   the
2   multiplication
588   by
4   dx
94   out
2059   of
597   #
6605   the
23   loop
2223   and
3144   to
1   observe
1061   that
6605   the
2   divide
588   by
102   2
1837   is
4   unnecessary
597   #
42   except
1113   for
6605   the
45   values
2059   of
2   f()
277   at
6605   the
1   endpoints
3088   a
2223   and
89   b
1   since,
597   #
3   everywhere
4   else,
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
271   one
6   interval
1837   is
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
597   #
6605   the
5   next.
597   #
8   Note
6605   the
270   use
2059   of
23   eval
30   lets
2   me
26   paste
1307   in
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
29   function
597   #
1113   for
6605   the
2   call,
189   then
58   cause
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
2   compile
2223   and
146   run
6605   the
597   #
17   resulting
35   string.
983   The
5   circumflex
197   characters
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
197   each
597   #
372   line
650   are
87   there
234   just
3144   to
20   let
2   me
38   break
6605   the
129   string
17   across
30   multiple
597   #
111   lines
1113   for
6   readability.
110   proc
1   trapz(
3   f,
32   a,
7   b,
8   n)
94   local
22   i,
2   area,
4   dx
284   @
4   dx
527   =
7   (b
91   -
1   a)/n
23   eval
5   "@
9   area
527   =
1   ($f
6   (a)
117   +
2   $f
1   (b))/2
34   ^
1113   for
109   i
527   =
214   1
3144   to
49   n
91   -
214   1
176   do
34   ^
284   @
9   area
14   +=
2   $f
11   (a
117   +
1   i*dx)
34   ^
1   end"
284   @
9   area
7   *=
4   dx
159   return
9   area
412   end
2   trapz
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

446   <h3>
1   ts.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="trapz.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="update.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
10   Search
1113   for
30   occurrences
2059   of
3088   a
63   simple
129   string
1307   in
364   all
6605   the
294   files
920   with
3088   a
597   #
91   given
18   extension
19   anywhere
1307   in
3088   a
319   directory
7   tree.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
4   1990-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
3   ts
49   works
588   by
1   pushing
6605   the
319   directory
3144   to
924   be
6   searched
50   onto
6605   the
319   directory
597   #
24   stack
15   making
879   it
6605   the
213   current
83   disk
2223   and
92   directory.
91   ls
2223   and
21   grep
650   are
281   used
597   #
3144   to
10   recursively
190   list
364   all
294   files
7   (not
1   directories)
439   any
105   where
1307   in
6605   the
3   tree
597   #
1061   that
412   end
920   with
1   .ext
105   where
1   ext
1837   is
34   whatever
6605   the
1   caller
2   requests.
1   Assuming
597   #
87   there
650   are
101   some
39   files,
18   fgrep
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
76   search
7   them,
9   ignoring
172   character
597   #
97   case
2223   and
18   showing
372   line
14   numbers.
983   The
36   test
1837   is
18   needed
30   since
6   calling
18   fgrep
597   #
63   without
3088   a
320   filename
77   argument
161   would
58   cause
879   it
3144   to
47   try
3144   to
125   read
29   stdin.
983   The
597   #
106   text
77   argument
1837   is
97   inside
25   double
52   quotes
1307   in
97   case
6605   the
76   search
106   text
1837   is
207   more
597   #
171   than
271   one
25   word.
110   proc
1   ts(startdir,ext,
2   text)
13   pushd
66   -s
1   $startdir
436   set
294   files
527   =
1   ``ls
1   -rD1
498   |
21   grep
30   -i
1   \.$ext^$``
790   if
1   (files
28   !=
6   '')
18   fgrep
1   -in
1   "$text"
2   $files
498   |
207   more
17   popd
66   -s
412   end
3   ts
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

1   update.csh<br/>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
8   Compare
2223   and
11   update
3088   a
3   backup
92   directory.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
2   2001-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
91   Usage:
11   update
3   [-acd]
7   frompath
5   topath
597   #
597   #
8   Compare
6605   the
7   frompath
2223   and
5   topath
103   directories
25   looking
1113   for
4   differences,
597   #
3   updating
6605   the
5   topath
319   directory
857   as
18   needed
3144   to
53   make
879   it
590   an
4   up-to-date
597   #
8   copy.
597   #
597   #
2   Comparison
1837   is
58   done
15   based
883   on
1   timestamps,
471   not
40   contents
1113   for
2   speed.
32   By
597   #
38   default,
199   only
294   files
1061   that
55   already
18   exist
1307   in
6605   the
3   'topath'
650   are
5   updated.
597   #
29   Files
1061   that
18   exist
199   only
1307   in
6605   the
1   'frompath'
650   are
471   not
5   copied.
84   (This
1837   is
597   #
58   done
883   on
6605   the
4   assumption
1061   that
6605   the
3   'topath'
1837   is
12   intended
199   only
3144   to
38   contain
597   #
3088   a
2   snapshot
2059   of
6605   the
12   important
3   files.)
597   #
597   #
32   By
38   default,
590   an
10   extra
294   files
1307   in
6605   the
3   'topath'
650   are
471   not
4   deleted.
597   #
597   #
97   Options:
597   #
597   #
29   -a
113   All
52   files.
468   If
3088   a
383   file
1041   or
7   subdirectory
9   exists
199   only
1307   in
6605   the
597   #
2   frompath,
60   copy
879   it
3144   to
6605   the
2   topath.
597   #
64   -c
8   Compare
199   only
2223   and
2   report.
597   #
39   -d
16   Delete
439   any
10   extra
294   files
1307   in
6605   the
2   topath.
597   #
20   -v
8   Verbose.
110   proc
1   update(args)
94   local
5   j,
2   frompath,
1   topath,
1   allfiles,
1   compareonly,
1   deleteextra,
3   Verbose
790   if
2   ($#args
49   &lt;
7   2)
189   then
296   echo
3   "Usage:
11   update
1   [-acdv]
7   frompath
3   topath"
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
159   return
412   end
95   while
2   ($#args
11   &gt;=
7   3)
790   if
2   (substr(args[0],
32   1,
17   1)
28   !=
1   '-')
189   then
296   echo
3   "Usage:
11   update
3   [-acd]
7   frompath
3   topath"
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
159   return
412   end
1113   for
44   j
527   =
102   2
3144   to
1   strlen(args[0])
176   do
18   switch
2   (substr(args[0],
5   j,
7   1))
97   case
1   'a':
284   @
1   allfiles
527   =
214   1
38   break
97   case
1   'c':
284   @
1   compareonly
527   =
214   1
38   break
97   case
1   'd':
284   @
1   deleteextra
527   =
214   1
38   break
97   case
1   'v':
284   @
3   Verbose
527   =
214   1
38   break
97   case
1   '-':
38   break
9   default:
296   echo
3   "Usage:
11   update
3   [-acd]
7   frompath
3   topath"
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
159   return
412   end
412   end
6   shift
9   args
412   end
284   @
7   frompath
527   =
1   fullpath(args[0])
284   @
5   topath
527   =
1   fullpath(args[1])
790   if
1   (frompath
19   =~
3   "*\")
284   @
7   frompath
527   =
1   substr(frompath,
32   1,
1   strlen(frompath)
91   -
17   1)
790   if
1   (topath
19   =~
3   "*\")
284   @
5   topath
527   =
1   substr(topath,
32   1,
1   strlen(topath)
91   -
17   1)
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
4   Comparing
4   "$frompath"
2223   and
8   "$topath"
790   if
9   (-e
4   "$frompath"
32   &amp;&amp;
34   -e
8   "$topath"
32   &amp;&amp;
1   $#frompath
69   ==
214   1
32   &amp;&amp;
1   $#topath
69   ==
17   1)
189   then
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
1   Paths
10   exist,
410   now
12   comparing
790   if
2   (-D
1   "$frompath")
189   then
790   if
11   (!
25   -D
2   "$topath")
189   then
296   echo
8   "$topath"
64   must
924   be
3088   a
319   directory
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
159   return
412   end
790   if
1   (!allfiles)
189   then
33   foreach
44   j
6   (``ls
4   -1rD
3   "$frompath"``:q)
790   if
9   (-e

32   &amp;&amp;
2   `newer
6   "$frompath\$j"
2   "$topath\$j"`)
189   then
790   if
6   (compareonly)
189   then
296   echo
106   --
15   "$topath\$j"
1837   is
94   out
2059   of
37   date
56   else
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
4   Updating
15   "$topath\$j"
39   cp
106   --
6   "$frompath\$j"
15   "$topath\$j"
412   end
412   end
412   end
56   else
33   foreach
44   j
6   (``ls
1   -1ra
3   +D
7   -.
3   "$frompath"``:q)
790   if
11   (!
34   -e
2   "$topath\$j")
189   then
790   if
6   (compareonly)
189   then
296   echo
106   --
15   "$topath\$j"
135   does
471   not
18   exist
56   else
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
2   Creating
15   "$topath\$j"
9   mkdir
106   --
15   "$topath\$j"
412   end
412   end
412   end
33   foreach
44   j
6   (``ls
4   -1rD
3   "$frompath"``:q)
790   if
9   (-e
2   "$topath\$j")
189   then
790   if
2   (`newer
6   "$frompath\$j"
2   "$topath\$j"`)
189   then
790   if
6   (compareonly)
189   then

15   "$topath\$j"
1837   is
94   out
2059   of
37   date
56   else
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
4   Updating
15   "$topath\$j"
39   cp
106   --
6   "$frompath\$j"
15   "$topath\$j"
412   end
412   end
56   else
790   if
6   (compareonly)
189   then
296   echo
106   --
15   "$topath\$j"
135   does
471   not
18   exist
56   else
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
2   Creating
15   "$topath\$j"
39   cp
106   --
6   "$frompath\$j"
15   "$topath\$j"
412   end
412   end
412   end
412   end
790   if
1   (deleteextra)
189   then
790   if
6   (compareonly)
189   then
33   foreach
44   j
6   (``ls
4   -1rD
2   "$topath"``:q)
790   if
11   (!
34   -e
2   "$frompath\$j")
189   then
296   echo
106   --
6   "$frompath\$j"
135   does
471   not
18   exist
412   end
412   end
56   else
33   foreach
44   j
6   (``ls
4   -1rD
2   "$topath"``:q)
790   if
11   (!
34   -e
2   "$frompath\$j")
189   then
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
1   Deleting
15   "$topath\$j"
27   rm
106   --
15   "$topath\$j"
412   end
412   end
412   end
412   end
56   else
790   if
2   (-D
2   "$topath")
189   then
296   echo
106   --
8   "$topath"
64   must
924   be
590   an
37   ordinary
383   file
284   @
60   status
527   =
214   1
159   return
412   end
790   if
6   (compareonly)
189   then
296   echo
106   --
8   "$topath"
1837   is
94   out
2059   of
37   date
56   else
790   if
8   (Verbose)
296   echo
4   Updating
8   "$topath"
39   cp
106   --
4   "$frompath"
8   "$topath"
412   end
412   end
56   else
296   echo
11   Either
4   "$frompath"
1041   or
8   "$topath"
1837   is
471   not
3088   a
11   valid
37   pathname
412   end
412   end
11   update
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   uptime.csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="update.htm">Previous</a>
