182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
3   uptime.csh
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
1   2010-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
597   #
1   Uptime
16   takes
227   no
74   arguments
10   (and
3   ignores
439   any
2   given)
2223   and
35   prints
3088   a
63   simple
597   #
63   message
6   telling
6605   the
7   days,
8   hours,
6   minutes
2223   and
23   seconds
6605   the
110   system
289   has
382   been
597   #
71   up.
111   For
101   example,
597   #
597   #
3   116
64   C%
3   uptime
597   #
6   11
7   days,
4   19
8   hours,
2   41
4   minutes,
1   02
23   seconds
597   #
181   This
1837   is
5   calculated
640   from
6605   the
3   elapsed
96   time
1113   for
1   p0,
6605   the
110   system
1   idle
597   #
20   process.
110   proc
1   uptime(
210   )
94   local
1   elapsed,
7   days,
8   hours,
2   min,
3   sec
597   #
181   This
71   next
372   line
49   works
90   like
320   this
3144   to
51   get
8   hours,
6   minutes
2223   and
23   seconds
597   #
857   as
16   three
48   separate
27   words.
597   #
597   #
3   117
64   C%
20   ps
66   -s
498   |
8   g
2   Idle
597   #
1   p0
2   Idle
1   283:49:03
1   2221:19:27.00
1   ......
597   #
3   118
64   C%
296   echo
3   `ps
66   -s
498   |
8   g
1   Idle`:2
597   #
1   283:49:19
597   #
2   119
64   C%
296   echo
3   `ps
66   -s
498   |
8   g
2   Idle`:2:gs/:/
23   /
597   #
2   283
2   49
2   29
284   @
3   elapsed
527   =
3   `ps
66   -s
498   |
21   grep
2   Idle`:2:gs/:/
23   /
284   @
11   hours
527   =
1   elapsed[0]
284   @
3   min
527   =
1   elapsed[1]
284   @
3   sec
527   =
1   elapsed[2]
790   if
84   (
11   hours
11   &gt;=
5   24
210   )
189   then
284   @
14   days
527   =
11   hours
12   //
5   24
284   @
11   hours
3   %=
5   24
296   echo
1   $days
7   days,
2   $hours
8   hours,
3   $min
4   minutes,
4   $sec
23   seconds
56   else
790   if
84   (
11   hours
11   &gt;=
214   1
210   )
189   then
296   echo
2   $hours
8   hours,
3   $min
4   minutes,
4   $sec
23   seconds
56   else
790   if
84   (
3   min
11   &gt;=
214   1
210   )
189   then
296   echo
3   $min
4   minutes,
4   $sec
23   seconds
56   else
296   echo
4   $sec
23   seconds
412   end
412   end
412   end
412   end
3   uptime
160   </tt></pre>

4   Define
3088   a
63   simple
436   set
2059   of
22   functions
1113   for

1   math,

6605   the
2   vectors
597   #
650   are
2   two-dimensional
2223   and

924   be

1307   in

3   rectangular
1041   or
3   polar
597   #
1   coordinates,
1307   in
93   either
5   radians
1041   or
1   degrees.
597   #
11   Basic
22   functions

1   adding,
1   subtracting,
1   multiplying,
1   dividing
597   #
2223   and
1   inverting
2   vectors
2059   of
6605   the
122   same
84   type

22   functions
1113   for
11   converting
597   #

3   rectangular
2223   and
3   polar

2223   and
64   between
5   degrees

1   radians.

29   Calculate
6605   the
28   day
2059   of
6605   the
12   week
33   corresponding
3144   to
3088   a
91   given
12   date.

1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.

65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
1   weekday(month,
7   day,
6   year)

7   days,
109   i
436   set
14   days
527   =
2   Sunday
2   Monday
1   Tuesday
1   Wednesday
1   Thursday
1   Friday
1   Saturday
597   #
4   Get
6605   the
10   Julian
7   day,
241   but
8   notice
1061   that
4   4713
3   BC
363   was
471   not
3088   a
2   leap
6   year.
790   if
1   ((i
527   =
4   `julian
2   $month
4   $day
1   $year`)
49   &lt;
1   58)
284   @
2   i++
159   return
1   days[(i
117   +
7   2)

1   7]

58   <pre><tt>#
13   Determine
201   which
11   alias,
72   procedure
1041   or
40   executable
383   file
380   will
12   run.
597   #
64   Copyright
65   (c)
1   1998-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
110   proc
2   possiblename(
31   s
210   )
94   local
5   c,
109   i
284   @
29   c
527   =
2   substr(
2   s,
18   0,
214   1
210   )
790   if
84   (
29   c
10   !~
1   "[a-zA-Z_@]"
210   )
159   return
120   0
1113   for
109   i
527   =
214   1
3144   to
1   strlen(
31   s
210   )
176   do
284   @
29   c
527   =
2   substr(
2   s,
22   i,
214   1
210   )
790   if
84   (
29   c
10   !~
1   "[a-zA-Z_@0-9]"
210   )
159   return
120   0
412   end
159   return
214   1
412   end
110   proc
1   which(
17   cmd
210   )
597   #
2   Figure
94   out
81   what
380   will
924   be
146   run
790   if
17   cmd
1837   is
13   typed.
597   #
983   The
76   search
25   order
2   is:
597   #
35   1.
17   Aliases
597   #
23   2.
8   Procedures
597   #
22   3.
3   Executable
294   files
94   local
48   result
790   if
84   (
1   $#cmd
210   )
189   then
790   if
84   (
2   possiblename(
17   cmd
210   )
210   )
189   then
597   #
7   Turn
91   off
18   errors
790   if
25   looking
1113   for
31   aliases
2223   and
1   procs
597   #
1061   that
38   don't
25   exist.
94   local
3   savenonovar
284   @
3   savenonovar
527   =
8   nonovar
284   @
8   nonovar
527   =
102   2
597   #
16   discard
18   errors
284   @
48   result
527   =
2   ``eval
164   alias
4   $cmd``
790   if
84   (
4   $#result
210   )
189   then
436   set
48   result
527   =
2   "alias
2   $result"
56   else
284   @
48   result
527   =
2   ``eval
110   proc
4   $cmd``
790   if
84   (
4   $#result
210   )
189   then
436   set
48   result
527   =
1   "proc
2   $result"
56   else
284   @
48   result
527   =
4   ``whereis
4   $cmd``
790   if
84   (
4   $#result
49   &gt;
214   1
210   )
284   @
48   result
527   =
2   result[
120   0
93   ]
412   end
597   #
4   Restore
6605   the
106   error
1   handling.
284   @
8   nonovar
527   =
3   savenonovar
412   end
56   else
284   @
48   result
527   =
4   ``whereis
4   $cmd``
790   if
84   (
4   $#result
49   &gt;
214   1
210   )
284   @
48   result
527   =
2   result[
120   0
93   ]
412   end
412   end
159   return
48   result
412   end
201   which
43   $argv

51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
27   Print
6605   the
21   Win32
63   message
33   corresponding
6605   the
91   given
106   error
21   code.

65   (c)
1   1993-2012
588   by
1043   Hamilton
64   Laboratories.
113   All
65   rights
62   reserved.
52   */
51   /*
52   */
51   /*
52   */
6   /***************************************************************************/
20   #include
4   &lt;windows.h&gt;
20   #include
1   &lt;ctype.h&gt;
20   #include
6   &lt;stdlib.h&gt;
20   #include
3   "<a
3   href="internat.htm">internat.h</a>"
6   void
2   main(
12   int
6   argc,
23   char
2   **argv
210   )
34   {
12   int
8   i;
2   HANDLE
8   Stdout
527   =
2   GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
3   Internationalize();
790   if
1   (Stdout
69   ==
1   INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
1   ExitProcess(GetLastError());
1113   for
11   (i
527   =
18   1;
109   i
49   &lt;
3   argc;
6   i++)
34   {
4   register
23   char
2   *p,
1   c;
5   DWORD
2   bytes;
1113   for
2   (p
527   =
1   argv[i];
29   c
527   =
2   *p,
29   c
32   &amp;&amp;
1   isdigit(c);
2   p++)
30   ;
790   if
1   (c
69   ==
10   0)
34   {
23   char
1   msg_buf[1024],
1   errno_buf[20],
1   NoHelp[]
527   =
1   "No
62   help
1837   is
16   available
1113   for
320   this
1   error.\r\n";
5   DWORD
1   Errno
527   =
1   (DWORD)atoi(argv[i]);
1   _itoa(Errno,
3   errno_buf,
1   10);
1113   for
2   (p
527   =
1   errno_buf;
2   *p;
2   p++)
30   ;
3   *p++
527   =
1   ':';
3   *p++
527   =
12   '
2   ';
3   *p++
527   =
12   '
2   ';
6   WriteFile(Stdout,
3   errno_buf,
32   p
91   -
3   errno_buf,
5   &amp;bytes,
6   NULL);
790   if
1   (bytes
527   =
1   FormatMessage(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM,
1   NULL,
1   Errno,
1   MAKELANGID(LANG_NEUTRAL,
1   SUBLANG_NEUTRAL),
2   msg_buf,
1   sizeof(msg_buf),
1   NULL))
6   WriteFile(Stdout,
2   msg_buf,
6   bytes,
5   &amp;bytes,
6   NULL);
56   else
6   WriteFile(Stdout,
1   NoHelp,
1   sizeof(NoHelp)
91   -
32   1,
5   &amp;bytes,
6   NULL);
49   }
56   else
34   {
23   char
1   NotNumeric[]
527   =
1   ":
29   No
62   help
3   available.
7   Error
4   codes
64   must
11   "
1   "be
1   numeric.\r\n";
95   while
1   (*p)
1   p++;
6   WriteFile(Stdout,
2   argv[i],
32   p
91   -
2   argv[i],
5   &amp;bytes,
6   NULL);
6   WriteFile(Stdout,
1   NotNumeric,
1   sizeof(NotNumeric)
91   -
32   1,
5   &amp;bytes,
6   NULL);
49   }
49   }
2   ExitProcess(0);
49   }

446   <h3>
1   binedit<br/>
10   <small><span
10   class="grey">Previous
10   |</span>
3314   <a
2   href="cat.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
9   Binary
1   Edit
91   Usage:
7   binedit
1   [-ih!-]
1   [-r
1   replace]
76   search
29   file1
99   [
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
7   binedit
1837   is
3088   a
44   very
63   simple
69   utility
1113   for
5   scanning
19   arbitrary
39   files,
25   looking
1113   for
2223   and
3   optionally
9   changing
439   any
35   references
3144   to
6605   the
76   search
77   argument
3144   to
6605   the
6   replacement
21   value.
7   binedit
1837   is
11   quite
33   useful
1   patching
72   binary
39   files,
95   e.g.,
3144   to
12   replace
364   all
30   occurrences
2059   of
1   C:\2.0
920   with
1   C:\2.1.
1   Occurrences
380   will
924   be
27   reported
857   as
18   hex
10   offsets
640   from
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
6605   the
294   files
675   you
32   name.
150   You
511   can
190   also
10   ask
7   binedit
3144   to
53   make
6605   the
3   change,
191   using
6605   the
29   -r
1   (replace)
43   option.
1   Nothing
1   fancy.
159   It
234   just
45   changes
364   all
1   occur-
1   rences
3144   to
6605   the
129   string
675   you
94   specify
2223   and
1   quits.
2   Neither
6605   the
76   search
9   nor
6605   the
12   replace
129   string
193   may
38   contain
48   null
19   characters,
241   but
19   otherwise
87   there
650   are
227   no
2   restrictions.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
30   -i
17   Ignore
172   character
97   case
1307   in
6605   the
76   search
12   argument.
29   -r
12   replace
4   Replace
439   any
30   occurrences
2059   of
6605   the
76   search
129   string
920   with
320   this
6   replacement
21   value.
9   -!
2   Pad
920   with
2   nulls
1041   or
4   truncate
6605   the
12   replace
129   string
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
122   same
38   length
857   as
6605   the
76   search
35   string.
2   (Otherwise,
102   it's
590   an
106   error
790   if
28   they're
58   different
1   lengths.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
4   Concatenate
29   Files
3144   to
8   Stdout
91   Usage:
24   cat
22   [-h-]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
24   cat
30   copies
6605   the
294   files
675   you
3   specify,
271   one
34   immediately
61   after
6   another,
50   onto
44   stdout.
29   No
11   end-of-file
1041   or
176   other
5   delimiter
197   characters
650   are
4   inserted
64   between
52   files.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

446   <h3>
1   cd<br/>
10   <small><span
10   class="grey">Previous
10   |</span>
3314   <a
2   href="chcp.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
27   Change
3144   to
3088   a
16   New
18   Current
17   Directory
91   Usage:
52   cd
2   [-chr-]
2   [+chr
93   ]
319   directory
52   cd
49   works
21   exactly
90   like
6605   the
271   one
1307   in
15   cmd.exe
588   by
9   default:
790   if
675   you
94   specify
3088   a
32   directory,
879   it
18   tries
3144   to
53   make
1061   that
6605   the
213   current
883   on
6605   the
11   appropriate
83   disk
241   but
12   won't
78   change
252   your
213   current
24   disk.
468   If
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
32   directory,
879   it
17   reports
6605   the
213   current
3   setting.
468   If
6605   the
89   path
675   you
94   specify
1837   is
234   just
61   3
1041   or
207   more
3   dots,
52   cd
380   will
10   interpret
1061   that
4   specially.
13   Just
857   as
10   ".."
99   means
19   go
157   up
271   one
3   level,
6   "..."
99   means
157   up
102   2
9   levels,
3   "...."
99   means
157   up
61   3
9   levels,
38   etc.
8   Note
1061   that
6   "..."
1837   is
190   also
3088   a
45   wildcard
11   notation
1113   for
29   zero
1041   or
207   more
319   directory
9   levels,
241   but
199   only
790   if
102   it's
15   preceded
588   by
2   "\",
27   "/",
3   "~"
1041   or
2   ":"
1041   or
42   followed
588   by
4   "\"
1041   or
27   "/",
113   so
10   usually
19   there's
227   no
4   conflict
920   with
320   this
11   notation
1113   for
17   going
157   up
30   multiple
103   directories
920   with
2   cd.
983   The
8   exception
1837   is
268   when
5   you'd
90   like
3144   to
19   go
157   up
30   multiple
103   directories
883   on
590   an
18   explicitly
152   specified
2   drive;
1307   in
1061   that
13   case,
8   you'll
299   have
3144   to
20   quote
6605   the
97   word
3144   to
28   turn
91   off
6605   the
8   wildcarding.
181   This
65   version
2059   of
52   cd
190   also
16   supports
2   CDPATH.
468   If
675   you
94   specify
3088   a
89   path
1061   that
22   isn't
12   found,
52   cd
380   will
43   look
109   through
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
439   any
103   directories
675   you
94   specify
1307   in
6605   the
6   CDPATH
90   environmental
243   variable
42   (or
6605   the
4   equivalent
9   cdpath
1129   shell
3   variable)
3144   to
43   see
790   if
6605   the
319   directory
675   you
84   want
1837   is
1307   in
271   one
2059   of
47   those
55   directories.
983   The
25   syntax
1113   for
6   CDPATH
2223   and
9   cdpath
1837   is
6605   the
122   same
857   as
1113   for
12   PATH
1041   or
89   path
42   except
1061   that
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
44   need
471   not
924   be
4   listed.
10   (See
190   also
6605   the
7   dirs,
7   pushd,
17   popd
2223   and
12   rotd
9   commands.)
97   Options:
468   If
675   you
436   set
6605   the
2   chgdisk
243   variable
11   equal
3144   to
214   1
4   (its
117   default
1837   is
4   0),
52   cd
380   will
37   automatically
78   change
213   current
18   disks
790   if
6605   the
319   directory
1837   is
883   on
55   another
26   drive.
983   The
8   +c
2223   and
64   -c
65   options
49   allow
675   you
3144   to
8   manually
41   control
320   this
112   drive
2   switching:
8   +c
2   Automatically
78   change
6605   the
213   current
83   disk
64   -c
26   Don't
37   automatically
78   change
213   current
83   disk
468   If
675   you
436   set
6605   the
3   cdhome
243   variable
3144   to
214   1
4   (its
117   default
1837   is
4   0),
52   cd
380   will
78   change
3144   to
252   your
40   home
319   directory
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
271   one
46   instead
2059   of
25   reporting
252   your
213   current
7   position.
150   You
511   can
8   manually
41   control
320   this
920   with
6605   the
4   +r
2223   and
29   -r
5   options:
4   +r
9   Report
241   but
38   don't
78   change
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
790   if
227   no
20   destination
319   directory
1837   is
25   specified.
29   -r
27   Change
3144   to
6605   the
40   home
319   directory
1307   in
320   this
3   situation.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>

11931   <li><a

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
27   Change
3144   to
3088   a
16   New
18   Current
17   Directory
91   Usage:
52   cd
2   [-chr-]
2   [+chr
93   ]
319   directory
52   cd
49   works
21   exactly
90   like
6605   the
271   one
1307   in
15   cmd.exe
588   by
9   default:
790   if
675   you
94   specify
3088   a
32   directory,
879   it
18   tries
3144   to
53   make
1061   that
6605   the
213   current
883   on
6605   the
11   appropriate
83   disk
241   but
12   won't
78   change
252   your
213   current
24   disk.
468   If
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
32   directory,
879   it
17   reports
6605   the
213   current
3   setting.
468   If
6605   the
89   path
675   you
94   specify
1837   is
234   just
61   3
1041   or
207   more
3   dots,
52   cd
380   will
10   interpret
1061   that
4   specially.
13   Just
857   as
10   ".."
99   means
19   go
157   up
271   one
3   level,
6   "..."
99   means
157   up
102   2
9   levels,
3   "...."
99   means
157   up
61   3
9   levels,
38   etc.
8   Note
1061   that
6   "..."
1837   is
190   also
3088   a
45   wildcard
11   notation
1113   for
29   zero
1041   or
207   more
319   directory
9   levels,
241   but
199   only
790   if
102   it's
15   preceded
588   by
2   "\",
27   "/",
3   "~"
1041   or
2   ":"
1041   or
42   followed
588   by
4   "\"
1041   or
27   "/",
113   so
10   usually
19   there's
227   no
4   conflict
920   with
320   this
11   notation
1113   for
17   going
157   up
30   multiple
103   directories
920   with
2   cd.
983   The
8   exception
1837   is
268   when
5   you'd
90   like
3144   to
19   go
157   up
30   multiple
103   directories
883   on
590   an
18   explicitly
152   specified
2   drive;
1307   in
1061   that
13   case,
8   you'll
299   have
3144   to
20   quote
6605   the
97   word
3144   to
28   turn
91   off
6605   the
8   wildcarding.
181   This
65   version
2059   of
52   cd
190   also
16   supports
2   CDPATH.
468   If
675   you
94   specify
3088   a
89   path
1061   that
22   isn't
12   found,
52   cd
380   will
43   look
109   through
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
439   any
103   directories
675   you
94   specify
1307   in
6605   the
6   CDPATH
90   environmental
243   variable
42   (or
6605   the
4   equivalent
9   cdpath
1129   shell
3   variable)
3144   to
43   see
790   if
6605   the
319   directory
675   you
84   want
1837   is
1307   in
271   one
2059   of
47   those
55   directories.
983   The
25   syntax
1113   for
6   CDPATH
2223   and
9   cdpath
1837   is
6605   the
122   same
857   as
1113   for
12   PATH
1041   or
89   path
42   except
1061   that
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
44   need
471   not
924   be
4   listed.
10   (See
190   also
6605   the
7   dirs,
7   pushd,
17   popd
2223   and
12   rotd
9   commands.)
97   Options:
468   If
675   you
436   set
6605   the
2   chgdisk
243   variable
11   equal
3144   to
214   1
4   (its
117   default
1837   is
4   0),
52   cd
380   will
37   automatically
78   change
213   current
18   disks
790   if
6605   the
319   directory
1837   is
883   on
55   another
26   drive.
983   The
8   +c
2223   and
64   -c
65   options
49   allow
675   you
3144   to
8   manually
41   control
320   this
112   drive
2   switching:
8   +c
2   Automatically
78   change
6605   the
213   current
83   disk
64   -c
26   Don't
37   automatically
78   change
213   current
83   disk
468   If
675   you
436   set
6605   the
3   cdhome
243   variable
3144   to
214   1
4   (its
117   default
1837   is
4   0),
52   cd
380   will
78   change
3144   to
252   your
40   home
319   directory
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
271   one
46   instead
2059   of
25   reporting
252   your
213   current
7   position.
150   You
511   can
8   manually
41   control
320   this
920   with
6605   the
4   +r
2223   and
29   -r
5   options:
4   +r
9   Report
241   but
38   don't
78   change
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
790   if
227   no
20   destination
319   directory
1837   is
25   specified.
29   -r
27   Change
3144   to
6605   the
40   home
319   directory
1307   in
320   this
3   situation.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)

446   <h3>
1   chgrp<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="cat.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="chmod.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   chgrp:
27   Change
6605   the
26   group
1113   for
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
91   Usage:
13   chgrp
1   [-rth-]
4   groupid
29   file1
99   [
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
13   chgrp
380   will
78   change
6605   the
26   group
34   information
19   associated
920   with
8   NTFS
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
3144   to
6605   the
152   specified
5   group.
13   chgrp
380   will
471   not
146   run
126   under
841   Windows
7   9x.
983   The
4   groupid
193   may
924   be
152   specified
857   as
93   either
3088   a
63   simple
152   name
1041   or
857   as
3088   a
2   machine\name
5   pair.
3   (Warning:
14   specifying
3088   a
152   name
883   on
55   another
22   machine
511   can
16   take
35   several
23   seconds
1113   for
13   network
2   handshaking.)
983   The
4   groupid
1837   is
7   omitted
920   with
6605   the
27   -t
43   option.
103   To
270   use
320   this
29   command,
675   you
64   must
299   have
320   this
2   right,
201   which
511   can
924   be
2   granted
17   via
6605   the
19   User
1   Manager:
4   Restore
294   files
2223   and
103   directories
97   Options:
29   -r
2   Recursive.
468   If
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
9   paths
152   specified
1837   is
3088   a
32   directory,
13   chgrp
380   will
10   recursively
5   walk
109   through
6605   the
33   entire
319   directory
6   tree,
9   changing
6605   the
26   group
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
6   contents.
27   -t
2   Take.
27   Change
6605   the
26   group
3144   to
6605   the
122   same
857   as
6605   the
3   primary
26   group
2059   of
6605   the
213   current
20   process.
983   The
4   groupid
77   argument
1837   is
5   omitted.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

1   chmod<br/>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
27   Change
10   Mode
2   Bits
883   on
29   Files
7   (not
1   Directories)
91   Usage:
9   chmod
1   [-+]
1   [rRAHSCwh]
4   pathname1
99   [
4   pathname2
57   ...
93   ]
97   Options:
29   -r
5   Recursively
78   change
40   contents
2059   of
55   directories.
2   +R
5   Read-only
44   mode
1837   is
11   set.
53   (The
383   file
1837   is
1   write-protected.)
10   -R
5   Read-only
44   mode
1837   is
29   turned
13   off.
1   +A
10   Archive
49   bit
1837   is
11   set.
8   -A
10   Archive
49   bit
1837   is
29   turned
13   off.
3   +H
6   Hidden
44   mode
1837   is
11   set.
9   -H
6   Hidden
44   mode
1837   is
29   turned
13   off.
2   +S
2   Mark
857   as
3088   a
22   System
96   file.
15   -S
2   Mark
857   as
3088   a
17   normal
55   user
96   file.
2   +C
1   Compress
6605   the
383   file
14   or,
790   if
102   it's
3088   a
32   directory,
12   mark
879   it
113   so
439   any
257   new
294   files
33   created
87   there
380   will
924   be
3   compressed.
2   (Supported
199   only
126   under
841   Windows
81   NT
37   release
9   3.51
1041   or
11   later
2223   and
199   only
790   if
21   supported
588   by
6605   the
1   filesystem.)
16   -C
1   De-compress
6605   the
383   file
14   or,
790   if
102   it's
3088   a
32   directory,
12   mark
879   it
113   so
257   new
294   files
33   created
87   there
380   will
471   not
924   be
3   compressed.
21   -w
4   Give
3088   a
12   warning
63   message
241   but
23   continue
35   trying
3144   to
9   chmod
439   any
10   remaining
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
115   even
790   if
46   problems
132   were
18   encountered
920   with
101   some
2059   of
21   them.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   chown<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="chmod.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="cmp.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   chown:
27   Change
6605   the
13   ownership
2059   of
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
91   Usage:
16   chown
1   [-ADPrRtTh-]
12   userid
29   file1
99   [
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
16   chown
380   will
78   change
6605   the
13   ownership
2059   of
8   NTFS
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
3144   to
6605   the
152   specified
8   user.
16   chown
380   will
471   not
146   run
126   under
841   Windows
7   9x.
983   The
12   userid
193   may
924   be
152   specified
857   as
93   either
3088   a
63   simple
152   name
1041   or
857   as
3088   a
2   machine\name
5   pair.
3   (Warning:
14   specifying
3088   a
152   name
883   on
55   another
22   machine
511   can
16   take
35   several
23   seconds
1113   for
13   network
2   handshaking.)
983   The
12   userid
1837   is
7   omitted
268   when
191   using
6605   the
1   -R,
27   -t
1041   or
15   -T
118   options.
103   To
270   use
320   this
428   command
3144   to
16   take
13   ownership
1113   for
2   yourself,
675   you
64   must
299   have
320   this
3   right:
3   Take
13   ownership
2059   of
294   files
1041   or
176   other
5   objects
468   If
675   you
161   would
90   like
3144   to
4   grant
13   ownership
3144   to
55   another
5   userid,
675   you
64   must
190   also
299   have
320   this
3   right:
4   Restore
294   files
2223   and
103   directories
30   These
65   rights
511   can
924   be
2   granted
17   via
6605   the
19   User
3   Manager.
97   Options:
8   -A
9   Add
590   an
44   access
41   control
20   entry
3144   to
439   any
44   access
41   control
1   lists,
1   granting
31   full
44   access
3144   to
6605   the
257   new
2   owner.
25   -D
47   Default
2   ACL,
1   inheriting
640   from
6605   the
21   parent
241   but
21   adding
590   an
1   ACE
19   allowing
31   full
44   access
3144   to
6605   the
257   new
2   owner.
11   -P
1   Private.
9   Add
590   an
4   ACL
3144   to
197   each
383   file
19   allowing
31   full
44   access
3144   to
6605   the
257   new
4   owner
241   but
227   no
44   access
3144   to
5   anyone
5   else.
29   -r
2   Recursive.
468   If
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
9   paths
152   specified
1837   is
3088   a
32   directory,
16   chown
380   will
10   recursively
5   walk
109   through
6605   the
33   entire
319   directory
6   tree,
9   changing
6605   the
13   ownership
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
6   contents.
10   -R
8   Remove
439   any
1   ACL.
983   The
12   userid
77   argument
1837   is
5   omitted.
3   (Warning:
3088   a
48   null
4   ACL
3   grants
31   full
44   access
3144   to
5   everyone
2223   and
29   cannot
924   be
6   edited
920   with
6605   the
243   Microsoft
2   cacls
6   command.)
983   The
12   userid
77   argument
1837   is
5   omitted.
27   -t
2   Take.
27   Change
6605   the
13   ownership
3144   to
6605   the
122   same
857   as
1061   that
2059   of
6605   the
213   current
20   process.
468   If
675   you
650   are
92   running
12   elevated
857   as
590   an
1   Administrator,
13   ownership
380   will
924   be
25   taken
1307   in
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
1061   that
5   group.
84   (This
1837   is
113   so
1061   that
1   Administrators
511   can
8   easily
4   share
3   files.)
983   The
12   userid
77   argument
1837   is
5   omitted.
15   -T
3   Take
13   ownership
1307   in
252   your
51   own
12   name,
115   even
790   if
675   you
92   running
12   elevated
857   as
590   an
1   Administrator.
983   The
12   userid
77   argument
1837   is
5   omitted.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

446   <h3>
1   cmp<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="chown.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="cp.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
9   Binary
8   Compare
2   Two
29   Files
1041   or
23   Directories
91   Usage:
12   cmp
1   [-lsdxoph-]
3   [-r&lt;radix&gt;]
29   file1
28   file2
12   cmp
3   compares
294   files
2223   and
12   directories,
7   byte
588   by
1   byte.
468   If
104   they
650   are
1   identical,
12   cmp
25   writes
227   no
64   output
2223   and
13   exits
920   with
3088   a
159   return
66   code
2059   of
16   0.
468   If
104   they
1   differ,
12   cmp
1   will,
588   by
38   default,
38   report
6605   the
3   location
2059   of
6605   the
281   first
13   difference
2223   and
44   exit
920   with
3088   a
159   return
66   code
2059   of
35   1.
468   If
271   one
18   operand
1837   is
3088   a
319   directory
2223   and
6605   the
176   other
1837   is
3088   a
39   file,
12   cmp
380   will
43   look
1113   for
2223   and
24   compare
27   against
3088   a
383   file
2059   of
1061   that
122   same
152   name
1307   in
6605   the
92   directory.
4   Comparing
12   directories,
12   cmp
8   builds
28   lists
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
294   files
104   they
2   contain,
7   searching
364   all
6605   the
90   way
27   down
109   through
6605   the
7   tree.
983   The
28   lists
650   are
2   sorted,
189   then
3   compared.
468   If
6605   the
122   same
320   filename
9   exists
1307   in
197   each
319   directory
6   tree,
104   they
650   are
3   compared.
983   The
281   first
13   difference
380   will
924   be
27   reported
588   by
372   line
15   number,
80   always
1307   in
5   decimal,
2223   and
6   offset
640   from
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
6605   the
39   file,
13   counting
640   from
4   zero,
1307   in
6605   the
12   radix
152   specified
920   with
6605   the
4   -d,
2   -x,
15   -o
1041   or
29   -r
18   option,
1041   or
588   by
6605   the
3   RADIX
76   environment
39   variable,
790   if
67   set,
1041   or
1307   in
6605   the
117   default
12   radix
6   16
1   (hex).
97   Options:
27   -l
29   List
364   all
6605   the
4   differences,
1   showing,
1113   for
1   each,
6605   the
6   offset
640   from
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
6605   the
383   file
2223   and
6605   the
45   values
2059   of
6605   the
7   differing
55   characters.
1   Offsets
2223   and
2223   and
172   character
45   values
380   will
924   be
26   shown
1307   in
6605   the
12   radix
5   chosen
588   by
6605   the
8   user.
66   -s
18   Write
4   nothing
1113   for
7   differing
3   files;
234   just
436   set
6605   the
159   return
21   code.
12   -p
3   POSIX-compatible
1   reporting:
439   any
63   message
106   text
380   will
924   be
3   presented
21   exactly
857   as
152   specified
588   by
6605   the
27   POSIX
1   1003.2
4   standard,
10   offsets
20   within
6605   the
294   files
380   will
924   be
6   counted
31   starting
277   at
32   1,
471   not
18   0,
2223   and
6605   the
45   values
2059   of
439   any
7   differing
41   bytes
380   will
924   be
26   shown
1307   in
9   octal.
39   -d
5   Decimal
4   radix.
29   -x
2   Hex.
15   -o
2   Octal.
4   -r&lt;radix&gt;
3   User-specified
4   radix.
468   If
3088   a
12   radix
49   &lt;
20   8
1837   is
62   specified,
199   only
6605   the
172   character
45   values
380   will
924   be
26   shown
1307   in
1061   that
1   radix;
10   offsets
380   will
924   be
26   shown
1307   in
4   hex.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

87   <pre><tt>
18   Copy
29   Files
1041   or
23   Directories
91   Usage:
39   cp
1   [-cfilmsh-]
4   source1
99   [
3   source2
57   ...
93   ]
20   destination
39   cp
511   can
60   copy
56   both
294   files
2223   and
55   directories.
468   If
6605   the
20   destination
1837   is
590   an
31   existing
32   directory,
6605   the
51   source
1   object(s)
380   will
924   be
23   copied
178   into
1061   that
92   directory.
468   If
207   more
171   than
271   one
51   source
8   object
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
20   destination
64   must
924   be
3088   a
32   directory,
241   but
879   it
44   need
471   not
55   already
25   exist.
468   If
3088   a
20   destination
383   file
55   already
4   exists,
879   it
380   will
924   be
1   overwritten;
320   this
1837   is
471   not
66   considered
590   an
106   error
2223   and
227   no
5   diagnostic
63   message
1837   is
10   given.
32   By
38   default,
23   security
8   descriptors
2223   and
44   access
41   control
28   lists
650   are
471   not
23   copied
640   from
51   source
3144   to
4   destination.
181   This
1837   is
1307   in
7   keeping
920   with
6605   the
841   Windows
22   convention
1061   that
23   security
1837   is
15   generally
37   inherited
109   through
6605   the
319   directory
7   structure.
97   Options:
64   -c
6   Continue
115   even
790   if
18   errors
650   are
18   encountered
7   attempting
3144   to
70   process
101   some
58   input
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
47   -f
10   Force
22   read-only
294   files
3144   to
924   be
3   overwritten.
30   -i
3   Interactive:
4   Ask
98   before
9   copying
197   each
8   object
883   on
6605   the
428   command
75   line.
27   -l
3   Logging
1837   is
3   on:
16   Display
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
197   each
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
857   as
102   it's
5   copied.
12   -m
7   Merge
2   sub-directories
2059   of
122   same
152   name
1307   in
51   source
2223   and
4   destination.
66   -s
3   Simple
8   copy.
3   (Default.)
9   Do
471   not
60   copy
23   security
8   descriptors
2223   and
44   access
41   control
4   lists.
3   +s
18   Copy
23   security
8   descriptors
2223   and
44   access
4   lists.
35   Under
841   Windows
17   9x
1041   or
790   if
6605   the
20   destination
15   filesystem
135   does
471   not
54   support
2   ACLs,
49   that's
471   not
44   possible
2223   and
6605   the
23   security
34   information
380   will
924   be
8   lost.
181   This
1837   is
471   not
66   considered
590   an
106   error
2223   and
227   no
5   diagnostic
63   message
1837   is
10   given.

11   (this
76   screen.)

2059   of
118   options.

11   Run
4   Commands
277   at
5   Specified
2   Times
91   Usage:
46   cron
1   [-asLwW!h-]
2   [-o&lt;opt&gt;]
4   [-d
1   &lt;dir&gt;]
99   [
1   crontab1
1   crontab2
57   ...
93   ]
498   |
6   -install
9   [-N
7   &lt;name&gt;]

7   &lt;dispname&gt;]

498   |

9   [-N
7   &lt;name&gt;]
8   [-D
7   &lt;dispname&gt;]
46   cron
3   executes
62   commands
277   at
8   times
10   according
3144   to
6605   the
15   crontab
2   (.crt)
294   files
1   specifed.
468   If
439   any
89   path
152   specified
1837   is
3088   a
32   directory,
46   cron
380   will
146   run
439   any
15   crontab
294   files
1307   in
1061   that
319   directory
1041   or
439   any
2   subdirectory.
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
62   specified,
46   cron
380   will
125   read
6605   the
15   crontab
640   from
29   stdin.
45   Each
383   file
1837   is
6   expected
3144   to
38   contain
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
13   activities
3144   to
924   be
146   run
277   at
28   certain
4   times,
152   specified
271   one
26   per
75   line.
29   There
650   are
2   six
35   fields
26   per
31   line,
29   separated
588   by
68   white
13   space.
983   The
281   first
4   five
1   specify:
5   minute
1   (0-59)
3   hour
1   (0-23)
28   day
2059   of
6605   the
26   month
1   (1-31)
26   month
2059   of
6605   the
24   year
1   (1-12)
28   day
2059   of
6605   the
12   week
1   (0-6,
120   0
1837   is
1   Sunday)
45   Each
2059   of
94   these
35   fields
193   may
924   be
590   an
1   asterisk
3   (meaning
364   all
13   legal
1   values)
1041   or
3088   a
2   comma-separated
190   list
2059   of
1   elements,
105   where
197   each
14   element
1837   is
93   either
3088   a
110   single
165   number
1041   or
3088   a
7   range,
91   given
857   as
94   two
21   numbers
29   separated
588   by
3088   a
1   minus.
468   If
93   either
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
22   range
1837   is
3   omitted,
879   it
9   defaults
3144   to
6605   the
1   highest/lowest
13   legal
20   value,
857   as
4   appropriate.
468   If
6605   the
14   days
650   are
152   specified
1307   in
56   both
28   day
2059   of
6605   the
26   month
2223   and
28   day
2059   of
6605   the
12   week
4   fields,
6605   the
2   union
2059   of
47   those
35   fields
1837   is
3   used;
3144   to
94   specify
6605   the
14   days
588   by
199   only
271   one
1   field,
6605   the
176   other
131   should
924   be
590   an
2   asterisk.
111   For
101   example,
120   0
120   0
214   1
41   *
214   1
99   means
146   run
6605   the
428   command
277   at
1   midnight
883   on
6605   the
281   first
2059   of
23   every
26   month
2223   and
190   also
883   on
23   every
1   Monday.
983   The
2   sixth
39   field
2059   of
197   each
372   line
1837   is
3088   a
428   command
1061   that
1837   is
3144   to
924   be
13   executed
588   by
6605   the
1129   shell
277   at
6605   the
152   specified
3   times.
39   Any
2   percent
197   characters
1307   in
320   this
39   field
2   (unless
8   escaped
588   by
6605   the
121   escape
2   character)
650   are
2   translated
3144   to
9   carriage
2   return/newline
2   combinations.
15   Only
6605   the
281   first
372   line
2   (up
3144   to
6605   the
281   first
60   %
1041   or
412   end
2059   of
4   line)
1837   is
73   passed
857   as
3088   a
6   command;
6605   the
176   other
111   lines
650   are
63   written
3144   to
6605   the
1129   shell
857   as
29   stdin.
468   If
227   no
58   input
111   lines
650   are
34   given,
6605   the
1129   shell
380   will
12   inherit
36   stdin
6   opened
3144   to
6605   the
5   nul
10   device.
6   Blank
111   lines
2223   and
439   any
111   lines
45   beginning
920   with
597   #
380   will
924   be
66   considered
857   as
4   comments.
468   If
6605   the
15   crontab
363   was
125   read
640   from
3088   a
39   file,
6605   the
1129   shell
380   will
12   inherit
30   stdout
2223   and
17   stderr
5   handles
1113   for
56   writing

790   if
6605   the
383   file

3144   to
3088   a
383   file
33   created
588   by
4   replacing
6605   the
3   .crt

6605   the
15   crontab

920   with
1   .nnn,
105   where
2   nnn
1837   is
6605   the
2   linenumber
1307   in
6605   the
3   .crt
96   file.
11   (If
6605   the
15   crontab
363   was
125   read
640   from
7   stdin,
189   then
6605   the
1129   shell
380   will
12   inherit
6605   the
30   stdout
2223   and
17   stderr
1061   that
46   cron
37   inherited
268   when
879   it
1   started.)
468   If
3088   a
25   syntax
1041   or
176   other
106   error
1837   is
18   encountered
1307   in
3088   a
1   crontab,
1061   that
31   line,
241   but
471   not
6605   the
16   rest
2059   of
6605   the
383   file
380   will
924   be
22   ignored.
983   The
1   rationale
1837   is
1061   that
46   cron
131   should
23   continue
92   running
115   even
790   if
879   it
10   encounters
1   problems;
879   it
131   should
471   not
924   be
14   necessary
3144   to
1   restart
879   it
234   just
64   because
271   one
20   entry
1307   in
271   one
15   crontab
24   contained
590   an
19   error.
32   By
38   default,
790   if
6605   the
15   crontab
1837   is
125   read
640   from
3088   a
39   file,
62   commands
380   will
924   be
146   run
2   asynchronously,
54   meaning
1061   that
364   all
8   entries
1061   that
650   are
5   ready
3144   to
146   run
277   at
439   any
91   given
96   time

924   be
11   quickly
2   spawned,
271   one

61   after

6   waiting
1113   for
197   each
3144   to
24   complete

6605   the

1837   is
4   spawned.
468   If
6605   the
15   crontab
1837   is
125   read
640   from
7   stdin,
6605   the
117   default
380   will
924   be
1   synchronous
3   execution,
54   meaning
197   each
64   must
24   complete
98   before
6605   the
71   next
1   starts;
49   that's
113   so
439   any
64   output
640   from

924   be
1   jumbled

1061   that
2059   of
6   another.
30   These
9   defaults
511   can
924   be
2   overridden
920   with
230   command-line
118   options.
10   Once
102   it's
4   started,
46   cron
380   will
53   make
590   an
20   initial
4   scan
2059   of
6605   the
15   crontab
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
10   Once
23   every
5   minute
61   after
1061   that
879   it
380   will
43   look
1113   for
439   any
45   changes
588   by
12   comparing
19   timestamps
883   on
6605   the
52   files.
3   Running
10   Cron
857   as
3088   a
1   Service:
35   Under
841   Windows
240   NT,
87   there
650   are
94   two
14   ways
3144   to
146   run
3   cron.
983   The
6   simplest
1837   is
857   as
590   an
37   ordinary
20   process.
58   But
46   cron
511   can
190   also
924   be
146   run
857   as
3088   a
7   service,
201   which
99   means
879   it
511   can
146   run
115   even
126   under
3088   a
58   different
12   ID
171   than
6605   the
1   person
10   currently
3   logged
1307   in
1041   or
115   even
268   when
227   no
271   one
1837   is
3   logged
7   in.
106   When
146   run
857   as
3088   a
7   service,
46   cron
511   can
924   be
436   set
157   up
3144   to
87   start
157   up
37   automatically
268   when
841   Windows
81   NT
1837   is
1   booted
1041   or
1113   for
2   manual
18   startup
191   using
6605   the
3   Services
4   applet
1307   in
6605   the
12   Control
3   Panel.
12   Finally,
857   as
7   service,
46   cron
511   can
924   be
93   either
3   interactive,
54   meaning
879   it
2223   and
122   its
12   children
51   get
44   access
3144   to
6605   the

1041   or
1   non-interactive,
54   meaning

2223   and

12   children

146   run
1   invisibly,
920   with
227   no

64   output
2223   and
227   no
99   means
1113   for

109   through
6605   the
13   keyboard

1   mouse.
39   Any
106   error
26   messages

924   be
8   appended
3144   to
3088   a
1   cron.log

6605   the

319   directory

26   messages
63   written
3144   to
6605   the

924   be
8   lost.
983   The
7   choice
2059   of
92   running
46   cron
857   as
93   either
590   an
12   interactive
1041   or
5   non-
12   interactive
21   service
1837   is
5   this:
790   if
675   you
146   run

3   interactively,

87   there
193   may
924   be
3088   a

30   since

21   appear
2223   and

924   be
29   able

1   interact

6605   the
16   applications
46   cron

1307   in
14   ways
675   you
147   didn't
1   intend.
139   Also,
6605   the
55   user

924   be
1   annoyed

3   popping

17   going

920   with
3   cron.
11   On
6605   the
176   other
3   hand,
790   if
675   you

46   cron
1   non-interactively,

675   you
193   may
471   not
924   be
29   able
3144   to
270   use

3144   to
2   schedule
26   everything
675   you
1   need.
111   For
101   example,

87   start

3088   a

3144   to
6605   the

3144   to
6605   the

21   An

3144   to

21   service

2   Service
97   Options:
6   -install
2   Install
46   cron
857   as
3088   a
11   service.
983   The
84   following
65   options

924   be

1   -install:
19   -u

11   Run

983   The
55   user

1307   in

1   domain,

1   .\Username.
983   The

6605   the

103   To

3088   a

103   To

1   Pull

4   grant
1061   that
37   right
3144   to
8   selected
6   groups
1041   or
9   users.
12   -p
2   &lt;password&gt;
2   Login
7   password
1113   for
6605   the
152   specified
55   user
32   name.
9   -H
1   &lt;directory&gt;
6   Home
319   directory
1061   that
6605   the
46   cron
21   service
131   should
87   start
157   up
7   in.
47   Default
1837   is
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
277   at
6605   the
96   time
6605   the
21   install
363   was
11   done.
5   -M
2   Manual
12   startup.
47   Default
1837   is
3144   to
18   startup
37   automatically
268   when
841   Windows
81   NT
1837   is
1   booted.
10   -I
1   Interactive.
47   Default
1837   is
5   non-
1   interactive.
261   A
21   service
511   can
471   not
924   be
16   installed
857   as
12   interactive
790   if
6605   the
19   -u
192   option
1837   is
25   specified.
5   &lt;arguments&gt;
39   Any
7   run-time
74   arguments
3144   to
924   be
73   passed
3144   to
46   cron
268   when
879   it
4   starts.
8   Note
1061   that
439   any
65   options
78   being
436   set
157   up
1113   for
6605   the
21   service
1   MUST
13   follow
439   any
6   -install
118   options.
983   The
281   first
192   option
49   that's
471   not
590   an
6   -install
192   option
1837   is
13   assumed
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
7   run-time
43   option.
29   No
25   syntax
1041   or
176   other
6   checks
650   are
56   made
13   during
18   installation
1061   that
6605   the
7   run-time
74   arguments
650   are
3   sensible.
468   If
227   no
74   arguments
650   are
91   given
920   with
93   either
6   -install
1041   or
1   -start,
46   cron
380   will
43   look
1113   for
15   crontab
2   (.crt)
294   files
1307   in
6605   the
40   home
92   directory.
2   -start
5   &lt;arguments&gt;
22   Start
6605   the
14   previously
16   installed
46   cron
7   service,
6   passing
879   it
34   whatever
74   arguments
193   may
924   be
3   desired.
468   If
6605   the
6   -install
18   operation
190   also
152   specified
590   an
77   argument
10   list,
320   this
77   argument
190   list
380   will
14   override
61   it.
2   -stop
2   Stop
6605   the
46   cron
11   service.
2   -pause
2   Pause
6605   the
46   cron
11   service.
2   -continue
1   Allow
46   cron
3144   to
23   continue
21   execution
61   after
25   having
382   been
1   paused.
2   -delete
16   Delete
1   (uninstall)
6605   the
46   cron
11   service.
3   -status
9   Report
6605   the
60   status
2059   of
6605   the
46   cron
11   service.
113   All
6605   the
21   service
65   options
4   above
25   accept
6605   the
84   following
23   additional
65   options
1113   for
14   specifying
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
1   service:
26   -N
3   &lt;name&gt;
2   Service
152   name
1113   for
3   naming
6605   the
20   entry
1307   in
6605   the
1   Registry.
25   -D
1   &lt;dispname&gt;
16   Display
152   name
1113   for
270   use
1307   in
6605   the
3   Services
5   applet.
35   Under
240   NT,
197   each
21   service
289   has
94   two
2   names:
271   one
1837   is
6605   the
21   service
12   name,
201   which
1837   is
6605   the
152   name
126   under
201   which
364   all
6605   the
34   information
47   about
1061   that
21   service
1837   is
18   stored
1307   in
6605   the
2   registry.
983   The
33   second
1837   is
6605   the
26   display
12   name,
201   which
1837   is
6605   the
207   more
1   human-readable
152   name
26   shown
1307   in
6605   the
3   Services
4   applet
1307   in
6605   the
12   Control
3   Panel.
32   By
38   default,
6605   the
21   service
152   name
1113   for
46   cron
1837   is
1   "Hamilton_Cron"
2223   and
6605   the
26   display
152   name
1837   is
2   "Hamilton
10   Cron
1   Service".
106   When
2   installing
3088   a
7   service,
56   both
6605   the
21   service
152   name
2223   and
6605   the
26   display
152   name
64   must
924   be
1   unique;
1061   that
2   is,
87   there
20   can't
924   be
439   any
176   other
1   services
55   already
16   installed
920   with
1061   that
21   service
152   name
1041   or
920   with
1061   that
26   display
32   name.
10   Once
2   installed,
93   either
152   name
193   may
924   be
281   used
3144   to
20   refer
3144   to
6605   the
11   service.
1   General
97   Options:
29   -a
1   Asynchronous
6   execution.
26   Don't
14   wait
1113   for
271   one
428   command
3144   to
24   complete
98   before
7   spawning
6605   the
5   next,
115   even
790   if
6605   the
15   crontab
363   was
125   read
640   from
29   stdin.
66   -s
1   Synchronous
6   execution.
4   Always
14   wait
1113   for
271   one
428   command
3144   to
24   complete
98   before
7   spawning
6605   the
5   next,
115   even
790   if
6605   the
15   crontab
363   was
125   read
640   from
3088   a
96   file.
17   -L
1   Logging.
23   As
197   each
428   command
1837   is
2   spawned,
19   timestamp
2223   and
6   log
879   it
3144   to
30   stdout
2223   and
3144   to
6605   the
64   output
383   file
790   if
49   that's
471   not
6605   the
122   same
857   as
44   stdout.
21   -w
7   Wait
42   until
6605   the
71   next
50   whole
1   minute.
468   If
46   cron
32   wasn't
150   started
3   near
3088   a
50   whole
5   minute
9   (i.e.,
29   zero
3144   to
16   three
23   seconds
8   past
3088   a
50   whole
5   minute
1   mark),
14   wait
42   until
6605   the
71   next
50   whole
5   minute
98   before
45   beginning
3144   to
2   schedule
46   cron
1   events.
2   -o&lt;opt&gt;
1   Remainder
2059   of
97   word
35   contains
65   options
3144   to
924   be
73   passed
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
920   with
439   any
71   commands.
20   E.g.,
1   -oF
99   means
1930   C
1129   shell
131   should
176   do
14   fast
18   startup
268   when
92   running
71   commands.
39   -d
1   &lt;dir&gt;
3   Output
294   files
131   should
924   be
33   created
1307   in
6605   the
152   specified
32   directory,
471   not
6605   the
319   directory
105   where
6605   the
3   .crt
294   files
132   were
8   found.
9   -!
2   Install
3088   a
17   interrupt
4   handler
3144   to
1   shield
46   cron
2223   and
122   its
12   children
640   from
8   Ctrl-C
2223   and
3   Ctrl-Break
2   interrupts.
4   (Remember
3144   to
84   type
320   this
192   option
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
190   list
113   so
6605   the
67   space
2   afterward
380   will
4   prevent
879   it
640   from
78   being
13   confused
857   as
3088   a
112   history
2   reference.)
4   -W
8   Open
3088   a
257   new
43   console
66   window
46   rather
171   than
191   using
6605   the
213   current
11   one.
15   Only
5   meaningful
1113   for
46   cron
146   run
857   as
590   an
37   ordinary
6   process,
241   but
33   useful
790   if
6605   the
9   -!
192   option
1837   is
25   specified.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   csh<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="cron.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="cut.htm">Next</a></small>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
8   shell(tm)
91   Usage:
15   csh
1   [-!BbefFhHiKLlNnPQ.sTtuxXYZ-]
1   [-IO]
1   [+IO]
1   [-cC
1   command]
2   [arguments]
97   Options:
9   -!
17   Ignore
1   errors:
6   Continue
21   execution
115   even
790   if
3088   a
428   command
1   terminates
1   abnormally.
2   (Implied
588   by
3   interactive.)
8   -B
67   Berkeley
44   mode
1113   for
25   better
29   compatibility
920   with
6605   the
1   BSD4.3
1930   C
1129   shell
1113   for
364   all
228   commands,
471   not
234   just
47   those
125   read
640   from
3088   a
159   script
31   starting
920   with
3   #!/bin/csh.
32   -b
29   No
67   Berkeley
29   compatibility
44   mode
277   at
6   all,
471   not
115   even
883   on
52   scripts
31   starting
920   with
3   #!/bin/csh.
64   -c
7   Execute
6605   the
428   command
84   following
883   on
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
189   then
7   exit.
4   (Implies
471   not
3   interactive.)
16   -C
10   Normally,
320   this
99   means
34   immediately
146   run
6605   the
428   command
883   on
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
189   then
23   continue
920   with
17   normal
18   startup
2223   and
13   processing
2059   of
29   stdin.
58   But
1113   for
29   compatibility
920   with
2   cmd.exe,
6605   the
7   -X
192   option
193   may
924   be
281   used
3144   to
2   toggle
320   this
3144   to
299   have
6605   the
122   same
54   meaning
857   as
64   -c
241   but
920   with
6605   the
20   initial
1   greeting
2223   and
6   copyright
8   notice
2   suppressed.
34   -e
4   Echo
6605   the
15   raw
58   input
3144   to
44   stdout.
1   (Sets
3   echoallinput
527   =
2   1.)
47   -f
3   Fast
2   startup:
26   Don't
43   look
1113   for
3088   a
26   startup.csh
96   file.
12   -F
3   Faster
2   startup:
26   Don't
43   look
1113   for
3088   a
26   startup.csh
383   file
2223   and
38   don't
13   hash
6605   the
89   path
1   directores.
9   -H
1   Heapstats.
10   At
101   some
2   penalty
1307   in
4   performance,
320   this
39   causes
6605   the
1129   shell
3144   to
8   keep
3088   a
16   count
2059   of
6605   the
165   number
2223   and
14   total
24   size
2059   of
364   all
5   objects
4   allocated
1041   or
1   freed
640   from
6605   the
4   heap.
4   Statistics
511   can
924   be
10   displayed
191   using
6605   the
6   heapstat
47   command.
30   -i
2   Interactive
2   (even
790   if
36   stdin
19   appears
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
383   file
1041   or
3088   a
1   pipe):
8   Prompt
1113   for
58   input
2223   and
32   show
6605   the
48   result
2059   of
112   history
4   substitutions.
10   -I
22   Start
920   with
230   command-line
57   editing
1307   in
7   insert
27   mode.
1   +I
22   Start
23   every
428   command
1307   in
7   insert
27   mode.
1   -K
9   Do
3088   a
14   fast
3   startup,
3   skipping
56   both
6605   the
17   login.csh
2223   and
26   startup.csh
39   files,
146   run
6605   the
428   command
883   on
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
2223   and
7   exit.
17   -L
2   Login
7   shell:
6   Look
1113   for
17   login.csh
2223   and
176   do
112   history
3   save
277   at
44   exit
790   if
2   savehist
69   ==
35   1.
27   -l
38   Same
857   as
2   -L,
54   meaning
320   this
1837   is
3088   a
11   login
55   shell.
26   -N
29   No
67   space
61   after
6605   the
77   last
320   filename
14   generated
588   by
320   filename
10   completion.
181   This
1837   is
6605   the
117   default
2223   and
3   overrides
1   -S.
45   -n
29   No
2   execution:
4   Parse
62   commands
25   looking
1113   for
25   syntax
18   errors
241   but
38   don't
16   execute
21   them.
9   -O
22   Start
920   with
230   command-line
57   editing
1307   in
3   overstrike
1   (default)
27   mode.
2   +O
22   Start
23   every
428   command
1307   in
3   overstrike
27   mode.
11   -P
1   Word-oriented
428   command
372   line
57   editing
23   operations
380   will
11   treat
28   individual
37   pathname
9   segments
857   as
48   separate
27   words.
8   -Q
4   Quiet:
2   Skip
6605   the
6   opening
6   copyright
2   notice.
7   -.
26   Used
920   with
1   -P,
39   causes
3   periods
3144   to
924   be
66   considered
857   as
97   word
1   separators
1307   in
428   command
372   line
57   editing
2059   of
2   pathnames.
66   -s
24   Read
2223   and
16   execute
3088   a
110   single
372   line
640   from
29   stdin.
4   (Implies
471   not
3   interactive.)
15   -S
6   Put
3088   a
67   space
61   after
6605   the
77   last
320   filename
14   generated
588   by
320   filename
10   completion.
1   Overrides
1   -N.
15   -T
1   Plain
30   Tab
9   key.
30   Tab
2223   and
1   BackTab
650   are
56   normally
281   used
3144   to
176   do
320   filename
46   completion
2223   and
3144   to
5   walk
1   file-by-file
109   through
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
52   filenames
1061   that
132   were
14   matched.
103   To
84   type
590   an
37   ordinary
30   Tab
15   character,
3   Ctrl-Tab
1837   is
31   used.
181   This
192   option
1   reverses
30   Tab
2223   and
1   Ctrl-Tab,
15   making
30   Tab
3088   a
3   plain
172   character
2223   and
3   Ctrl-Tab
6605   the
320   filename
46   completion
9   key.
27   -t
6   Suppress
4   callstack
1   tracing.
7   Error
26   messages
380   will
471   not
26   include
3088   a
9   dump
2059   of
6605   the
4   callstack
241   but
15   performance
380   will
924   be
17   improved
4   slightly.
19   -u
2   Reads
640   from
8   devices
1041   or
7   pipes
131   should
924   be
1   unbuffered.
1   (Intended
3144   to
49   allow
6605   the
1129   shell
3144   to
924   be
281   used
53   over
3088   a
1   comm
2   line.)
29   -x
106   When
281   used
920   with
64   -c
1041   or
1   -C,
6605   the
281   first
77   argument
97   word
1837   is
25   taken
857   as
6605   the
29   command,
3144   to
924   be
15   parsed
857   as
3088   a
35   string.
983   The
10   remaining
74   arguments
650   are
4   placed
1307   in
6605   the
18   argv
1129   shell
47   variable.
181   This
1837   is
1113   for
1   compatibity
920   with
17   GNU
2   tcsh
2223   and
2   make.
7   -X
3   Toggle
64   between
6605   the
17   normal
54   meaning
2059   of
16   -C
2223   and
3088   a
1   cmd.exe-
7   compatible
1   interpretation.
150   You
511   can
436   set
320   this
920   with
6605   the
3   CSHOPTIONS
90   environmental
243   variable
1307   in
16   combination
920   with
35   setting
4   COMSPEC
3144   to
39   point
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
49   allow
12   programs
1061   that
270   use
1   /C
3144   to
28   pass
62   commands
3144   to
15   cmd.exe
3144   to
924   be
281   used
920   with
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
10   instead.
3   -Y
29   No
1   Interrupts.
3   Leave
6605   the
13   keyboard
1307   in
34   whatever
9   state
879   it
363   was
1307   in
277   at
1   startup;
38   don't
6   force
8   Ctrl-C
3144   to
924   be
590   an
2   interrupt.
7   (Useful
1113   for
92   running
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
97   inside
590   an
1   Emacs
1   buffer.)
7   -Z
8   Very
94   special
1   purpose:
26   Don't
3   bump
6605   the
14   maximum
18   FAT
15   filesystem
42   open
383   file
24   handle
26   limit
13   during
1129   shell
2   initialization.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
65   options
1113   for
6605   the
1930   C
55   shell.
111   For
364   all
6605   the
228   utilities,
241   but
471   not
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
9   itself,
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
243   variable
193   may
924   be
281   used
3144   to
436   set
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
1   options.)
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   cut<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="csh.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="date.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
3   Cut
94   out
1   Selected
1   Fields
2059   of
45   Each
3   Line
2059   of
6   Text
91   Usage:
7   cut
1   [-hsr-]
1   [-c&lt;list&gt;]
1   [-f&lt;list&gt;]
1   [-d&lt;delims&gt;]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
7   ...]
7   cut
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
10   select
28   certain
3   columns
1041   or
35   fields
640   from
197   each
372   line
2059   of
8   input.
468   If
6605   the
64   -c
192   option
1837   is
14   used,
35   fields
650   are
43   defined
857   as
19   specific
172   character
3   positions.
468   If
6605   the
47   -f
192   option
1837   is
14   used,
6605   the
35   fields
511   can
924   be
2059   of
243   variable
7   length,
197   each
39   field
29   separated
640   from
6605   the
71   next
588   by
6605   the
5   delimiter
37   character.
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
62   specified,
7   cut
26   reads
58   input
111   data
640   from
29   stdin.
261   A
190   list
2059   of
35   fields
1041   or
172   character
7   positions
1837   is
152   specified
857   as
3088   a
2   comma-separated
190   list
2059   of
4   integers.
983   The
27   minus
11   sign
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
14   indicate
3088   a
9   range.
14   Here
650   are
101   some
4   examples:
1   1,4,7;
1   1-3,8;
1   -5,10
4   (short
1113   for
1   1-5,10);
1041   or
1   3-
4   (short
1113   for
2   third
109   through
77   last
1   field.)
3   Ranges
511   can
924   be
2   reversed,
95   e.g.,
1   -f5-2
1041   or
115   even
1   -c80-1.
468   If
3088   a
172   character
22   range
1837   is
2   reversed,
439   any
197   characters
1307   in
47   those
7   positions
380   will
924   be
23   copied
3144   to
6605   the
64   output
1307   in
11   reverse
3   order.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
66   -s
6   Suppress
111   lines
920   with
227   no
7   delimiters
1307   in
97   case
2059   of
47   -f
43   option.
12   Otherwise,
111   lines
920   with
227   no
7   delimiters
650   are
73   passed
109   through
1   unchanged.
1   -c&lt;list&gt;
983   The
190   list
9   specifies
172   character
3   positions.
1   -f&lt;list&gt;
983   The
190   list
9   specifies
39   field
14   numbers.
1   -d&lt;delims&gt;
983   The
152   specified
197   characters
650   are
281   used
857   as
6605   the
39   field
7   delimiters
920   with
6605   the
47   -f
43   option.
39   Any
165   number
2059   of
7   delimiters
511   can
924   be
25   specified.
983   The
117   default
1837   is
6605   the
28   tab
37   character.
29   -r
1   Repeated
7   delimiters
650   are
35   treated
857   as
790   if
199   only
3088   a
110   single
5   delimiter
60   had
2   appeared.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

87   <pre><tt>
27   Print
6605   the
7   Date
2223   and
8   Time
91   Usage:
6   dt
1   [-nh-]
1   [+format]
37   date
35   prints
6605   the
37   date
2223   and
96   time
3144   to
44   stdout.
983   The
117   default
59   format
10   shows
6605   the
28   day
2059   of
6605   the
1   week,
6605   the
37   date
2223   and
96   time
2059   of
28   day
1307   in
3   24-hour
2   notation.
468   If
590   an
18   operand
45   beginning
920   with
117   +
1837   is
34   given,
6605   the
59   format
2059   of
6605   the
64   output
1837   is
5   controlled
588   by
6605   the
39   field
8   descriptors
2223   and
176   other
106   text
1307   in
1061   that
8   operand.
181   This
428   command
1837   is
56   normally
18   stored
1307   in
6605   the
383   file
1   dt.exe
2223   and
21   invoked
920   with
590   an
164   alias
113   so
879   it
511   can
924   be
281   used
640   from
15   cmd.exe
63   without
2   colliding
920   with
6605   the
30   internal
15   cmd.exe
37   date
3   function.
97   Options:
1   +format
106   When
3088   a
59   format
129   string
1837   is
62   specified,
197   each
39   field
4   descriptor
1837   is
12   replaced
920   with
122   its
33   corresponding
21   value.
113   All
176   other
197   characters
650   are
23   copied
3144   to
6605   the
64   output
63   without
2   change.
2   Field
1   Descriptors:
1   %a
2   Abbreviated
1   weekday.
1   %A
7   Full
2   weekday
32   name.
1   %b
2   Abbreviated
2   month.
1   %B
7   Full
2   month.
1   %c
7   Date
2223   and
96   time
1307   in
6605   the
59   format
2   mm/dd/yy
1   hh:mm:ss.
1   %C
1   Century
857   as
3088   a
27   decimal
165   number
8   00
3144   to
4   99.
2   %d
3   Day
2059   of
6605   the
7   month,
5   01
3144   to
2   31.
1   %D
7   Date
1307   in
6605   the
59   format
1   mm/dd/yy.
1   %e
3   Day
2059   of
6605   the
26   month
857   as
3088   a
3   2-digit
165   number
920   with
17   leading
67   space
1   fill.
1   %h
261   A
13   synonym
1113   for
1   %b.
1   %H
2   Hour
1   (24
11   h
2   clock),
8   00
3144   to
2   23.
1   %I
2   Hour
1   (12
11   h
2   clock),
5   01
3144   to
4   12.
1   %j
3   Day
2059   of
6605   the
1   year,
1   001
3144   to
2   366.
1   %m
4   Month,
5   01
3144   to
4   12.
1   %M
1   Minute,
8   00
3144   to
2   59.
1   %n
3   CarriageReturn/NewLine
5   combination.
1   %p
4   AM
1041   or
1   PM.
1   %r
1   Time,
122   same
857   as
1   "%I:%M:%S
1   %p".
1   %s
1   Hundredths
2059   of
1   seconds,
8   00
3144   to
4   99.
1   %S
1   Seconds,
8   00
3144   to
2   61.
1   %t
261   A
28   tab
37   character.
1   %u
2   Weekday
857   as
3088   a
27   decimal
15   number,
214   1
527   =
2   Monday
3144   to
28   7
527   =
1   Sunday.
1   %U
3   Week
2059   of
24   year
1   (Sunday
857   as
6605   the
281   first
28   day
2059   of
197   each
3   week),
5   01
3144   to
4   53.
1   %V
3   Week
2059   of
24   year
2   (Monday
857   as
6605   the
281   first
28   day
2059   of
197   each
3   week),
5   01
3144   to
4   53.
1   %w
2   Weekday
857   as
3088   a
27   decimal
15   number,
120   0
527   =
2   Sunday
3144   to
17   6
527   =
1   Saturday.
1   %W
3   Week
2059   of
24   year
2   (Monday
857   as
6605   the
281   first
28   day
2059   of
197   each
3   week),
8   00
3144   to
4   53.
1   %x
7   Date
1307   in
2   mm/dd/yy
16   format.
1   %X
8   Time
1307   in
1   hh:mm:ss
16   format.
1   %y
1   Year,
8   00
3144   to
4   99.
1   %Y
2   Year
920   with
1   century.
1   %Z
1   Timezone
152   name
1041   or
227   no
197   characters
790   if
6605   the
2   timezone
29   cannot
924   be
1   determined.
1   %%
1   Percent
11   sign
37   character.
45   -n
26   Don't
37   automatically

3088   a
11   Carriage
1   Return-
3   Line
9   Feed
24   sequence
3144   to
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the

446   <h3>
1   des<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="date.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="diff.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
7   DES
10   Data
5   Encryption
91   Usage:
10   des
1   [-edbhnrz-]
2   [-k
1   key]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
10   des
1837   is
3088   a
11   filter
1061   that
1   encrypts
1041   or
1   decrypts
111   data
125   read
640   from
6605   the
294   files
675   you
3   specify,
271   one
61   after
6   another,
3144   to
30   stdout
920   with
6605   the
10   Data
5   Encryption
4   Standard
2   (DES).
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
34   given,
10   des
26   reads
640   from
29   stdin.
468   If
87   there
650   are
30   multiple
39   files,
28   they're
44   simply
5   concatenated
857   as
28   they're
17   read.
11   Either
34   -e
1   (encrypt)
1041   or
39   -d
1   (decrypt)
64   must
924   be
25   specified.
468   If
6605   the
38   key
1837   is
471   not
91   given
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
920   with
6605   the
8   -k
18   option,
10   des
380   will
52   prompt
1113   for
22   it,
2   suppressing
3   echo.
97   Options:
34   -e
1   Encrypt.
39   -d
1   Decrypt.
32   -b
1   Electronic
2   Code
1   Book
1   (ECB)
44   mode
1837   is
31   used.
983   The
117   default
1837   is
3144   to
270   use
7   DES
2   Cipher
3   Block
2   Chaining
1   (CBC)
44   mode
920   with
590   an
20   initial
5   vector
1   (IV)
2059   of
364   all
7   zeros.
35   Under
1   ECB
23   mode,
197   each
35   block
2059   of
20   8
41   bytes
1837   is
1   enciphered
1   independently,
13   depending
199   only
883   on
6605   the
9   key.
35   Under
2   CBC
23   mode,
6605   the
1   enciphering
2059   of
197   each
35   block
190   also
6   depends
883   on
6605   the
111   data
1307   in
6605   the
32   previous
3   blocks.
983   The
117   default
2   CBC
44   mode
1837   is
66   considered
7   somewhat
207   more
2   secure.
8   -k
38   key
5   Encryption
10   key,
49   typed
857   as
3088   a
63   simple
53   ASCII
35   string.
11   With
590   an
53   ASCII
10   key,
7   DES
3   ignores
6605   the
9   low
25   order
49   bit
2059   of
197   each
38   key
7   byte
241   but
6605   the
14   high
25   order
49   bit
1837   is
436   set
1113   for
1   odd
1   parity,
9   thus
2   retaining
6605   the
34   information
24   contained
1307   in
6605   the
9   low
25   order
2   bit.
29   -x
6   Hex
9   key.
983   The
38   key
129   string
1837   is
3088   a
24   sequence
2059   of
157   up
3144   to
6   16
18   hex
19   characters,
37   right
6   padded
920   with
7   zeros.
11   With
3088   a
18   hex
10   key,
6605   the
9   low
25   order
49   bit
2059   of
197   each
7   byte
1837   is
25   again
18   ignored
26   per
6605   the
7   DES
1   algorithm.
181   This
42   allows
6605   the
270   use
2059   of
439   any
1   arbi-
1   trary
1   56-bit
10   key,
33   including
41   bytes
7   representing
41   control
197   characters
1061   that
76   could
471   not
924   be
13   typed.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
5   Special
1   Interchange
97   Options:
7   Not
364   all
7   DES
8   implementations
650   are
6605   the
6   same.
29   There
650   are
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
1   early
8   implementations
1307   in
1   circulation
1061   that
93   either
1   poorly
1041   or
2   improperly
8   implement
1   DES.
2   Cipher
3   Block
2   Chaining
193   may
471   not
924   be
2   supported,
2   forcing
6605   the
270   use
2059   of
6605   the
32   -b
43   option.
150   You
193   may
190   also
2   discover
176   other
1   flaws,
1   necessitating
1061   that
675   you
2   experiment
920   with
101   some
2059   of
94   these
94   special
5   options:
45   -n
6   Suppress
1   parity
5   calculation
883   on
590   an
53   ASCII
9   key.
13   Just
270   use
6605   the
2   low-order
28   7
15   bits
2059   of
197   each
172   character
1   as-is.
29   -r
12   Convert
364   all
22   \r\n
39   sequences
3144   to
26   \n
883   on
58   input
2223   and
364   all
26   \n
197   characters
3144   to
22   \r\n
39   sequences
883   on
19   output.
1   (Some
1   implementers
299   have
281   used
6605   the
1930   C
7   library
9   stdio
125   read
2223   and
60   write
18   routines
241   but
299   have
1   forgotten
3144   to
270   use
72   binary
1   mode.)
10   -z
9   Do
471   not
12   mark
6605   the
77   last
35   block
920   with
3088   a
4   length;
234   just
10   fill
879   it
920   with
72   binary
7   zeros.
468   If
675   you
1   encipher,
189   then
1   decipher
3088   a
383   file
320   this
8   way,
6605   the
48   result
380   will
924   be
6   padded
920   with
8   zeros
94   out
3144   to
590   an
2   8-byte
6   boundary.
468   If
675   you
8   encounter
46   problems
3   exchanging
4   encrypted
111   data
920   with
55   another
7   DES
1   implementation,
675   you
131   should
47   try
364   all
6605   the
25   various
7   combinations
2059   of
6605   the
2   -b,
4   -n,
29   -r
2223   and
10   -z
118   options.
1   (We've
6   seen
271   one
44   very
1   poor
4   implementation
2059   of
7   DES
1061   that
60   had
364   all
94   these
1   flaws.)
1   Notes:
35   1.
468   If
675   you
5   lose
6605   the
38   key
3144   to
3088   a
383   file
4   encrypted
920   with
2   DES,
87   there
1837   is
227   no
10   known
90   way
3144   to
3   decrypt
61   it.
983   The
111   data
1837   is
8   lost.
23   2.
106   When
3   choosing
7   keys,
23   avoid
41   anything
1   obvious
1061   that
2   someone
56   else
55   might
8   easily
1   guess.
20   E.g.,
38   don't
270   use
234   just
252   your
152   name
1041   or
252   your
37   date
2059   of
2   birth
1041   or
3088   a
19   common
25   word.
13   Instead,
21   choose
3088   a
38   key
920   with
3088   a
3   seemingly
15   random
3   mix
2059   of
2   alphanumeric
2223   and
2   punctuation
55   characters.
22   3.
29   No
2   encryption
110   system
131   should
924   be
66   considered
6   perfectly
2   secure.
4   Although
87   there
650   are
227   no
10   known
1   practical
2   methods
1113   for
1   attacking
2   DES,
28   such
2   methods
193   may
25   exist.
17   4.
5   Encryption
511   can
199   only
1   protect
111   data
49   that's
38   actually
1   encrypted.
468   If
675   you
299   have
30   copies
2059   of
6605   the
6   clear
106   text
883   on
252   your
14   disk,
5   anyone
920   with
44   access
3144   to
252   your
22   machine
193   may
924   be
29   able
3144   to
125   read
6605   the
27   data.
139   Also,
115   even
268   when
3088   a
383   file
1837   is
3   deleted,
6605   the
40   contents
193   may
1   remain
883   on
252   your
14   disk,
2   accessible
3144   to
5   anyone
920   with
1   knowledge
2059   of
6605   the
383   file
6   system.
11   5.
468   If
675   you
161   would
90   like
3144   to
3   compress
4   encrypted
5   data,
95   e.g.,
920   with
297   utilities
28   such
857   as
1   WinZip,
3   compress
4   first,
189   then
1   encrypt.
983   The
2   encryption
70   process
3   tends
3144   to
1   destroy
6605   the
2   redundancy
1307   in
6605   the
111   data
1061   that
10   compression
12   programs
7   depend
18   on.
160   </tt></pre>
