1655   <div
222   id="userguidecontent">
446   <h3>
1   diff<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="des.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="dim.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
8   Compare
29   Files
1041   or
23   Directories
91   Usage:
36   diff
1   [-bBeEfhiNqrsvw!-]
3   [-m
1   minmatch]
4   [-n
1   maxbest]
3   [-o
1   maxwindow]
1   [-Dstring]
1   [-dstring]
1   oldpath
2   newpath
36   diff
11   produces
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
15   differences
64   between
94   two
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
983   The
13   working
4   assumption
1837   is
1061   that
2   newpath
1837   is
3088   a
16   newer
65   version
2059   of
1   whatever's
1307   in
1   oldpath.
468   If
28   they're
39   files,
36   diff
7   assumes
104   they
38   contain
3   ascii
106   text
241   but
790   if
879   it
10   encounters
3088   a
383   file
50   containing
8   lots
2059   of
72   binary
5   data,
879   it
3   switches
3144   to
3088   a
72   binary
16   comparison
44   mode
3144   to
23   avoid
3   dumping
1   gibberish
3144   to
6605   the
14   screen.
4   Comparing
39   files,
36   diff
20   looks
1113   for
3   minimal
3   sections
2059   of
2   change.
45   Each
13   difference
1837   is
26   shown
857   as
590   an
1   add,
14   delete
1041   or
78   change
920   with
6605   the
11   appropriate
372   line
21   numbers
1041   or
372   line
165   number
13   ranges
1113   for
197   each
96   file.
2   Following
650   are
1   texts
2059   of
6605   the
7   differing
7   section.
15   Lines
1061   that
299   have
382   been
16   deleted
650   are
2   flagged
920   with
1   '&lt;';
111   lines
1061   that
299   have
382   been
104   added
650   are
2   flagged
920   with
1   '&gt;'.
2   Alternately,
36   diff
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
15   produce
3   merged
5   listings
920   with
1   #ifdefs
1113   for
6605   the
1930   C
14   compiler
1041   or
18   highlighting
1113   for
12   quick
1   visual
1   scanning.
983   The
8   algorithm
1113   for
12   comparing
294   files
1837   is
3144   to
1   maintain
1   sliding
20   windows
178   into
197   each
2059   of
6605   the
94   two
39   files,
21   adding
257   new
111   lines
3144   to
197   each
66   window
42   until
87   there
1837   is
3088   a
26   matching
24   sequence
2059   of
101   some
3   minimal
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
277   at
6605   the
5   bottom
2059   of
197   each
29   window.
39   That
6   minimum
511   can
924   be
1   configured
17   via
6605   the
12   -m
43   option.
10   Once
1061   that
3   minimal
65   match
1837   is
12   found,
36   diff
9   begins
3144   to
24   compare
6605   the
94   two
20   windows
1307   in
590   an
16   attempt
3144   to
1   minimize
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
1307   in
197   each
1061   that
29   cannot
924   be
16   matched
27   against
6605   the
4   other.
468   If
6605   the
3   combined
14   total
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
1307   in
6605   the
94   two
20   windows
1837   is
13   less
171   than
101   some
2   heuristic
4   limit,
436   set
17   via
6605   the
45   -n
18   option,
36   diff
380   will
176   do
320   this
16   comparison
920   with
3088   a
9   recursive
8   algorithm
3   guaranteed
3144   to
38   find
6605   the
3   absolute
8   best
1   solution.
58   But
64   because
6605   the
1   computation
4   involved
1307   in
320   this
3   approach
2   grows
44   very
11   quickly
857   as
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
1   increases,
36   diff
3   switches
3144   to
3088   a
2   heuristic
3   approach
1113   for
207   more
16   complex
66   window
2   comparisons,
11   breaking
6605   the
20   windows
27   down
178   into
6   smaller
9   segments
27   against
201   which
6605   the
2   exhaustive
3   approach
511   can
924   be
31   used.
4   Comparing
12   directories,
36   diff
8   builds
28   lists
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
294   files
104   they
2   contain,
7   searching
364   all
6605   the
90   way
27   down
109   through
6605   the
7   tree.
983   The
28   lists
650   are
2   sorted,
189   then
3   compared.
468   If
6605   the
122   same
320   filename
9   exists
1307   in
197   each
319   directory
6   tree,
3088   a
12   quick
72   binary
16   comparison
1837   is
56   normally
56   made
2059   of
57   whether
104   they
38   contain
6605   the
122   same
1041   or
58   different
27   data.
468   If
29   -r
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
36   diff
106   text
16   comparison
1837   is
58   done
10   recursively
6605   the
50   whole
90   way
27   down
6605   the
94   two
1   trees.
468   If
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
74   arguments
3144   to
36   diff
1837   is
3088   a
383   file
2223   and
6605   the
176   other
1837   is
3088   a
32   directory,
36   diff
380   will
43   look
1113   for
2223   and
24   compare
27   against
3088   a
383   file
2059   of
1061   that
122   same
152   name
1307   in
6605   the
92   directory.
97   Options:
32   -b
6   Blank
42   spaces
2059   of
439   any
38   length
24   compare
10   equal.
17   Ignore
439   any
17   leading
1041   or
16   trailing
68   white
67   space
883   on
197   each
75   line.
8   -B
9   Binary
16   comparison
115   even
883   on
106   text
52   files.
1   -Dstring
3   Produce
3088   a
3   merged
1   #ifdef'ed
2   listing,
920   with
6605   the
129   string
78   being
43   defined
54   meaning
270   use
6605   the
24   older
5   version.
1   (Newer
65   version
1837   is
1   intentionally
6605   the
2   default.)
1   -dstring
38   Same
857   as
1   -Dstring,
241   but
20   add
11   comments
2059   of
6605   the
32   form
51   /*
129   string
52   */
3144   to
6605   the
3   #else
2223   and
3   #endif
2   directives
1061   that
650   are
2   generated.
34   -e
3   Produce
590   an
2   ed
159   script
1   which,
268   when
3088   a
9   w
13   (the
60   write
2   command)
1837   is
8   appended
3144   to
22   it,
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
1   transform
6605   the
281   first
383   file
178   into
6605   the
4   second.
8   -E
7   Turn
91   off
18   highlighting
2059   of
16   empty
15   lines.
32   By
38   default,
790   if
18   highlighting
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
32   show
2   areas
2059   of
3   change,
115   even
16   empty
111   lines
380   will
299   have
22   ANSI
39   sequences
277   at
6605   the
45   beginning
2223   and
412   end
113   so
1061   that
790   if
207   more
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
26   display
6605   the
64   output
920   with
6605   the
117   default
46   color
4   stretch
44   mode
6   on,
16   empty
111   lines
380   will
66   still
924   be
6   highlighted.
47   -f
10   Force
3   diff-style
16   comparison
3144   to
23   continue
115   even
883   on
294   files
1061   that
21   appear
3144   to
38   contain
72   binary
27   data.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
30   -i
17   Ignore
172   character
43   case.
12   -m
1   minmatch
2   Minimum
65   match
38   length
3144   to
7   insist
883   on
98   before
1   resynchro-
1   nizing
94   two
52   files.
13   (Default
1837   is
8   20
6   lines.)
45   -n
1   maxbest
3   Maximum
14   total
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
1307   in
6605   the
94   two
20   windows
27   against
201   which
36   diff
380   will
16   attempt
590   an
3   absolute
8   best
19   match.
468   If
6605   the
14   total
1837   is
1   larger,
879   it
380   will
16   attempt
3144   to
38   break
6605   the
33   problem
27   down
920   with
1   heuristics.
13   (Default
1837   is
4   15
6   lines.)
26   -N
17   Ignore
15   differences
1307   in
372   line
2   endings.
15   NewLine
2223   and
2   CarriageReturn-NewLine
4   endings
380   will
924   be
66   considered
10   equal.
15   -o
1   maxwindow
3   Maximum
14   total
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
1061   that
36   diff
380   will
49   allow
3144   to
924   be
3   collected
178   into
6605   the
94   two
20   windows
98   before
879   it
24   gives
157   up
25   looking
1113   for
3088   a
1   resynchronizing
19   match.
13   (Default
1837   is
1   4000
6   lines.)
14   -q
4   Quiet:
13   suppress
5   warnings
47   about
294   files
50   containing
72   binary
27   data.
29   -r
5   Recursively
36   diff
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
439   any
5   subdirectories.
66   -s
9   Add
42   spaces
3144   to
48   separate
6605   the
3088   a
2   (add),
29   c
2   (change)
1041   or
15   d
1   (delete)
197   characters
640   from
6605   the
372   line
21   numbers
1307   in
3088   a
36   diff
38   report
1113   for
25   better
6   readability.
20   -v
3   Verbose
24   listing
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
439   any
33   entire
7   subdirectory
104   added
1041   or
4   deleted.
21   -w
18   White
67   space
1837   is
18   ignored
3   totally.
9   -!
3   Produce
1   merged,
8   highlighted
5   version.
6   Text
49   that's
2   unchanged
1837   is
1   normal,
16   deleted
106   text
1837   is
11   red,
257   new
106   text
1837   is
5   green.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   Colors:
150   You
193   may
436   set
252   your
51   own
9   choices
1113   for
204   screen
197   colors
191   using
94   these
90   environmental
9   variables:
22   Name
39   Use
47   Default
26   COLORS
13   Normal
204   screen
197   colors
7   &lt;null
7   string&gt;
7   ADDITIONS
15   Lines
104   added
31   Bright
18   White
883   on
19   Green
7   DELETIONS
15   Lines
16   deleted
31   Bright
18   White
883   on
16   Red
9   Colors
34   recognized
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
8   magenta
42   (or
19   red
7   blue),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
1041   or
8   white.
12   Foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
16   dim
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
2223   and
6605   the
80   words
16   bright,
10   dim,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on
193   may
924   be
1307   in
93   either
21   upper
1041   or
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
11   Either
1041   or
56   both
6605   the
17   foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
924   be
7   specified;
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
20   value,
102   it's
66   considered
9   transparent
2223   and
20   inherits
6605   the
46   color
10   underneath
61   it.
7   ADDITIONS
2223   and
7   DELETIONS
12   inherit
640   from
7   COLORS.
468   If
26   COLORS
1837   is
13   null,
36   diff
55   uses
6605   the
213   current
204   screen
197   colors
879   it
13   finds

4   Discard
439   any
22   ANSI
121   escape
39   sequences
1307   in
6605   the
58   input
6   stream
91   Usage:
16   dim
22   [-h-]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
16   dim
2   deletes
439   any
22   ANSI
121   escape
39   sequences
857   as
879   it
30   copies
106   text
640   from
197   each
2059   of
6605   the
294   files
675   you
94   specify
50   onto
44   stdout.
468   If
35   several
294   files
650   are
34   given,
28   they're
5   concatenated
271   one
61   after
55   another
3144   to
6605   the
19   output.
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
34   given,
16   dim
26   reads
640   from
29   stdin.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)

97   End
2059   of
118   options.

17   Directory
4   Selection
2   Dialog
2   Box
91   Usage:
7   dirbox
1   [-efnQh-]
4   [-i
1   path]
4   [-t
2   title]
7   dirbox
6   displays
3088   a
319   directory
10   selection
9   dialog
4   box.
468   If
3088   a
319   directory
1837   is
1   selected,
122   its
152   name
1837   is
63   written
3144   to
44   stdout.
97   Options:
34   -e
29   No
29   edit
4   box.
47   -f
1   Browse
294   files
857   as
4   well
857   as
55   directories.
30   -i
89   path
7   Initial
319   directory
2   selection.
45   -n
29   No
257   new
5   folders
2   button.
8   -Q
3   Quote
52   filenames
1061   that
38   contain
439   any
2059   of
94   these
94   special
2   characters,all
2059   of
201   which
299   have
2   significance
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
7   shell:
7   space,
2   (),
2   [],
2   {},
2   ~,
30   ;
2223   and
2   &amp;.
53   (The
52   quotes
511   can
924   be
4   stripped
91   off
191   using
6605   the
23   eval
6   command.)

22   title
2   Title.

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
8   directory:
12   Find
94   special
12   folder
3   locations
91   Usage:
319   directory
1   [-ah!-]
1   [allusers]
3   foldernames
57   ...
319   directory
32   returns
6605   the
16   actual
9   paths
3144   to
6605   the
152   specified
94   special
3   folders,
271   one
26   per
75   line.
468   If
227   no
3   foldernames
650   are
62   specified,
319   directory
28   lists
6605   the
3   symbolic
88   names
2223   and
3   locations
2059   of
364   all
2059   of
21   them.
29   There
650   are
5   four
9   types
2059   of
94   these
2   folders:
35   1.
22   System
3   folders,
95   e.g.,
6605   the
20   windows
319   directory
50   containing
6605   the
11   operating
110   system
52   files.
23   2.
4   Folders
1113   for
28   individual
9   users.
111   For
101   example,
197   each
55   user
289   has
4   his
51   own
5   My
3   Music
6   folder.
22   3.
4   Folders
30   shared
588   by
364   all
4   users,
95   e.g.,
6605   the
319   directory
2059   of
18   desktop
5   items
30   shared
588   by
364   all
9   users.
17   4.
1   Virtual
5   folders
1061   that
38   don't
38   actually
18   exist
857   as
16   actual
55   directories.
111   For
101   example,
6605   the
18   desktop
197   each
55   user
7   sees
1837   is
3088   a
5   virtual
12   folder
5   merging
94   two
6   physical
3   folders,
6605   the
28   individual
10   user's
18   desktop
12   folder
15   plus
6605   the
18   desktop
12   folder
30   shared
588   by
364   all
9   users.
319   directory
511   can
199   only
159   return
6605   the
89   path
3144   to
3088   a
12   folder
1061   that
38   actually
9   exists
857   as
3088   a
6   physical
92   directory.
159   It
29   cannot
159   return
3088   a
89   path
3144   to
3088   a
5   virtual
12   folder
64   because
5   virtual
5   folders
38   don't
31   really
18   exist
857   as
6   physical
55   directories.
30   These
650   are
6605   the
5   folders
1113   for
201   which
319   directory
511   can
30   tell
675   you
6605   the
1   location:
22   System
2   folders:
110   system
983   The
841   Windows
110   system
6   folder.
20   windows
983   The
841   Windows
92   directory.
4   Folders
1113   for
28   individual
2   users:
1   cdburning
983   The
1   staging
9   area
1113   for
294   files
6   waiting
3144   to
924   be
63   written
3144   to
2   CD.
1   cookies
8   Repository
1113   for
3   Internet
1   cookies.
112   history
4   Common
2   repository
1113   for
3   Internet
112   history
5   items.
1   internetcache
8   Repository
1113   for
6   temporary
3   Internet
52   files.
1   localappdata
10   Data
2   repository
1113   for
16   applications
883   on
320   this
9   machine.
1   nethood
39   Any
6   link
5   objects
1061   that
193   may
18   exist
1307   in
6605   the
10   user's
5   My
1   Network
1   Places
5   virtual
6   folder.
1   printhood
39   Any
6   link
5   objects
1061   that
193   may
18   exist
1307   in
6605   the
10   user's
1   Printers
5   virtual
6   folder.
2   profile
983   The
10   user's
2   profile
6   folder.
4   recent
1   Shortcuts
3144   to
6605   the
10   user's
35   most
2   recently
281   used
2   documents.
1   sendto
983   The
319   directory
50   containing
439   any
1   Send
103   To
7   menu
5   items.
4   Folders
1061   that
18   exist
56   both
3   per-user
2223   and
1113   for
364   all
2   users:
1   admintools
1   Administrative
2   tools.
983   The
243   Microsoft
1   Management
1   Console
380   will
3   save
2   customized
1   consoles
3144   to
320   this
92   directory.
1   altstartup
983   The
18   startup
18   program
5   group.
1   appdata
8   Repository
1113   for
1   application-specific
27   data.
18   desktop
17   Directory
1113   for
2   storing
5   items
883   on
6605   the
6   desktop.
2   favorites
8   Repository
1113   for
2   favorite
5   items.
1   mydocuments
8   Repository
1113   for
2   documents.
1   mymusic
8   Repository
1113   for
1   music
52   files.
1   mypictures
8   Repository
1113   for
5   image
52   files.
1   myvideo
8   Repository
1113   for
2   video
52   files.
12   programs
983   The
113   All
5   Programs
26   group
1307   in
6605   the
22   Start
3   menu.
1   startmenu
17   Directory
50   containing
6605   the
22   Start
7   menu
5   items.
18   startup
17   Directory
50   containing
6605   the
1   Startup
18   program
5   group.
983   The
110   system
29   starts
94   these
12   programs
268   when
6605   the
55   user
1   logs
18   on.
1   templates
17   Directory
50   containing
1   templates.
468   If
87   there
650   are
56   both
3   per-user
2223   and
364   all
17   users
26   versions
2059   of
3088   a
1   folder,
319   directory
32   returns
6605   the
89   path
3144   to
6605   the
213   current
10   user's
12   folder
588   by
7   default.
1   Prefacing
6605   the
1   folder's
152   name
588   by
1   "allusers"
12   (as
3088   a
48   separate
1   word)
1041   or
191   using
6605   the
29   -a
192   option
39   causes
319   directory
3144   to
159   return
6605   the
89   path
3144   to
6605   the
30   shared
12   folder
281   used
588   by
364   all
9   users.
103   To
51   get
6605   the
3   per-user
65   version
2059   of
3088   a
94   special
12   folder
1113   for
3088   a
55   user
176   other
171   than
271   one
213   current
8   user,
146   run
319   directory
191   using
6605   the
49   su
47   command.
10   (See
1   "su
3   -h"
1113   for
207   more
1   information.)
97   Options:
29   -a
1   Allusers
65   version
2059   of
6605   the
6   folder.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

29   List
6605   the
18   Current
17   Directory
6   Stack
91   Usage:
7   dirs
22   [-h-]
21   Show
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
6   fully-qualified
319   directory
5   pathnames
883   on
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
4   stack,
18   highlighting
6605   the
213   current
1   disk:directory
5   pair.
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
3   maintains
3088   a
24   stack
7   representing
6605   the
213   current
319   directory
2223   and
439   any
32   previous
213   current
103   directories
6605   the
55   user
289   has
4   saved
6   there.
10   (See
190   also
6605   the
4   cd,
7   pushd,
17   popd
2223   and
12   rotd
9   commands.)
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS

24   variable.)

24   Read
2   Raw
6   Sectors
640   from
3088   a
7   Disk
91   Usage:
31   dskread
1   [-bcdEhHLS-]
4   [-n
2   name]
9   [-N
2   sectors]
6   [-s
2   size]
4   [-t
2   tracks]
99   [
5   disk:
93   ]
99   [
2   &lt;sectorlist&gt;
93   ]
31   dskread
30   copies
6   low-level
15   raw
18   sectors
883   on
6605   the
83   disk
675   you
94   specify
3144   to
44   stdout.
106   In
3   conjunction
920   with
4   dskwrite,
31   dskread
1837   is
35   most
33   useful
857   as
3088   a
12   quick
20   diskette
2   duplication
3   utility:
675   you
511   can
125   read
3088   a
50   whole
20   diskette
5   image
178   into
3088   a
383   file
920   with
6   dskread,
189   then
60   write
879   it
51   back
94   out
920   with
49   dskwrite
3144   to
3088   a
257   new
7   diskette.
58   But
102   it's
190   also
33   useful
1113   for
5   restoring
3088   a
53   long
6   stream
2059   of
111   data
3   dumped
17   across
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
6   diskettes
920   with
3   dskwrite.
983   The
83   disk
1837   is
91   given
857   as
3088   a
3088   a
110   single
11   alphabetic
112   drive
13   letter
15   plus
3088   a
8   colon.
468   If
227   no
83   disk
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
281   first
7   logical
112   drive
1837   is
13   assumed
6   (in
35   most
4   machines,
320   this
1837   is
6605   the
24   a:
1   drive).
2   Operation:
31   dskread
56   normally
29   starts
277   at
4   cylinder
18   0,
16   head
18   0,
18   sector
120   0
2223   and
2   walks
109   through
6605   the
50   whole
14   disk,
46   reading
364   all
6605   the
18   sectors
883   on
3088   a
3   track
126   under
271   one
16   head
2223   and
189   then
364   all
2   tracks
1307   in
3088   a
4   cylinder
98   before
4   repositioning
6605   the
4   heads
3144   to
6605   the
71   next
2   cylinder.
31   dskread
80   always
26   reads
50   whole
18   sectors
42   except
268   when
46   reading
640   from
3088   a
383   file
191   using
6605   the
39   -d
43   option.
97   Options:
32   -b
2   Boot
4   record.
2   Skip
18   sector
120   0
883   on
6605   the
4   assumption
879   it
44   simply
35   contains
3088   a
37   standard
17   boot
16   record
2223   and
6   parameter
35   block
33   corresponding
3144   to
6605   the
20   particular
5   media.
64   -c
2   Continuation.
2   Assume
6605   the
111   data
289   has
382   been
7   split
17   across
35   several
4   diskettes.
11   After
197   each
83   disk
289   has
382   been
3   read,
52   prompt
1113   for
6605   the
71   next
11   one.
468   If
39   -d
1837   is
152   specified
6   also,
6605   the
320   filename
18   extension
883   on
197   each
83   disk
380   will
924   be
6605   the
83   disk
15   number,
11   i.e.,
2   001,
2   002,
2   003,
38   etc.
39   -d
2   Dummy
8   filesystem.
2   Assume
6605   the
111   data
1837   is
1307   in
3088   a
110   single
383   file
883   on
6605   the
24   disk.
468   If
5   neither
6605   the
39   -d
9   nor
6605   the
32   -b
65   options
1837   is
34   given,
6605   the
83   disk
380   will
924   be
125   read
45   beginning
920   with
18   sector
16   0.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
45   -n
3   &lt;name&gt;
983   The
320   filename
3144   to
43   look
1113   for
790   if
6605   the
39   -d
2   (dummy
1   file-
3   system)
192   option
1837   is
31   used.
47   Default
1837   is
2   'bindata'.
15   -S
3   Share
6605   the
112   drive
1113   for
11   read/write
44   access
588   by
176   other
11   processes.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
2   Formatting:
47   Default
1837   is
3144   to
20   let
841   Windows
81   NT
47   try
3144   to
19   determine
6605   the
8   formatting
1061   that
363   was
31   used.
468   If
6605   the
83   disk
363   was
63   written
1307   in
590   an
2   unusual
59   format
1041   or
289   has
4   non-standard
111   data
1307   in
18   sector
18   0,
6605   the
84   following
65   options
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
14   override
1   OS/2's
16   attempt
3144   to
3   guess
6605   the
8   format:
8   -E
4   Extended
6   density
2   (2.88M)
16   format.
9   -H
2   High
6   density
16   format.
17   -L
3   Low
6   density
16   format.
26   -N
2   &lt;sectors&gt;
6   Sectors
26   per
2   track.
66   -s
6   &lt;size&gt;
4   Sector
5   size.
2   Normally
199   only
13   512
1837   is
21   supported
5   but,
13   depending
883   on
252   your
2   hardware,
675   you
193   may
190   also
924   be
29   able
3144   to
38   create
2   128,
4   256
1041   or
2   1024-byte
2   sectors.
27   -t
2   &lt;tracks&gt;
13   Number
2059   of
3   tracks.
4   Sector
2   lists:
3   Optionally,
675   you
511   can
94   specify
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
18   sectors
675   you
84   want
17   read.
6   Sectors
650   are
91   given
1307   in
2   (cylinder,
8   head,
2   sector)
3   coordinates
920   with
8   parentheses
45   around
2223   and
8   commas
1041   or
68   white
67   space
3144   to
48   separate
6605   the
25   numeric
45   values
675   you
3   write.
2   Cylinders,
4   heads
2223   and
18   sectors
650   are
6   counted
640   from
29   zero
2223   and
511   can
924   be
152   specified
1307   in
5   decimal,
18   hex
1041   or
9   octal.
261   A
110   single
18   sector
152   specified
3   alone
99   means
234   just
1061   that
4   sector.
4   Listing
35   several
29   separated
588   by
8   commas
1041   or
42   spaces
99   means
197   each
271   one
2   individually.
261   A
8   pair
2059   of
18   sectors
7   joined
588   by
3088   a
5   hyphen
99   means
3088   a
4   range:
364   all
6605   the
2   consecutive
18   sectors
45   beginning
920   with
6605   the
281   first
2223   and
92   running
109   through
3144   to
6605   the
4   second.
8   Specifying
3088   a
4   negative
165   number
857   as
590   an
2   ordinate
99   means
270   use
6605   the
4   highest
44   possible
105   value
1113   for
1061   that
24   disk.
468   If
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
2   ordinates
2059   of
3088   a
18   sector
650   are
3   omitted,
28   they're
13   assumed
3144   to
924   be
29   zero
42   except
268   when
879   it
2   closes
3088   a
7   range,
1307   in
201   which
97   case
879   it
99   means
270   use
6605   the
4   highest
44   possible
21   value.
3   Examples:
35   1.
103   To
5   duplicate
3088   a
50   whole
20   diskette
2   image,
2   autoformatting
6605   the
64   output
16   media
790   if
102   it's
471   not
55   already
2   formatted:
31   dskread
24   a:
49   &gt;
4   dskimage.a
49   dskwrite
2   -av
24   a:
49   &lt;
4   dskimage.a
23   2.
103   To
270   use
3088   a
20   diskette
857   as
3088   a
8   serial
80   archive
3   media:
983   The
39   -d
192   option
42   allows
675   you
3144   to
6   request
234   just
7   enough
5   dummy
383   file
110   system
2   "envelope"
45   around
6605   the
19   otherwise
19   arbitrary
111   data
675   you
6   intend
3144   to
60   write
3144   to
17   ensure
6605   the
83   disk
511   can
66   still
924   be
281   used
920   with
176   other
841   Windows
81   NT
22   utilities.
12   Here's
590   an
43   example
56   writing
6605   the
48   result
2059   of
3088   a
4   tar'ing
2   (archiving)
3088   a
50   whole
319   directory
3144   to
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
3   diskettes,
25   again
2   autoformatting:
189   tar
5   -cs
10   mydir
498   |
49   dskwrite
2   -avcd
45   -n
10   mydir
24   a:
25   It's
6   restored
920   with
31   dskread
2   -dc
45   -n
10   mydir
24   a:
498   |
189   tar
4   -xs
983   The
6   diskettes
281   used
176   do
471   not
364   all
299   have
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
122   same
4   density;
439   any
3   mix
2059   of
14   high
2223   and
9   low
1837   is
2   okay.
58   But
17   remember
1061   that
790   if
3088   a
83   disk
22   isn't
55   already
2   formatted,
19   there's
227   no
90   way
1113   for
49   dskwrite
3144   to
30   tell
57   whether
879   it
131   should
924   be
14   high
1041   or
9   low
4   density;
439   any
18   disks
879   it
289   has
3144   to

380   will
364   all
924   be
10   formatted
6605   the
122   same
4   way.
22   3.
4   Reading
1041   or
56   writing
9   tar-format
2   floppies:
10   Many
283   UNIX
16   machines
54   support
6605   the
270   use
2059   of
3088   a
4   floppy
857   as
3088   a
189   tar
80   archive
3   media,
234   just
857   as
790   if
879   it
132   were
3088   a
12   tape.
4   Every
18   sector
35   contains
3   data;
19   there's
227   no
15   filesystem
2223   and
227   no
17   boot
16   record
277   at
7   all.
181   This
42   allows
6605   the
6   greatest
44   possible
10   amount
2059   of
111   data
3144   to
924   be
63   written
3144   to
6605   the

2223   and
879   it
135   does
49   allow
4   interchange
920   with
3088   a

9   machine,

9   tar-format
3   floppies
650   are
471   not
2   readable

439   any

22   utilities.

4   tar'ing

18   Write
2   Raw
6   Sectors
3144   to
3088   a
7   Disk
91   Usage:
49   dskwrite
1   [-abcdEfFhHLSTvxz-]
1   [-Z!]
4   [-n
2   name]
9   [-N
2   sectors]
6   [-s
2   size]
4   [-t
2   tracks]
1   [-V
1   volid]
99   [
5   disk:
93   ]
99   [
2   &lt;sectorlist&gt;
93   ]
49   dskwrite
30   copies
36   stdin
3144   to
6605   the
6   low-level
15   raw
18   sectors
883   on
6605   the
83   disk
675   you
4   specify.
106   In
3   conjunction
920   with
6   dskread,
49   dskwrite
1837   is
35   most
33   useful
857   as
3088   a
12   quick
20   diskette
2   duplication
3   utility:
675   you
511   can
125   read
3088   a
50   whole
20   diskette
5   image
178   into
3088   a
383   file
920   with
6   dskread,
189   then
60   write
879   it
51   back
94   out
920   with
49   dskwrite
3144   to
3088   a
257   new
7   diskette.
58   But
102   it's
190   also
33   useful
1113   for
3   dumping
3088   a
53   long
6   stream
2059   of
111   data
17   across
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
3   diskettes,
8   formatting
2223   and
1   filling
197   each
920   with
857   as
30   much
857   as
44   possible
98   before
2   requesting
6605   the
71   next
11   one.
983   The
83   disk
1837   is
91   given
857   as
3088   a
110   single
11   alphabetic
112   drive
13   letter
15   plus
3088   a
8   colon.
468   If
227   no
83   disk
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
281   first
7   logical
112   drive
1837   is
5   assumed.
3   (In
35   most
4   machines,
320   this
1837   is
6605   the
24   a:
2   drive.)
2   Operation:
49   dskwrite
56   normally
29   starts
277   at
4   cylinder
18   0,
16   head
18   0,
18   sector
120   0
2223   and
2   walks
109   through
6605   the
50   whole
14   disk,
56   writing
364   all
6605   the
18   sectors
883   on
3088   a
3   track
126   under
271   one
16   head
2223   and
189   then
364   all
2   tracks
1307   in
3088   a
4   cylinder
98   before
4   repositioning
6605   the
4   heads
3144   to
6605   the
71   next
2   cylinder.
150   You
511   can
190   also
58   cause
49   dskwrite
3144   to
60   write
3144   to
234   just
19   specific
18   sectors
588   by
9   giving
879   it
3088   a
18   sector
39   list.
49   dskwrite
80   always
25   writes
50   whole
18   sectors
13   and,
790   if
1   requested,
8   formats
50   whole
3   tracks.
468   If
6605   the
77   last
18   sector
1837   is
199   only
1   partially-
14   used,
49   dskwrite
3   fills
879   it
94   out
920   with
72   binary
7   zeros.
103   To
23   avoid
3   conflicts
920   with
176   other
3   applications,
49   dskwrite
80   always
1   locks
3088   a
112   drive
98   before
38   actually
56   writing
3144   to
61   it.
11   Basic
97   Options:
29   -a
1   Autoformat.
468   If
6605   the
83   disk
19   appears
3144   to
924   be
1   unformatted,
37   automatically
176   do
3088   a
6   low-level
59   format
2059   of
6605   the
33   entire
24   disk.
47   -f
3   Low-level
59   format
6605   the
33   entire
83   disk
857   as
111   data
1837   is
23   copied
3144   to
879   it
640   from
29   stdin.
12   -F
3   Low-level
59   format
6605   the
33   entire
20   diskette
2223   and
38   create
590   an
16   empty
18   FAT
8   filesystem.
9   Do
471   not
125   read
41   anything
640   from
29   stdin.
15   -S
3   Share
6605   the
112   drive
1113   for
11   read/write
44   access
588   by
176   other
11   processes.
20   -v
1   Verify.
24   Read
51   back
2223   and
10   verify
197   each
3   write.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
6   Options
1113   for
191   using
6605   the
83   disk
857   as
3088   a
8   serial
3   media:
32   -b
2   Boot
4   record.
18   Write
3088   a
63   simple
2   non-system
83   disk
17   boot
16   record
2223   and
6   parameter
35   block
33   corresponding
3144   to
6605   the
20   particular
16   media
178   into
18   sector
16   0.
468   If
56   writing
6605   the
33   entire
14   disk,
23   continue
920   with
6605   the
71   next
4   sector.
64   -c
2   Continuation.
468   If
19   there's
207   more
111   data
883   on
36   stdin
61   after
590   an
33   entire
83   disk
289   has
382   been

1113   for
3088   a
257   new
83   disk
3144   to
924   be
4   inserted

2   continue.
468   If
39   -d
1837   is
152   specified
6   also,
6605   the
320   filename
18   extension
883   on
197   each

380   will
924   be
6605   the
83   disk
15   number,
11   i.e.,
2   001,
2   002,
2   003,
38   etc.
39   -d

8   filesystem.
18   Write
3088   a
17   boot
16   record
2223   and
3088   a
18   FAT
15   filesystem

6605   the
20   initial
18   sectors
1   allocating
34   whatever
1837   is
63   written
3144   to
3088   a
110   single
96   file.
45   -n
3   &lt;name&gt;
983   The
320   filename
3144   to
924   be
91   given
3144   to
439   any
111   data
63   written
50   onto
6605   the
83   disk
790   if
6605   the
39   -d
2   (dummy
1   filesystem)
192   option
1837   is
31   used.
47   Default
1837   is
2   'bindata'.
2   Formatting:
47   Default
1837   is
3144   to
20   let
841   Windows
81   NT
47   try
3144   to
19   determine
91   how
6605   the
16   media
289   has
382   been
10   formatted
2223   and
471   not
3144   to
1   reformat
6605   the
24   disk.
468   If
6605   the
83   disk
22   isn't
55   already
10   formatted
2223   and
6605   the
29   -a
1   (autoformat)
192   option
1837   is
8   selected
1041   or
790   if
8   formatting
1837   is
18   explicitly
4   requested
920   with
6605   the
47   -f
1041   or
12   -F
26   options,
49   dskwrite
380   will
176   do
3088   a
6   low-level
59   format
2059   of
6605   the
5   media.
5   Dskwrite
16   takes
122   its
6   specification
2059   of
6605   the
59   format
32   (e.g.,
1   low-
1041   or
1   high-density)
640   from
6605   the
84   following
1   sources,
1307   in
7   decreasing
1   priority:
35   1.
2   Explicit
1   specifications
883   on
6605   the
428   command

23   2.
983   The
841   Windows
81   NT
1   kernel's
3   guess
277   at
6605   the
16   media
13   format,
7   assuming
6605   the

1837   is
55   already
10   formatted
2223   and
471   not
78   being
1   re-formatted.
22   3.
983   The
59   format
4   parameters
1307   in
6605   the
17   boot
18   sector
23   copied
640   from
7   stdin,
7   assuming
5   neither
6605   the
32   -b
9   nor
6605   the
39   -d
65   options
1837   is
10   given.
17   4.
983   The
32   previous
59   format
2059   of
6605   the
3   media,
7   assuming
102   it's
55   already
10   formatted
1307   in
3088   a
37   standard
2   configuration
241   but
78   being
1   reformatted.
11   5.
983   The
1   highest-density
59   format
21   supported
588   by
6605   the
26   drive.
2   Unless
675   you
94   specify
32   -b
1041   or
4   -d,
49   dskwrite
380   will
12   expect
3144   to
60   copy
3088   a
7   compatible

3088   a
10   suitable

3   sector,

7   happens
37   automatically

1   dskread'ing

1837   is

1   dskwrite'ing
3088   a

2   Explicit
2   Format
1   Specification
97   Options:
8   -E
4   Extended
6   density
2   (2.88M)

16   format.

13   512
1837   is

2059   of

2059   of

3144   to

8   Very

4   Sector
2   lists:

1307   in

8   head,

2223   and
8   commas

3   write.

18   hex
1041   or
9   octal.
261   A
110   single
18   sector
152   specified
3   alone
99   means
234   just
1061   that
4   sector.
4   Listing
35   several
29   separated
588   by
8   commas
1041   or
42   spaces
99   means
197   each
271   one
2   individually.
261   A
8   pair
2059   of
18   sectors
7   joined
588   by
3088   a
5   hyphen
99   means
3088   a
4   range:
364   all
6605   the
2   consecutive
18   sectors
45   beginning
920   with
6605   the
281   first
2223   and
92   running
109   through
3144   to
6605   the
4   second.
8   Specifying
3088   a
4   negative
165   number
857   as
590   an
2   ordinate
99   means
270   use
6605   the
4   highest
44   possible
105   value
1113   for
1061   that
24   disk.
468   If
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
2   ordinates
2059   of
3088   a
18   sector
650   are
3   omitted,
28   they're
13   assumed
3144   to
924   be
29   zero
42   except
268   when
879   it
2   closes
3088   a
7   range,
1307   in
201   which
97   case
879   it
99   means
270   use
6605   the
4   highest
44   possible
21   value.
3   Examples:
35   1.
103   To
5   duplicate
3088   a
50   whole
20   diskette
2   image,
2   autoformatting
6605   the
64   output
16   media
790   if
102   it's
471   not
55   already
2   formatted:
31   dskread
24   a:
49   &gt;
4   dskimage.a
49   dskwrite
2   -av
24   a:
49   &lt;
4   dskimage.a
23   2.
103   To
270   use
49   dskwrite
3144   to
59   format
3088   a
83   disk
920   with
590   an
16   empty
18   FAT
383   file
6   system,
270   use
2   either:
49   dskwrite
12   -F
24   a:
1   or:
49   dskwrite
1   -df
24   a:
49   &lt;
5   nul
22   3.
103   To
6   rewrite
234   just
6605   the
17   boot
18   sector
3144   to
53   make
879   it
3088   a
2   non-system
5   disk:
49   dskwrite
32   -b
24   a:
49   &lt;
5   nul
17   4.
103   To
270   use
3088   a
20   diskette
857   as
3088   a
8   serial
80   archive
3   media:
983   The
39   -d
192   option
42   allows
675   you
3144   to
6   request
234   just
7   enough
5   dummy
383   file
110   system
2   "envelope"
45   around
6605   the
19   otherwise
19   arbitrary
111   data
675   you
6   intend
3144   to
60   write
3144   to
17   ensure
6605   the
83   disk
511   can
66   still
924   be
281   used
920   with
176   other
841   Windows
81   NT
22   utilities.
12   Here's
590   an
43   example
56   writing
6605   the
48   result
2059   of
3088   a
4   tar'ing
2   (archiving)
3088   a
50   whole
319   directory
3144   to
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
3   diskettes,
25   again
2   autoformatting:
189   tar
5   -cs
10   mydir
498   |
49   dskwrite
2   -avcd
45   -n
10   mydir
24   a:
25   It's
6   restored
920   with
31   dskread
2   -dc
45   -n
10   mydir
24   a:
498   |
189   tar
4   -xs
983   The
6   diskettes
281   used
176   do
471   not
364   all
299   have
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
122   same
4   density;
439   any
3   mix
2059   of
14   high
2223   and
9   low
1837   is
2   okay.
58   But
17   remember
1061   that
790   if
3088   a
83   disk
22   isn't
55   already
2   formatted,
19   there's
227   no
90   way
1113   for
49   dskwrite
3144   to
30   tell
57   whether
879   it
131   should
924   be
14   high
1041   or
9   low
4   density;
439   any
18   disks
879   it
289   has
3144   to
59   format
380   will
364   all
924   be
10   formatted
6605   the
122   same
4   way.
11   5.
4   Reading
1041   or
56   writing
9   tar-format
2   floppies:
10   Many
283   UNIX
16   machines
54   support
6605   the
270   use
2059   of
3088   a
4   floppy
857   as
3088   a
189   tar
80   archive
3   media,
234   just
857   as
790   if
879   it
132   were
3088   a
12   tape.
4   Every
18   sector
35   contains
3   data;
19   there's
227   no
15   filesystem
2223   and
227   no
17   boot
16   record
277   at
7   all.
181   This
42   allows
6605   the
6   greatest
44   possible
10   amount
2059   of
111   data
3144   to
924   be
63   written
3144   to
6605   the
83   disk
2223   and
879   it
135   does
49   allow
4   interchange
920   with
3088   a
283   UNIX
9   machine,
241   but
9   tar-format
3   floppies
650   are
471   not
2   readable
588   by
439   any
37   ordinary
22   utilities.
12   Here's
590   an
101   example,
4   tar'ing
10   mydir
3144   to
3088   a
110   single
9   tar-format
2   floppy:
189   tar
5   -cs
10   mydir
498   |
49   dskwrite
3   -vx
24   a:
25   It's
6   restored
920   with
31   dskread
24   a:
498   |
189   tar
4   -xs
468   If
6605   the
10   amount
2059   of
111   data
11   you're
3   archiving
1837   is
207   more
171   than
380   will
6   fit
883   on
271   one
2   diskette,
270   use
6605   the
64   -c
192   option
920   with
31   dskread
2223   and
3   dskwrite.
58   But
30   since
19   there's
227   no
2   labeling
2   recorded
883   on
6605   the
6   diskettes
2223   and
6605   the
111   data
234   just
20   runs
2   continuously
640   from
271   one
20   diskette
3144   to
6605   the
5   next,
675   you
380   will
44   need
3144   to
2   pay
2   attention
3144   to
6605   the
25   order
1307   in
201   which
28   they're
63   written
1041   or
17   read.
1   Non-standard
1   Diskette
1   Formats:
468   If
675   you
60   write
41   anything
241   but
3088   a
37   standard
17   boot
16   record
178   into
6605   the
17   boot
3   sector,
675   you
380   will
471   not
924   be
29   able
3144   to
125   read
879   it
920   with
41   anything
241   but
31   dskread
2223   and
115   even
189   then
199   only
790   if
675   you
30   tell
879   it
18   explicitly
81   what
59   format
363   was
31   used.
1   Without
3088   a
37   standard
6   parameter
35   block
1307   in
6605   the
17   boot
3   sector,
6605   the
841   Windows
81   NT
20   diskette
19   device
3   driver
234   just
20   can't
30   tell
883   on
122   its
51   own
91   how
6605   the
20   diskette
363   was
4   written.
8   Similarly,
102   it's
44   possible
675   you
193   may
924   be
29   able
3144   to
60   write
3088   a
5   non-
37   standard
59   format
32   (e.g.,
3088   a
18   sector
24   size
176   other
171   than
13   512
6   bytes,
9   etc.)
13   depending
883   on
252   your
2   hardware.
58   But
21   doing
1061   that
193   may
53   make
6605   the
20   diskette
5   impossible
3144   to
125   read
883   on
176   other
5   machines.
111   For
1061   that
5   reason,
49   dskwrite
56   normally
12   won't
20   let
675   you
60   write
3088   a
17   boot
16   record
1061   that
28   doesn't
65   match
6605   the
16   actual
59   format
2059   of
6605   the
20   diskette
9   nor
380   will
879   it
20   let
675   you
60   write
41   anything
176   other
171   than
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
37   standard
16   format.
103   To
14   override
94   these
1   checks,
675   you
64   must
270   use
6605   the
29   -x
43   option.
5   Writing
3144   to
3088   a
3   Hard
1   Disk:
2   Deliberately,
49   dskwrite
56   normally
199   only
30   lets
675   you
60   write
3144   to
4   diskettes.
5   Writing
3144   to
3088   a
10   hard
83   disk
1837   is
44   very
2   risky
30   since
6605   the
2   chance
2059   of
1   catastrophic
4   loss
2059   of
34   information
1837   is
113   so
1   high.
139   Also,
199   only
1   ESDI
2223   and
1   SCSI
83   disk
1   controllers
7   routinely
4   map
94   out
9   bad
1   blocks,
113   so
46   reading
6605   the
83   disk
5   image
640   from
271   one
112   drive
2223   and
56   writing
879   it
3144   to
55   another
1837   is
1   unlikely
3144   to
102   work
790   if
87   there
650   are
9   bad
8   blocks
883   on
93   either
11   one.
103   To
6   force
49   dskwrite
3144   to
60   write
3144   to
3088   a
10   hard
14   disk,
675   you
64   must
94   specify
6605   the
3   -Z!
18   option,
7   meant
3144   to
924   be
10   hard
3144   to
6   accidentally
4   type.
106   In
3   effect,
6605   the
3   -Z!
192   option
99   means
675   you
1   understand
6605   the
1   risk
11   you're
1   taking.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

446   <h3>
1   du<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="dskwrite.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
29   List
7   Disk
2   Usage
4   Statistics
91   Usage:
17   du
1   [-acdxvh-]
99   [
3   disk1
3   disk2
57   ...
93   ]
17   du
35   prints
2   statistics
18   showing
6605   the
1   total,
281   used
2223   and
10   free
67   space
883   on
197   each
83   disk
8   partition.
468   If
227   no
83   disk
5   partitions
650   are
62   specified,
17   du
20   looks
1113   for
3088   a
8   DRIVEMASK
90   environmental
243   variable
1061   that
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
8   mask
91   off
234   just
6605   the
55   drives
675   you
84   want
11   reported.
983   The
8   DRIVEMASK
1837   is
152   specified
857   as
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
112   drive
3   letters;
13   ranges
650   are
6   allowed.
12   Otherwise,
364   all
5   partitions
45   beginning
920   with
8   c:
650   are
11   reported.
983   The
213   current
2   disk's
2   statistics
650   are
6   highlighted.
1   Sizes
650   are
56   normally
27   reported
1307   in
72   binary
1   (1000*1024)
3   megabytes.
97   Options:
29   -a
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
38   report
883   on
364   all
7   disks.
64   -c
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
38   report
883   on
234   just
6605   the
213   current
24   disk.
39   -d
9   Report
1307   in
27   decimal
1   (1,000,000)
3   megabytes.
29   -x
9   Report
1307   in
18   hex
1   (1024*1024)
3   megabytes.
20   -v
8   Verbose.
4   Give
4   detailed
1   cluster
6   information.
95   -h
79   Help.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   Colors:
150   You
193   may
436   set
252   your
51   own
9   choices
1113   for
204   screen
197   colors
191   using
94   these
90   environmental
9   variables:
22   Name
39   Use
47   Default
26   COLORS
13   Normal
204   screen
197   colors
7   &lt;null
7   string&gt;
12   HIGHLIGHT
18   Current
83   disk
31   Bright
9   Colors
34   recognized
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
8   magenta
42   (or
19   red
7   blue),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
1041   or
8   white.
12   Foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
16   dim
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
2223   and
6605   the
80   words
16   bright,
10   dim,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on
193   may
924   be
1307   in
93   either
21   upper
1041   or
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
11   Either
1041   or
56   both
6605   the
17   foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
924   be
7   specified;
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
20   value,
102   it's
66   considered
9   transparent
2223   and
20   inherits
6605   the
46   color
10   underneath
61   it.
12   HIGHLIGHT
20   inherits
640   from
7   COLORS.
468   If
26   COLORS
1837   is
13   null,
17   du
55   uses
6605   the
213   current
204   screen
197   colors
879   it
13   finds
277   at
12   startup.
8   Specifying
5   COLORS=none
20   turns
91   off
364   all
270   use
2059   of
4   color.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

87   <pre><tt>
4   Echo
6605   the
3   Arguments
3144   to
4   Standard
3   Output
91   Usage:
296   echo
1   [-n2h-]
99   [
106   text
93   ]
4   Echo
6605   the
106   text
3144   to
37   standard
64   output
42   (or
1   stderr),
1   substituting
1113   for
28   certain
172   character
39   sequences
15   preceded
588   by
6605   the
15   escapesym
37   character.
53   (The
15   escapesym
172   character
1837   is
56   normally
1   '^'
241   but
511   can
924   be
21   changed
920   with
6605   the
436   set
6   command.)
1   ^a
7   Audible
6   Alert
6   (Bell)
1   ^r
11   Carriage
13   Return
1   ^b
5   BackSpace
1   ^t
30   Tab
1   ^f
7   Form
9   Feed
1   ^v
7   Vertical
30   Tab
3   ^n
15   NewLine
3   ^^
11   Single
15   escapesym
983   The
15   escapesym
172   character
193   may
190   also
924   be
42   followed
920   with
6605   the
25   numeric
105   value
2059   of
6605   the
12   intended
39   substitution
172   character
105   where
6605   the
105   value
1837   is
152   specified
1307   in
18   hex
12   (as
590   an
1   'x'
42   followed
588   by
18   hex
1   digits)
1041   or
1307   in
9   octal.
97   Options:
45   -n
26   Don't
37   automatically
11   append
3088   a
11   Carriage
1   Return/Line
9   Feed
24   sequence
3144   to
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
19   output.
18   -2
18   Write
3144   to
17   stderr
46   instead
2059   of
44   stdout.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)

3314   <a
2   href="exec.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   env:
7   Execute
3088   a
428   command
920   with
3088   a
257   new
76   environment
91   Usage:
26   env
1   [-]
1   [-iCDNtTwh-]
99   [
2   name=value
93   ]
57   ...
99   [
428   command
93   ]
26   env
380   will
1   modify
6605   the
213   current
76   environment
10   according
3144   to
6605   the
74   arguments
2223   and
146   run
590   an
19   arbitrary
47   command.
983   The
428   command
511   can
20   refer
3144   to
439   any
40   executable
383   file
1041   or
3144   to
3088   a
1930   C
1129   shell
428   command
1041   or
8   alias.
468   If
3088   a
24   complete
89   path
1837   is
471   not
62   specified,
26   env
380   will
43   look
109   through
6605   the
76   search
11   path.
468   If
590   an
18   extension
1837   is
471   not
62   specified,
26   env
380   will
47   try
364   all
6605   the
12   usual
2   possibilities:
5   .csh,
5   .exe,
3   .com,
12   .cmd
2223   and
2   .bat.
468   If
3088   a
33   corresponding
40   executable
383   file
29   cannot
924   be
12   found,
26   env
380   will
8   assume
6605   the
428   command
1837   is
590   an
30   internal
1930   C
1129   shell
428   command
1041   or
8   alias.
468   If
227   no
428   command
1837   is
62   specified,
26   env
380   will
31   print
94   out
6605   the
17   resulting
4   environment,
271   one
2   name=value
8   pair
26   per
75   line.
97   Options:
91   -
3   Obsolete
65   version
2059   of
1   -i.
30   -i
15   Only
6605   the
76   environment
152   specified
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
380   will
924   be
73   passed
3144   to
6605   the
14   child.
983   The
37   inherited
76   environment
1837   is
10   not.
16   -C
22   Start
157   up
3088   a
60   copy
2059   of
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
146   run
197   each
47   command.
25   -D
39   Any
76   environment
111   variables
436   set
3144   to
3088   a
48   null
129   string
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
380   will
924   be
16   deleted
640   from
6605   the
4   environment.
26   -N
16   New
3   console.
8   Open
3088   a
257   new
66   window
3144   to
146   run
6605   the
47   command.
1   Meaningful
199   only
268   when
92   running
3088   a
43   console
13   application.
27   -t
4   Trace
27   mode.
983   The
428   command
372   line
1837   is
63   written
3144   to
17   stderr
234   just
7   prior
3144   to
5   invocation.
15   -T
27   Change
6605   the
22   title
16   bar
268   when
31   starting
6605   the
14   child.
21   -w
7   Wait
1113   for
6605   the
107   child
3144   to
44   exit
98   before
2   returning,
115   even
790   if
102   it's
92   running
1307   in
3088   a
257   new
29   window.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

87   <pre><tt>
4   Parse
29   &amp;
4   Evaluate
277   at
1   Run-Time
91   Usage:
23   eval
22   [-h-]
99   [
1   arbitrary_command_text
93   ]
4   Evaluate
6605   the
80   words
84   following
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
857   as
106   text
3144   to
924   be
15   parsed
2223   and
21   evaluated
857   as
73   statements
199   only
61   after
364   all
6605   the
34   substitutions
2223   and
1   wild-
1   carding
299   have
382   been
11   done.
39   Command
1041   or
243   variable
34   substitutions
6   aren't
56   normally
58   done
42   until
61   after
73   statements
299   have
55   already
382   been
15   parsed
2223   and
15   compiled
178   into
590   an
30   internal
32   form
13   and,
790   if
102   it's
3088   a
65   background
11   statement,
73   passed
91   off
3144   to
3088   a
65   background
107   child
16   thread.
983   The
23   eval
428   command
1837   is
33   useful
790   if
2   either:
91   -
150   You
84   want
428   command
1041   or
243   variable
34   substitutions
3144   to
924   be
34   recognized
857   as
439   any
2059   of
6605   the
7   reserved
80   words
2059   of
6605   the
35   language
1041   or
857   as
590   an
11   alias,
1041   or
91   -
150   You
84   want
6605   the
34   substitutions
58   done
98   before
3088   a
65   background
79   thread
1837   is
3   started.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   exec:
7   Execute
3088   a
428   command
91   Usage:
4   exec
1   [-CtTh-]
1   [&lt;command&gt;]
4   exec
380   will
146   run
590   an
19   arbitrary
47   command.
97   Options:
16   -C
22   Start
157   up
3088   a
60   copy
2059   of
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
146   run
197   each
47   command.
27   -t
4   Trace
27   mode.
45   Each
14   generated
428   command
372   line
1837   is
63   written
3144   to
17   stderr
234   just
7   prior
3144   to
5   invocation.
15   -T
27   Change
6605   the
22   title
16   bar
268   when
31   starting
6605   the
14   child.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   fgrep<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="exec.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="filebox.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
3   Fast
3   String
10   Search
1   (Fast
1   grep)
2059   of
6   Text
29   Files
91   Usage:
18   fgrep
1   [-hbcilnqsvwx-]
4   [-f
2   ptrnfile]
99   [
46   pattern
93   ]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
7   ...]
18   fgrep
135   does
3088   a
2   quick,
2   deliberately
63   simple
129   string
2   search.
159   It
135   does
471   not
270   use
37   regular
9   expressions,
241   but
135   does
299   have
101   some
3   diff-style
65   options
1113   for
9   ignoring
1   upper-/lower-case
15   differences
1041   or
4   treating
68   white
42   spaces
2059   of
439   any
38   length
857   as
2   equal,
38   etc.
150   You
511   can
190   also
45   give
879   it
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
56   strings
675   you
84   want
6   searched
73   for,
271   one
26   per
372   line
1307   in
3088   a
46   pattern
383   file
1041   or
17   via
29   stdin.
45   Each
26   matching
372   line
1837   is
23   copied
3144   to
44   stdout.
468   If
207   more
171   than
271   one
383   file
1837   is
78   being
2   searched,
197   each
372   line
1837   is
15   preceded
588   by
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
383   file
105   where
6605   the
16   matched
4   occurred
15   plus
3088   a
4   ':'
37   character.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
32   -b
6   Blank
42   spaces
2059   of
439   any
38   length
24   compare
10   equal.
17   Ignore
439   any
17   leading
1041   or
16   trailing
68   white
67   space
883   on
197   each
75   line.
64   -c
13   Just
31   print
3088   a
16   count
2059   of
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
201   which
19   match.
47   -f
2   ptrnfile
24   Read
6605   the
16   patterns
640   from
3088   a
96   file.
30   -i
17   Ignore
172   character
43   case.
27   -l
21   Show
234   just
6605   the
88   names
2059   of
439   any
294   files
50   containing
277   at
24   least
271   one
19   match.
21   Show
197   each
152   name
199   only
4   once,
197   each
883   on
3088   a
48   separate
75   line.
45   -n
21   Show
6605   the
372   line
21   numbers
2059   of
439   any
20   matches.
14   -q
4   Quiet:
38   don't
32   show
52   filenames
105   where
6605   the
33   matches
4   occur.
66   -s
24   Read
6605   the
16   patterns
640   from
29   stdin.
20   -v
3   Invert
6605   the
2   pattern:
32   show
364   all
111   lines
3   EXCEPT
47   those
1061   that
19   match.
21   -w
18   White
67   space
1837   is
18   ignored
3   totally.
29   -x
1   Exact
2   match:
6605   the
50   whole
372   line
64   must
65   match
6605   the
19   pattern.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

1   filebox<br/>

2   href="fgrep.htm">Previous</a>

3314   <a

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
25   File
4   Selection
2   Dialog
2   Box
91   Usage:
10   filebox
1   [-acmnopQsh-]
4   [-i
2   dir]
1   [-e
1   ext]
4   [-f
84   type
1   pattern]
4   [-i
1   file]
2   [-I
1   index]
4   [-t
2   title]
10   filebox
6   displays
590   an
1   Explorer-style
383   file
10   selection
9   dialog
1   box
920   with
93   either
590   an
8   Open
1041   or
3088   a
5   Save
2   button.
39   Any
294   files
8   selected
650   are
3   written,
271   one
26   per
31   line,
3144   to
44   stdout.
97   Options:
29   -a
25   File
64   must
25   exist.
2   (Open
9   dialog
5   only.)
64   -c
4   Ask
790   if
383   file
1837   is
3144   to
924   be
8   created.
2   (Open
9   dialog
5   only.)
34   -e
84   type
46   pattern
47   Default
18   extension
790   if
12   none
25   specified.
1   (Save
9   dialog
5   only.)
181   This
84   type
117   default
18   extension
1837   is
37   automatically
104   added
3144   to
6605   the
16   head
2059   of
6605   the
190   list
2059   of
3   filetype
3   filters.
47   -f
84   type
46   pattern
1   Filetype
3   filter.
468   If
12   none
62   specified,
117   default
1837   is
2   '-f
113   All
294   files
1   "*.*"'.
103   To
94   specify
30   multiple
16   patterns
1113   for
271   one
6   type,
270   use
6   semicolons
3144   to
48   separate
7   them,
95   e.g.,
2   '-f
1   "C
1   Language"
1   "*.c;*.h"'.
6   Multiple
2   filters
193   may
924   be
152   specified
920   with
30   multiple
47   -f
118   options.
12   -F
383   file
7   Initial
3   filename.
30   -i
16   dir
7   Initial
1   Directory.
10   -I
10   index
7   Initial
10   index
1307   in
3   filters.
12   -m
6   Multiple
294   files
193   may
924   be
2   selected.
15   -o
1   Verify
7   overwrite
790   if
5   saving
1   (-s).
12   -p
1   Leading
89   path
64   must
25   exist.
8   -Q
3   Quote
52   filenames
1061   that
38   contain
439   any
2059   of
94   these
94   special
2   characters,all
2059   of
201   which
299   have
2   significance
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
7   shell:
7   space,
2   (),
2   [],
2   {},
2   ~,
30   ;
2223   and
2   &amp;.
53   (The
52   quotes
511   can
924   be
4   stripped
91   off
191   using
6605   the
23   eval
6   command.)
66   -s
5   Save
1   dialog.
27   -t
22   title
2   Title.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   getopt<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="filebox.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="grep.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
4   Parse
1   Command-Line
6   Options
91   Usage:
6   getopt
99   [
1   -hqC-
93   ]
99   [
64   -c
2   cmdname
93   ]
2   optionslist
74   arguments
57   ...
6   getopt
1837   is
281   used
1307   in
1129   shell
52   scripts
1113   for
13   parsing
428   command
372   line
65   options
178   into
3088   a
1   canonical
10   form,
105   where
197   each
192   option
1837   is
3   presented
1307   in
3088   a
48   separate
97   word
2223   and
439   any
192   option
1061   that
16   takes
590   an
77   argument
289   has
6605   the
77   argument
91   given
1307   in
6605   the
4   Next
25   word.
983   The
190   list
2059   of
192   option
197   characters
1061   that
131   should
924   be
34   recognized
1837   is
91   given
857   as
6605   the
2   optionslist
8   argument,
95   e.g.,
1   abcz
790   if
1   -a,
2   -b,
64   -c
2223   and
10   -z
65   options
650   are
1   recogized.
468   If
439   any
192   option
289   has
3088   a
3   colon
6   following,
95   e.g.,
1   ab:cz,
189   then
879   it
8   requires
590   an
12   argument.
1   Scanning
1113   for
65   options
3   stops
277   at
6605   the
281   first
77   argument
201   which
135   does
471   not
22   begin
920   with
3   '-'
1041   or
4   '/'
1041   or
201   which
4   consists
199   only
2059   of
1   '--'
1041   or
1   '//'.
983   The
26   SWITCHCHARS
76   environment
243   variable
193   may
924   be
281   used
3144   to
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
176   other
171   than
3   '-'
1041   or
4   '/'
857   as
6605   the
192   option
18   switch
197   characters
3144   to
924   be
34   recognized
883   on
8   input.
11   On
2   output,
6605   the
18   switch
172   character
380   will
924   be
6605   the
271   one
1061   that
363   was
281   used
920   with
1061   that
43   option.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (
181   This
14   screen.
210   )
14   -q
2   Enclose
439   any
64   output
80   words
50   containing
1930   C
1129   shell
97   word
10   separator
197   characters
97   inside
25   double
52   quotes
113   so
1061   that
6605   the
97   word
380   will
471   not
924   be
7   split
157   up
268   when
1   assigning
879   it
3144   to
3088   a
243   variable
1307   in
3088   a
19   script.
983   The
97   word
1   Separators
3   are:
7   space,
84   (
4   ,
1   ),
1   ;,
1   |,
1   &amp;,
1   &lt;,
1   &gt;,
2   \n,
10   \r
2223   and
1   \t.
4   Note:
181   This
192   option
1837   is
56   normally
281   used
920   with
1   eval,
95   e.g.,
23   eval
436   set
9   args
527   =
1   `getopt
14   -q
2   ...`
64   -c
2   cmdname
39   Any
7   Error
26   messages
1061   that
650   are
12   produced
131   should
5   say
104   they
132   were
14   generated
588   by
1   cmdname,
471   not
1   getopt.
16   -C
1   Canonicalize
6605   the
64   output
3144   to
270   use
3   '-'
857   as
6605   the
2   switchchar
227   no
7   matter
81   what
2   switchchar
363   was
38   actually
31   used.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

446   <h3>
1   grep<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="getopt.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="head.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
6   Regular
4   Expression
2   Pattern
10   Search
2059   of
6   Text
29   Files
91   Usage:
21   grep
1   [-hcilnqsv-]
4   [-f
2   ptrnfile]
99   [
46   pattern
93   ]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
7   ...]
21   grep
55   uses
94   special
16   patterns
26   called
37   regular
25   expressions
3144   to
11   filter
81   what
879   it
26   reads
640   from
36   stdin
1041   or
640   from
439   any
294   files
675   you
4   specify.
6   Regular
25   expressions
650   are
63   written
1307   in
320   this
3   notation,
1307   in
7   decreasing
5   precedence:
29   c
39   Any
37   ordinary
172   character
33   matches
18   itself.
3   \c
52   Match
6605   the
44   literal
172   character
8   c.
4   Certain
197   characters
650   are
35   treated
4   specially:
3   \a
7   Audible
6   Alert
6   (Bell)
10   \r
11   Carriage
13   Return
3   \b
5   BackSpace
4   \t
30   Tab
3   \f
7   Form
9   Feed
3   \v
7   Vertical
30   Tab
26   \n
15   NewLine
6   \\
11   Single
4   BackSlash
5   \x
983   The
71   next
271   one
1041   or
94   two
197   characters
650   are
35   treated
857   as
18   hex
13   digits
14   specifying
6605   the
172   character
21   code.
34   ^
7   Beginning
2059   of
75   line.
4   $
97   End
2059   of
75   line.
14   .
52   Match
439   any
110   single
37   character.
4   [...]
52   Match
439   any
110   single
172   character
1307   in
6605   the
39   list.
4   [^...]
52   Match
439   any
110   single
172   character
471   not
1307   in
6605   the
39   list.
26   \n
52   Match
34   whatever
44   literal
106   text
6605   the
4   n'th
6   tagged
3   \(...\)
63   expression
14   matched.
3   r*
52   Match
29   zero
1041   or
207   more
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{n\}
52   Match
21   exactly
49   n
30   occurrences
2059   of
4   r,
105   where
49   n
1837   is
590   an
11   unsigned
27   decimal
12   integer.
3   r\{n,\}
52   Match
277   at
24   least
49   n
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{n,m\}
52   Match
277   at
24   least
7   n,
241   but
471   not
207   more
171   than
15   m
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{,m\}
52   Match
277   at
35   most
15   m
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r1r2
52   Match
63   expression
3   r1
42   followed
588   by
3   r2.
3   \(r\)
4   Tagged
37   regular
15   expression.
52   Match
6605   the
46   pattern
97   inside
6605   the
3   \(...\),
2223   and
17   remember
6605   the
44   literal
106   text
1061   that
14   matched.
261   A
37   regular
63   expression
46   pattern
29   cannot
38   contain
3   Null,
15   NewLine
1041   or
5   CarriageReturn
55   characters.
106   When
19   typing
3088   a
37   regular
63   expression
883   on
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
17   remember
1061   that
2   $,
2   [,
7   ],
4   ^,
84   (
2223   and
210   )
299   have
94   special
54   meaning
3144   to
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
55   shell.
6   Put
110   single
52   quotes
45   around
6605   the
129   string
3144   to
28   turn
91   off
1061   that
94   special
5   meaning.
139   Also,
115   even
97   inside
6   quotes,
84   type
3   ^^
3144   to
19   mean
34   ^
42   except
268   when
879   it
34   immediately
7   follows
3   [.
45   Each
26   matching
372   line
1837   is
23   copied
3144   to
44   stdout.
468   If
207   more
171   than
271   one
383   file
1837   is
78   being
2   searched,
197   each
372   line
1837   is
15   preceded
588   by
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
383   file
105   where
6605   the
16   matched
4   occurred
15   plus
3088   a
4   ':'
37   character.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
64   -c
13   Just
31   print
3088   a
16   count
2059   of
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
201   which
19   match.
47   -f
2   ptrnfile
24   Read
6605   the
16   patterns
640   from
3088   a
96   file.
30   -i
17   Ignore
172   character
43   case.
27   -l
21   Show
234   just
6605   the
88   names
2059   of
439   any
294   files
50   containing
277   at
24   least
271   one
19   match.
21   Show
197   each
152   name
199   only
4   once,
197   each
883   on
3088   a
48   separate
75   line.
45   -n
21   Show
6605   the
372   line
21   numbers
2059   of
439   any
20   matches.
14   -q
4   Quiet:
38   don't
32   show
52   filenames
105   where
6605   the
33   matches
4   occur.
66   -s
24   Read
6605   the
16   patterns
640   from
29   stdin.
20   -v
3   Invert
6605   the
2   pattern:
32   show
364   all
111   lines
3   EXCEPT
47   those
1061   that
19   match.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

3314   <a
2   href="heapstat.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
27   Print
7   Path
3   Hashing
2   Performance
4   Statistics
91   Usage:
5   hashstat
22   [-h-]
2   Summarize
6605   the
4   recent
1   effectiveness
2059   of
6605   the
89   path
19   hashing
4   mechanism.
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
55   uses
3088   a
19   hashing
27   mechanism
3144   to
62   help
879   it
7   decide
201   which
89   path
103   directories
2223   and
3   filetype
3   extensions
131   should
924   be
14   tried
281   first
268   when
25   looking
1113   for
590   an
40   executable
96   file.
181   This
8   way,
879   it
3   avoids
1   wasting
96   time
920   with
3   requests
3144   to
6605   the
81   NT
16   kernel
3144   to
43   look
1113   for
294   files
1061   that
650   are
10   known
3144   to
924   be
1   non-existent.
2   Sometimes,
6605   the
281   first
3   guess
56   made
320   this
90   way
1837   is
14   wrong
13   (the
13   hash
4   says
3088   a
383   file
55   might
10   exist,
241   but
879   it
1   doesn't)
2223   and
6605   the
1129   shell
289   has
3144   to
47   try
25   again
920   with
3088   a
58   different
319   directory
1041   or
7   extension.
5   hashstat
10   shows
675   you
6605   the
11   hit
3   rate,
201   which
1837   is
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
2   hits
1   divided
588   by
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
18   tries
1   (hits
15   plus
1   misses).
2   Blindspots
650   are
294   files
1061   that
6   aren't
28   found
191   using
6605   the
13   hash
241   but
650   are
28   found
883   on
3088   a
33   second
1   pass,
191   using
590   an
2   exhaustive
2   search.
2   Blindspots
9   happen
268   when
675   you
20   add
257   new
294   files
3144   to
3088   a
89   path
1   directory;
268   when
1   detected,
104   they
58   cause
6605   the
319   directory
3144   to
924   be
1   rehashed.
10   (See
190   also
6605   the
6   rehash
2223   and
6   unhash
9   commands.)
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

87   <pre><tt>
18   Copy
6605   the
11   First
2   Few
15   Lines
1041   or
3   Bytes
2059   of
3088   a
25   File
3144   to
8   Stdout
91   Usage:
16   head
1   [-hcnq&lt;size&gt;-]
2   [-t&lt;tabs&gt;][
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
16   head
30   copies
6605   the
281   first
33   part
2059   of
197   each
2059   of
6605   the
294   files
675   you
94   specify
50   onto
44   stdout.
468   If
35   several
294   files
650   are
34   given,
197   each
1837   is
1   announced
42   unless
675   you
94   specify
2   quiet
27   mode.
150   You
193   may
94   specify
91   how
30   much
3144   to
125   read
640   from
197   each
383   file
1307   in
93   either
111   lines
1041   or
10   bytes.
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
34   given,
16   head
26   reads
640   from
29   stdin.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
64   -c
10   Count
55   characters.
13   (Default
1837   is
6   lines.)
14   -q
5   Quiet
27   mode.
26   Don't
4   announce
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
197   each
383   file
857   as
102   it's
17   read.
2   -&lt;size&gt;
1   Amount
3144   to
924   be
125   read
640   from
197   each
96   file.
13   (Default
1837   is
21   10
111   lines
1041   or
13   512
4   bytes.)
3   -t&lt;tabs&gt;
30   Tab
18   settings
3144   to
270   use
1113   for
4   viewing
19   text.
13   (Default
1837   is
3144   to
270   use
105   value
91   given
588   by
6605   the
7   TABS
76   environment
243   variable
14   or,
790   if
49   that's
3   undefined,
3144   to
176   do
227   no
28   tab
2   expansion.)
45   -n
29   No
28   tab
6   expansion.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

27   Print
1   Heap
2   Usage
4   Statistics
91   Usage:
6   heapstat
22   [-h-]
2   Summarize
6605   the
213   current
8   heap
2   usage,
11   i.e.,
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
5   objects
4   allocated
883   on
6605   the
8   heap
2223   and
6605   the
14   total
1   storage
31   used.
1   Heapstats
650   are
199   only
16   available
790   if
104   they
132   were
5   enabled
920   with
6605   the
9   -H
192   option
268   when
6605   the
1129   shell
363   was
3   started.
13   Because
2059   of
6605   the
7   significant
15   performance
2   penalty
19   associated
920   with
1   tracking
8   heap
2   usage,
2   heapstats
650   are
471   not
56   normally
3   enabled.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS

24   variable.)

16   Display
6605   the
9   History
29   List
91   Usage:
112   history
1   [-srh-]
99   [
49   n
1   [m]
93   ]
16   Display
62   commands
640   from
6605   the
112   history
39   list.
468   If
227   no
10   operands
650   are
34   given,
32   show
6605   the
33   entire
39   list.
468   If
3088   a
110   single
33   integer
2   'n'
1837   is
62   specified,
26   display
6605   the
77   last
49   n
71   commands.
468   If
56   both
6   integers
2   'n'
2223   and
1   'm'
650   are
34   given,
1   then:
790   if
15   m
11   &gt;=
2   n:
16   Display
62   commands
3   numbered
49   n
109   through
1   m.
790   if
15   m
49   &lt;
2   n:
16   Display
15   m
228   commands,
45   beginning
277   at
428   command
1   n.
53   (The
24   size
2059   of
6605   the
190   list
1837   is
5   controlled
588   by
6605   the
112   history
39   variable,
21   changed
191   using
6605   the
436   set
6   command.)
97   Options:
66   -s
3   Short
5   form:
3   Leave
91   off
6605   the
428   command
14   numbers.
29   -r
5   Reverse
3   order:
21   Show
6605   the
1   oldest
4   first.

446   <h3>
1   kill<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="history.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="popd.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
5   Kill
5   Specified
3   Process
1041   or
5   Thread
3   Activity
91   Usage:
23   kill
1   [-x!h-]
2   scheduling_id
99   [
2   scheduling_id
57   ...
93   ]
2   Terminate
19   specific
4   activities.
10   Normally,
199   only
3   direct
107   child
30   processes
511   can
924   be
1   killed.
15   Only
28   certain
33   threads
380   will
3   respond
3144   to
3088   a
1   kill;
675   you
29   cannot
1   inadvertantly
23   kill
17   normal
30   internal
1   housekeeping.
1   Requests
3144   to
23   kill
3088   a
70   process
650   are
56   normally
1   carried
94   out
588   by
3   sending
3088   a
3   Ctrl-Break
2   event
3144   to
6605   the
70   process
2223   and
122   its
4   children.
3   Ctrl-Break
22   isn't
3   guaranteed
3144   to
102   work
1   (any
91   given
70   process
193   may
21   choose
3144   to
16   ignore
3   it)
241   but
790   if
879   it
1   does,
102   it's
3   guaranteed
1061   that
70   process
380   will
4   terminate
1   cleanly,
1   releasing
439   any
3   DLL's
102   it's
2   using.
1   Scheduling_ids
650   are
6605   the
1   job,
79   thread
1041   or
70   process
1   indentifiers
857   as
27   reported
588   by
6605   the
20   ps
47   command.
21   An
1   all-numeric
5   id
8   indicates
3088   a
65   background
1   job;
590   an
5   id
45   beginning
920   with
1   't'
8   indicates
3088   a
1   thread;
1   'p'
8   indicates
3088   a
20   process.
97   Options:
29   -x
5   Kill
115   even
30   processes
1061   that
650   are
471   not
3   direct
4   children.
9   -!
5   Kill
30   processes
191   using
1   TerminateProcess,
471   not
1   Ctrl-Break.
181   This
380   will
23   kill
4   almost
41   anything
11   (a
70   process
29   cannot
16   ignore
3   it)
241   but
30   since
122   its
13   effect
1837   is
1   immediate,
439   any
3   DLL's
1307   in
270   use
380   will
471   not
1   necessarily
4   clean
157   up
21   properly.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

87   <pre><tt>
5   Dump
94   out
439   any
20   particular
38   key
1041   or
105   value
1307   in
6605   the
6   registry
91   Usage:
5   listreg
22   [-h-]
1   registery_path
5   listreg
5   dumps
94   out
439   any
20   particular
6   registry
38   key
1041   or
20   value,
91   given
6605   the
5   path,
31   starting
640   from
1   HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT,
1   HKEY_CURRENT_USER,
1   HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,
1   HKEY_USERS
1041   or
1   HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA
1041   or
32   their
5   aliases,
1   HKCR,
1   HKCU,
1   HKLM
2223   and
1   HKPD.
1   Pathnames
650   are
471   not
4   case-sensitive.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.

76   screen.)

2059   of

4   ln
22   [-h-]

7   ...]
20   destination
7   Create
257   new
10   hard
5   links
3144   to
31   existing
8   NTFS
39   files,
241   but
199   only
20   within
6605   the
122   same
8   partition.
468   If
207   more
171   than
271   one
51   source
383   file
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
20   destination
64   must
924   be
3088   a
92   directory.
468   If
6605   the
20   destination
1837   is
3088   a
319   directory
6605   the
51   source
294   files
650   are
4   linked
178   into
879   it
920   with
32   their
213   current
10   names.

47   -f

31   existing
20   destination
294   files
3144   to
924   be
