182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
29   List
29   Files
1041   or
23   Directories
91   Usage:
91   ls
1   [-+][lLoOgG!rqhx-
1   ndtsez
1   mU
29   c
1   DHSARC.a
1   0-9
1   FQTw]
4   pathname1
99   [
4   pathname2
57   ...
93   ]
91   ls
28   lists
6605   the
152   specified
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
17   Directory
88   names
650   are
56   normally
8   highlighted
2223   and
88   names
2059   of
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
920   with
6605   the
110   system
49   bit
436   set
650   are
56   normally
26   shown
1307   in
9   green
241   but
675   you
193   may
21   choose
252   your
51   own
197   colors
790   if
675   you
3   prefer.
25   File
2223   and
319   directory
88   names
650   are
56   normally
27   reported
1307   in
6605   the
16   actual
40   mixed
97   case
1307   in
201   which
104   they
1   appear.
58   But
91   ls
380   will
43   look
1113   for
590   an
90   environmental
39   variable,
3   MIXEDCASEDRIVES,
9   giving
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
5   drives,
95   e.g.,
2   f-hq,
54   meaning
199   only
55   drives
2   F:
109   through
2   H:
2223   and
112   drive
1   Q:
131   should
10   displayed
1307   in
40   mixed
97   case
920   with
6605   the
16   rest
27   reported
1307   in
364   all
32   lower
43   case.
103   To
7   customize
91   ls
920   with
3088   a
117   default
8   behavior
2059   of
252   your
51   own
1   choosing,
270   use
6605   the
3   LSOPTIONS
90   environmental
47   variable.
91   ls
380   will
281   first
70   process
439   any
65   options
152   specified
1307   in
3   LSOPTIONS
98   before
439   any
152   specified
883   on
6605   the
428   command
75   line.
97   Options:
27   -l
9   Long
59   format
5   listings
2059   of
6605   the
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
17   -L
8   Very
9   Long
59   format
5   listings
920   with
3088   a
207   more
4   precise
1   timestamp.
15   -o
1   Owner.
29   List
6605   the
4   owner,
790   if
2   known,
920   with
197   each
383   file
1041   or
92   directory.
4   (Ignored
126   under
841   Windows
6   9x,
201   which
135   does
471   not
54   support
6605   the
31   full
841   Windows
23   security
2   model.)
9   -O
9   Like
2   -o,
241   but
2   enables
4   polling
2059   of
176   other
841   Windows
81   NT
16   machines
883   on
6605   the
13   network
790   if
3088   a
55   user
1041   or
26   group
12   ID
1837   is
471   not
10   known
2   locally.
5   (But
924   be
3   aware
1061   that
4   polling
511   can
16   take
35   several
1   seconds.)
4   -g
1   Group.
29   List
6605   the
3   group,
790   if
2   known,
920   with
197   each
383   file
1041   or
92   directory.
4   (Ignored
126   under
841   Windows
6   9x,
201   which
135   does
471   not
54   support
6605   the
31   full
841   Windows
23   security
2   model.)
3   -G
9   Like
1   -g,
241   but
2   enables
4   polling
2059   of
176   other
841   Windows
81   NT
16   machines
883   on
6605   the
13   network
790   if
3088   a
55   user
1041   or
26   group
12   ID
1837   is
471   not
10   known
2   locally.
9   -!
29   List
234   just
6605   the
88   names
62   specified,
471   not
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
439   any
55   directories.
4   (Remember
3144   to
84   type
320   this
192   option
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
190   list
113   so
6605   the
67   space
2   afterward
380   will
4   prevent
879   it
78   being
13   confused
857   as
3088   a
112   history
2   reference.)
29   -r
5   Recursively
190   list
40   contents
2059   of
439   any
5   subdirectories.
14   -q
4   Quiet.
26   Don't
10   generate
590   an
106   error
63   message
1113   for
13   non-existent
52   files.
95   -h
11   Help
4   (short
4   list.)
1   -hx
4   Extended
62   help
11   (this
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   (Useful
790   if
52   filenames
87   start
920   with
5   "-".)
1   Sorting
97   Options:
1   Sorts
193   may
924   be
58   done
1307   in
439   any
1   order;
117   default
1837   is
1   -nds.
53   (The
320   filename
1837   is
6605   the
35   most
12   important
32   sort
4   criteria
2223   and
2   ties
650   are
23   broken
588   by
37   date
1041   or
1   size.)
45   -n
22   Name
3   (lowest
11   alphabetic
5   first.)
39   -d
7   Date
1   (oldest
5   first.)
27   -t
8   Time
1   (same
857   as
1   -dz
527   =
3   newest
5   first.)
66   -s
3   Size
1   (largest
5   first.)
34   -e
1   Extension
3   (lowest
11   alphabetic
5   first.)
10   -z
5   Reverse
6605   the
5   major
1041   or
77   last
152   specified
5   sort.
12   -m
7   Merge
6605   the
5   listings
2059   of
103   directories
2223   and
52   files.
1   -U
1   Unordered
6   (in
25   order
2059   of
1   appearance
1307   in
6605   the
2   directory.)
4   Selection
1   Criteria:
1   +&lt;type&gt;
2   Include
1   files/directories
2   fitting
320   this
19   pattern.
1   -&lt;type&gt;
3   Leave
94   out
41   anything
2   fitting
320   this
19   pattern.
105   where
2   &lt;type&gt;
1837   is
3088   a
16   combination
2059   of
6605   the
84   following
3   characters:
5   D
1   Directories.
5   H
6   Hidden
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
2   S
22   System
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
261   A
10   Archive
49   bit
11   set.
1   R
5   Read-only
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
1930   C
1   Compressed
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
2   (Supported
199   only
126   under
841   Windows
81   NT
9   3.51
1041   or
3   later.)
14   .
14   "."
2223   and
10   ".."
52   files.
1041   or
6605   the
110   single
1   char:
3088   a
113   All
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
15   regardless
2059   of
4   attributes.
983   The
117   default
1837   is
1   "+a
7   -.
1   -H",
54   meaning
41   anything
176   other
171   than
14   "."
2223   and
10   ".."
471   not
21   marked
1   Hidden.
2   Anything
152   specified
1837   is
104   added
1   to/subtracted
640   from
320   this
11   set.
1   Ordering
2059   of
1   additions/substractions
135   does
53   make
3088   a
1   difference.
468   If
6605   the
24   slash,
27   "/",
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
879   it
1837   is
35   treated
857   as
3088   a
15   plus
268   when
281   used
920   with
10   selection
1   criteria.
4   Selection
4   criteria
56   normally
3   applies
199   only
3144   to
103   directories
2223   and
294   files
28   found
588   by
24   listing
3088   a
92   directory.
113   All
88   names
91   given
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
380   will
924   be
23   listed
790   if
104   they
18   exist
15   regardless
2059   of
57   whether
104   they
65   match
6605   the
10   selection
4   criteria
42   unless
6605   the
64   -c
192   option
1837   is
25   specified.
64   -c
39   Command
372   line
88   names
64   must
65   match
4   criteria
6   also,
42   unless
199   only
271   one
152   name
1837   is
10   given.
4   Listing
97   Options:
1   -&lt;integer&gt;
5   Specified
165   number
2059   of
3   columns.
1   -0
4   Standard
1   multi-columns
883   on
3   80-column
14   screen.
12   -F
6   Put
3088   a
3   backslash
42   (or
3088   a
24   slash,
790   if
6605   the
121   escape
172   character
1837   is
6605   the
1   backslash)
61   after
197   each
319   directory
32   name.
8   -Q
3   Quote
439   any
52   filenames
50   containing
94   special
197   characters
1061   that
55   might
924   be
1   misinterpreted
588   by
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1307   in
428   command
14   substitution.
15   -T
4   True
1   mixed-case.
16   Display
52   filenames
1307   in
6605   the
4   upper-
1041   or
1   lower-
97   case
197   characters
38   actually
18   stored
1307   in
6605   the
383   file
6   system.
21   -w
1   Walk
4   subdirectories
3144   to
32   show
11   true
9   sizes
1307   in
53   long
59   format
1   listings.
7   Colors:
150   You
193   may
436   set
252   your
51   own
9   choices
1113   for
204   screen
197   colors
191   using
94   these
90   environmental
9   variables:
22   Name
39   Use
47   Default
26   COLORS
13   Normal
204   screen
197   colors
7   &lt;null
7   string&gt;
4   READONLYFILES
29   Files
21   marked
22   read-only
122   same
857   as
26   COLORS
7   SYSTEMFILES
29   Files
920   with
110   system
49   bit
436   set
19   Green
12   DIRECTORIES
23   Directories
31   Bright
4   READONLYDIRS
23   Directories
21   marked
22   read-only
122   same
857   as
12   DIRECTORIES
8   SYSTEMDIRS
23   Directories
920   with
110   system
49   bit
436   set
2   (see
1   below)
9   Colors
34   recognized
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
8   magenta
42   (or
19   red
7   blue),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
1041   or
8   white.
12   Foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
16   dim
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
2223   and
6605   the
80   words
16   bright,
10   dim,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on
193   may
924   be
1307   in
93   either
21   upper
1041   or
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
11   Either
1041   or
56   both
6605   the
17   foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
924   be
7   specified;
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
20   value,
102   it's
66   considered
9   transparent
2223   and
20   inherits
6605   the
46   color
10   underneath
61   it.
8   SYSTEMDIRS
56   normally
20   inherits
3088   a
5   merging
2059   of
6605   the
12   DIRECTORIES
2223   and
7   SYSTEMFILES
14   colors.
12   DIRECTORIES
2223   and
7   SYSTEMFILES
12   inherit
640   from
7   COLORS.
468   If
3088   a
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
289   has
56   both
6605   the
110   system
2223   and
22   read-only
15   bits
67   set,
6605   the
110   system
197   colors
380   will
924   be
31   used.
468   If
26   COLORS
1837   is
13   null,
91   ls
55   uses
6605   the
213   current
204   screen
197   colors
879   it
13   finds
277   at
12   startup.
8   Specifying
5   COLORS=none
20   turns
91   off
364   all
270   use
2059   of
4   color.

446   <h3>
1   mkdir<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="ls.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
4   Make
23   Directories
91   Usage:
9   mkdir
1   [-rwh-]
2   directory1
99   [
2   directory2
57   ...
93   ]
97   Options:
29   -r
1   Recursive:
790   if
439   any
21   parent
319   directory
13   levels
650   are
3   missing,
38   create
47   those
8   also.
21   -w
4   Give
3088   a
12   warning
63   message
241   but
23   continue
35   trying
3144   to
53   make
439   any
10   remaining
103   directories
115   even
790   if
46   problems
132   were
18   encountered
920   with
101   some
2059   of
21   them.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
261   A
2   Better
841   Windows
81   NT
13   More
2   Filter
91   Usage:
4   hmore
1   [-#IezinNwcvbodxCh-][-r&lt;radix&gt;][-t&lt;tabs&gt;][-s&lt;scroll&gt;]
1   [file1
28   file2
7   ...]
181   This
207   more
15   provides
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
2   advantages
53   over
6605   the
37   standard
81   NT
1   more.com
3   filter.
25   It's
2   faster,
8   goes
1   backwards
2223   and
2   forwards
109   through
3088   a
39   file,
511   can
76   search
1113   for
172   character
56   strings
1041   or
33   matches
3144   to
37   regular
25   expressions
2223   and
511   can
26   display
72   binary
111   data
11   embedded
1307   in
6605   the
19   text.
23   As
879   it
26   reads
3088   a
39   file,
879   it
8   builds
590   an
2   ISAM
10   structure
1   on-the-fly
1061   that
30   lets
879   it
4   jump
3144   to
3088   a
19   specific
372   line
165   number
4   almost
1   instantaneously.
25   It's
5   designed
1113   for
44   very
14   fast
1   browsing.
1   On-line
62   help
1837   is
16   available
1113   for
6605   the
38   key
3   bindings
588   by
5   pressing
1   "h"
268   when
675   you
43   see
6605   the
4   Press
5   H
1113   for
11   Help
52   prompt
277   at
6605   the
5   bottom
2059   of
3088   a
2   screenful
2059   of
27   data.
97   Options:
4   -#
21   Show
372   line
14   numbers.
16   -C
26   Don't
6   clear
6605   the
204   screen
98   before
197   each
257   new
3   screenful.
10   -I
22   Start
157   up
1307   in
1   case-independent
76   search
27   mode.
34   -e
10   Search
191   using
37   regular
13   expressions.
10   -z
1   Inverted
1   search:
76   search
1113   for
111   lines
1061   that
176   do
2   NOT
65   match
6605   the
76   search
129   string
1041   or
37   regular
15   expression.
30   -i
2   Go
178   into
2   Interactive
44   mode
1   immediately,
201   which
99   means
6   clear
6605   the
204   screen
281   first
1113   for
12   faster
2   painting
2223   and
20   put
157   up
6605   the
4   Press
5   H
1113   for
11   Help
52   prompt
46   rather
171   than
234   just
9   exiting
790   if
19   there's
13   less
171   than
3088   a
2   screenful
2059   of
8   input.
26   -N
29   No
1   stretch.
26   Don't
4   stretch
46   color
45   changes
94   out
3144   to
6605   the
37   right
1   edge
2059   of
6605   the
14   screen.
45   -n
4   Next
383   file
43   option.
1   Pressing
67   space
16   bar
268   when
6605   the
11   end-of-file
63   message
1837   is
10   displayed
39   causes
207   more
3144   to
23   continue
920   with
6605   the
71   next
383   file
1041   or
3144   to
44   exit
790   if
87   there
650   are
227   no
207   more
52   files.
1   -s&lt;scroll&gt;
21   Set
6605   the
33   integer
117   default
6   scroll
1   amount.
3   -t&lt;tabs&gt;
21   Set
19   tabs
23   every
33   integer
165   number
2059   of
7   spaces.
21   -w
1   Enable
2   mouse
2   wheel
2   scrolling.
64   -c
21   Show
2   non-printables
1307   in
1930   C
35   language
1   style.
20   -v
4   Make
2   non-printables
1   Visible
857   as
41   control
55   characters.
32   -b
21   Show
9   Binary
45   values
2059   of
3   non-printable
55   characters.
15   -o
39   Use
5   Octal
1113   for
72   binary
27   data.
39   -d
39   Use
5   Decimal
1113   for
72   binary
27   data.
29   -x
39   Use
1   Hexadecimal
1113   for
72   binary
27   data.
4   -r&lt;radix&gt;
39   Use
1   user-specified
12   radix
1113   for
72   binary
27   data.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   (Useful
790   if
3088   a
320   filename
9   begins
920   with
5   "-".)
7   Initial
28   tab
18   settings
2223   and
12   radix
45   values
650   are
25   taken
640   from
6605   the
90   environmental
7   TABS
2223   and
3   RADIX
111   variables
790   if
28   they're
11   defined.
12   Otherwise,
1   TABS=8
2223   and
1   RADIX=16
1837   is
5   assumed.
6   Regular
2   Expressions:
2   Searching
511   can
924   be
58   done
1113   for
63   simple
44   literal
56   strings
1041   or
1113   for
33   matches
3144   to
37   regular
9   expressions,
201   which
650   are
63   written
1307   in
320   this
3   notation,
1307   in
7   decreasing
5   precedence:
29   c
39   Any
37   ordinary
172   character
33   matches
18   itself.
3   \c
52   Match
6605   the
44   literal
172   character
8   c.
4   Certain
197   characters
650   are
35   treated
4   specially:
3   \a
7   Audible
6   Alert
6   (Bell)
10   \r
11   Carriage
13   Return
3   \b
5   BackSpace
4   \t
30   Tab
3   \f
7   Form
9   Feed
3   \v
7   Vertical
30   Tab
26   \n
15   NewLine
6   \\
11   Single
4   BackSlash
5   \x
983   The
71   next
271   one
1041   or
94   two
197   characters
650   are
35   treated
857   as
18   hex
13   digits
14   specifying
6605   the
172   character
21   code.
34   ^
7   Beginning
2059   of
75   line.
4   $
97   End
2059   of
75   line.
14   .
52   Match
439   any
110   single
37   character.
4   [...]
52   Match
439   any
110   single
172   character
1307   in
6605   the
39   list.
4   [^...]
52   Match
439   any
110   single
172   character
471   not
1307   in
6605   the
39   list.
26   \n
52   Match
34   whatever
44   literal
106   text
6605   the
4   n'th
6   tagged
3   \(...\)
63   expression
14   matched.
3   r*
52   Match
29   zero
1041   or
207   more
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{n\}
52   Match
21   exactly
49   n
30   occurrences
2059   of
4   r,
105   where
49   n
1837   is
590   an
11   unsigned
27   decimal
12   integer.
3   r\{n,\}
52   Match
277   at
24   least
49   n
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{n,m\}
52   Match
277   at
24   least
7   n,
241   but
471   not
207   more
171   than
15   m
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{,m\}
52   Match
277   at
35   most
15   m
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r1r2
52   Match
63   expression
3   r1
42   followed
588   by
3   r2.
3   \(r\)
4   Tagged
37   regular
15   expression.
52   Match
6605   the
46   pattern
97   inside
6605   the
3   \(...\),
2223   and
17   remember
6605   the
44   literal
106   text
1061   that
14   matched.
261   A
37   regular
63   expression
46   pattern
29   cannot
38   contain
3   Null,
15   NewLine
1041   or
5   CarriageReturn
55   characters.
7   Colors:
150   You
193   may
436   set
252   your
51   own
9   choices
1113   for
204   screen
197   colors
191   using
94   these
90   environmental
9   variables:
22   Name
39   Use
47   Default
26   COLORS
13   Normal
204   screen
197   colors
7   &lt;null
7   string&gt;
7   MOREEOF
97   End
1041   or
8   Top
2059   of
25   File
26   messages
19   Green
4   MORETOPMEM
8   Top
2059   of
5   Memory
63   message
31   Bright
6   Yellow
6   MOREPROMPT
8   Prompt
372   line
277   at
6605   the
5   bottom
16   Red
883   on
18   White
7   MOREFILLIN
7   Characters
49   typed
277   at
6605   the
52   prompt
5   Black
7   MOREERROR
5   Unrecognizable
428   command
18   errors
31   Bright
18   White
883   on
16   Red
9   Colors
34   recognized
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
8   magenta
42   (or
19   red
7   blue),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
1041   or
8   white.
12   Foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
16   dim
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
2223   and
6605   the
80   words
16   bright,
10   dim,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on
193   may
924   be
1307   in
93   either
21   upper
1041   or
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
11   Either
1041   or
56   both
6605   the
17   foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
924   be
7   specified;
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
20   value,
102   it's
66   considered
9   transparent
2223   and
20   inherits
6605   the
46   color
10   underneath
61   it.
7   MOREERROR
2223   and
7   MOREFILLIN
12   inherit
640   from
1   MOREPROMPT.
1   MOREPROMPT,
4   MORETOPMEM
2223   and
7   MOREEOF
12   inherit
640   from
7   COLORS.
468   If
26   COLORS
1837   is
13   null,
207   more
55   uses
6605   the
213   current
204   screen
197   colors
879   it
13   finds
277   at
12   startup.

446   <h3>
1   mv<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="mt.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="newer.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
5   Move
29   Files
1041   or
23   Directories
91   Usage:
19   mv
1   [-cfilmsh-][+s]
4   source1
99   [
3   source2
57   ...
93   ]
20   destination
19   mv
1837   is
590   an
1   intelligent
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
1   mover.
25   It's
29   able
3144   to
16   move
93   either
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
15   regardless
2059   of
57   whether
6605   the
51   source
2223   and
20   destination
650   are
1307   in
6605   the
122   same
319   directory
1041   or
115   even
6605   the
122   same
26   drive.
29   Files
78   being
7   moved
19   anywhere
883   on
6605   the
122   same
6   partition
650   are
44   simply
1   renamed;
6605   the
111   data
2   stays
105   where
879   it
4   is.
4   Moving
3088   a
383   file
3144   to
3088   a
58   different
6   partition
1837   is
58   done
588   by
9   copying
6605   the
383   file
2223   and
189   then
5   deleting
6605   the
2   original.
468   If
675   you
16   move
3088   a
319   directory
241   but
879   it
4   keeps
6605   the
122   same
1   parent,
1061   that
190   also
1837   is
3088   a
63   simple
1   rename.
4   Moving
3088   a
319   directory
3144   to
3088   a
257   new
21   parent
1837   is
58   done
588   by
3088   a
9   mkdir
1307   in
6605   the
257   new
21   parent
2223   and
6   moving
364   all
6605   the
319   directory
40   contents
191   using
6605   the
122   same
1   "rename
105   where
1   possible"
1   strategy
1   recursively.
32   By
38   default,
23   security
8   descriptors
2223   and
44   access
41   control
28   lists
650   are
471   not
23   copied
640   from
51   source
3144   to
4   destination.
181   This
1837   is
1307   in
7   keeping
920   with
6605   the
841   Windows
22   convention
1061   that
23   security
1837   is
15   generally
37   inherited
109   through
6605   the
319   directory
7   structure.
97   Options:
64   -c
6   Continue
115   even
790   if
18   errors
650   are
18   encountered
7   attempting
3144   to
70   process
101   some
58   input
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
47   -f
10   Force
22   read-only
294   files
3144   to
924   be
3   overwritten.
30   -i
3   Interactive:
4   Ask
98   before
6   moving
197   each
8   object
883   on
6605   the
428   command
75   line.
27   -l
3   Logging
1837   is
3   on:
16   Display
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
197   each
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
857   as
102   it's
1   moved.
12   -m
7   Merge
2   sub-directories
2059   of
122   same
152   name
1307   in
51   source
2223   and
4   destination.
66   -s
3   Simple
2   move.
3   (Default.)
9   Do
471   not
60   copy
23   security
8   descriptors
2223   and
44   access
41   control
4   lists.
3   +s
18   Copy
23   security
8   descriptors
2223   and
44   access
4   lists.
35   Under
841   Windows
17   9x
1041   or
790   if
6605   the
20   destination
15   filesystem
135   does
471   not
54   support
2   ACLs,
49   that's
471   not
44   possible
2223   and
6605   the
23   security
34   information
380   will
924   be
8   lost.
181   This
1837   is
471   not
66   considered
590   an
106   error
2223   and
227   no
5   diagnostic
63   message
1837   is
10   given.
95   -h
11   Help
11   (this
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   (Useful
790   if
52   filenames
87   start
920   with
5   "-".)
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
10   Test
57   whether
29   file1
1837   is
16   newer
171   than
364   all
6605   the
7   others
91   Usage:
16   newer
2   [-2h-]
29   file1
28   file2
99   [
4   file3
57   ...
93   ]
2   Prints
2   "1"
790   if
29   file1
1837   is
16   newer
171   than
364   all
6605   the
4   others,
19   otherwise
35   prints
2   "0".
97   Options:
18   -2
2   Two-second
7   granularity
1113   for
12   comparing
2   timestamps.
2   Timestamps
883   on
8   NTFS
299   have
3088   a
16   100
2   nanosecond
2   granu-
2   larity.
58   But
790   if
6605   the
383   file
1837   is
23   copied
3144   to
3088   a
18   FAT
1041   or
10   HPFS
2   partition,
105   where
6605   the
7   granularity
1837   is
199   only
1307   in
2   two-
33   second
3   increments,
6605   the
19   timestamp
193   may
924   be
3   rounded
157   up
1041   or
3   down,
7   somewhat
3   arbitrarily.
8   (NT
4   rounds
27   down
241   but
36   OS/2
4   rounds
3   up.)
181   This
192   option
39   causes
439   any
94   two
19   timestamps
20   within
439   any
91   given
3   two-second
66   window
2   (endpoints
2   included)
3144   to
24   compare
10   equal.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

87   <pre><tt>
10   Test
57   whether
29   file1
1837   is
24   older
171   than
364   all
6605   the
7   others
91   Usage:
24   older
2   [-2h-]
29   file1
28   file2
99   [
4   file3
57   ...
93   ]
2   Prints
2   "1"
790   if
29   file1
1837   is
24   older
171   than
364   all
6605   the
4   others,
19   otherwise
35   prints
2   "0".
97   Options:
18   -2
2   Two-second
7   granularity
1113   for
12   comparing
2   timestamps.
2   Timestamps
883   on
8   NTFS
299   have
3088   a
16   100
2   nanosecond
2   granu-
2   larity.
58   But
790   if
6605   the
383   file
1837   is
23   copied
3144   to
3088   a
18   FAT
1041   or
10   HPFS
2   partition,
105   where
6605   the
7   granularity
1837   is
199   only
1307   in
2   two-
33   second
3   increments,
6605   the
19   timestamp
193   may
924   be
3   rounded
157   up
1041   or
3   down,
7   somewhat
3   arbitrarily.
8   (NT
4   rounds
27   down
241   but
36   OS/2
4   rounds
3   up.)
181   This
192   option
39   causes
439   any
94   two
19   timestamps
20   within
439   any
91   given
3   two-second
66   window
2   (endpoints
2   included)
3144   to
24   compare
10   equal.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

1   open<br/>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
8   Open
3088   a
25   File
191   using
6605   the
1   Associated
1   Application
91   Usage:
42   open
22   [-h-]
1   [-&lt;verb&gt;]
383   file
99   [
1   optional-parameters
93   ]
42   open
3   opens
590   an
19   arbitrary
383   file
191   using
6605   the
27   application
19   associated
920   with
1061   that
383   file
6   type,
15   based
883   on
122   its
320   filename
7   extension.
35   Under
841   Windows
2   95
2223   and
2   Window
81   NT
65   version
5   4.0
1041   or
10   later,
1   associations
650   are
18   stored
1307   in
6605   the
6   registry
857   as
1   classes
920   with
34   information
47   about
81   what
27   application
131   should
924   be
281   used
920   with
197   each
84   type
2059   of
383   file
2223   and
91   how
879   it
12   works.
106   When
42   open
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
42   open
3088   a
39   file,
49   that's
80   always
58   done
1307   in
3088   a
58   different
12   window,
13   though
8   sometimes
1061   that
193   may
924   be
1307   in
590   an
31   existing
3   instance
2059   of
6605   the
13   application.
111   For
101   example,
6   opening
3088   a
243   Microsoft
9   Word
11   document
380   will
87   start
3088   a
257   new
70   process
92   running
9   Word
790   if
271   one
1837   is
471   not
55   already
8   running.
58   But
790   if
1   Word's
55   already
8   running,
189   then
9   Word
380   will
44   simply
42   open
6   yet
55   another
107   child
66   window
920   with
6605   the
152   specified
96   file.
983   The
7   choice
2059   of
57   whether
3144   to
87   start
55   another
3   instance
2059   of
590   an
1   already-
92   running
27   application
14   versus
25   having
879   it
44   simply
42   open
55   another
107   child
66   window
1837   is
43   defined
588   by
6605   the
27   application
2223   and
6605   the
8   entries
1307   in
6605   the
1   registry,
471   not
588   by
2   open.
11   Both
111   data
294   files
2223   and
37   ordinary
40   executable
294   files
511   can
924   be
6   opened
920   with
2   open.
468   If
102   it's
590   an
37   ordinary
1   executable,
23   additional
74   arguments
511   can
924   be
62   specified,
201   which
650   are
44   simply
73   passed
857   as
428   command
372   line
1   (argc,
2   argv)
74   arguments
3144   to
6605   the
107   child
20   process.
1   Optional
4   parameters
6   aren't
15   generally
5   meaningful
268   when
6   opening
111   data
39   files,
13   though
10   usually
364   all
1061   that
7   happens
1837   is
1061   that
28   they're
22   ignored.
983   The
8   exception
161   would
924   be
159   script
294   files
1061   that
511   can
16   take
12   arguments.
10   Once
6605   the
19   associated
27   application
289   has
382   been
4   started,
42   open
2   exits.
159   It
135   does
471   not
14   wait
1113   for
6605   the
107   child
27   application
3144   to
5   complete.
97   Options:
95   -h
11   Help
1   -&lt;verb&gt;
8   Open
6605   the
383   file
2223   and
11   perform
6605   the
5   action
1   indicated
588   by
6605   the
1   verb,
95   e.g.,
1   'print'.
983   The
190   list
2059   of
1   verbs
1061   that
193   may
924   be
281   used
6   depends
883   on
6605   the
13   application.
983   The
117   default
1837   is
44   simply
3144   to
42   open
6605   the
96   file.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
65   options
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   paste<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="open.htm">Previous</a>

446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   Paste:
7   Merge
1   Corresponding
1041   or
1   Subsequent
15   Lines
91   Usage:
26   paste
2   [-sh-]
4   [-d
1   list]
383   file
57   ...
4   Concatenate
33   corresponding
111   lines
2059   of
6605   the
58   input
39   files,
56   writing
6605   the
64   output
3144   to
44   stdout.
39   Any
3   newlines
1041   or
9   carriage
1   return-
8   newline
7   combinations
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
439   any
111   lines
42   except
47   those
125   read
640   from
6605   the
77   last
383   file
650   are
12   replaced
920   with
28   tab
55   characters.
468   If
11   end-of-file
1837   is
18   encountered
883   on
101   some
241   but
471   not
364   all
6605   the
39   files,
26   paste
3   behaves
857   as
790   if
879   it
132   were
46   reading
16   empty
111   lines
640   from
47   those
52   files.
261   A
320   filename
2059   of
3088   a
110   single
1   "-"
1   (minus)
172   character
1837   is
3088   a
94   special
97   case
2223   and
380   will
924   be
18   interpreted
857   as
5   referring
3144   to
29   stdin.
97   Options:
39   -d
190   list
1   Specifies
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
7   delimiters
3144   to
924   be
281   used
46   instead
6605   the
117   default
28   tab
172   character
268   when
9   pasting
111   lines
6   together.
468   If
207   more
171   than
271   one
172   character
1837   is
34   given,
26   paste
380   will
270   use
72   them
1   circularly,
1   resetting
51   back
3144   to
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
6605   the
190   list
61   after
197   each
372   line
2059   of
19   output.
983   The
190   list
193   may
38   contain
6605   the
84   following
94   special
121   escape
1   sequences:
26   \n
11   Carriage
4   return-newline
16   combination
4   \t
30   Tab
6   \\
1   Backslash
1   \0
1   Empty
129   string
7   (not
3088   a
48   null
1   character).
66   -s
4   Concatenate
2   subsequent
111   lines
2059   of
197   each
383   file
46   rather
171   than
5   merging
111   lines
640   from
58   different
52   files.
983   The
412   end
2059   of
111   data
640   from
197   each
383   file
380   will
924   be
6   terminated
920   with
6605   the
4   line-end
16   combination
28   found
87   there
1041   or
3088   a
9   carriage
4   return-newline
16   combination
790   if
87   there
363   was
227   no
372   line
9   end.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
5   Pop
3088   a
257   new
18   Current
17   Directory
2223   and
7   Disk
91   off
6605   the
6   Stack
91   Usage:
17   popd
1   [-hvd-]
99   [
49   n
93   ]
5   Pop
590   an
33   integer
49   n
319   directory
9   paths
640   from
6605   the
14   top
2059   of
6605   the
4   stack,
15   making
6605   the
14   top
271   one
10   remaining
6605   the
257   new
213   current
319   directory
2223   and
24   disk.
983   The
117   default
1113   for
49   n
1837   is
35   1.
10   (See
190   also
6605   the
4   cd,
7   dirs,
13   pushd
2223   and
12   rotd
9   commands.)
97   Options:
39   -d
4   Discard
234   just
24   stack
20   entry
7   n,
13   counting
640   from
120   0
277   at
6605   the
1   top,
3   popping
26   everything
1   below
879   it
157   up
271   one
4   level.
66   -s
3   Silent.
26   Don't
31   print
6605   the
17   resulting
319   directory
19   stack.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>

522   <h4>
3314   <a
223   href="https://hamiltonlabs.com">Hamilton
223   Laboratories</a>
663   &#9655;
3314   <a
223   href="https://hamiltonlabs.com/Cshell.htm">Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
223   2012</a>
663   &#9655;
3314   <a
288   href="../index.htm">User
222   guide</a>
663   &#9655;
3314   <a
144   href="../50-BuiltinUtilities.htm">Builtin
90   utilities</a>

87   <pre><tt>
27   Print
3   Process
29   &amp;
5   Thread
1   Status
91   Usage:
20   ps
2   [-sh-]
21   Show
6605   the
60   status
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
65   background
2   jobs,
30   processes
2223   and
33   threads
10   related
3144   to
320   this
5   invocation
2059   of
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
980   shell,
18   highlighting
6605   the
213   current
16   thread.
4   Background
1   jobs
650   are
33   created
268   when
675   you
84   type
590   an
5   ampersand
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
428   command
75   line.
983   The
18   job
165   number
1837   is
6605   the
165   number
27   reported
268   when
6605   the
18   job
1837   is
33   created
2223   and
3   applies
3144   to
364   all
1   screens,
30   processes
2223   and
33   threads
33   created
588   by
1061   that
2   job.
1   Processes
650   are
33   created
268   when
62   commands
650   are
49   typed
1061   that
7   require
176   other
40   executable
12   programs
3144   to
12   run.
3   Process
3   ids
22   begin
920   with
1   'p'.
5   Threads
650   are
2   concurrent
13   activities
17   going
883   on
97   inside
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
55   shell.
1   Some,
28   such
857   as
6605   the
4   cleanup
13   activities
1061   that
4   watch
1113   for
176   other
33   threads
1041   or
30   processes
3144   to
412   end
80   always
146   run
1307   in
6605   the
8   background.
1   Others
650   are
33   created
268   when
3088   a
428   command
8   requires
1061   that
590   an
30   internal
29   function
924   be
146   run
1307   in
6605   the
8   background.
5   Thread
3   ids
22   begin
920   with
1   't'.
97   Options:
66   -s
29   List
6   details
2059   of
364   all
30   processes
2   system-wide.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>

87   <pre><tt>
4   Push
3088   a
257   new
18   Current
17   Directory
2223   and
7   Disk
50   onto
6605   the
6   Stack
91   Usage:
13   pushd
2   [-hs-]
99   [
64   -c
1   [n]
93   ]
99   [
319   directory
93   ]
2   Go
3144   to
3088   a
257   new
213   current
319   directory
2223   and
14   disk,
5   saving
6605   the
26   old
45   values
883   on
6605   the
319   directory
19   stack.
468   If
227   no
10   operands
650   are
34   given,
2   swap
6605   the
14   top
94   two
13   elements
2059   of
6605   the
19   stack.
468   If
6605   the
89   path
675   you
94   specify
1837   is
234   just
61   3
1041   or
207   more
3   dots,
13   pushd
380   will
10   interpret
1061   that
4   specially.
13   Just
857   as
10   ".."
99   means
19   go
157   up
271   one
3   level,
6   "..."
99   means
157   up
102   2
9   levels,
3   "...."
99   means
157   up
61   3
9   levels,
38   etc.
468   If
6605   the
319   directory
22   isn't
12   found,
6605   the
6   CDPATH
1837   is
2   searched.
10   (See
190   also
6605   the
4   cd,
7   dirs,
17   popd
2223   and
12   rotd
9   commands.)
97   Options:
64   -c
18   Copy
590   an
3   item
55   already
883   on
6605   the
24   stack
50   onto
6605   the
4   top.
181   This
32   form
16   takes
590   an
8   optional
6   parameter
49   n
201   which
9   specifies
6605   the
33   integer
3   item
15   number,
13   counting
640   from
120   0
277   at
6605   the
4   top.
47   Default
1837   is
49   n
69   ==
16   0.
66   -s
3   Silent.
26   Don't
31   print
6605   the
17   resulting
319   directory
19   stack.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,

6605   the

87   <pre><tt>
27   Print
6605   the
18   Current
1   Working
23   Directories
91   Usage:
15   pwd
1   [-ach-]
99   [
3   disk1
3   disk2
57   ...
93   ]
15   pwd
35   prints
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
6605   the
213   current
55   directories.
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
15   pwd
20   looks
1113   for
3088   a
8   DRIVEMASK
90   environmental
243   variable
171   than
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
8   mask
91   off
234   just
6605   the
55   drives
675   you
84   want
11   reported.
983   The
8   DRIVEMASK
1837   is
152   specified
857   as
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
112   drive
3   letters;
13   ranges
650   are
6   allowed.
12   Otherwise,
364   all
6605   the
27   fixed
83   disk
5   partitions
45   beginning
920   with
8   c:
650   are
11   reported.
983   The
213   current
319   directory
883   on
6605   the
213   current
112   drive
1837   is
6   highlighted.
15   pwd
7   routinely
17   reports
26   everything
1307   in
32   lower
97   case
1113   for
25   better
6   readability.
58   But
15   pwd
380   will
43   look
1113   for
590   an
1   evironmental
39   variable,
3   MIXEDCASEDRIVES,
9   giving
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
5   drives,
95   e.g.,
2   f-hq,
54   meaning
55   drives
2   F:
109   through
2   H:
2223   and
112   drive
1   Q:,
201   which
131   should
924   be
10   displayed
1307   in
40   mixed
43   case.
97   Options:
29   -a
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
38   report
883   on
364   all
7   disks.
64   -c
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
38   report
883   on
234   just
6605   the
213   current
24   disk.
95   -h
79   Help.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   Colors:
150   You
193   may
436   set
252   your
51   own
9   choices
1113   for
204   screen
197   colors
191   using
94   these
90   environmental
9   variables:
22   Name
39   Use
47   Default
26   COLORS
13   Normal
204   screen
197   colors
7   &lt;null
7   string&gt;
12   HIGHLIGHT
18   Current
83   disk
31   Bright
9   Colors
34   recognized
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
8   magenta
42   (or
19   red
7   blue),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
1041   or
8   white.
12   Foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
16   dim
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
2223   and
6605   the
80   words
16   bright,
10   dim,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on
193   may
924   be
1307   in
93   either
21   upper
1041   or
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
11   Either
1041   or
56   both
6605   the
17   foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
924   be
7   specified;
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
20   value,
102   it's
66   considered
9   transparent
2223   and
20   inherits
6605   the
46   color
10   underneath
61   it.
12   HIGHLIGHT
20   inherits
640   from
7   COLORS.
468   If
26   COLORS
1837   is
13   null,
15   pwd
55   uses
6605   the
213   current
204   screen
197   colors
879   it
13   finds
277   at
12   startup.
8   Specifying
5   COLORS=none
20   turns
91   off
364   all
270   use
2059   of
4   color.

446   <h3>
1   random<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="pwd.htm">Previous</a>

851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   Random
165   number
1   generator
91   Usage:
15   random
99   [
64   -c
93   ]
99   [
32   -b
498   |
2   -e[Digits]
498   |
2   -f[Digits]
498   |
2   -u[Bits]
93   ]
99   [
49   n
93   ]
15   random
25   writes
49   n
3   pseudorandom
45   values
3144   to
6   stdout,
105   where
6605   the
45   values
511   can
924   be
11   unsigned
4   integers,
30   floating
39   point
21   numbers
64   between
1   0.0
2223   and
1   1.0,
1041   or
41   bytes
2059   of
72   binary
27   data.
983   The
117   default
1837   is
271   one
1   31-bit
11   unsigned
12   integer.
47   Default
1113   for
30   floating
39   point
1837   is
17   6
13   digits
2059   of
1   precision,
14   maximum
1837   is
2   17.
15   random
1   relies
883   on
6605   the
21   Win32
1   CryptGenRandom
8   API
1307   in
841   Windows
857   as
6605   the
1   underlying
2   cryptographically
3   secure
3   pseudorandom
165   number
1   generator.
97   Options:
64   -c
1   Continuously
60   write
15   random
111   data
42   until
4   interrupted
1041   or
42   until
25   writes
6   fail,
95   e.g.,
790   if
56   writing
178   into
3088   a
21   pipe
1061   that
1   closes.
32   -b
3   Bytes
2059   of
72   binary
27   data.
2   -e[Digits]
1   E-format
30   floating
6   point.
2   -f[Digits]
3   Fixed
39   point
30   floating
6   point.
2   -u[Bits]
3   Unsigned
4   integers,
14   maximum
1   64
4   bits.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
160   </tt></pre>

1   rehash<br/>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   Reinitialize
7   Path
3   Hashing
91   Usage:
6   rehash
22   [-h-]
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
55   uses
3088   a
19   hashing
27   mechanism
3144   to
3   speed
157   up
3   searches
2059   of
6605   the
89   path
55   directories.
468   If
11   you're
3   performing
110   system
2   administration
12   work,
6   moving
294   files
1307   in
6605   the
89   path
12   directories,
6605   the
13   hash
27   mechanism
193   may
471   not
80   always
18   reflect
6605   the
15   latest
45   changes
5   you've
7   made.
983   The
6   rehash
428   command
42   allows
675   you
3144   to
2   re-initialize
6605   the
13   hash
588   by
1   re-reading
364   all
6605   the
89   path
103   directories
2223   and
35   setting
6   nohashing
527   =
16   0.
53   (The
6   unhash
428   command
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
28   turn
19   hashing
1   off.)
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

446   <h3>
1   rm<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="random.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
8   Remove
29   Files
1041   or
23   Directories
91   Usage:
2   hrm
1   [-rfcHSxZilh-]
4   pathname1
99   [
4   pathname2
57   ...
93   ]
27   rm
511   can
14   delete
56   both
294   files
2223   and
55   directories.
468   If
675   you
47   try
3144   to
14   remove
3088   a
383   file
920   with
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
94   special
44   mode
15   bits
436   set
2   (see
1   chmod)
1041   or
3088   a
319   directory
49   that's
471   not
2   empty,
6   it'll
3   refuse
42   unless
675   you
270   use
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
65   options
3144   to
20   let
879   it
22   know
49   that's
31   really
81   what
675   you
2   mean.
97   Options:
29   -r
5   Recursively
14   remove
2   non-empty
55   directories.
47   -f
10   Force
22   read-only
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
3144   to
924   be
6   removed.
139   Also,
1   warn
47   about
241   but
19   otherwise
16   ignore
8   attempts
3144   to
14   remove
5   non-
1   existent
52   files.
9   -H
6   Hidden
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
511   can
924   be
6   removed.
15   -S
22   System
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
511   can
924   be
6   removed.
29   -x
113   All
2059   of
6605   the
2   above.
38   Same
857   as
1   -rfHS
64   -c
6   Continue
115   even
790   if
18   errors
650   are
18   encountered
7   attempting
3144   to
70   process
101   some
294   files
1041   or
55   directories.
7   -Z
18   Write
72   binary
8   zeros
17   across
439   any
294   files
78   being
16   deleted
98   before
4   removing
7   them,
9   thus
2   preventing
5   anyone
640   from
1   recovering
6605   the
111   data
191   using
590   an
2   "undelete"
5   program.
30   -i
3   Interactive:
4   Ask
98   before
4   removing
197   each
8   object
883   on
6605   the
428   command
75   line.
27   -l
3   Logging
1837   is
3   on:
16   Display
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
197   each
383   file
1041   or
319   directory
857   as
102   it's
6   removed.
95   -h
11   Help
11   (this
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   (Useful
790   if
52   filenames
87   start
920   with
5   "-".)
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

2   directory2

380   will
199   only
14   remove
16   empty
55   directories.

15   bits
1   (system,
17   hidden
1041   or
1   read-only)
650   are
22   ignored.

6605   the
17   Directory
6   Stack

12   rotd
2   [-hs-]

93   ]

6605   the
319   directory
24   stack
590   an
33   integer
49   n
3   positions.
1   Positive
45   values
58   cause
2   upward
1   rotation;
4   negative
45   values
58   cause
1   downward
1   rotation.
983   The
117   default
1837   is
2   upward
2   rotation
588   by
271   one
7   position.

190   also
6605   the
4   cd,
7   dirs,
13   pushd
2223   and
17   popd
9   commands.)

66   -s

31   print
6605   the

319   directory
19   stack.

76   screen.)

2059   of
118   options.

24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.

58   different

2   Stream
4   editor
91   Usage:

51   sed
1837   is
3088   a
94   special
106   text
4   editor
1113   for
270   use
883   on
2   streams
2059   of
111   data
105   where
879   it
1   cycles,
46   reading
3088   a
372   line
640   from
8   input,
2   applying
6605   the
57   editing
23   operations
5   you've
62   specified,
2223   and
56   writing
6605   the
48   result
3144   to
44   stdout.
983   The
58   input
1837   is
125   read
1307   in
3088   a
110   single
28   pass
2223   and
197   each
372   line
1837   is
4   acted
883   on
199   only
5   once.
983   The
57   editing
159   script
511   can
924   be
152   specified
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
14   or,
790   if
102   it's
53   long
2223   and
4   complex,
1307   in
3088   a
96   file.
468   If
675   you
84   want
3144   to
2   combine
3088   a
159   script
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
920   with
439   any
176   other
24   script,
675   you
64   must
270   use
6605   the
34   -e
43   option.
983   The
57   editing
23   operations
16   available
650   are
6605   the
12   usual
3   search/replace,
1   insert/delete,
38   etc.
11   With
197   each
2   operation,
675   you
15   generally
511   can
94   specify
6605   the
111   lines
1307   in
6605   the
383   file
879   it
131   should
9   affect
93   either
588   by
372   line
165   number
1041   or
26   matching
3088   a
46   pattern
1041   or
3088   a
22   range
2059   of
15   lines.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
47   -f
2   scriptfile
24   Read
6605   the
159   script
640   from
3088   a
96   file.
6   Multiple
47   -f
65   options
650   are
5   allowed
2223   and
6605   the
52   scripts
650   are
2   concatenated.
34   -e
159   script
3   Take
6605   the
84   following
77   argument
97   word
857   as
3088   a
19   script.
6   Multiple
34   -e
65   options
650   are
190   also
6   allowed.
30   -i
17   Ignore
172   character
43   case.
45   -n
26   Don't
37   automatically
60   write
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
6605   the
29   edit
45   buffer
3144   to
30   stdout
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
197   each
6   cycle.
26   -N
2   Normalize
439   any
58   input
3144   to
270   use
6605   the
283   UNIX
22   convention
2059   of
3088   a
63   simple
26   \n
172   character
3144   to
4   terminate
197   each
31   line,
189   then
1   re-expand
6605   the
106   text
883   on
64   output
3144   to
13   follow
6605   the
22   \r\n

281   used
883   on
3088   a
1   PC.
181   This
192   option
1837   is
33   useful
1307   in
1   porting
51   sed
52   scripts
640   from
3088   a
283   UNIX
6   system.
66   -s

6605   the
159   script
640   from
29   stdin.
53   (The
58   input
6   stream
3144   to
924   be
6   edited
64   must
924   be
1307   in
3088   a
2   file.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
1   Scripts:
983   The
159   script
1837   is
63   written
857   as
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
228   commands,
197   each
29   separated
640   from
6605   the
71   next
588   by
3088   a
372   line
412   end
1041   or
3088   a
2   semicolon.
983   The
59   format
2059   of
3088   a
428   command
2   is:
99   [
1   address1
99   [
4   ,
1   address2
93   ]
93   ]
18   operation
3   Spacing
64   between
35   fields
1837   is
2   arbitrary:
675   you
511   can
270   use
42   spaces
1041   or
19   tabs
64   between
35   fields
1041   or
299   have
12   none
277   at
364   all
857   as
675   you
3   prefer.
14   Here
650   are
6605   the
1   fields:
8   address
1837   is
3088   a
372   line
165   number
1041   or
37   regular
63   expression
3144   to
924   be
14   matched.
106   When
3088   a
37   regular
63   expression
1837   is
281   used
857   as
590   an
3   address,
102   it's
56   normally
63   written
857   as
1   /regexp/
241   but
102   it's
190   also
44   possible
3144   to
270   use
6605   the
25   syntax
1   \?regexp?
105   where
13   ?
1837   is
439   any
37   character.
1   Zero-
1041   or
1   One-Address
2   Operations:
468   If
675   you
38   don't
45   give
590   an
3   address,
6605   the
18   operation
1837   is
8   applied
3144   to
364   all
15   lines.
468   If
675   you
45   give
3088   a
110   single
3   address,
6605   the
18   operation
1837   is
58   done
883   on
197   each
372   line
1061   that
20   matches.
1   Ranges:
106   When
675   you
45   give
94   two
1   addresses,
675   you
21   define
3088   a
9   range.
261   A
22   range
511   can
924   be
3088   a
110   single
31   line,
95   e.g.,
1   "3,3",
1041   or
3088   a
50   whole
26   group
2059   of
15   lines.
468   If
6605   the
1   addresses
2   involve

6605   the
22   range

8   occur

2223   and
53   over
1307   in
6605   the
58   input
2223   and
380   will
924   be
4   acted
883   on
197   each
16   time.
11   Most
4   operations,
95   e.g.,
3   search/replace,
650   are
58   done
27   against
364   all
111   lines
1307   in
6605   the
9   range.
983   The
6   exceptions
650   are
2   i\
1   (insert),
201   which
1837   is
4   acted
883   on
277   at
20   entry
3144   to
6605   the
1   range;
3   a\
1   (append),
2223   and
33   q
1   (quit),
201   which
650   are
4   acted
883   on
277   at
6605   the
2   end;
2223   and
3   c\
1   (change),
201   which
2   deletes
364   all
6605   the
111   lines
1307   in
6605   the
22   range

28   doesn't
60   write
439   any
64   output
42   until
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
9   range.
18   operation
1837   is
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
3   28
11   basic
23   operations
1   provided,
13   together
920   with
439   any
74   arguments
879   it
1   takes.
2   Operations:
29   There
650   are
94   two
8   buffers
1307   in
1   sed:
6605   the
29   edit
45   buffer
2223   and
6605   the
13   hold
13   buffer.
11   Most
2059   of
6605   the
57   editing
23   operations
102   work
883   on
6605   the
29   edit
5   buffer,
21   doing
12   search/replace
4   operations,
3   translating
19   characters,
2223   and
5   saving
1041   or
2   retrieving
106   text
1307   in
6605   the
13   hold
13   buffer.
5   Sed
37   automatically
7   puts
197   each
257   new
372   line
178   into
6605   the
29   edit
45   buffer
1   (along
920   with
122   its
16   trailing
372   line
2   end)

6605   the
87   start
2059   of

3   cycle
42   unless
87   there
363   was
32   something
20   left
53   over

3088   a
5   D

1   head)
47   command.
261   A
33   second
26   group
2059   of
23   operations
17   provide
14   ways
2059   of
4   inserting
8   blocks
2059   of
5   static
19   text.
983   The
71   next

2059   of
23   operations

1   rudimentary
14   ways
2059   of
1   condition-testing
2223   and
2   branching

2059   of
8   nesting
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
23   operations

6   Finally
87   there

1113   for
2   printing
2223   and
21   doing
176   other
28   i/o
2223   and
1113   for

2   miscellaneous
1   things.
11   Basic
1   Editing:
15   d
16   Delete
320   this
7   section.
22   Start
6605   the
71   next
6   cycle.
5   D

640   from
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
29   edit
45   buffer
109   through
2223   and
33   including
6605   the
281   first
372   line

468   If

106   text
2   remaining,
34   immediately

277   at
6605   the
14   top
2059   of

159   script
63   without
46   reading
3088   a
257   new

12   Otherwise,
87   start
6605   the

6   cycle.
1   s/.../.../[ngpw]
1   Search/replace
191   using
37   regular
13   expressions.
106   In
6605   the
12   replace
13   string,
1   "&amp;"
99   means
34   whatever
6605   the
76   search
129   string
14   matched.
1   "\n",

49   n
1837   is
3088   a
15   number,
99   means
34   whatever
16   matched
1061   that
6   tagged
63   expression
1307   in
6605   the
76   search
35   string.
11   Other
121   escape
2   sequences,
28   such
857   as
1   "\r"
3144   to
19   mean
11   Carriage
1   Return,
511   can
190   also
924   be
14   used,
234   just
857   as
104   they
650   are
1307   in
3088   a
37   regular
63   expression
76   search
129   string
1   (described
1   below).
983   The
76   search
2223   and
12   replace
56   strings
650   are
26   shown
20   here
1   delimited
920   with
1   /,
241   but
675   you
193   may
21   choose
439   any
172   character
675   you
90   like
1061   that
28   doesn't
8   occur

983   The
84   following
10   modifiers
650   are
1   accepted:
49   n

640   from

3144   to

1113   for

8   g

72   binary
55   characters.
32   p
1   Print.
18   Write
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
6605   the
29   edit
45   buffer
3144   to
44   stdout.
1   P
27   Print
640   from
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
6605   the
29   edit
45   buffer
109   through
2223   and
33   including
6605   the
281   first
372   line
2   ending.
1   #n
6   Suppress
439   any
4   automatic
64   output
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
197   each
1   cyle.
11   Other
18   I/O
3   operations:
49   n
4   Next
75   line.
18   Write
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
6605   the
29   edit
45   buffer
3144   to
6   stdout,
9   dump
439   any
8   appended
106   text
2223   and
125   read
3088   a
257   new
372   line
640   from
36   stdin
3144   to
6605   the
29   edit
13   buffer.
3   N
24   Read
6605   the
71   next
372   line
50   onto
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
29   edit
45   buffer
920   with
3088   a
22   \r\n
24   sequence
1307   in
2   between.
20   r
383   file
18   Copy
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
320   this
383   file
3144   to
30   stdout
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
6   cycle.
9   w
383   file
18   Write
6605   the
29   edit
1   butter
50   onto
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
39   file,
14   creating
879   it
790   if
879   it
28   doesn't
25   exist.
1   Miscellaneous:
15   !
18   operation
26   Don't
6   apply
320   this
29   function
42   unless
6605   the
1   addressing
1   DOESN'T
19   match.
3   Invert
6605   the
372   line
1   selections.
30   ;
3   Null
30   statement.
597   #
11   comment
3   Comments
2223   and
10   blank
111   lines
650   are
22   ignored.
468   If
30   multiple
3   a\
3   (append)
1041   or
20   r
1   (read
3   file)
6   instructions
650   are
13   executed
42   (or
6605   the
122   same
271   one
1837   is
3   iterated
1307   in
3088   a
1   loop),
3088   a
257   new
20   entry
1837   is
56   made
883   on
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
8   appended
106   text
8   blocks
3144   to
924   be
23   copied
3144   to
30   stdout
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
6   cycle.
106   When
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
3   cycle
1837   is
3   finally
1   reached,
6605   the
50   whole
190   list
1837   is
1   dumped,
1307   in
25   order
640   from
6605   the
4   top.
6   Regular
2   Expressions:
10   Search
16   patterns
650   are
152   specified
857   as
37   regular
25   expressions
90   like
47   those
281   used
588   by
4   grep.
6   Regular
25   expressions
650   are
63   written
1307   in
320   this
3   notation,
1307   in
7   decreasing
5   precedence:
29   c
39   Any
37   ordinary
172   character
33   matches
18   itself.
3   \c
52   Match
6605   the
44   literal
172   character
8   c.
4   Certain
197   characters
650   are
35   treated
4   specially:
3   \a
7   Audible
6   Alert
6   (Bell)
10   \r
11   Carriage
13   Return
3   \b
5   BackSpace
4   \t
30   Tab
3   \f
7   Form
9   Feed
3   \v
7   Vertical
30   Tab
26   \n
15   NewLine
6   \\
11   Single
4   BackSlash
5   \x
983   The
71   next
271   one
1041   or
94   two
197   characters
650   are
35   treated
857   as
18   hex
13   digits
14   specifying
6605   the
172   character
21   code.
34   ^
7   Beginning
2059   of
75   line.
4   $
97   End
2059   of
75   line.
14   .
52   Match
439   any
110   single
37   character.
4   [...]
52   Match
439   any
110   single
172   character
1307   in
6605   the
39   list.
4   [^...]
52   Match
439   any
110   single
172   character
471   not
1307   in
6605   the
39   list.
26   \n
52   Match
34   whatever
44   literal
106   text
6605   the
4   n'th
6   tagged
3   \(...\)
63   expression
14   matched.
3   r*
52   Match
29   zero
1041   or
207   more
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{n\}
52   Match
21   exactly
49   n
30   occurrences
2059   of
4   r,
105   where
49   n
1837   is
590   an
11   unsigned
27   decimal
12   integer.
3   r\{n,\}
52   Match
277   at
24   least
49   n
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{n,m\}
52   Match
277   at
24   least
7   n,
241   but
471   not
207   more
171   than
15   m
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r\{,m\}
52   Match
277   at
35   most
15   m
30   occurrences
2059   of
12   r.
3   r1r2
52   Match
63   expression
3   r1
42   followed
588   by
3   r2.
3   \(r\)
4   Tagged
37   regular
15   expression.
52   Match
6605   the
46   pattern
97   inside
6605   the
3   \(...\),
2223   and
17   remember
6605   the
44   literal
106   text
1061   that
14   matched.
261   A
37   regular
63   expression
46   pattern
29   cannot
38   contain
1   Nulls
241   but
879   it
511   can
38   contain
15   NewLine
1041   or
5   CarriageReturn
197   characters
12   (which
193   may
924   be
33   useful
920   with
6605   the
3   N
1041   or
2   G
9   commands.)
106   When
19   typing
3088   a
37   regular
63   expression
883   on
6605   the
428   command
31   line,
17   remember
1061   that
2   $,
2   [,
7   ],
4   ^,
84   (
2223   and
210   )
299   have
94   special
54   meaning
3144   to
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
55   shell.
6   Put
110   single
52   quotes
45   around
6605   the
129   string
3144   to
28   turn
91   off
1061   that
94   special
5   meaning.
139   Also,
115   even
97   inside
6   quotes,
84   type
3   ^^
3144   to
19   mean
34   ^
42   except
268   when
879   it
34   immediately
7   follows
3   [.
139   Also,
23   /
277   at
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
3088   a
97   word
883   on
6605   the
428   command
372   line
1837   is
25   taken
857   as
3   introducing
590   an
43   option.
468   If
675   you
19   mean
879   it
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
3088   a
24   script,
270   use
6605   the
1   "--"
192   option
10   ahead
2059   of
61   it.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>

446   <h3>
1   setrows<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="sed.htm">Previous</a>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
2   Set/Report
6605   the
13   Number
2059   of
1   Rows
1307   in
6605   the
16   Display
2   Window
91   Usage:
9   setrows
22   [-h-]
99   [
1   buffer_rows
1   [[buffer_columns]
1   window_rows
1   [window_columns]]
93   ]
1   Setrows
380   will
47   try
3144   to
436   set
6605   the
9   sizes
2059   of
6605   the
43   console
45   buffer
2223   and
2059   of
6605   the
8   visible
66   window
178   into
61   it.
983   The
4   exact
2   effects
2059   of
1   setrows,
1307   in
7   addition
3144   to
25   reporting
6605   the
213   current
5   values,
6   depends
883   on
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
2   arguments:
120   0
26   Don't
78   change
439   any
3   settings.
214   1
21   Set
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
45   buffer
1   rows,
1   shrinking
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
66   window
6   rows
857   as
2   necessary.
102   2
21   Set
6605   the
45   buffer
2223   and
66   window
5   rows.
61   3
21   Set
6605   the
45   buffer
2223   and
66   window
6   rows
2223   and
66   window
3   columns.
35   4
21   Set
1   everything.
468   If
227   no
74   arguments
650   are
62   specified,
9   setrows
234   just
17   reports
6605   the
213   current
7   values.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

17   hidden

1837   is

2   task

6   bar.

2223   and

1837   is

6605   the

2223   and

446   <h3>
1   shortcut<br/>

2   href="setwin.htm">Previous</a>

2   href="showdesk.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
7   Create
1041   or
9   Report
3088   a
2   Shortcut
91   Usage:
16   shortcut
22   [-h-]
1   [-a
74   arguments
93   ]
4   [-d
1   directory]
8   [-D
1   description]
6   [-s
1   showcommand]
4   [-i
1   iconfile]
1   [-x
1   iconindex]
2   [-c
1   consoleprop]
4   shortcutfile
99   [
3   linkedpath
99   [
74   arguments
2   ]]
7   Create
1041   or
38   report
3088   a
6   shortcut.
468   If
56   both
6605   the
3   linkedpath
2223   and
4   shortcutfile
74   arguments
650   are
34   given,
6605   the
16   shortcut
1837   is
8   created.
468   If
199   only
6605   the
4   shortcutfile
77   argument
1837   is
34   given,
102   it's
27   reported
1041   or
1   updated,
13   depending
883   on
6605   the
1   presence
1041   or
1   absense
2059   of
439   any
118   options.
468   If
6605   the
4   shortcutfile
135   does
471   not
412   end
1307   in
3088   a
1   .lnk
7   extension,
6605   the
383   file
380   will
66   still
924   be
33   created
241   but
6605   the
1129   shell
12   won't
10   recognize
61   it.
97   Options:
29   -a
74   arguments
39   Any
428   command
372   line
74   arguments
3144   to
924   be
73   passed
3144   to
6605   the
19   associated
13   application.
6   Multiple
74   arguments
193   may
924   be
152   specified
191   using
29   -a
65   options
6   and/or
588   by
14   specifying
74   arguments
191   using
29   -a
2223   and
84   following
6605   the
1   linkedpath,
1307   in
201   which
13   case,
28   they're
5   concatenated
920   with
42   spaces
64   between
21   them.
39   -d
319   directory
7   Initial
13   working
319   directory
268   when
6   opening
6605   the
3   linkedpath
96   file.
25   -D
7   description
21   An
8   optional
1   descriptive
11   comment
3144   to
924   be
104   added
3144   to
6605   the
6   shortcut.
66   -s
1   showcommand
983   The
20   initial
32   show
9   state
2059   of
6605   the
29   window.
9   May
924   be
439   any
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
3   following:
2   hidden,
1   minimized,
3   maximized
1041   or
17   normal
1   (default).
21   Show
5   states
650   are
97   case
2   insensitive
2223   and
199   only
857   as
25   many
197   characters
857   as
14   necessary
3144   to
924   be
7   unique
44   need
924   be
25   specified.
30   -i
1   iconfile
983   The
37   pathname
2059   of
3088   a
383   file
50   containing
6605   the
5   icon
3144   to
3144   to
924   be
19   associated
920   with
320   this
6   shortcut.
29   -x
1   iconindex
21   An
10   index
3144   to
6605   the
5   icon
20   within
1061   that
39   file,
13   counting
640   from
5   zero.
64   -c
1   consoleprop
261   A
43   console
66   window
1   property
1   setting:
1   Colors=color
35   setting
32   (e.g.,
68   white
883   on
1   blue)
1   Popups=color
35   setting
1   ScreenBufferSize=(rows,
2   columns)
1   WindowSize=(rows,
2   columns)
1   AutoPosition=True/False/On/Off
1   Position=(row,
1   column)
1   Font=name
3   (usually
93   either
1   Terminal
1041   or
2   Lucida
1   Console)
1   FontSize=(pixels
1   wide,
1   pixels
1   high)
1041   or
234   just
1   height
1113   for
2   Lucida
1   Console.
1   QuickEdit=True/False/On/Off
1   InsertMode=True/False/On/Off
95   -h

87   <pre><tt>
5   Sleep
1113   for
3088   a
5   Specified
1   Period
91   Usage:
11   sleep
1   [-hm-]
99   [
23   seconds
93   ]
5   Sleep
6605   the
152   specified
33   integer
165   number
2059   of
23   seconds
1   (rounded
3144   to
6605   the
71   next
1   clock
1   tick.)
47   Default
1837   is
214   1
33   second
1041   or
42   until
590   an
17   interrupt
3   occurs.
97   Options:
12   -m
5   Sleep
6   interval
1837   is
1307   in
2   milliseconds
46   rather
171   than
3   seconds.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>

87   <pre><tt>
6   Sort
6   and/or
7   Merge
29   Files
91   Usage:
2   hsort
1   [-cmh]
3   [-o
1   output]
1   [-RsuvdfinxNXWrb]
1   [-tT
1   char]
2   [-k
1   keydef]
57   ...
1   [+pos1
1   [-pos2]]
57   ...
1   [file
7   ...]
6   Sort
1041   or
3   merge
111   lines
2059   of
106   text
640   from
6605   the
10   named
294   files
1041   or
640   from
36   stdin
790   if
227   no
383   file
6   specification
1837   is
10   given.
3   Comparisons
650   are
15   based
883   on
271   one
1041   or
207   more
32   sort
17   keys
11   extracted
640   from
197   each
75   line.
32   By
38   default,
87   there
1837   is
271   one
32   sort
10   key,
6605   the
33   entire
372   line
3   (minus
439   any
372   line
2   termination
1   characters),
2223   and
4   ordering
1837   is
58   done
10   according
3144   to
6605   the
53   ASCII
3   collate
4   sequence.
97   Options:
64   -c
5   Check
1061   that
6605   the
58   input
1837   is
4   ordered
857   as
25   specified.
29   No
64   output
1837   is
1   produced.
15   Only
6605   the
44   exit
66   code
1837   is
3   affected.
12   -m
7   Merge
8   only.
983   The
58   input
294   files
650   are
13   assumed
3144   to
924   be
55   already
2   sorted.
15   -o
64   output
18   Write
6605   the
64   output
3144   to
383   file
25   specified.
181   This
511   can
924   be
6605   the
122   same
857   as
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
58   input
52   files.
10   -R
3   Ensure
1061   that
197   each
16   record
11   ends
920   with
3088   a
22   \r\n
4   sequence.
66   -s
1   Stable
5   sort.
468   If
3   records
65   match
883   on
364   all
6605   the
32   sort
7   keys,
2   preserve
6605   the
58   input
1   ordering.
19   -u
1   Unique:
13   suppress
364   all
241   but
271   one
1307   in
197   each
436   set
2059   of
111   lines
25   having
11   equal
8   keys.
468   If
281   used
920   with
2   -c,
12   check
1061   that
87   there
650   are
227   no
111   lines
920   with
11   equal
8   keys.
20   -v
8   Verbose.
468   If
6605   the
58   input
1837   is
2   checked
920   with
64   -c
2223   and
102   it's
94   out
2059   of
1   order,
31   print
6605   the
16   record
165   number
2223   and
6   contents.
2   Comparison
97   Options:
983   The
84   following
65   options
14   override
117   default
4   ordering
3   rules.
106   When
94   these
65   options
21   appear
3   independent
2059   of
439   any
38   key
39   field
1   specifi-
1   cation,
104   they
6   apply
3   globally
3144   to
364   all
32   sort
8   keys.
106   When
1   attached
3144   to
3088   a
19   specific
10   key,
104   they
14   override
439   any
4   global
4   ordering
118   options.
39   -d
15   Only
1   blanks
2223   and
2   alphanumeric
197   characters
650   are
66   considered
1307   in
12   comparing
8   keys.
47   -f
1   Case-independent
1   comparison:
21   upper
2223   and
32   lower
97   case
197   characters
380   will
24   compare
10   equal.
30   -i
17   Ignore
439   any
3   non-printable
55   characters.
45   -n
1   Interpret
6605   the
39   field
857   as
27   decimal
33   integer
111   data
201   which
193   may
38   contain
8   optional
17   leading
3   spaces,
15   plus
1041   or
27   minus
1   sign,
2223   and
8   commas
857   as
1   thousands
1   separators.
29   -x
9   Like
4   -n,
241   but
190   also
22   accepts
15   octal
1041   or
18   hex
4   integers.
26   -N
9   Like
4   -n,
241   but
190   also
22   accepts
30   floating
39   point
111   data
50   containing
1   fractional
1   components
1041   or
1   exponents
1   expressed
1307   in
1   E-notation,
95   e.g.,
1   1.0E-03
3144   to
19   mean
1   .001.
7   -X
9   Like
1   -N,
241   but
190   also
22   accepts
15   octal
1041   or
18   hex
4   integers.
4   -W
39   Use
6605   the
21   Win32
1   CompareString
29   function
3144   to
24   compare
56   strings
10   according
3144   to
6605   the
3   collate
24   sequence
152   specified
588   by
6605   the
10   user's
1   locale
1   descriptor.
12   Otherwise,
588   by
38   default,
6605   the
37   standard
53   ASCII
3   collate
24   sequence
1837   is
281   used
1113   for
30   much
10   greater
4   performance.
29   -r
5   Reverse
6605   the
3   sense
2059   of
3   comparisons.
2   Field
1   Separator
97   Options:
32   -b
17   Ignore
17   leading
1041   or
16   trailing
42   spaces
268   when
2   determining
6605   the
31   starting
2223   and
9   ending
7   positions
2059   of
3088   a
32   sort
9   key.
27   -t
23   char
39   Use
4   &lt;char&gt;
857   as
6605   the
39   field
10   separator
2   character;
4   &lt;char&gt;
1837   is
471   not
66   considered
3144   to
924   be
33   part
2059   of
3088   a
9   field.
45   Each
5   occurrence
2059   of
4   &lt;char&gt;
1837   is
7   significant
4   so,
95   e.g.,
1   &lt;char&gt;&lt;char&gt;
1   delimits
590   an
16   empty
9   field.
15   -T
23   char
9   Like
2   -t,
241   but
197   each
4   maximal
24   sequence
2059   of
4   &lt;char&gt;
197   characters
1837   is
66   considered
3088   a
110   single
39   field
2   separator.
32   By
38   default,
197   each
4   maximal
24   sequence
2059   of
42   spaces
1837   is
3088   a
39   field
2   separator.
6   Sort
2   Key
1   Specification:
8   -k
1   keydef
4   Define
3088   a
32   sort
38   key
9   field.
983   The
59   format
2059   of
1   &lt;keydef&gt;
1837   is
1   field_start[type][,field_end[type]]
105   where
2   &lt;field_start&gt;
2223   and
2   &lt;field_end&gt;
21   define
6605   the
45   beginning
2223   and
9   ending
4   points
2059   of
3088   a
39   field
2   as:
1   field_number[.first_character]
105   where
56   both
35   fields
2223   and
197   characters
650   are
3   numbered
31   starting
640   from
214   1
2223   and
152   specified
857   as
2   positive
27   decimal
4   integers.
468   If
1   &lt;.first_character&gt;
1837   is
7   omitted
640   from
3088   a
1   &lt;field_start&gt;,
6605   the
32   sort
38   key
9   begins
920   with
6605   the
281   first
172   character
2059   of
6605   the
1   field;
790   if
102   it's
7   omitted
640   from
3088   a
1   &lt;field_end&gt;,
6605   the
38   key
11   ends
920   with
6605   the
77   last
172   character
2059   of
6605   the
9   field.
23   As
3088   a
94   special
13   case,
3088   a
39   field
165   number
2059   of
120   0
9   specifies
6605   the
33   entire
4   record.
261   A
172   character
165   number
2059   of
120   0
9   specifies
6605   the
77   last
172   character
2059   of
6605   the
9   field.
983   The
2   &lt;type&gt;
10   modifiers
511   can
924   be
439   any
16   combination
2059   of
7   b,
5   d,
3   f,
22   i,
7   n,
3   N
1041   or
4   r,
201   which
1   behave
234   just
90   like
6605   the
33   corresponding
26   options,
42   except
857   as
3088   a
3   modifier
104   they
9   affect
199   only
6605   the
152   specified
32   sort
9   key.
983   The
89   b
3   modifier
3   applies
199   only
3144   to
6605   the
2   &lt;field_start&gt;
1041   or
2   &lt;field_end&gt;
3144   to
201   which
879   it
1837   is
1   attached.
468   If
6605   the
32   -b
192   option
1041   or
89   b
84   type
3   modifier
1837   is
62   specified,
197   characters
20   within
6605   the
39   field
650   are
6   counted
640   from
6605   the
281   first
1   non-blank
37   character.
106   When
87   there
650   are
30   multiple
38   key
4   fields,
11   later
17   keys
650   are
6   compared
199   only
61   after
364   all
9   earlier
17   keys
24   compare
1   equally.
2   Except
268   when
19   -u
1837   is
62   specified,
111   lines
1061   that
19   otherwise
24   compare
4   equally
650   are
4   ordered
857   as
790   if
227   no
4   -d,
1   -f,
1   -i,
4   -n,
26   -N
1041   or
8   -k
65   options
132   were
7   present
2223   and
920   with
364   all
41   bytes
1307   in
6605   the
111   lines
7   significant
3144   to
6605   the
2   comparison.
2   +pos1
1   [-pos2]
21   An
24   older
32   form
2059   of
38   key
39   field
6   specification,
410   now
66   considered
6   obsolete
588   by
3   POSIX.
983   The
1   &lt;pos1&gt;
2223   and
1   &lt;pos2&gt;
8   entries
94   specify
6605   the
87   start
2223   and
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
38   key
234   just
6605   the
90   way
6605   the
8   -k
192   option
161   would
42   except
1061   that
1307   in
320   this
10   form,
35   fields
2223   and
197   characters
650   are
3   numbered
31   starting
277   at
18   0,
471   not
35   1.
261   A
1   fully-specified
38   key
2059   of
6605   the
32   form
2   +pos1
1   -pos2
920   with
84   type
10   modifiers
1   T
2223   and
1   U:
1   +w.xT
1   -y.zU
1837   is
4   equivalent
2   to:
8   -k
1   (w+1).(x+1)T,y.0U
7   (z
69   ==
10   0)
8   -k
1   (w+1).(x+1)T,(y+1).zU
7   (z
49   &gt;
10   0)
95   -h
11   Help
4   (short
4   list.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   Exit
2   status:
120   0
113   All
6605   the
58   input
363   was
5   sorted
1   successfully,
1041   or
64   -c
363   was
152   specified
2223   and
6605   the
58   input
363   was
55   already
2   sorted.
214   1
983   The
64   -c
192   option
363   was
152   specified
2223   and
6605   the
58   input
363   was
471   not
4   ordered
21   correctly
1041   or
1   -cu
363   was
152   specified
2223   and
94   two
111   lines
5   sorted
10   equal.
1   &gt;1
21   An
106   error
3   occurred.

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
24   Read
4   Commands
640   from
3088   a
25   File
1041   or
640   from
4   Stdin
91   Usage:
51   source
1   [-eELnsh-]
1   [filename]
2   [arguments]
4   Commands
650   are
13   executed
234   just
857   as
790   if
104   they
132   were
49   typed
11   directly
1307   in
3144   to
320   this
79   thread
2059   of
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
511   can
78   change
94   local
111   variables
2223   and
213   current
319   directory
3   settings.
84   (This
1   differs
640   from
19   typing
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
3088   a
1930   C
1129   shell
159   script
383   file
857   as
3088   a
6   command;
790   if
675   you
176   do
7   that,
3088   a
48   separate
79   thread
1837   is
1   created.)
97   Options:
34   -e
7   Execute
8   only.
29   No
3   logging
3144   to
5   history.
53   (The
2   default.)
8   -E
7   Execute
2223   and
6   log
3144   to
5   history.
17   -L
2   Load
6605   the
112   history
190   list
8   only.
29   No
25   syntax
1   checking.
45   -n
29   No
1   Execute.
13   Just
176   do
3088   a
25   syntax
1   check.
26   -N
29   No
1   Execute,
241   but
5   load
6605   the
112   history
39   list.
66   -s
24   Read
62   commands
640   from
29   stdin.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   split<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="sort.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="strings.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
7   Split
3088   a
1   Large
25   File
178   into
1   Chunks
91   Usage:
7   split
1   [-bhs&lt;size&gt;-]
99   [
2   infile
1   [prefix]
93   ]
7   split
4   breaks
157   up
3088   a
23   large
383   file
178   into
1   chunks,
63   written
3144   to
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
64   output
294   files
3   formed
2059   of
6605   the
11   prefix
15   plus
3088   a
1   .nnn
7   extension,
105   where
2   nnn
1837   is
3088   a
2   3-digit
27   decimal
16   number.
983   The
117   default
11   prefix
1837   is
1   'chunk'.
45   Each
4   chunk
380   will
924   be
2059   of
6605   the
152   specified
165   number
2059   of
111   lines
1041   or
10   bytes.
468   If
199   only
271   one
18   operand
1837   is
34   given,
102   it's
13   assumed
3144   to
924   be
6605   the
58   input
320   filename
42   unless
66   -s
1837   is
25   specified.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
32   -b
10   Count
10   bytes.
13   (Default
1837   is
6   lines.)
66   -s
4   Stdin
1837   is
1   split.
2   (Implied
790   if
227   no
294   files
650   are
1   specified.)
2   -&lt;size&gt;
1   Chunk
5   size.
1   (Defaults
650   are
1   3000
1   lines/300000
4   bytes.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
