446   <h3>
1   strings<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="split.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="su.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
8   Extract
53   ASCII
56   strings
640   from
3088   a
383   file
91   Usage:
56   strings
1   [-hatbenuqvlodx-]
1   [-&lt;min&gt;]
3   [-r&lt;radix&gt;]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
56   strings
380   will
76   search
1113   for
439   any
30   occurrences
2059   of
53   ASCII
106   text
1307   in
6605   the
294   files
675   you
45   give
61   it.
983   The
1   presumption
1837   is
1061   that
6605   the
294   files
650   are
5   mostly
72   binary
2223   and
4   perhaps
11   quite
3   large,
15   making
879   it
1   impractical
3144   to
43   look
277   at
72   them
4   directly.
261   A
129   string
1837   is
56   normally
43   defined
857   as
35   4
1041   or
207   more
12   printable
53   ASCII
197   characters
6   terminated
588   by
3088   a
3   Null,
1   CarriageReturn,
15   NewLine
1041   or
3088   a
2   CarriageReturn-NewLine
5   combination.
113   All
6605   the
68   white
67   space
197   characters
650   are
66   considered
12   printable
2223   and
650   are
3   included
1307   in
6605   the
38   length
16   count
42   except
268   when
104   they
4   terminate
3088   a
35   string.
8   (To
1930   C
1   programmers,
94   these
12   printable
53   ASCII
197   characters
650   are
6605   the
1   isprint()
2223   and
1   IsSpace()
4   characters.)
468   If
675   you
94   specify
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
39   files,
28   they're
6   searched
271   one
61   after
6605   the
2   other,
197   each
271   one
27   introduced
588   by
152   name
42   unless
675   you
94   specify
5   Quiet
27   mode.
45   Each
129   string
49   that's
28   found
1837   is
23   listed
883   on
3088   a
48   separate
75   line.
8   Note
1061   that
790   if
3088   a
20   particular
129   string
35   contains
15   NewLine
1041   or
5   CarriageReturn
19   characters,
879   it
380   will
924   be
10   displayed
857   as
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
1   (possibly)
44   very
15   short
1   substrings,
271   one
26   per
75   line.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
1   -&lt;min&gt;
2   Minimum
129   string
38   length
3144   to
1   report,
152   specified
857   as
3088   a
27   decimal
12   integer.
29   -a
39   Any
13   string,
115   even
790   if
471   not
6   terminated
920   with
3088   a
372   line
9   ending
1041   or
3088   a
48   null
37   character.
27   -t
1   Trim
17   leading
68   white
67   space
640   from
197   each
35   string.
32   -b
4   Discard
56   strings
50   containing
199   only
68   white
13   space.
34   -e
2   European
197   characters
1   (accented
1   alphabetics
2223   and
2   European
1   punctuation)
380   will
924   be
66   considered
857   as
37   ordinary
12   printable
19   text.
45   -n
12   Control
197   characters
1   FormFeed
2223   and
1   VerticalTab
380   will
190   also
924   be
66   considered
3144   to
924   be
129   string
1   terminators.
19   -u
3   UNICODE
56   strings
12   consisting
2059   of
37   ordinary
53   ASCII
197   characters
1   (each
3088   a
12   printable
53   ASCII
172   character
42   followed
588   by
3088   a
48   null
2   character)
380   will
924   be
11   extracted
857   as
37   regular
5   ASCII.
14   -q
5   Quiet
27   mode.
26   Don't
4   announce
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
197   each
383   file
857   as
102   it's
17   read.
20   -v
8   Verbose.
6   Paste
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
383   file
1307   in
201   which
879   it
1   occurs
50   onto
6605   the
7   front
2059   of
197   each
35   string.
27   -l
9   Long
27   mode.
21   Show
105   where
197   each
129   string
1   occurs,
13   counting
41   bytes
640   from
6605   the
45   beginning
2059   of
6605   the
96   file.
983   The
12   radix
281   used
511   can
924   be
18   explicitly
5   chosen
920   with
2   -o,
4   -d,
2   -x,
1041   or
1   -r;
879   it
9   defaults
3144   to
6605   the
105   value
152   specified
588   by
6605   the
3   RADIX
90   environmental
243   variable
790   if
43   defined
1041   or
6   16
4   otherwise.
15   -o
5   Octal
2   offsets.
39   -d
5   Decimal
2   offsets.
29   -x
6   Hex
10   offsets
1   shown.
4   -r&lt;radix&gt;
3   User-specified
4   radix.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

446   <h3>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   su:
11   Run
590   an
12   elevated
428   command
1041   or
857   as
55   another
55   user
91   Usage:
2   su.exe
1   [-.eCLnPStvxwh-]
2   [-c
1   &lt;colors&gt;]
3   [-o
1   &lt;options&gt;]
2   [-p
2   &lt;password&gt;]
6   [-s
2   &lt;setrows&gt;
93   ]
2   [-X
2   &lt;errlimit&gt;]
99   [
12   userid
99   [
428   command
2   ]]
49   su
1837   is
6605   the
841   Windows
4   equivalent
2059   of
6605   the
283   UNIX
1   "super
1   user"
47   command.
49   su
20   runs
6605   the
152   specified
428   command
1   (by
38   default,
6605   the
1930   C
3   shell)
857   as
93   either
590   an
12   elevated
428   command
1041   or
857   as
55   another
55   user
42   (or
1   both)
1307   in
3088   a
257   new
29   window.
32   By
38   default,
879   it
189   then
13   exits
4   immediately.
1   Invoked
63   without
439   any
428   command
372   line
4   arguments,
49   su
9   defaults
3144   to
31   starting
590   an
12   elevated
60   copy
2059   of
6605   the
1930   C
55   shell.
8   Even
13   though
6605   the
428   command
380   will
146   run
920   with
257   new
1   credentials,
879   it
380   will
12   inherit
6605   the
1   parent's
76   environment
111   variables
2223   and
213   current
55   directories.
49   su
135   does
320   this
588   by
7   spawning
3088   a
60   copy
2059   of
17   itself
920   with
6605   the
257   new
3   credentials
3144   to
38   actually
146   run
6605   the
428   command
2223   and
1   handshaking
920   with
879   it
109   through
30   shared
17   memory
3144   to
28   pass
6605   the
4   environment.
103   To
146   run
857   as
55   another
8   user,
49   su
55   uses
6605   the
2   Secondary
2   Logon
21   service
3144   to
87   start
1061   that
60   copy
2059   of
17   itself
54   meaning
1061   that
110   system
21   service
64   must
924   be
8   running.
103   To
1   elevate,
49   su
55   uses
3088   a
94   special
60   copy
2059   of
9   itself,
1   elevate.exe,
201   which
289   has
382   been
21   marked
1113   for
6605   the
11   operating
110   system
857   as
3   requiring
4   elevation,
25   causing
6605   the
3   secure
18   desktop
9   prompt.
103   To
146   run
12   elevated
857   as
55   another
8   user,
49   su
281   first
3   spawns
3088   a
60   copy
2059   of
17   itself
857   as
6605   the
257   new
8   user,
189   then
1   elevates.
983   The
12   userid
193   may
924   be
152   specified
857   as
93   either
3088   a
63   simple
152   name
1041   or
857   as
3088   a
1   domain\name
5   pair.
468   If
227   no
12   userid
1837   is
62   specified,
1041   or
790   if
14   "."
1837   is
62   specified,
49   su
380   will
10   interpret
1061   that
3144   to
19   mean
6605   the
213   current
5   userid.
468   If
6605   the
213   current
55   user
1837   is
62   specified,
3088   a
7   password
1837   is
471   not
24   required
64   because
49   su
380   will
55   already
924   be
92   running
857   as
1061   that
8   user.
3   (In
5   fact,
790   if
3088   a
7   password
1837   is
62   specified,
3   seemingly
1113   for
6605   the
213   current
8   user,
49   that's
35   treated
857   as
590   an
106   error
3144   to
23   avoid
6   accidentally
92   running
12   elevated
268   when
1061   that
363   was
471   not
6605   the
1   intent.)
111   For
2   userids
176   other
171   than
6605   the
213   current
8   user,
790   if
227   no
7   password
1837   is
34   given,
49   su
380   will
47   try
3   logging
1307   in
63   without
3088   a
1   password.
468   If
1061   that
3   fails,
49   su
380   will
52   prompt
1113   for
3088   a
1   password;
6605   the
7   password
380   will
471   not
924   be
6   echoed
3144   to
6605   the
14   screen.
983   The
428   command
511   can
20   refer
3144   to
439   any
40   executable
383   file
1041   or
3144   to
3088   a
1930   C
1129   shell
428   command
1041   or
8   alias.
468   If
3088   a
24   complete
89   path
1837   is
471   not
62   specified,
49   su
380   will
43   look
109   through
6605   the
76   search
11   path.
468   If
590   an
18   extension
1837   is
471   not
62   specified,
49   su
380   will
47   try
364   all
6605   the
12   usual
2   possibilities:
5   .csh,
5   .exe,
3   .com,
12   .cmd
2223   and
2   .bat.
468   If
3088   a
33   corresponding
40   executable
383   file
29   cannot
924   be
12   found,
49   su
380   will
8   assume
6605   the
428   command
1837   is
590   an
30   internal
1930   C
1129   shell
428   command
1041   or
8   alias.
468   If
227   no
428   command
1837   is
62   specified,
49   su
380   will
146   run
6605   the
1930   C
55   shell.
1   Net
270   use
55   drives
650   are
37   inherited
199   only
268   when
1   elevating,
471   not
268   when
92   running
857   as
3088   a
58   different
8   user.
39   Any
213   current
319   directory
18   settings
1307   in
6605   the
37   inherited
76   environment
1061   that
20   refer
3144   to
55   drives
1061   that
38   don't
18   exist
126   under
6605   the
257   new
3   credentials
650   are
3   silently
22   ignored.
49   su
380   will
471   not
146   run
126   under
841   Windows
17   9x
2223   and
3   requests
3144   to
1   elevate
650   are
18   ignored
42   unless
92   running
126   under
224   Vista,
841   Windows
28   7
1041   or
2   later.
97   Options:
7   -.
1   Elevate
43   option.
11   Run
6605   the
428   command
12   elevated
857   as
6605   the
213   current
5   userid.
29   No
12   userid
1041   or
7   password
131   should
924   be
25   specified.
34   -e
1   Elevate.
11   Run
6605   the
428   command
12   elevated
857   as
6605   the
152   specified
8   user.
64   -c
1   &lt;colors&gt;
468   If
49   su
1837   is
92   running
1307   in
3088   a
257   new
66   window
64   because
2059   of
4   elevation,
270   use
6605   the
204   screen
197   colors
152   specified
1307   in
6605   the
71   next
8   word,
4   overriding
34   whatever
1837   is
152   specified
1307   in
6605   the
26   COLORS
76   environment
47   variable.
468   If
87   there
1837   is
5   neither
3088   a
26   COLORS
76   environment
9   nor
3088   a
64   -c
192   option
14   specifying
6605   the
4   colors,
6605   the
117   default
1837   is
1   "white
883   on
1   blue".
16   -C
22   Start
157   up
3088   a
60   copy
2059   of
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
146   run
6605   the
47   command.
17   -L
468   If
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
7   run,
53   make
879   it
3088   a
11   login
55   shell.
45   -n
2   Non-interactive.
983   The
1   password,
790   if
471   not
13   null,
64   must
924   be
73   passed
883   on
6605   the
428   command
75   line.
49   su
380   will
471   not
52   prompt
1113   for
61   it.
15   -o
1   &lt;options&gt;
6   Options
3144   to
924   be
73   passed
3144   to
6605   the
1930   C
980   shell,
790   if
49   su
8   calls
61   it.
12   -p
2   &lt;password&gt;
1   Password
3144   to
924   be
281   used
920   with
6605   the
152   specified
5   userid.
11   -P
2   Pause
2   always.
8   Prompt
1113   for
6605   the
55   user
3144   to
5   press
3   Enter
98   before
1   exiting.
1   Implies
1   -w.
66   -s
2   &lt;setrows&gt;
468   If
49   su
1837   is
92   running
1307   in
3088   a
257   new
66   window
64   because
2059   of
4   elevation,
436   set
6605   the
66   window
2223   and
45   buffer
9   sizes
3144   to
6605   the
45   values
152   specified
1307   in
6605   the
71   next
77   argument
25   word.
983   The
59   format
1837   is
6605   the
122   same
857   as
281   used
588   by
6605   the
9   setrows
47   command.
983   The
38   default,
1   "1000
9   80
5   40
1   80",
99   means
3088   a
45   buffer
2059   of
2   1000
6   rows
38   x
9   80
3   columns
2223   and
3088   a
26   display
66   window
2059   of
5   40
6   rows
38   x
9   80
3   columns.
15   -S
1   Inverse
2059   of
2   -L.
468   If
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
7   run,
176   do
471   not
53   make
879   it
3088   a
11   login
55   shell.
1   Let
879   it
146   run
26   startup.csh
8   only.
27   -t
4   Trace
27   mode.
983   The
428   command
372   line
1837   is
63   written
3144   to
17   stderr
234   just
7   prior
3144   to
5   invocation.
20   -v
8   Verbose.
468   If
93   either
49   su
1041   or
6605   the
107   child
13   exits
920   with
3088   a
159   return
66   code
10   greater
171   than
6605   the
106   error
4   limit,
31   print
6605   the
159   return
66   code
2223   and
6605   the
33   corresponding
110   system
106   error
9   message.
21   -w
7   Wait
1113   for
6605   the
107   child
3144   to
44   exit
98   before
2   returning,
115   even
790   if
102   it's
92   running
1307   in
3088   a
257   new
29   window.
29   -x
7   Exit
2   always.
32   By
38   default,
790   if
49   su
1837   is
92   running
1307   in
3088   a
257   new
66   window
64   because
2059   of
4   elevation,
879   it
1   pauses
2223   and
7   prompts
1113   for
6605   the
55   user
3144   to
5   press
3   Enter
790   if
879   it
25   writes
439   any
26   messages
1041   or
790   if
3088   a
107   child
13   exits
920   with
590   an
106   error
3144   to
17   ensure
6605   the
55   user
19   gets
3144   to
125   read
3   what's
10   displayed
98   before
6605   the
66   window
8   goes
1   away.
181   This
192   option
3   overrides
1061   that
117   default
1   behavior.
7   -X
2   &lt;errlimit&gt;
7   Error
3   limit.
468   If
3088   a
107   child
428   command
13   exits
920   with
3088   a

1061   that
3144   to

32   By
38   default,
439   any
159   return
66   code
49   &gt;
214   1
1837   is
66   considered
590   an
19   error.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

446   <h3>
1   sum<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="su.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="tabs.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
2   Checksum
6605   the
1   Contents
2059   of
3088   a
25   File
91   Usage:
19   sum
1   [-prxh-]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
19   sum
2   checksums
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
197   each
2059   of
6605   the
294   files
675   you
3   specify,
56   writing
6605   the
27   results
3144   to
30   stdout
15   along
920   with
3088   a
16   count
2059   of
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
5   512-byte
8   blocks
879   it
125   read
7   (including
439   any
2   partial
1   blocks.)
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
34   given,
19   sum
26   reads
640   from
29   stdin.
19   sum
1837   is
6   typically
281   used
3144   to
1   validate
3088   a
383   file
1   communicated
53   over
3088   a
2   possibly
1   noisy
2   communications
75   line.
19   sum
4   treats
6605   the
197   characters
879   it
26   reads
857   as
2   8-bit
11   unsigned
6   integers
2223   and
56   normally
234   just
4   adds
72   them
13   together
3144   to
32   form
3088   a
5   16-bit
11   unsigned
7   result.
1   Overflows
650   are
22   ignored.
97   Options:
12   -p
27   POSIX
4   checksum.
39   Use
6605   the
1   ISO-8802-3
2   CRC-32
1   poly-
1   nomial
3144   to
3   calculate
3088   a
1   cyclic
2   redundancy
12   check
1113   for
197   each
58   input
383   file
2223   and
3144   to
60   write
1061   that
105   value
15   along
920   with
3088   a
16   count
2059   of
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
41   bytes
7   (not
1   blocks)
3144   to
44   stdout.
29   -r
1   Rotated
4   checksum.
6   Rotate
6605   the
3   accumulated
9   checksum
37   right
271   one
49   bit
3   position
98   before
21   adding
197   each
37   character.
29   -x
1   Xor'ed
4   checksum.
111   For
197   each
257   new
15   character,
5   c,
6605   the
1   checksum,
22   i,
1837   is
5   calculated
857   as
109   i
14   +=
11   (i
16   &lt;&lt;
17   1)
34   ^
8   c.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
117   default
2223   and
2   rotated
2   checksums
650   are
6605   the
122   same
857   as
47   those
5   calculated
588   by
6605   the
32   Unix
22   System
5   V
19   sum
6   command;
6605   the
11   xor
9   checksum
1837   is
7   unique
3144   to
320   this
1   implementation.)
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   Expand/Unexpand
2   Tabs
91   Usage:
19   tabs
1   [-hua-]
1   [-&lt;tabs&gt;][
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
19   tabs
3   expands
28   tab
197   characters
178   into
42   spaces
14   or,
790   if
19   -u
1837   is
62   specified,
1   unexpands
42   spaces
178   into
19   tabs
857   as
879   it
30   copies
6605   the
58   input
294   files
3144   to
44   stdout.
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
34   given,
28   tab
26   reads
640   from
29   stdin.
468   If
30   multiple
294   files
650   are
34   given,
28   they're
1   concat-
1   enated
271   one
61   after
6605   the
176   other
3144   to
44   stdout.
106   When
1   unexpanding,
199   only
17   leading
68   white
67   space
1837   is
56   normally
9   converted
3144   to
7   tabs.
468   If
29   -a
1837   is
62   specified,
19   tabs
650   are
4   inserted
19   anywhere
104   they
161   would
12   replace
94   two
1041   or
207   more
55   characters.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
19   -u
2   Unexpand
7   tabs.
29   -a
2   Unexpand
364   all
7   tabs.
1   -&lt;tabs&gt;
30   Tab
18   settings
3144   to
270   use
1113   for
4   viewing
19   text.
47   Default
1837   is
3144   to
270   use
105   value
91   given
588   by
6605   the
7   TABS
76   environment
243   variable
14   or,
790   if
49   that's
3   undefined,
3144   to
8   assume
4   tabstops
23   every
20   8
55   characters.
468   If
2   desired,
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
4   tabstops
511   can
62   specified,
29   separated
588   by
1   commas;
6605   the
13   difference
64   between
6605   the
77   last
94   two
19   tabs
91   given
1837   is
281   used
3088   a
37   standard
1   increment
1113   for
84   following
7   tabs.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

87   <pre><tt>
18   Copy
6605   the
6   Last
2   Few
15   Lines
1041   or
3   Bytes
2059   of
3088   a
25   File
3144   to
8   Stdout
91   Usage:
18   tail
1   [-hcfnq-]
1   [-i&lt;sec&gt;]
1   [-m&lt;msec&gt;]
1   [-+&lt;start&gt;]
2   [-t&lt;tabs&gt;][
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
18   tail
30   copies
6605   the
77   last
33   part
2059   of
6605   the
383   file
675   you
94   specify
50   onto
44   stdout.
150   You
193   may
94   specify
105   where
3144   to
22   begin
9   copying
1307   in
93   either
111   lines
1041   or
41   bytes
1   measured
640   from
93   either
6605   the
45   beginning
1041   or
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
96   file.
468   If
227   no
383   file
1837   is
34   given,
18   tail
26   reads
640   from
29   stdin.
468   If
35   several
294   files
650   are
34   given,
197   each
1837   is
1   annouced
42   unless
675   you
94   specify
2   quiet
27   mode.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
64   -c
10   Count
55   characters.
13   (Default
1837   is
6   lines.)
47   -f
1   Follow.
10   At
412   end
2059   of
39   file,
19   go
178   into
590   an
2   endless
5   loop,
3   sleeping
1113   for
3088   a
4   second,
189   then
3   waking
157   up
3144   to
43   see
790   if
207   more
1   data's
382   been
41   added.
2   (Use
11   ^C
3144   to
2   exit.)
983   The
13   follow
192   option
1837   is
471   not
11   valid
790   if
207   more
171   than
271   one
383   file
1837   is
152   specified
2223   and
1837   is
18   ignored
790   if
111   data
1837   is
78   being
125   read
640   from
3088   a
7   pipe.
1   -i&lt;sec&gt;
2   Interval
1307   in
23   seconds
64   between
3   checking
1113   for
207   more
111   data
790   if
47   -f
192   option
1837   is
31   used.
11   (If
6605   the
6   interval
152   specified
1837   is
10   greater
171   than
271   one
4   second,
18   tail
380   will
5   temporarily
2   drop
51   back
3144   to
3088   a
271   one
33   second
6   interval
3   anytime
879   it
13   finds
257   new
111   data
268   when
879   it
135   does
3   wake
3   up.)
1   -m&lt;msec&gt;
2   Interval
1307   in
2   milliseconds
64   between
3   checking
1113   for
207   more
111   data
790   if
47   -f
192   option
1837   is
31   used.
1   -&lt;start&gt;
4   Starting
4   point,
10   relative
3144   to
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
96   file.
13   (Default
1837   is
77   last
21   10
111   lines
1041   or
13   512
4   bytes.)
1   +&lt;start&gt;
4   Starting
4   point,
10   relative
3144   to
6605   the
87   start
2059   of
6605   the
96   file.
3   -t&lt;tabs&gt;
30   Tab
18   settings
3144   to
270   use
1113   for
4   viewing
19   text.
13   (Default
1837   is
3144   to
270   use
105   value
91   given
588   by
6605   the
7   TABS
76   environment
243   variable
14   or,
790   if

3   undefined,
3144   to
176   do
227   no
28   tab
2   expansion.)
45   -n
29   No
28   tab
6   expansion.

5   Quiet
27   mode.
26   Don't
4   announce
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
197   each
383   file

182   <table>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
4   Read/Write
283   UNIX
5   TAR
2223   and
25   CPIO
2   Format
29   Files
91   Usage:
189   tar
1   [-acCMtxXyh]
1   [-#!ADFjJLNpPqrRsSTvV]
1   [-fQwWZ-]
1   [-#n]
1   [-B
1   blksize]
1   [-Hon]

189   tar
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
125   read
1041   or
60   write
3088   a
63   simple
80   archive
59   format
6   popular
1113   for
3   exchanging
294   files
64   between
1   dissimilar
5   machines.
189   tar
56   normally
9   expects
6605   the
80   archive
3144   to
924   be
1307   in
3088   a
383   file

588   by
6605   the
5   tarfile
8   operand.
106   When
21   adding
39   files,
6605   the
88   names
650   are
1307   in
6605   the
10   user's
17   normal

2223   and
18   wildcards
511   can
924   be

1307   in
6605   the
17   normal
3   fashion.
106   When

16   extracting

1061   that
13   follow

924   be
7   case-sensitive
1307   in

1307   in
6605   the
80   archive

64   must
65   match
6605   the
24   complete

6   there.
7   Full
51   wildcarding
1837   is
11   supported.
111   For
101   example,
189   tar

439   any

2223   and
6605   the

39   -d

5   TAR
3   Format:
41   Tar
294   files
650   are
2   organized
857   as
3088   a
29   series
2059   of
5   512-byte
3   blocks.
7   Individual
294   files
80   always
87   start
883   on
3088   a
35   block
2   boundary
920   with
3088   a
27   header
35   block
42   followed
588   by
6605   the
1   uncompressed
111   data
1307   in
6605   the
96   file.
10   At
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
6605   the
383   file
650   are
94   two
8   blocks
6   filled
920   with
72   binary
7   zeros.
983   The
27   header
289   has
6605   the
84   following
13   format,
1   packed
920   with
28   individual
35   fields
1   byte-aligned:
4   typedef
4   struct
34   {
23   char
1   name[100],
1   mode[8],
1   userid[8],
1   groupid[8],
1   filesize[12],
1   timestamp[12],
1   checksum[8],
1   linkflag,
1   linkname[100];
2   union
34   {
23   char
1   unused_chars[255];
4   struct
34   {
23   char
1   magic[6],
1   version[2]
1   username[32],
1   groupname[32],
1   devmajor[8],
1   devminor[8],
1   prefix[155];
49   }
1   ustar;
49   }
1   u;
49   }
1   tar_header;
1   Traditionally,
26   everything
1307   in
3088   a
189   tar
27   header
1837   is
1307   in
53   ASCII
920   with
2   nulls
2223   and
42   spaces
3144   to
1   punctuate
6605   the
35   fields
2223   and
21   numbers
650   are
80   always
1307   in
9   octal.
58   But
1   eleven
15   octal
13   digits
1   (plus
3088   a
2   space)
1307   in
6605   the
4   filesize
39   field
161   would
199   only
49   allow
3088   a
14   maximum
105   value
2059   of
1   8.59GB,
201   which
1837   is
5   certainly
6   smaller
171   than
193   may
924   be
21   supported
883   on
25   many
4   modern
5   systems,
33   including
12   Windows.
5   Thus,
3088   a
6   popular
18   extension
21   supported
588   by
320   this
189   tar
1837   is
3144   to
10   interpret
25   numeric
35   fields
857   as
72   binary
790   if
6605   the
14   high
49   bit
1837   is
436   set
1307   in
6605   the
281   first
37   character.
983   The
23   mode,
55   user
2223   and
26   group
3   ids
6   aren't
5   meaningful
883   on
81   NT
2223   and
650   are
18   ignored
268   when
16   extracting
2223   and
234   just
6   filled
1307   in
920   with
11   read/write
1113   for
4   owner,
2   owned
588   by
23   root
268   when
2   adding.
983   The
19   timestamp
1837   is
1307   in
23   seconds
30   since
5   Jan
214   1
1   00:00:00
2   GMT
1   1970.
983   The
9   checksum
1837   is
5   calculated
857   as
790   if
1061   that
39   field
24   contained
7   spaces.
983   The
2   linkflag
21   tells
6605   the
383   file
6   type,
27   reported
1307   in
6605   the
53   long
24   listing
857   as
271   one
2059   of
6605   the
3   following:
91   -

25   File
5   D
17   Directory
1   L

3088   a
48   separate

55   another

2   S

2   Link
1930   C
6   Character
4   Device
4   B
3   Block
4   Device
1   F

240   NT,
199   only
6605   the
17   normal
294   files
2223   and
103   directories
299   have
439   any
5   meaning.
23   Directories
650   are
56   normally
6   highlighted.
983   The
176   other
383   file
9   types

56   normally
27   reported
1307   in
41   bright
19   red

19   otherwise
22   ignored.
983   The
77   last
1   255

106   In

6605   the
2   magic

2   null-terminated

11   prefix

468   If
6605   the

13   null,

1   groupname

1   devmajor

25   CPIO
3   Format:

12   -p

4   typedef

983   The
1   dev,
4   inode,
23   mode,
5   userid,
4   groupid,

18   0,

468   If
11   -P

2223   and

1   Portable

3   Format:

4   typedef
23   char

4   struct

4   groupid,

16   trailing

1   checksum;

2   name[
1   namelen+1
2   ];
49   }
1   new_cpio_ascii_header;
983   The
2   magic
39   field
80   always
35   contains
93   either
1   "070701"
1   (normal)
1041   or
1   "070702"
1   (checksum
1   variation.)
983   The
4   inode,
23   mode,
5   userid,
4   groupid,
3   nlink,
1   dev
2223   and
2   rdev
35   fields
650   are
471   not
5   meaningful
883   on
81   NT
2223   and
650   are
18   ignored
268   when
16   extracting
2223   and
6   filled
1307   in

32   1,
11   read/write
588   by
4   owner,
18   0,
18   0,
32   1,
32   1,
2223   and
18   0,
7   respectively,

2   writing.
983   The
2   header,

6605   the
6   filename,
1837   is
6   padded
3144   to
6605   the
71   next
5   DWORD

983   The
111   data
9   section
34   immediately
7   follows
2223   and
1837   is
190   also
6   padded
3144   to
6605   the
71   next
5   DWORD
6   boundary.
983   The
13   difference

6605   the
12   -p

11   -P
65   options

790   if
11   -P
1837   is

11   unsigned
2   8-bit
21   value.
7   Colors:
150   You

122   same
857   as
12   DIRECTORIES
4   READONLYFILES
29   Files
21   marked
22   read-only
122   same
857   as
26   COLORS
9   Colors
34   recognized
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
8   magenta
42   (or
19   red
7   blue),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
1041   or
8   white.
12   Foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
16   dim
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
2223   and
6605   the
80   words
16   bright,
10   dim,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on
193   may
924   be
1307   in
93   either
21   upper
1041   or
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
11   Either
1041   or
56   both
6605   the
17   foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
924   be
7   specified;
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
20   value,
102   it's
66   considered
9   transparent
2223   and
20   inherits
6605   the
46   color
10   underneath
61   it.
2   DIRECTORIES,
5   FOREIGNFILES
2223   and
3   ASCIICONVERT
12   inherit
640   from
7   COLORS.
468   If
26   COLORS
1837   is
13   null,
189   tar
55   uses
6605   the
213   current
204   screen
197   colors
879   it
13   finds
277   at
12   startup.
8   Specifying
5   COLORS=none
20   turns
91   off
364   all
270   use
2059   of
1   COLOR.
468   If
6605   the
25   -D
2   (dim)
192   option
1837   is
62   specified,
364   all
18   highlighting
1837   is
29   turned
4   off,
15   regardless
2059   of
6605   the
18   settings
1113   for
94   these
76   environment
12   variables.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>
850   </tr>
192   </table>

18   Copy
4   Stdin
3144   to
8   Stdout
2223   and
3144   to
45   Each
25   File
5   Specified
91   Usage:
5   tee
2   [-ah-]
29   file1
99   [
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
5   tee
1837   is
3088   a
1   "pipe-fitting"
69   utility
1113   for
1   snapshotting
6605   the
111   data
6   passing
109   through
6605   the
7   middle
2059   of
3088   a
2   pipeline.

29   -a
6   Append
3144   to
439   any
64   output
294   files
1061   that
55   already
18   exist
46   instead
2059   of

2223   and
5   overwriting

446   <h3>
1   touch<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="tee.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="tr.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
7   Create
25   File
1041   or
21   Set
1   Modification
8   Time
91   Usage:
14   touch
1   [-rfc2wh-]
99   [
1   mmddhhmm[ss][[yy]yy]]
93   ]
4   pathname1
99   [
4   pathname2
57   ...
93   ]
14   touch
12   sets
6605   the
19   timestamp
883   on
3088   a
383   file
3144   to
6605   the
213   current
1041   or
152   specified
37   date
2223   and
16   time.
468   If
6605   the
383   file
28   doesn't
10   exist,
6605   the
17   normal
5   action
1837   is
3144   to
38   create
61   it.
97   Options:
1   mmddhhmmssyyyy
4   Month,
1   Day,
1   Hour,
1   Minutes,
1   Seconds
2223   and
2   Year
1307   in
4   decimal.
11   (If
6605   the
1   century
22   isn't
62   specified,
2   81
3144   to
1   99
1837   is
18   interpreted
857   as
1   1981
3144   to
1   1999;
8   00
3144   to
9   80
1837   is
18   interpreted
857   as
857   as
2   2000
3144   to
1   2080.)
468   If
199   only
21   10
13   digits
650   are
62   specified,
14   touch
4   interprets
6605   the
77   last
94   two
13   digits
857   as
23   seconds
790   if
28   they're
13   less
171   than
1   60;
4   otherwise,
879   it
4   interprets
72   them
857   as
6605   the
6   year.
29   -r
5   Recursively
14   touch
40   contents
2059   of
55   directories.
47   -f
10   Force
5   Read-only
294   files
3144   to
924   be
1   touched
8   also.
64   -c
25   File
1837   is
471   not
33   created
790   if
879   it
28   doesn't
55   already
25   exist.
18   -2
2   Two
33   second
7   granularity
1113   for
29   compatibility
920   with
18   FAT
2223   and
10   HPFS
2   filesystems.
21   -w
4   Give
3088   a
12   warning
63   message
241   but
23   continue
35   trying
3144   to
14   touch
439   any
10   remaining
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
115   even
790   if
46   problems
132   were
18   encountered
920   with
101   some
2059   of
21   them.
95   -h
79   Help.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

87   <pre><tt>
5   Translate
7   Characters
2   Filter
91   Usage:
15   tr
1   [-cdsnh-]
99   [
2   string1
1   [string2]
93   ]
15   tr
1837   is
281   used
3144   to
11   perform
63   simple
172   character
34   substitutions
857   as
879   it
30   copies
111   data
640   from
36   stdin
3144   to
44   stdout.
7   Individual
197   characters
1307   in
2   string1
650   are
5   mapped
3144   to
6605   the
33   corresponding
197   characters
2059   of
2   string2.
468   If
3   string2
1837   is
13   too
2   short,
879   it
1837   is
6   padded
588   by
1   duplicating
122   its
77   last
37   character.
106   In
93   either
13   string,
6605   the
27   minus
11   sign
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
14   indicate
3088   a
22   range
2059   of
55   characters.
12   Here's
590   an
43   example
201   which
13   creates
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
80   words
1307   in
1   file1,
271   one
26   per
31   line,
1307   in
1   file2,
105   where
3088   a
97   word
1837   is
25   taken
857   as
3088   a
4   maximal
129   string
2059   of
1   alphabetics.
53   (The
3   ^n
172   character
1837   is
11   expanded
588   by
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
178   into
3088   a
8   newline
2   character.)
60   %
15   tr
1   -csn
1   A-Za-z
3   ^n
1   &lt;file1
1   &gt;file2
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
64   -c
1   Complement
6605   the
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
1307   in
2   string1.
39   -d
16   Delete
439   any
30   occurrences
2059   of
6605   the
197   characters
1307   in
2   string1.
11   (If
1   present,
3   string2
1837   is
3   ignored.)
66   -s
1   Squeeze
364   all
56   strings
2059   of
7   repeated
64   output
197   characters
1307   in
3   string2
3144   to
110   single
55   characters.
45   -n
2   Normalize
372   line
2   endings.
3   Ensure
1061   that
23   every
372   line
11   ends
920   with
3   \r\n.
13   Fixup
439   any
10   \r
1041   or
26   \n
588   by
17   itself
1041   or
439   any
2   reversed
2   \n\r
172   character
5   pair.
106   When
1   squeezing,
2   normalization
190   also
39   causes
7   repeated
22   \r\n
39   sequences
3144   to
924   be
2   squeezed
790   if
93   either
10   \r
1041   or
26   \n
1837   is
1307   in
2   string2.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

87   <pre><tt>
7   Turn
91   off
7   Path
3   Hashing
91   Usage:
6   unhash
22   [-h-]
10   Normally,
3088   a
19   hashing
27   mechanism
1837   is
281   used
1307   in
590   an
16   attempt
3144   to
3   speed
157   up
3   searches
2059   of
6605   the
89   path
55   directories.
468   If
11   you're
3   performing
110   system
2   administration
12   work,
6   moving
294   files
1307   in
6605   the
89   path
12   directories,
6605   the
13   hash
27   mechanism
193   may
471   not
80   always
18   reflect
6605   the
15   latest
45   changes
5   you've
7   made.
983   The
6   unhash
428   command
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
28   turn
19   hashing
4   off,
3   setting.
6   nohashing
527   =
35   1.
10   (See
190   also
6605   the
6   rehash
2223   and
5   hashstat
9   commands.)
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
9   Report
2   Unique
15   Lines
1307   in
6   Text
29   Files
91   Usage:
11   uniq
1   [-hbcdiuw-]
4   [-f
1   fields]
6   [-s
1   chars]
1   [-&lt;n&gt;]
1   [+&lt;m&gt;]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
7   ...]
11   uniq
135   does
3088   a
2   quick,
63   simple
129   string
16   comparison
2059   of
1   adjacent
111   lines
1307   in
106   text
39   files,
56   normally
234   just
2   discarding
439   any
1   duplicates
857   as
879   it
30   copies
122   its
58   input
3144   to
44   stdout.
29   There
650   are
101   some
3   diff-style
65   options
1113   for
9   ignoring
1   upper-/lower-
97   case
15   differences
1041   or
4   treating
68   white
42   spaces
2059   of
439   any
38   length
857   as
2   equal,
38   etc.
139   Also,
675   you
511   can
3   optionally
21   choose
3144   to
190   list
199   only
6605   the
111   lines
1061   that
8   occur
234   just
10   once
1041   or
199   only
47   those
1061   that
299   have
2   duplicates.
468   If
35   several
294   files
650   are
34   given,
6605   the
13   effect
1837   is
6605   the
122   same
857   as
790   if
104   they
132   were
9   pasted
3   together,
271   one
37   right
61   after
55   another
178   into
271   one
53   long
96   file.
97   Options:
32   -b
6   Blank
42   spaces
2059   of
439   any
38   length
24   compare
10   equal.
17   Ignore
439   any
17   leading
1041   or
16   trailing
68   white
67   space
883   on
197   each
75   line.
64   -c
2   Preface
197   each
372   line
920   with
3088   a
16   count
2059   of
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
8   times
879   it
3   occurred.
39   -d
1   Duplicates.
15   Only
6605   the
111   lines
201   which
299   have
277   at
24   least
271   one
5   duplicate
650   are
11   reported.
30   -i
17   Ignore
172   character
43   case.
19   -u
2   Unique
15   lines.
15   Only
6605   the
111   lines
201   which
8   occur
199   only
10   once
650   are
11   reported.
21   -w
18   White
67   space
1837   is
18   ignored
3   totally.
47   -f
35   fields
17   Ignore
6605   the
281   first
3   &lt;fields&gt;
35   fields
883   on
197   each
58   input
372   line
268   when
21   doing
2   comparisons,
105   where
3   &lt;fields&gt;
1837   is
1837   is
3088   a
2   positive
27   decimal
12   integer.
261   A
39   field
1837   is
43   defined
857   as
3088   a
4   maximal
129   string
2059   of
19   tabs
1041   or
42   spaces
42   followed
588   by
1   non-tab,
1   non-space
55   characters.
66   -s
1   chars
17   Ignore
6605   the
281   first
2   &lt;chars&gt;
197   characters
268   when
21   doing
3   comparisons.
468   If
281   used
1307   in
3   conjunction
920   with
6605   the
47   -f
18   option,
6605   the
281   first
2   &lt;chars&gt;
197   characters
61   after
6605   the
281   first
3   &lt;fields&gt;
35   fields
380   will
924   be
22   ignored.
1   -&lt;n&gt;
21   An
24   older
32   form
2059   of
39   field
6   specification,
410   now
66   considered
6   obsolete
588   by
3   POSIX.
2   Equivalent
3144   to
47   -f
1   &lt;n&gt;.
1   +&lt;m&gt;
21   An
24   older
32   form
2059   of
172   character
6   specification,
410   now
66   considered
6   obsolete
588   by
3   POSIX.
2   Equivalent
3144   to
66   -s
1   &lt;m&gt;.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

446   <h3>
1   uudecode<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="uniq.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="uuencode.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
5   Uudecode
9   Binary
10   Data
91   Usage:
10   uudecode
22   [-h-]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
8   Uuencode
2223   and
5   Uudecode
650   are
281   used
3144   to
3   encode
19   arbitrary
72   binary
111   data
178   into
3088   a
24   sequence
12   consisting
3   solely
2059   of
12   printable
53   ASCII
19   characters,
9   thus
19   allowing
6605   the
111   data
3144   to
924   be
2   sent
53   over
5   mail
5   systems,
22   etc.,
1061   that
29   cannot
24   handle
72   binary
27   data.
8   Uuencode
26   reads
640   from
6605   the
51   source
383   file
42   (or
36   stdin
790   if
227   no
51   source
383   file
1837   is
2   specified),
56   writing
6605   the
13   encoded
65   version
3144   to
44   stdout.
5   Uudecode
26   reads
6605   the
13   encoded
383   file
42   (or
2   stdin),
2   strips
91   off
439   any
17   leading
2223   and
16   trailing
111   lines
2223   and
221   recreates
6605   the
253   original
39   file,
9   giving
879   it
6605   the
152   name
1061   that
60   had
382   been
152   specified
3144   to
8   uuencode
857   as
6605   the
3   decode_pathname
2   parameter.
8   Uuencode
8   format:
983   The
13   encoded
32   form
4   consists
2059   of
3088   a
27   header
372   line
42   followed
588   by
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
2   body
111   lines
2223   and
3088   a
4   trailer
75   line.
983   The
27   header
1837   is
2059   of
6605   the
5   form:
22   begin
5   &lt;mode&gt;
2   &lt;decode_pathname&gt;
105   where
6605   the
5   &lt;mode&gt;
39   field
8   indicates
6605   the
11   read/write
4   permissions
3144   to
924   be
91   given
3144   to
6605   the
96   file.
983   The
383   file
11   ends
920   with
3088   a
372   line
2059   of
6605   the
5   form:
412   end
11   Both
94   these
111   lines
4   shall
299   have
227   no
32   preceding
1041   or
16   trailing
106   text
1041   or
68   white
13   space.
983   The
27   POSIX
37   standard
9   specifies
1061   that
6605   the
2   "end"
372   line
131   should
924   be
6605   the
199   only
2   indicator
2059   of
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
27   data.
11   Most
31   existing
10   uudecode
8   implementations
176   do
471   not
2   adhere
3144   to
320   this
6   specification,
3   however.
13   Instead,
104   they
7   require
1061   that
87   there
924   be
590   an
34   immediately
32   preceding
372   line
21   marked
857   as
50   containing
120   0
41   bytes
2059   of
27   data.
103   To
17   ensure
29   compatibility
920   with
94   these
3   flawed
2   uudecodes,
320   this
2   uuencode/uudecode
8   pair
380   will
60   write
1061   that
5   dummy
372   line
268   when
6   encoding
2223   and
16   ignore
879   it
268   when
2   decoding.
10   Data
1837   is
13   encoded
16   three
41   bytes
277   at
3088   a
96   time
178   into
5   four
12   printable
53   ASCII
197   characters
588   by
2   splitting
6605   the
58   input
277   at
17   6
49   bit
5   intervals
178   into
35   4
6   bytes,
197   each
50   containing
111   data
1307   in
199   only
6605   the
32   lower
17   6
4   bits.
983   The
18   hex
105   value
12   0x20
1837   is
189   then
104   added
3144   to
197   each
2   byte,
7   producing
3088   a
105   value
1307   in
6605   the
22   range
12   0x20
3144   to
2   0x5f,
201   which
650   are
364   all
12   printable
53   ASCII
55   characters.
5   Thus,
16   three
41   bytes
2   A,
4   B
2223   and
1930   C
2059   of
15   raw
111   data
650   are
9   converted
3144   to
6605   the
5   four
53   ASCII
3   characters:
12   0x20
117   +
4   ((
261   A
13   &gt;&gt;
102   2
210   )
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
12   0x20
117   +
2   (((A
16   &lt;&lt;
4   4)
498   |
2   ((B
13   &gt;&gt;
4   4)
29   &amp;
2   0xf))
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
12   0x20
117   +
2   (((B
16   &lt;&lt;
7   2)
498   |
2   ((C
13   &gt;&gt;
4   6)
29   &amp;
2   0x3))
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
12   0x20
117   +
4   ((
1930   C
210   )
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
983   The
13   encoded
111   data
1837   is
3   arranged
178   into
111   lines
2059   of
227   no
207   more
171   than
3   60
197   characters
2   (representing
277   at
35   most
4   45
41   bytes
2059   of
15   raw
7   data)
15   preceded
588   by
3088   a
38   length
15   character,
11   equal
3144   to
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
15   raw
197   characters
13   encoded
15   plus
3   0x20.
16   Some
31   existing
8   uuencode
8   implementations
176   do
471   not
21   correctly
13   follow
320   this
2   specification.
468   If
6605   the
17   resulting
172   character
1837   is
3088   a
7   space,
2   they'll
60   write
3088   a
3   backquote
10   instead.
2   Their
3   decoding
72   procedure
1837   is
3144   to
17   extract
199   only
6605   the
9   low
28   7
15   bits
61   after
1   subtracting
3   0x20.
181   This
10   extra
4   step
2   is,
1   fortunately,
3   innocuous
883   on
21   correctly
13   encoded
5   data,
113   so
1113   for
29   compatibility
920   with
31   existing
1   uuencodes,
320   this
65   version
2059   of
10   uudecode
2   performs
1061   that
8   mask
18   operation
8   also.
4   Although
471   not
24   required
588   by
6605   the
27   POSIX
4   standard,
320   this
65   version
2059   of
10   uudecode
289   has
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
1   enhancements:
35   1.
159   It
380   will
25   accept
58   input
2   streams
50   containing
439   any
165   number
2059   of
3   uuencoded
294   files
5   concatenated
6   together.
45   Each
380   will
924   be
88   properly
11   extracted
857   as
3088   a
48   separate
96   file.
23   2.
468   If
439   any
319   directory
13   levels
1307   in
6605   the
64   output
650   are
3   missing,
590   an
16   attempt
380   will
924   be
56   made
3144   to
38   create
21   them.
22   3.
983   The
2   tilde
1837   is
34   recognized
857   as
3088   a
40   home
319   directory
30   reference
1307   in
6605   the
1   decode
5   pathname.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

446   <h3>
1   uuencode<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="uudecode.htm">Previous</a>
498   |
3314   <a
2   href="ver.htm">Next</a></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
8   Uuencode
9   Binary
10   Data
91   Usage:
8   uuencode
22   [-h-]
3   [-m
1   &lt;mode&gt;]
99   [
383   file
93   ]
3   decode_pathname
1   [-ca-
4   source1
99   [
3   source2
57   ...
93   ]
20   destination
93   ]
8   Uuencode
2223   and
5   Uudecode
650   are
281   used
3144   to
3   encode
19   arbitrary
72   binary
111   data
178   into
3088   a
24   sequence
12   consisting
3   solely
2059   of
12   printable
53   ASCII
19   characters,
9   thus
19   allowing
6605   the
111   data
3144   to
924   be
2   sent
53   over
5   mail
5   systems,
22   etc.,
1061   that
29   cannot
24   handle
72   binary
27   data.
8   Uuencode
26   reads
640   from
6605   the
51   source
383   file
42   (or
36   stdin
790   if
227   no
51   source
383   file
1837   is
2   specified),
56   writing
6605   the
13   encoded
65   version
3144   to
44   stdout.
5   Uudecode
26   reads
6605   the
13   encoded
383   file
42   (or
2   stdin),
2   strips
91   off
439   any
17   leading
2223   and
16   trailing
111   lines
2223   and
221   recreates
6605   the
253   original
39   file,
9   giving
879   it
6605   the
152   name
1061   that
60   had
382   been
152   specified
3144   to
8   uuencode
857   as
6605   the
3   decode_pathname
2   parameter.
8   Uuencode
8   format:
983   The
13   encoded
32   form
4   consists
2059   of
3088   a
27   header
372   line
42   followed
588   by
3088   a
165   number
2059   of
2   body
111   lines
2223   and
3088   a
4   trailer
75   line.
983   The
27   header
1837   is
2059   of
6605   the
5   form:
22   begin
5   &lt;mode&gt;
2   &lt;decode_pathname&gt;
105   where
6605   the
5   &lt;mode&gt;
39   field
8   indicates
6605   the
11   read/write
4   permissions
3144   to
924   be
91   given
3144   to
6605   the
96   file.
983   The
383   file
11   ends
920   with
3088   a
372   line
2059   of
6605   the
5   form:
412   end
11   Both
94   these
111   lines
4   shall
299   have
227   no
32   preceding
1041   or
16   trailing
106   text
1041   or
68   white
13   space.
983   The
27   POSIX
37   standard
9   specifies
1061   that
6605   the
2   "end"
372   line
131   should
924   be
6605   the
199   only
2   indicator
2059   of
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
27   data.
11   Most
31   existing
10   uudecode
8   implementations
176   do
471   not
2   adhere
3144   to
320   this
6   specification,
3   however.
13   Instead,
104   they
7   require
1061   that
87   there
924   be
590   an
34   immediately
32   preceding
372   line
21   marked
857   as
50   containing
120   0
41   bytes
2059   of
27   data.
103   To
17   ensure
29   compatibility
920   with
94   these
3   flawed
2   uudecodes,
320   this
2   uuencode/uudecode
8   pair
380   will
60   write
1061   that
5   dummy
372   line
268   when
6   encoding
2223   and
16   ignore
879   it
268   when
2   decoding.
10   Data
1837   is
13   encoded
16   three
41   bytes
277   at
3088   a
96   time
178   into
5   four
12   printable
53   ASCII
197   characters
588   by
2   splitting
6605   the
58   input
277   at
17   6
49   bit
5   intervals
178   into
35   4
6   bytes,
197   each
50   containing
111   data
1307   in
199   only
6605   the
32   lower
17   6
4   bits.
983   The
18   hex
105   value
12   0x20
1837   is
189   then
104   added
3144   to
197   each
2   byte,
7   producing
3088   a
105   value
1307   in
6605   the
22   range
12   0x20
3144   to
2   0x5f,
201   which
650   are
364   all
12   printable
53   ASCII
55   characters.
5   Thus,
16   three
41   bytes
2   A,
4   B
2223   and
1930   C
2059   of
15   raw
111   data
650   are
9   converted
3144   to
6605   the
5   four
53   ASCII
3   characters:
12   0x20
117   +
4   ((
261   A
13   &gt;&gt;
102   2
210   )
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
12   0x20
117   +
2   (((A
16   &lt;&lt;
4   4)
498   |
2   ((B
13   &gt;&gt;
4   4)
29   &amp;
2   0xf))
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
12   0x20
117   +
2   (((B
16   &lt;&lt;
7   2)
498   |
2   ((C
13   &gt;&gt;
4   6)
29   &amp;
2   0x3))
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
12   0x20
117   +
4   ((
1930   C
210   )
29   &amp;
8   0x3f)
983   The
13   encoded
111   data
1837   is
3   arranged
178   into
111   lines
2059   of
227   no
207   more
171   than
3   60
197   characters
2   (representing
277   at
35   most
4   45
41   bytes
2059   of
15   raw
7   data)
15   preceded
588   by
3088   a
38   length
15   character,
11   equal
3144   to
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
15   raw
197   characters
13   encoded
15   plus
3   0x20.
97   Options:
12   -m
5   &lt;mode&gt;
10   Mode
3144   to
924   be
152   specified
1113   for
6605   the
96   file.
47   Default
1837   is
3144   to
44   simply
10   fill
1307   in
1   666,
54   meaning
11   read/write
44   access
588   by
5   everyone
1113   for
17   normal
294   files
1041   or
1   444,
54   meaning
22   read-only
44   access
588   by
5   everyone
1113   for
294   files
21   marked
857   as
10   read-only.
64   -c
2   Alternate
2   cp-style
6   syntax.
4   Instead
2059   of
191   using
30   stdout
3144   to
60   write
6605   the
64   output
2223   and
25   having
3144   to
18   explicitly
94   specify
6605   the
152   name
3144   to
924   be
91   given
3144   to
197   each
383   file
1307   in
6605   the
3   uuencoded
10   form,
320   this
192   option
42   allows
271   one
3144   to
44   simply
60   copy
439   any
165   number
2059   of
294   files
1041   or
103   directories
178   into
6605   the
3   uuencoded
64   output
96   file.
983   The
152   name
1061   that
380   will
924   be
63   written
178   into
6605   the
27   header
380   will
924   be
234   just
6605   the
18   tail
2059   of
6605   the
6   filename,
234   just
857   as
39   cp
161   would
2   do.
29   -a
9   Like
2   -c,
241   but
1   appending.
468   If
6605   the
64   output
383   file
55   already
4   exists,
320   this
380   will
11   append
50   onto
6605   the
9   end.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

29   List
6   Volume
10   Labels
91   Usage:
3   vl
1   [-acvh-]
99   [
3   disk1
3   disk2
57   ...
93   ]
14   vol
17   reports
6605   the
10   volume
40   label
34   information
883   on
197   each
2059   of
6605   the
152   specified
7   disks.
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
14   vol
20   looks
1113   for
3088   a
8   DRIVEMASK
90   environmental
243   variable
1061   that
511   can
924   be
281   used
3144   to
8   mask
91   off
234   just
6605   the
55   drives
675   you
84   want
11   reported.
983   The
8   DRIVEMASK
1837   is
152   specified
857   as
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
112   drive
3   letters;
13   ranges
650   are
6   allowed.
3   Otherwise
364   all
6605   the
5   partitions
45   beginning
920   with
8   c:
650   are
11   reported.
983   The
213   current
2   disk's
40   label
34   information
1837   is
6   highlighted.
181   This
428   command
1837   is
56   normally
18   stored
1307   in
6605   the
383   file
1   vl.exe
2223   and
21   invoked
920   with
590   an
164   alias
113   so
879   it
511   can
924   be
281   used
640   from
15   cmd.exe
63   without
2   colliding
920   with
6605   the
30   internal
15   cmd.exe
14   vol
3   function.
97   Options:
29   -a
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
38   report
883   on
364   all
7   disks.
64   -c
468   If
227   no
18   disks
650   are
62   specified,
38   report
883   on
234   just
6605   the
213   current
24   disk.
20   -v
8   Verbose.
5   Also
38   report
14   maximum
4   component
7   length,
6605   the
5   features
879   it
16   supports
2223   and
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
8   filesystem.
95   -h
79   Help.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
7   Colors:
150   You
193   may
436   set
252   your
51   own
9   choices
1113   for
204   screen
197   colors
191   using
94   these
90   environmental
9   variables:
22   Name
39   Use
47   Default
26   COLORS
13   Normal
204   screen
197   colors
7   &lt;null
7   string&gt;
12   HIGHLIGHT
18   Current
83   disk
31   Bright
9   Colors
34   recognized
650   are
8   black,
11   red,
8   green,
9   yellow,
8   blue,
8   magenta
42   (or
19   red
7   blue),
9   cyan
42   (or
19   blue
8   green)
1041   or
8   white.
12   Foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors
193   may
190   also
924   be
16   bright,
16   dim
1041   or
9   reverse.
983   The
88   names
2059   of
6605   the
197   colors
2223   and
6605   the
80   words
16   bright,
10   dim,
11   reverse
2223   and
883   on

924   be
1307   in
93   either
21   upper
1041   or
32   lower
1041   or
40   mixed
43   case.
11   Either
1041   or
56   both
6605   the
17   foreground
2223   and
65   background
197   colors

924   be
7   specified;
790   if
675   you
38   don't
94   specify
3088   a
20   value,
102   it's
66   considered
9   transparent
2223   and
20   inherits
6605   the
46   color

12   HIGHLIGHT

640   from

7   Wait
1113   for
2   Children
3144   to
3   Complete
91   Usage:
14   wait
22   [-h-]
5   Sleep
42   until
3088   a
107   child
79   thread
1041   or
70   process
1   completes
1041   or
42   until
590   an
17   interrupt
3   occurs.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
53   (The
24   slash,
27   "/",
193   may
924   be
281   used
46   instead
2059   of
3088   a
27   minus
3144   to
54   introduce
118   options.
103   To
94   specify
3088   a
58   different
436   set
2059   of
197   characters
3144   to
54   introduce
26   options,
270   use
6605   the
26   SWITCHCHARS
90   environmental
24   variable.)

10   Count
4   Words
10   (and
111   lines
2223   and
1   characters)
91   Usage:
16   wc
1   [-lwch-]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
16   wc
35   prints
2   counts
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
11   lines,
80   words
6   and/or
197   characters
1307   in
197   each
2059   of
6605   the
294   files
62   specified,
2223   and
1   totals
1113   for
6605   the
50   whole
39   list.
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
62   specified,
879   it
2   counts
29   stdin.
97   Options:
27   -l
10   Count
111   lines
21   -w
10   Count
80   words
64   -c
10   Count
197   characters
95   -h
11   Help
106   --
97   End
2059   of
65   options
47   Default
1837   is
1   -lwc.
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   whereis.csh<br/>

2   href="wc.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
58   <pre><tt>#
5   whereis.csh
597   #
6   Look
109   through
6605   the
103   directories
883   on
6605   the
76   search
89   path
1113   for
439   any
294   files
33   corresponding
597   #
3144   to
6605   the
428   command
152   name
34   given,
25   reporting
41   anything
49   that's
12   found,
35   trying
197   each
597   #
47   try
197   each
2059   of
6605   the
2   six
2   possibilities,
227   no
7   extension,
5   .csh,
5   .exe,
3   .com,
12   .cmd
597   #
2223   and
1   .bat,
1307   in
197   each
92   directory.
597   #
181   This
1837   is
590   an
43   example
2059   of
3088   a
8   self-loading
9   procedure.
983   The
281   first
96   time
597   #
879   it
1837   is
1   referenced,
879   it
20   runs
857   as
3088   a
6   .csh
24   script,
4   defining
2223   and
92   running
597   #
6605   the
9   whereis
1   proc.
1   Successive
8   calls
11   directly
14   invoke
6605   the
1   pre-compiled
597   #
72   procedure
2223   and
380   will
146   run
7   slightly
6   faster.
1   (View
320   this
383   file
920   with
1   TABS=3.)
110   proc
1   whereis(name)
94   local
22   i,
44   j
790   if
1   ($#name)
189   then
790   if
1   ($#name
49   &gt;
17   1)
284   @
152   name
527   =
1   name[0]
33   foreach
109   i
1   ($path)
790   if
11   (i
19   =~
3   "*\")
189   then
790   if
9   (-e
1   $i$name)
296   echo
1   $i$name
33   foreach
44   j
2   (.csh
7   .exe
5   .com
12   .cmd
2   .bat)
790   if
9   (-e
1   $i$name$j)
296   echo
1   $i$name$j
412   end
56   else
790   if
9   (-e
1   $i\$name)
296   echo
1   $i\$name
33   foreach
44   j
2   (.csh
7   .exe
5   .com
12   .cmd
2   .bat)
790   if
9   (-e
1   $i\$name$j)
296   echo
1   $i\$name$j
412   end
412   end
412   end
412   end
412   end
9   whereis
43   $argv
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
27   Print
6605   the
18   Current
1   Domain
2223   and
19   User
2   Names
91   Usage:
7   whoami
1   [-dupgh-]
7   whoami
35   prints
94   out
6605   the
213   current
5   domain
2223   and
55   user
88   names
13   and,
2   optionally,
6605   the
6   groups
3144   to
201   which
6605   the
55   user
3   belongs.
32   By
38   default,
879   it
35   prints
879   it
1307   in
6605   the
32   form
1   &lt;domain&gt;\&lt;user&gt;.
35   Under
841   Windows
6   9x,
6605   the
5   domain
1837   is
38   actually
6605   the
213   current
22   machine
32   name.
1   Groups
18   exist
199   only
126   under
841   Windows
240   NT,
471   not
841   Windows
7   9x.
97   Options:
39   -d
27   Print
199   only
6605   the
5   domain
32   name.
19   -u
27   Print
199   only
6605   the
55   user
32   name.
12   -p
5   Also
31   print
6605   the
10   user's
3   primary
5   group.
8   (NT
5   only.)
4   -g
5   Also
31   print
3088   a
190   list
2059   of
364   all
6605   the
6   groups
3144   to
201   which
6605   the
55   user
3   belongs.
8   (NT
5   only.)
95   -h
11   Help
106   --
97   End
2059   of
65   options
160   </tt></pre>

446   <h3>
1   xargs<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="whoami.htm">Previous</a>

182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
1   xargs:
3   Construct
77   argument
2   list(s)
2223   and
14   invoke
69   utility
91   Usage:
23   xargs
1   [-CtTxh-]
2   [-o&lt;opt&gt;]
1   [-e&lt;escape&gt;]
2   [-X
2   &lt;errlimit&gt;]
4   [-n
1   &lt;number&gt;]
6   [-s
1   &lt;size&gt;]
1   [-r&lt;string&gt;]
1   [&lt;utility&gt;
1   [&lt;arguments&gt;]]
23   xargs
380   will
12   construct
3088   a
428   command
372   line
12   consisting
2059   of
6605   the
152   specified
69   utility
152   name
2223   and
74   arguments
42   followed
588   by
857   as
25   many
74   arguments
125   read
640   from
36   stdin
857   as
380   will
1   fit,
91   given
6605   the
1   constraints
2059   of
6605   the
11   operating
110   system
1041   or
857   as
152   specified
588   by
6605   the
45   -n
2223   and
66   -s
118   options.
23   xargs
189   then
4   invokes
1061   that
5   constructed
428   command
2223   and
5   waits
1113   for
879   it
3144   to
5   complete.
181   This
24   sequence
1837   is
7   repeated
42   until
11   end-of-file
1837   is
3   detected
883   on
36   stdin
1041   or
42   until
3088   a
5   constructed
428   command
13   exits
920   with
159   return
66   code
10   greater
171   than
214   1
1041   or
101   some
176   other
152   specified
21   value.
53   (The
105   value
2059   of
214   1
363   was
5   chosen
113   so
1061   that
62   commands
90   like
21   grep
2223   and
18   fgrep
1061   that
44   exit
920   with
214   1
790   if
227   no
33   matches
650   are
28   found
1307   in
3088   a
91   given
436   set
380   will
1   continue.)
3   Arguments
1307   in
6605   the
58   input
511   can
924   be
29   separated
588   by
1   unquoted,
2   unescaped
68   white
67   space
1   (spaces,
3   tabs,
9   carriage
32   returns
1041   or
1   newlines).
3   Quotes
511   can
924   be
281   used
45   around
439   any
106   text
50   containing
42   spaces
1041   or
7   tabs.
21   An
121   escape
172   character
511   can
924   be
281   used
277   at
6605   the
412   end
2059   of
3088   a
372   line
3144   to
8   embed
3088   a
9   carriage
4   return-newline
4   sequence.
983   The
14   generated
428   command
372   line
38   length
1837   is
6605   the
19   sum
2059   of
6605   the
24   size
1307   in
41   bytes
2059   of
6605   the
69   utility
152   name
2223   and
197   each
8   argument,
33   including
3088   a
67   space
64   between
197   each
8   argument,
3088   a
4   terminating
48   null
277   at
6605   the
5   end,
2223   and
439   any
52   quotes
1041   or
121   escape
197   characters
857   as
193   may
924   be
2   dictated
588   by
6605   the
11   operating
110   system
7   conventions
1113   for
4   embedding
439   any
94   special
55   characters.
97   Options:
16   -C
22   Start
157   up
3088   a
60   copy
2059   of
1930   C
1129   shell
3144   to
146   run
197   each
47   command.
27   -t
4   Trace
27   mode.
45   Each
14   generated
428   command
372   line
1837   is
63   written
3144   to
17   stderr
234   just
7   prior
3144   to
5   invocation.
15   -T
27   Change
6605   the
22   title
16   bar
1113   for
197   each
4   iteration.
29   -x
2   Terminate
790   if
3088   a
428   command
372   line
50   containing
6605   the
165   number
2059   of
74   arguments
152   specified
920   with
6605   the
45   -n
192   option
380   will
471   not
6   fit
883   on
6605   the
4   implied
1041   or
152   specified
428   command
75   line.
2   -o&lt;opt&gt;
5   Additional
18   startup
65   options
1113   for
6605   the
1930   C
55   shell.
111   For
101   example,
3144   to
51   get
3088   a
14   fast
3   startup,
270   use
1   -oF.
1   -e&lt;escape&gt;
12   Escape
37   character.
32   By
38   default,
23   xargs
380   will
270   use
6605   the
172   character
152   specified
588   by
6605   the
1   ESCAPESYM
76   environment
243   variable
8   (if
2   defined)
14   or,
790   if
471   not
13   defined,
6605   the
5   circumflex
1   ("^").
7   -X
2   &lt;errlimit&gt;
7   Error
3   limit.
468   If
3088   a
107   child
428   command
13   exits
920   with
3088   a
159   return
66   code
10   greater
171   than
6605   the
152   specified
2   &lt;errlimit&gt;,
23   xargs
380   will
44   exit
920   with
1061   that
159   return
66   code
640   from
6605   the
14   child.
32   By
38   default,
23   xargs
380   will
44   exit
920   with
6605   the
281   first
159   return
66   code
49   &gt;
35   1.
45   -n
4   &lt;number&gt;
7   Invoke
3   &lt;utility&gt;
920   with
157   up
3144   to
4   &lt;number&gt;
12   arguments.
2   Fewer
74   arguments
650   are
281   used
790   if
6   (a)
6605   the
428   command
372   line
38   length
2   exceeds
6605   the
24   size
26   limit
1041   or
4   (b)
6605   the
77   last
9   iteration
35   contains
1   fewer,
241   but
471   not
29   zero
3   operands.
32   By
38   default,
87   there
1837   is
227   no
4   &lt;number&gt;
3   limit.
66   -s
6   &lt;size&gt;
7   Invoke
3   &lt;utility&gt;
191   using
857   as
25   many
74   arguments
857   as
44   possible
3144   to
15   produce
3088   a
428   command
372   line
13   less
171   than
6   &lt;size&gt;
41   bytes
1307   in
2   length.
2   Fewer
74   arguments
650   are
281   used
790   if
6   (a)
6605   the
14   total
165   number
2059   of
74   arguments
2   exceeds
6605   the
4   &lt;number&gt;
26   limit
1041   or
4   (b)
11   end-of-file
1837   is
18   encountered
883   on
36   stdin
98   before
6   &lt;size&gt;
41   bytes
650   are
1   accumulated.
32   By
38   default,
87   there
1837   is
3088   a
6   &lt;size&gt;
26   limit
2059   of
2   32280
197   characters
1113   for
3088   a
1   Win32,
27   POSIX
1041   or
36   OS/2
3   application;
1113   for
3088   a
10   DOS
1041   or
7   Win3.x
9   application,
6605   the
26   limit
1837   is
2   110
55   characters.
468   If
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1837   is
78   being
21   invoked
3144   to
146   run
3088   a
428   command
49   that's
1   suspected
3144   to
924   be
3088   a
1930   C
1129   shell
11   alias,
23   xargs
2   reduces
6605   the
2   32280
26   limit
588   by
4   1024
197   characters
3144   to
49   allow
1113   for
44   possible
6   expansion.
1   -r&lt;string&gt;
4   Replace
6605   the
281   first
77   argument
97   word
201   which
4   consists
2059   of
199   only
6605   the
152   specified
129   string
920   with
77   argument
80   words
125   read
640   from
29   stdin.
47   Default
129   string
1837   is
1   "%%".
3   &lt;utility&gt;
983   The
152   name
2059   of
6605   the
69   utility
3144   to
924   be
2   invoked.
181   This
511   can
924   be
3088   a
6   fully-qualified
1041   or
10   relative
37   pathname
1041   or
3088   a
152   name
1   resolved
588   by
7   searching
6605   the
103   directories
23   listed
1307   in
6605   the
12   PATH
76   environment
47   variable.
23   As
5   needed,
23   xargs
380   will
43   look
1113   for
294   files
920   with
3088   a
5   .csh,
5   .exe,
5   .com
1041   or
12   .cmd
1041   or
7   .bat
7   extension,
1   auto-
1   matically
9   invoking
6605   the
1930   C
1129   shell
1113   for
6   .csh
294   files
2223   and
6605   the
37   standard
428   command
9   processor
1113   for
12   .cmd
1041   or
7   .bat
52   files.
468   If
3088   a
10   suitable
40   executable
383   file
29   cannot
924   be
12   found,
23   xargs
380   will
8   assume
879   it
193   may
924   be
3088   a
1930   C
1129   shell
164   alias
1041   or
10   built-in
47   command.
468   If
227   no
69   utility
1837   is
62   specified,
3088   a
10   built-in
296   echo
69   utility
1837   is
31   used.
5   &lt;arguments&gt;
7   Initial
65   options
1041   or
10   operands
3144   to
1   &lt;utility&gt;.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>

993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
6   Hex
5   Dump
3088   a
25   File
3144   to
8   Stdout
91   Usage:
7   xd
1   [-hbwlFD
1   Zdxor
1   nNq-]
3   [-r&lt;radix&gt;]
2   [-O
1   &lt;offset&gt;]
2   [-E
1   &lt;endset&gt;]
1   [-L[&lt;items&gt;]]
99   [
29   file1
28   file2
57   ...
93   ]
7   xd
5   dumps
122   its
8   input,
1   presumed
3144   to
924   be
1307   in
5   binary,
1307   in
1   variety
2059   of
3   formats,
6605   the
117   default
78   being
4   hex.
468   If
207   more
171   than
271   one
383   file
1837   is
34   given,
197   each
1837   is
3   dumped
1307   in
4   sequence.
468   If
227   no
294   files
650   are
62   specified,
7   xd
26   reads
640   from
29   stdin.
1   Sequences
2059   of
111   lines
50   containing
6605   the
122   same
111   data
650   are
1   collapsed
94   out
2223   and
12   replaced
588   by
590   an
2   asterisk.
97   Options:
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
11   Basic
26   display
1   formats:
32   -b
1   Bytes.
3   (Default.)
21   -w
5   16-bit
27   words.
27   -l
26   32-bit
53   long
27   words.
12   -F
3   Short
2   4-byte
30   floating
6   point.
2   Floating
39   point
45   values
650   are
80   always
10   displayed
1307   in
4   decimal.
25   -D
1   Double-precision
2   8-byte
30   floating
6   point.
7   -Z
6   Suppress
17   leading
7   zeros.
10   Normally,
17   leading
8   zeros
650   are
26   shown
42   except
268   when
7   displaying
1307   in
4   decimal.
1   Radix
3144   to
924   be
281   used
1113   for
25   reporting
10   offsets
2223   and
3   data:
39   -d
5   Decimal
1   (unsigned).
29   -x
2   Hex.
15   -o
2   Octal.
4   -r&lt;radix&gt;
3   User-specified
4   radix.
468   If
3088   a
12   radix
49   &lt;
20   8
1837   is
1   chosen,
10   offsets
650   are
80   always
26   shown
1307   in
4   hex.
11   Other
5   options:
9   -O
1   &lt;offset&gt;
4   Offset
277   at
201   which
3144   to
22   begin
2   dumping.
8   -E
1   &lt;endset&gt;
4   Offset
277   at
201   which
3144   to
9   stop
2   dumping.
1   -L[&lt;items&gt;]
13   Number
2059   of
5   items
1   (bytes,
25   words,
9   etc.)
3144   to
1   dump.
468   If
17   -L
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
117   default
1837   is
11   one.
45   -n
29   No
3   ascii
2   column.
26   -N
29   No
6   offset
2   column.
14   -q
5   Quiet
27   mode.
26   Don't
4   announce
6605   the
152   name
2059   of
197   each
383   file
857   as
102   it's
17   read.
20   -v
8   Verbose.
21   Show
111   lines
2059   of
7   repeated
27   data.
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.

446   <h3>
1   xor<br/>
436   <small><a
2   href="xd.htm">Previous</a>
28   <span
10   class="grey">|
10   Next</span></small>
446   </h3>
182   <table>
851   <tr>
993   <td>
87   <pre><tt>
2   XOR
29   Files
3144   to
8   Stdout
91   Usage:
11   xor
1   [-qh-]
29   file1
99   [
28   file2
93   ]
11   xor
2   performs
3088   a
1   bytewise
1   exclusive-OR
2059   of
6605   the
40   contents
2059   of
94   two
39   files,
9   thus
3   performing
3088   a
1   one-time
1   pad,
56   writing
6605   the
48   result
3144   to
44   stdout.
468   If
199   only
271   one
383   file
1837   is
62   specified,
6605   the
33   second
383   file
1837   is
125   read
640   from
29   stdin.
468   If
6605   the
94   two
294   files
4   differ
1307   in
7   length,
6605   the
64   output
1837   is
5   truncated
3144   to
6605   the
38   length
2059   of
6605   the
2   shorter
96   file.
106   When
879   it
1   truncates,
11   xor
25   writes
590   an
106   error
63   message
2223   and
13   exits
920   with
3088   a
60   status
66   code
2   reflecting
6605   the
11   end-of-file
5   condition
42   unless
14   -q
1837   is
25   specified.
97   Options:
14   -q
4   Quiet.
25   It's
471   not
590   an
106   error
790   if
6605   the
58   input
294   files
299   have
7   differing
1   lengths.
11   xor
380   will
4   truncate
1   silently.
95   -h
79   Help.
84   (This
76   screen.)
106   --
97   End
2059   of
118   options.
160   </tt></pre>
1768   </td>

78   <p
2   class="sanserif"
6   style="text-align:
6   left">
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
1129   shell
174   2012
221   recreates
6605   the
253   original
32   Unix
1930   C
1129   shell
2223   and
297   utilities
231   completely
640   from
222   scratch
883   on
231   Windows,
21   adding
1   numerous
1   enhancements.
1679   </p>
78   <p
2   class="sanserif"
6   style="text-align:
6   left">
181   This
55   user
6   guide
1837   is
4   roughly
2   half
2   tutorial
2223   and
2   half
30   reference
1   material.
983   The
2   tutorial
1837   is
5   designed
3144   to
1   teach
675   you
91   how
3144   to
270   use
1043   Hamilton
1930   C
55   shell.
45   Each
1   topic
55   uses
8   lots
2059   of
12   examples
2223   and
1   narrative
3144   to
2   explain
91   how
11   things
43   work.
983   The
35   language
30   reference
1837   is
234   just
1   that:
3   Reference
1   material,
2   organized
5   mostly
857   as
1   tables
3144   to
62   help

2   answers
6   fast.
